diGRmRBRURYbtknl8PK7Uw.text: I feel like I could copy and paste in the Excalibur Buffet I did.. because quite simply.. other than the small middle Eastern food sampling they had, it's exactly the same.  I still don't get the two stars.  Don't go to a buffet expecting a 5 star restaurant.. and you won't be disappointed.   Buffets are buffets. A smorgasbord of different types of foods and drinks to meet any desires and requests..  The girlfriend and I came to the Luxor with yet another of the MLife coupon's we had earned on their facebook game MyVegas. 2 for 1 this time.  The Luxor and the Excalibur buffets are essentially the same thing. Different set up but we did take the chance to try it all. Sweets, waffles, omelets (which had just too much stuff to choose from), and even the middle Eastern sampling of baba ghnoush and tabbouleh with naan and pita bread.  It wasn't anything to write home about.. but it certainly wasn't two stars bad either.

L6UV8Fepkpt6tfUY6jiwfg.text: The food is ok with not that much to choose from. I guess what some buffets lack in one, the other has but lacks in something else. This place is very basic and the food is in taste as much as buffet food can be. But I must add that the wife was very pleased and impressed with the dessert portion of the buffet. Something the mandalay buffet did not have. But I would rather spend the 4 bucks extra a person and go to mandalay.

O8ODEoL0teiSSOtS-rjvew.text: Good food but most of there food are cold ones you get to your table..... Love the desert section specially the lava cake and brownies.. Not going back

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lava cake

ZZr43MlVy1TaIGD6TEvXiA.text: I don't know what the big deal is. This buffet is GOOD. Aside from a few low quality foods, the foods I got were great tasting. Since I'm a pasta fanatic, I got everything pasta along with oysters and dessert. The pesto was DELICIOUS and tasted like a quality Italian restaraunt dish (though not sure if you would deem it as 'authentic'). The Asian food was a little off, but hey, the other foods measured up. The oysters were also good and flavorful. Lastly, the dessert was simply great. I strongly recommend diners to try the caramel flan; it was so perfectly made! I applaud whoever made it.   Two complaints that caused it a star: - For the price, the presentation could've been way better. If not for the pharaoh decor it could've passed as a golden corral.  - Servers would only pick up our plates, did not give us new utensils like most other buffets do. Even so, new utensils weren't provided so we had to reuse our utensils or flag down servers (which was not easy)   If I hadn't done the timeshare and had to pay full price ($88 for my whole family) Another star probably would've been knocked off. Instead, I only had to pay $43 and for $43 this buffet is pretty nice. 2 thumbs up!

SfL6Wtsw0NF_OvXqPL8qSg.text: Food is so gross. Dessert is ok. Don't come here. Rather have went to McDonalds. Selection is limited. Food is luke warm, bland, flavorless, gross! I'm sorry but me and my BF were not happy. We love buffets and this was bad.

VvHat9s3STLYzKJIPXcSJw.text: Overpriced, poor service, and less than mediocre food. Don't waste your time at this hotel or the buffet.

8DdlytAKBoSQYRNgY7LXww.text: Hmm I guess most people are rating Luxor Buffet on a scale against all the other amazing buffets on the Vegas Strip... and I can see where they're coming from.   But in all honesty, the food selection is not bad, the service is really courteous, not too much I can complain about. However, our choice to eat here was of mere convenience and no more than that. If we weren't staying at the Luxor, I highly doubt we would have chosen this buffet to eat at. They would seriously need to up their game to compete against the other buffets along the strip, but considering it still survives means that they must offer something people still come for.

c5H0Bkw1E6XY3ZU_YMZHww.text: This buffet is a good buffet but I just witnessed the waitress drop the silverware on the floor and pick it up and hand it to a customer.   On the food side, the Saturday brunch was good. The omelette station had a long line and so I did not wait. The selection of salads abd breakfast items would please most tastes, however, the best part is that they have gluten free cakes, including carrot cake, lemon poppy seed, etc. And they have no sugar added pies, and sugar free desserts. Non fat yogurt too. The coffee is tasty and the tea is decent. I like that you serve yourself with drinks and they have multiple stations for self serving drinks so there is never a line.

IhDBRGx6Jh_9zi6Dvc0KEg.text: Had dinner here a few weeks ago and if I had based the idea of eating here upon the reviews I probably would not have done so. Luckily, I was not paying for the meal so we decided to give it a go! And we were very pleasantly surprised I am happy to report.  There are a bunch of different stations based on cuisine- so there was an Asian food area, a Mexican food area, etc.   Tried:   Ginger Soy Chicken - Decent. Good taste, okay chicken.  Fried Rice - Also not bad. Not outstanding, but decent enough to get a couple servings. :)  Pizza - Surprisingly delicious! Reminded me of our favourite pizza joint here in Southern California. A good crust (crunchy outside, soft inside- good bread-to-topping ratio), good tomato sauce and cheese. I tried the cheese pizza, FYI.  Meat Balls - Probably a tie for my affection between the pizza and meat balls. So good! Tender, juicy, and flavourful.  I also tried ham from the carvery station which was not bad.  Biggest surprise was the tamales. Who knew the Luxor buffet would have such a beautiful and rare Mexican gem such as tamales? These were also surprisingly good and tasted pretty authentic.  Drinks I saw were sodas, coffee, and juices (orange, apple, etc.).  There is also a decent dessert selection with all sorts including cheesecake and small chocolate dishes.   Knocked a star off for the price. Definitely enjoyed the buffet, but would not pay $23 for it. Depends on how much one can eat, I guess.  4 stars based upon my surprise at how good the buffet turned out to be. I felt compelled to write a review to give this poor buffet some positive publicity. I think enjoyment of the buffet might have a lot to do with expectations; if you're looking for a Bellagio calibre buffet you will probably be disappointed.  Come with realistic expectations and try different items and you should find some gems. :)

v_ie6sgGRnFJg5ifpNpACg.text: Over priced. We spent 60$ for hot food served cold. Desserts weren't bad that's the one star. Just go to one other the restaurants you'll spend the same amount and actually enjoy your meal.

3Gbo3ZxgBVheLraYQmjv1Q.text: For the price you get it's mediocre food! Nothing to complain about. Only reason why it's missing a star is because the line in the morning is incredibly long with only 2 people working the front I think having a full staff up front is necessary especially during the morning!

RXKRXOpqjnNYIjttS0MmFQ.text: I was sooooo excited to use our voucher for my mom, my sister and I. The place is very pretty. I love the whole set up. Very easy to get around. However, the food is a hit or mess. A lot of the food was bland and flavorless. Which is expected at buffets. I was a bit disappointed. The bus boy was awesome. He was on it. Thankfully we didn't pay for this out of pocket, but still. What about people who are paying for this bad excuse for food. If I were you reading this, I'd pass.

hFqDVllELWrxB-5dRm14qA.text: We ate at several buffets on the strip and felt this one was among the best, right next to Bayside at Mandalay Bay. We went on a Monday at 9PM and there was plenty of selection and nothing had been sitting out for long. If you think this is the worst buffet on the strip, you havent tried most.

sUlh-s3tvOHRzuElMZplZA.text: Don't go for Breakfast! It's like a cheap Continental breakfast from a motel that has been sitting out and getting hard. You will get a better quality breakfast from the Pyramid cafe, which is on the casino floor.    The manager was nice enough to give us a refund and admitted that the variety for breakfast was very limited. Basically eggs, bacon and sausage & old pancakes.

bY7rGX4chPsLjes6wqq7cQ.text: I probably shouldn't say anything but it was just not good food. The choices are ok but I have seen better other places. The best thing was the fruit cocktail. That's what my husband and I ate for 68.00 , this was a 15% gratuity included.

MNOH_1mWSsgRbw6alCoKXA.text: First time here.  Had brunch Buffett. Just ate off the breakfast side. A little over priced for $25 per person. Everything is good, just had a terrible piece of sausage. Other then that pretty good.

yYPz0mTu7TDXIz930UP2NQ.text: Got the chance to visit the buffet this morning with my boyfriend before heading back home. Eating is a passion of ours, and we like to try out different places to see what they have to offer. On a 1-10 scale I give this place a 5. Everything was mediocre at best, and pretty tasteless and cold. As other reviews had mentioned a lot of dishes were listed but they weren't physically there. My boyfriend figured out that if you add a crap load of ketchup though it really adds some flavor. The dessert however was pretty good. I'm not sure I would recommend this place to others as I was not impressed with the pink chicken that I was served. I ended up going back to the buffet tables 4 times just because I only liked about 4 bites worth on each plate. Maybe It was first timers luck?

Wp8BR4J1nf-ubV5kSO2XOg.text: It's not very good. The food is low quality and not cooked well and a lot of it looked old. The only thing going for it is $9.99 all you can drink draft beer and house wine and all day pass for $35.99 if you just want to eat cheap.

mwlV6DE9YRllDS2tqVrL3Q.text: There's something for everyone here. I find that most of the 1 and 2 star reviews are filled with nothing but negativity... If you're looking for exotic cuisine, stuff Gordon Ramsay would actually compliment, this isn't the place for you, and I don think they are trying to be. The food is fresh and the people are friendly. I'm not an exotic foodie so this place is A-OK by me. It's pricey for just coming in for one meal; but they have a $35 all day pass that would get you into here and the Excalibur buffet as many times as you want all day - if you are staying in the vicinity all day it's a good bargain to prepay for all of your meals.   I take all of the bad reviews with a grain of salt. I've worked in the service industry for 10+ years... Everyone can't please everyone - there is nothing egregiously bad about this buffet.

yo1JsNiaRbFwxK7CDDAyfQ.text: Wow!  This place only received two stars?  Perhaps everyone was hung over to enjoy it.  I didn't think it was all that bad.  The location is nice considering all other buffets in Las Vegas.  Located on the lower level of Luxor, the dining area is SPACIOUS.  The food selection is pretty much like your basic buffet, considering the price.  We went on a Monday afternoon for lunch.  There was no waiting and were sat immediately.  The wait staff were very friendly and helpful.  Empty plates were picked up instantaneously.

NW4uB_cFBQ0GA0QFcVJHJQ.text: We went there for breakfast. The reviews weren't making me too excited, but actually, not bad at all. Very good variety, but the food quality was about average for a Vegas buffet. A bit expensive but you're on the strip, so you pay for that. Typically cheezy luxor decor.

J1O3MyH0U1olsODOdlptaQ.text: I'm also surprised at the 3 star average. While staying at the Luxor a few years ago, this buffet was our go-to meal option, and it did not disappoint!  The seafood was the most memorable for me, as I practically gorged myself on the shrimp. it was fresh and delicious! I must have hit up the shrimp offerings every day of the weekend. We loved the champagne brunch!!  Decor is old-school Luxor (which I love.) Definitely a fan of this buffet compared to others!

w8myQz2oFd8liZJuxhCv4w.text: We had a couple of meals in the More Buffet while we stayed at the Lux. My hubby has a stomach of steel so the food did not bother him as much as it did me. What can I say it was just yucky low grade buffet food. The best thing I had there was an apple off the buffet.

jjYc-TKFvwXHwq6nEvLv4g.text: The line at this buffet was non-existent and that was just great.  But upon entering I can understand why.  The buffet was just alright.  But for the price it was a good value.    The buffet was split into different sections that had different types of cuisine, they had Italian, Mexican, Asian, American and I think one or two more.  While this buffet was on the cheaper side there were a couple of things that really stood out.  The prime rib here that I had was quite excellent.  And the cheesecake was one of the best cheesecakes that I have ever had.    When in Las Vegas and looking for a buffet for a cheap price this will be high up on the list.  Good food for the price, no line, and that cheesecake have made me a fan.

TXNrR-elZD40UgbmXei0qw.text: Living in Las Vegas we've been to a lot of buffets and I was skeptical of this one given some of the Yelp reviews, but it was great!  The price was about standard (but too high if you ask me).  We went for dinner and it was right around $25.00.  I was a bit surprised that I had to pay adult price for my 12 year old when most start charging more when they turn 13.  The buffet was very clean and spacious.  They had an array of food selections.  Not only did they split the crab legs, they cleaned and peeled the shrimp!  All the food tasted great.  You have to get your own drinks which I didn't like because ultimately other than plate removal, there is no service thus a minimal tip for the employees.  The desserts were fabulous!  They had a chocolate molten cake that was to die for!  Of 4 buffets in the area (Excaliber, MGM and Mandalay Bay) the Luxor would be the one I would choose to go back too.

cnTqvrOPT3vXxAtVmW4x_w.text: This buffet is by far the worst buffet I have been in my life. If you go to other decent buffets in Vegas, then you'll see the differences and no wonder people are complaining about the food and quality. Food quality is way lower than Vegas (and other buffet) standards. (even the desserts are not tasting good. Nobody in our group (party of 6) even finished their first round let alone bother for the next rounds. Please save your bucks and do not ever go there. I'd rather have something better even in the hotel food court or go to a better buffet.

6Y7waVKGnt_0SeBIJzgQnw.text: We ended up here after Titanic and Bodies. It was pretty good for lunch.  Lots of selection but nothing to write home about.  Much better than the circus circus but not as good as Treasure Island.  I did enjoy the privacy and overall quite nature when we went around 2:00pm

IUVCS73sdnHzYyAMQVYzLQ.text: This place has fallen off drastically.  Don't do the all day pass since it isn't worth it.  They serve the same food for all meals. The only plus is that it isn't as popular as before so lines are short.

xkezFYv-gXNICF-vOwYvLw.text: 2.5 stars The only reason to eat at the Luxor buffet is the convenience and that's why I was there for 3 meals in one day in early December.  A ballroom competition that I was in was at the Luxor, so eating at the buffet was an easy way to get food at all hours without worrying about a wait.  Everything self serve (it felt like a big cafeteria) including the drinks and there's a limited variety of food.  The desserts were uninspiring and they didn't have cookies.  But the plus is that you can get an all day wristband for $32.

r1YFIarqVaFCDvkjBoR79Q.text: I ate here on a late morning/early afternoon before heading out.  The food was good for the most part and it had an "ok" selection of food.  It had the usual Vegas buffet staples of salad, fruit, aisian, desserts, ice cream, etc.  I didn't have anything that I fell in love with, yet I didn't have anything that I brought to the table that I didn't eat either.   My buffet was complimentary with my room so I didn't pay and it was satisfying for the 'price,' yet if you want a great buffet, I would suggest going elsewhere (Rio and Ceaser's are at the top of my list).

UnZ3enpwqXf8hCKZzcmZQQ.text: The food here in not great nor is it "bad", it's lacking alot of good stuff - It's pretty basic & simple.  Breakfast - $9.99 Lunch       - $14.95 Dinner      - $19.99  Option to purchase an "eat all day" for $29.99 per person.  That would be the best deal if you plan on eating here all day.  They give you a colored band that is water proof, however it doesn't entitle you to jump in front of the line.

qgnZrHZNPSsPx0m6XlKCYg.text: My second review of a buffet on the Strip.  I am now able to define the bottom rung of the buffet experience.  Luckily I got the all day pass that was also good at Excalibur, otherwise it all would have been a waste.  Literally nothing was good here, and while it LOOKS big on the outside, the selection is awful.  There is a large salad bar though, but salads aren't really my thing...  The meat selection sucks.  Pass.

Rgo6N69pPo2JL3u_6Tinbw.text: My husband & I stopped here for breakfast while walking the strip.  I'd have to say, the only decent thing about it is that they accept mLife cards/points.  We noticed the reviews on all websites weren't the greatest, but we aren't that picky with our food and thought we'd give it a shot.  While there was a TON of food to choose from, there were only about two things that would be deemed as "good".  Not only were the eggs runny, but even the chocolate milk was watery!

tfuasdos4Snw-cYWiP3tUQ.text: This review is for the breakfast buffet.   We ate here twice because we liked it so much. Both times were very good. The lines can start getting long around 9 am but if you arrive early enough, before 8:30 am, you can beat the rush.   GOOD: The scrambled eggs and Spanish omelets were both good. The breakfast meats were also good, consisting of bacon, sausage links and sausage patties. They have real sliced home fried potatoes. Cheese blintzes were a bonus. Apple crepes were ok. I also like the self serve juice bar and coffee. It beats waiting on a server to bring you your beverage and hope they got it right. Biscuits and gravy were good one day, bad the next.  BAD: One day the biscuits were fresh, the next day they were hard as a rock. Even gravy could not save them. They placed breakfast meats in line just before the omelet station. People waiting in line for omelets to be made end up blocking the breakfast meats in. They really need to redesign the buffet line food placement to avoid this.  For the price, breakfast here can't be beat. This will be our regular breakfast stop.

JB4QoAyYc5V6zPX6fUYitw.text: It was an ok experience.  Each time I have came here, the staff takes a long time for drinks which makes it kind of a drag to eat there.  The price is decent.  Food quality is ok.  Some of the stuff seemed like its been sitting out.  Don't eat their sushi.  I had a bad stomache ache after eating the sushi there twice. I probably would go there again.

bjOsCh4DNX3f5sKhMIRiDA.text: I ate at this buffet place twice. Dinner and lunch. Although it doesnt  have enough variety, I thought its not bad atj all. Their prime rib at dinner time are pretty juicy and cook really good. Great on selection of food and desserts, great coffee when they make it fresh. Service are pretty ok tloo, never had too many empty plates lying on my table for too long.  People actually line up for this buffet and although I would give this place a four star, I just cant because the grumpy hostess that doesnt smile.

00yxpFLD41nfjnvrDx3oDg.text: The food was mediocre. Not much customer service. But after eating lunch there on 5/18, my whole family got food poisoning. I wouldn't recommend eating here. Go somewhere else. The Bellagio had amazing food!

VpNBgeB3J-cBmmOp1BC_TA.text: For being on the Strip, and holding up a reputation, the price was comparable but the quality was just not.... there. There wasn't much to choose from.... no salad toppings for salads, incomplete good stations, lots of empty slots and not even chicken in the chicken fajitas pan. I checked. Twice. If you want GOOD quality, try Bayside Buffet in Mandalay Bay.  This food was bland, sad and not very tasty. The best two items I found were the grapefruit juice from the drinking stations and the Heath Bar cheesecake. But.... it just isn't worth the money.

Fm2hYnauX-7f3SqpilOKOg.text: Ate here because we had buy one get one free, so it cost $23 for two including soft drinks. Barely worth that much. Food was all bland and the hot food was generally cold. There was a pretty good selection of food, drinks and desserts along with a friendly staff. That along with the desserts being pretty good raised my one star to two. If you get a deal on the cost and are looking for quantity over quality, this might be an option for you. However, with as many places to eat in Vegas, I recommend finding a better spot.

mw9V72HmneNqZMiMuXrsrg.text: We came just as breakfast was ending and lunch was starting. We ended up eating both though since they hadn't cleared away the breakfast completely yet. Everything tasted pretty good and it's not as expensive as some of the other buffets. I thought the eggs benedict tasted a little strange, but I quite liked the waffles.

JUmb-UhhZXN1s-xrLgC_og.text: The Buffet at the Luxor seems to be slightly lesser known than some of the other Buffet's that people tend to talk about or recommend.  But in my opinion is one of the better Buffet's as far as price, quality and wait time's in Vegas.  Buffet's are getting outrageously expensive in Vegas if you go to any of the more popular or highly rated ones on the strip.  You can easily pay upwards of $50 per person for a Dinner Buffet at some hotels or for the Seafood themed nights and wait an hour plus to pay these high prices.  Don't get me wrong, the food is normally very good, a lot of variety and quality seems high.  But paying $200+ for dinner for a family of four is not my idea of money well spent.  The Buffet at the Luxor has pretty much the same variety as most Buffets, the wait time when I have gone has never been more than 15 minutes and the price per person for dinner is only $24.99 each.  $16.99 for kids under 12 I believe. The have a great selection of salads with plenty of toppings, they have a carving station, Chinese, American, Mexican and Italian stations normally.  You can have made to order items from the Chef's, etc.  They also have an offering of seafood selections, I usually always have crab legs which are my favorite.  I have only been here once when they did not have them.  If you don't see them in the main sections of the Buffet, go to the areas where the Chef's are and they are sometimes serving them from there.  Of course they have a ton of desert options as well for you sweet tooth.  All in all if you are looking to have a Buffet experience that will not break the bank, I would recommend The Buffet at the Luxor.  Less than $100 for a family of four and you can eat until you need to be rolled out of there.    If you are part of Mlife or play My Vegas you can also get great discounts for free Buffet's or 2-1 Buffet's as well or even Free Buffets, even better.  One last plus that I have to mention, which is high on my list and I should have lead this Buffet is actually below the casino floor so the smoke levels are minimal (I really hate smoking and don't want to smell it while I am eating). This is great!!  Updated on 5/16/18  Came back for another visit while I was here in Vegas, I have to say, this time around not quite as good as previous times I had been here.  My review above still stands although I dropped the rating from a 5 to a 4 this time.  Still overall decent and priced right, but some of the options this time were limited and they did not have any kind of crab legs this go around (warm or cold) a little of a disappointment.  The roast beef was a little tough at the carving station, but the rest of the food was good.    Another thing I did not mention in my first review is that they have a full bar where you can get  beer, wine or various mixed drinks.  They charge for the drinks unless you pay for an unlimited all you can drink pass.  Still a nice addition to their buffet.  One last thing is all MGM properties charge for parking, unless you are a gold member or above  from their Mlife loyalty program.  Just something to consider when looking for a buffet in Vegas these days)  Enjoy.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. First course, Crab!!

c-fQuktvV9EqQmDZ3UovNw.text: Good choice in food. Wonderful entertainment! It's the Walmart of Buffets! It's a must see!!!

92qUKdFFVmX81KvyK8GqqQ.text: First time coming here to this buffet.  Its very unorganized.  The quality of the food is not the best.  I will think twice before coming here again.

cTGQX_frS7mR3aKnmm5-gQ.text: Decidedly underwhelming buffet. The food was kind of tasteless and if you are a vegan there are limited choices. The service is good and the restaurant is clean. The fruit was really good on the other hand.  We did a breakfast and a dinner and there was a lot of overlap between both buffet menus for some reason. If you get comps like we had then why not, give it a go. If you are paying out of pocket then save your money and enjoy dinner elsewhere.

n5SGgN4kOtBmVmbvQzSg9w.text: It's a casino buffet. It's all-you-can-eat for about $25. The food was decent, especially the dishes prepared in front of you. I didn't care for the carved beef, but crab! Desert bar was also decent.  I wasn't blown away by the quality for the price. Three stars is appropriate.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Steak and crab

0CYrh9_oFX9xZEzHNs6wMw.text: We were given services by a racist server on Dec 23 around 6PM. Her name is Diana. When we asked her for a crab cracker, she ignored us, until we had to walk to her and asked the second time.   When my husband came back from getting his food, he saw left-over liquid SPILLED all over his seat. He asked her to change our seatings. She said NO, and said that she would only clean it for him. She also asked him "Did you do this?". When she asked us about the finished plates, this was how she asked "IS THIS FINISHED?" (with an attitude) without saying Please as she did to the other tables ( customers are white)... Speechless!   Then she basically did not take our finished plates on the tables from that point. There were two plates on the table and she did not even touch them. Other Asian customers on the opposite table also had the same treatment.   I wish I can post her picture here. I took a picture of her, our table and the other table as mentioned above.   The food is too salty. I will never come back to Luxor The Buffet. This is the worse customer service and food I have ever had from a buffet this price range. You should re-train your workers' attitude. No one should be hired to treat people differently. Discrimination and racism will never be accepted.

FsjLjgReHGzT4iTcYp1jPQ.text: You couldn't pay me to come eat here again. Despite the underwhelming reviews we came here because it was the closet place to eat that was quick and we were all starving. Hoping for the best we figured let's give it a shot wth. The only way to describe this place is like if home town buffet decided to leave their food out for days unrefrigerated and then heated it up and served it to customers. It was the most pathetic and sad meal I have ever had. My 9 year old couldn't stomach the food she said it tasted like play doh or nothing at all. Their best dishes were the ones they didn't have to cook (Greek tomato salad) and the fruit.  For $25 you would be better off spending your money at any fast food joint, at least you would know it was fresh. Go somewhere else, save yourself!

5z7cCJls7lmR4RQ5kXBu9Q.text: Not good. Overpriced for lack of variety (about $28 including tax).  Leftovers from breakfast clearly out at dinner time. Would not return

6uJn2p3v0062cZpId8zKbQ.text: The only thing I wanted today was crab legs. The are  beyond over cooked to the point or being burnt (I had no idea that was possible). So rubbery & the butter tasted like movie theater popcorn.

0EhiDHdZx-OdcEsaY92R2A.text: Reading some of these reviews, people crack me up. Of course the price is ridiculously inflated for the buffet, but it's not difficult at all to find BOGO coupons, or even earn free meals, I've eaten here twice during my stay and didn't pay a dime.  Secondly, if you're looking for gourmet creations from a world class chef, you're not going to get it here. It's a casino buffet people!  What you will find is a nice selection on the salad bar, good choices for main dishes, and a plentiful desert counter.  For all you can eat, I sure ate a lot and wasn't disappointed whatsoever.

jeCcIJzmsOapohvIHKXOzg.text: The best thing about this buffet is the restaurant decor which is pretty cool almost like an eatery you would see at a Disney or Universal theme park. Other than that, eat somewhere else.

1Uy2qMdKa8d9jPbcVz2iRg.text: If you are wanting breakfast, this is a really good buffet! It's the only reason I gave it three stars. For lunch and dinner, however... for vegetarians, they truly suck! All the other buffets I've eaten at on the strip, good and bad; at least had a marking designating what's vegetarian. Luxor, however, did not and that might be because I am not sure they had any vegetarian options at all. At least not in the hot food area. All that money and I ate salads.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PmVZL0zy3fj9uqeNhIukrQ.text: Came here on Christmas Day. There was a line as it was expected. Everything in this buffet is self served even the drinks. They had a vast selection of cuisines. Greek, American, Italian, Asian, Mexican and sea food but more importantly everything was so tasty. Usually in buffets the desserts don't taste good despite their looks but I tried 2 desserts, tiramisu and cheesecake and both were so delicious. The price was 29 dollars and that includes one alcoholic drink.

dsbT-OawUxhxD6CzFJXd9g.text: We came here on a 2 for 1 lunch buffet. Really roomy area, we weren't trampling over each other to get our food. That's a HUGE plus. Food was pretty good! Mashed potatoes and gravy were divine, lots of butter in the potatoes and so creamy. The turkey off the carving station is the best I've ever had, moist, juicy and flavorful. Loved the little slider sloppy joes.   The international foods were kind of lacking...the Asian food was "meh"...they had some kind of sticky sweet sauce in the egg rolls that I didn't like...the potstickers were dried out, and the noodles had no flavor. The lasagne tasted good but the noodles were way over cooked and mushy.   Since this place is located in a giant pyramid, it would have been cool to see some middle-eastern food. Just a suggestion.   Good desserts, especially the creme brulee. It had some crunchy topping that was YUMMY.

qL7PzeTiRDtF5WLDH9CXzA.text: This is the worst Buffet I have ever eaten at. Do not eat here. The advertising for this place is way off. There is minimal food selection. For Italian the only thing available was old spaghetti and pizza. Most of the food is not labeled, containers empty, and the food tastes horrible. Seafood is warm and not cold. Salad bar is pretty much just whole apples. For being the "up graded" dinner I could have gone to the Mirage Buffet and had a gourmet meal instead. I will never eat here again. Go eat at the Mirage Buffet.

0kPilQBTLcQCv7C8u81ibw.text: Awesome gluten free experience! I had variety and I left full the chef Clark walked me around the buffett to show me what was safe and Imelda had n the bakery section had some good gluten free options to chose from! It was a nice experience for a person with a celiac diagnosis !! Way to go Luxor!!!!

-5Y6AwC-BIwXhL08tBIncg.text: 276. Got here right before their lunch period. We were hungry and it was a good deal.  After making my first round, I realized that this was very different from the classy, glamorous buffet that you would expect at an upscale resort. Some of the food was cold and hard. We felt sick when we left. I wouldn't say that there was something wrong with the food, but the quality was not there. The only saving grace was the mini flan they had for dessert.  It would be an understatement to say that I was disappointed. Not a place where you would come back for "more".

JCqZZcrx3oJ9tWlJ2OtMMw.text: It was what I expected.  Not mad.  I did like the waffle fries and soft serve though.  The meats were not appealing.   The fish was tastless and greasy.

lW6zRlhbCtjh6UVn3MWXjw.text: The selection was very limited.   The food was okay.   Nothing objectionable but probably the most limited selection of any buffet I've ever been to in Vegas.     We're staying here and it's easy.   Most likely won't do it again.   It's not gross like Excalibur,  just not good

0X4PdpeJIFuO81e4xE-uoQ.text: For a buffet this place is awesome, the meatballs and dumplings are everything. The dessert table is a site to see. Many variations to choose from, you will not be disappointed.  Price was $19.99 per adult for lunch, not bad at all most places start at $25 & up, they also have a package for the whole day of eating for $40. Considering the chips and aids are $9 in the gift shop $40 for the whole day of good food doesn't sound bad at all. Make sure to get your Mlife card to get discount.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tore the dessert table up  The only thing that didn&#39;t tasted bad was the raspberry square, it gave me a horrible taste and ruined my flow
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet dining area

VmVge2lhKo4Ni2TFSMaxEg.text: Too much money for God Awful food!!  Food was bland and pretty much tasted horrible!!  Not worth the $25+ I paid for it!!  I've had Fast Food that tasted MUCH better than the Swill they cook at this Buffet!!  I will definitely NOT be going there ever again.  The Luxor has MUCH Better restaurants and you will get a MUCH better meal for a whole lot less!!

sMzoOysaEec-KJMNN-PjyQ.text: My Family and I we were at the Luxor for a Wedding on Jan 2, 2016 and after the wedding we all wanted to eat at the More Buffet but we didn't have reservations because the young girls that planned the wedding were told they would have to pre-pay the full amount for the whole party and they were not able to do that for about 35 to 40 people. The Manager Millie Barrueta put us in a very nice private room and gave us the discount for having the wedding there and provided  us with the nicest waitress named Hiyon and it was just perfect.  Thanks to you both who went out of your way to make our special time wonderful!!!!!! Sherrie Lawson attended the Montez Wedding.

8FG72wvc6XxYwlbzzrZAug.text: Worst buffet in vegas by far!!! Wish we could have gotten our money back. We came here to eat as we were visiting the hotel for the titanic exhibition. The buffet had a poor selection many things were out. It was dirty and disgusting!

DG6Q0D9nEXgrPRXZ4QGfWQ.text: Wow.  What happened?! We were here just 10 months ago.  I cannot believe how different our visit today was compared to our first time.   All the food has been sitting out for a long time. The corn was soggy, the ribs were dried out. The waffle fries were hard as rock. The fried chicken was saturated in grease. I brought four plates of food back from the buffet and couldn't even eat 15%.   There was literally no bread out. The three baskets were completely empty, except for two rock hard pieces of sourdough. There was bread on the floor.  My boyfriend asked if there would be more bread put out. 20 min later I had to go track down the same worker and ask again.   The desert bar was no better. I had to scrape the top layer of the cheese cake off in order to eat it.   The lemon pannacotta had a strong metallic taste.  Never in my life have I left a buffet hungrier than when I arrived.   Granted, we only paid $27.05 for two people.  If I did not have a BOGO coupon I would have asked for my money back.   "It's sad that I had to make a sandwich from the buffet because I'm still so hungry, I couldn't eat any of that crap" - my poor boyfriend.

kR7PXufh00kNrcXy_J5ASA.text: Went there for breakfast and was disappointed. The potatoes were cold I mean refrigerator cold. Tho omelette station looked good but the oil they use gave the omelette a horrible taste.  The peaches and pears were canned fruit. The sausage patties were great but wouldn't pay 20.00 again find someplace else for breakfast

-jF__8nwqqynN8Evc7g-zA.text: Met a friend for the lunch buffet February 22, 2018. We both live in Las Vegas and rarely dine at strip restaurants. So glad he had a BOGO coupon. Buffet is over priced, poor selection and quality. The beef and broccoli, fried rice, spring roll were good. Nice selection of desserts including sugar free. Don't waste your time or money at this buffet.

eQNAkajN5-NSproaXsyo1w.text: I particularly enjoyed the breakfast pizza and great beverage selection. But there are plenty of other food options here, from breakfast cereals, Asian food, Mexican choices, and of course the basics such as omelettes and bash browns.   I got entry to this buffet on a comp but even if I did pay for it, I'd be satisfied. I have yet to try any other buffets in Vegas but my one base mark, a 4 star all inclusive in playa del Carmen, didn't have as good of one.

XxbW1kNF9LINi084J-aR-w.text: We really liked the buffet but tonight when we went there, some of the food they have always had was not there and there didn't seem to have as much variety as in the past. What happened to the serve yourself chilled crab legs that they always had broken in half??

dZ1Zbr7DsdwKxFRuwW5cTw.text: Not sure why this buffet has such low stars. It's not fantastic but it is a good deal for your money, especially since the Luxor is mostly full of expensive eateries. (You can catch a tram over to Mandalay Bay, which has more restaurants and a food court. But meh, lazy.)  They also have a deal running where you can eat at the Excalibur buffet as well as the Luxor one for a flat rate all day.  If I had kids or was on vacation I would definitely take advantage of that deal.   Food is your typical hotel fare, which means a carving station and crab legs and a selection of different international cuisines. Nothing like the Wynn, but for $24 per person I was very satisfied. Not to mention very full.   They also have a full bar in the area, as well as a soft-serve ice cream machine and froyo machine. Bonus points!

zCJ_61Z5CCe8vwcsNsER1Q.text: Looks like what you would think the basement of a pyramid would look like! Lol Since we stayed here, my hubby and I decided to check it out and to our surprise because of all the reviews on Yelp, we enjoyed it! Finally a place that my picky husband can eat at! He thoroughly enjoyed the carving station and the steak station where they will grill you a steak to your liking. I enjoyed the salad bar and the American and Italian but the Latino food could use some help.

541DygM5wEdt1iAfcI5dVQ.text: I had gotten lunch here and the variety of food was okay. It wasn't bad but I wouldn't come here again for my money's value. Food was bland and not my preference with the food offered. Lunch for 20 is a good value comparing to the price value of other hotel buffet.

k8TNxJ8lmGkkoBSCis1CXg.text: We went September 5, 2015. Bragging the steak dinner. Though they charge us $28 way less than the usual $40 buffet in Vegas.  Paella is ok.  No warm crab legs, only cold.  The man cooking the steak is BITCH, when asked for a medium well, told all the people in line to wait for 15 mins and just offered a medium rare. Also when I went back to get two more slices he doesn't want to give more than one. He doesn't deserve to be facing people, may be the best part is cooking in backdoor.  The dessert is ok though.

0dNeTrJgnujFqHhmSNtYew.text: Great place for brunch, a little on the pricey side ($50 total for 2 guests) but this included all you can drink mimosas which were made with really good orange juice unlike most places. All the food was great, we had omelets (they have an omelet bar, made to order),  and my wife had waffles which she loved and I had their French toast. Everything was excellent, one of the best breakfasts I've had in town.

I_mI4dygfczhC_96_xTzpw.text: I came here for the Easter Sunday brunch. I liked the unique decor, which is in line with the Luxor Theme. However, this is an older buffet, and you can tell by the dark carpets, and that the tables were wearing out and losing color.  Food, however, had more selections than the upgraded modern and contemporary Excalibur Buffet. I was satisfied with their selections and quality (this can't be compared to Bellagio or Wynn Buffet). Like Excalibur Buffet though, I think the price should be reduced by 25%.

MFqw88QUCaQBbnJOB461Yg.text: Went for the dinner buffet on the 28th and was pleasantly surprised by the selection of food offered for the price of about $25 and change/person. I really loved the Asian selection, especially the Korean BBQ ribs. The desserts were pretty damn good as were some of their other items like the Peruvian Chicken and the Pasta bar.  I don't really like crabs but there was a nonstop supply of it and my company sure enjoyed them.  Finally the gentleman that was clearing out the tables in our section by the soda fountain was such a friendly and warm person it made dinner even more enjoyable.  Next time we will get the Dinner and Breakfast package. All in all a great deal for the price.

qUrH_2_YSLHK_b5TTBJ0kA.text: Lunch is just spaghetti, sausage, orange chicken and other junk food, And they charge 18.99 per adult. What a waste. Still guest are lining up for convenience if your staying at the luxur. Never again. Spend you money elsewhere like Rio.

Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

bRz0ypqUZgQcHeR2ap9NnA.text: Well this was an average experience with a minus, at a low price. Nothing much to say about it tastewise.  Tried all the Meats and some of it was good. The fried chicken looked very dry, so skipped it eventhough Im a chicken lover.  The carvery beef was ok, but not a real deep beef taste.  The good thing was the desserts, tasted good and plenty to choose from.

hiPC7EYrKnsQ5jSSTVzF7Q.text: Heard good things about this 7 continent variety buffet at Luxor. For the price I'm sure there are better places to eat. The food was just ok. No real service to speak of since it is a buffet and we had minimal contact other than being taken to our table.   No welcome, no explanation of their different areas of food represented. I get it is Vegas, but not everyone is a return visitor. You have people visiting from all over the world and asking if you've been here before and if they say no, then give a quick run down. I truly feel if they had greeters engage more with quests and give a brief run down of the food variety that is available.  Again food isn't bad but they are a little pricey for the bland food with no customer service.  It was clean and there is lots of seating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I tried a small sampling from each area!

FGNuFu3RU7lsICkuNAm3UQ.text: This was our one and only buffet while in Vegas and what a disappointment! Luckily my wife had some coupons that got us a three for one deal. If we had to pay three full meal tickets then I would really have been pissed! Although the buffet bar was huge the food was so mediocre. The ham was fatty; the ribs were over-cooked; the fish was freezer burnt and the rest was very bland. I will give mad props for the dessert bar. The selection was good and the flavor and presentation was excellent.

KLNvlxxux_MbRyVnaj1qeg.text: BREAKFAST REVIEW:  I dined here two days in a row for breakfast and both times I left the buffet very pleased! It's surprising to find such a satisfying buffet with a great selection of breakfast items at the Luxor, which is a casino I'm not a big fan of. I'm a fan of their breakfast buffet though!  You'll find everything from French toast to cheese blintzes, from turkey sausages to pork sausages, from croissants to bagels, from breakfast burritos to biscuits and gravy--almost anything you can crave for breakfast. I played it safe with toast, cottage cheese topped with strawberry compote from the pancake/waffle section, turkey sausages, blueberry muffins (very moist!), scrambled eggs, and oatmeal.... it was all delicious. My family loved their corned beef hash, eggs Benedict, scrambled eggs with chorizo, and French toast. I think that pretty much confirms that everything here tastes great. My only complaint is that the fresh fruit selection is lacking. I swear, if they added some fresh berries and fresh pineapple instead of the canned ones they serve this buffet would be the best breakfast buffet! As a fruit lover, this is why I'm giving the buffet four stars instead of five.   The service was also friendly. Our servers always wore a big smile on their faces and welcomed us warmly on the second day we dined there.   I'm not sure how the lunch or dinner buffet at the Luxor is, but I'll be returning for the breakfast buffet even if I'm staying at another hotel. To me, it's worth the travel and the reasonable $17.99 price.

eWI2RCxCFAr1amNsgt8G5A.text: Horrible.  In the dungeon of the pyramid.  Went for breakfast but the food was bad.  I bit into a sausage and thought it tasted funny.  I wondered if it was turkey but it was super bitter.  Green inside apparently they don't check the food before they reheat it and serve it.   I told the only staff member i saw and the response was "oh". Not sorry not oh my god where did you get it from.  Nothing.  I live in Nevada bTW

uPOTElCU_czy29fqLKyXlQ.text: I went to "More" for the Sunday brunch at 11 am. $21.99 for 1 adult. The service was terrible as you wait for the host to seat you which took forever. The lines were long because of this. It reminded me of David Copperfield creating an illusion, an illusion that they were busy even though it was the host that made it appear they were busy. Food was just as bad, cold & greasy. I say "NO MORE" to "MORE"!!

rNRMrlbGbXp69SlrYCoXGg.text: Note to self. When in Vegas, do not be lazy and go to any ordinary buffet, skipping the Bellagio or the Wynn. They are often imitated, but never duplicated.  This business is an prime example of quantity over quality. While under $20 per person for lunch seems like a bargain, it is not. I know why this place was empty. This place is depressing and the food was terrible.   The burger station serves hockey pucks for patties. The pizza is barely edible. I picked up some sushi and the salmon pieces were so thin. Scary looking... here's a little more imagery: old pasta (it was sitting there for a while... you know when it turns to a darker shade of yellow?). BBQ ribs were dry (wait I didn't ask for beef jerky). Prime Rib had plenty of grizzle... grizzle rib? Is this turning you on? It shouldn't.  I wish I invested the buffet fees into a slot machine and went to McDonald's.  I will not return.   IFHTP 1

gYtf1RemyluR6zAVlTwQSg.text: First time trying buffet in Las Vegas. $20 per person for lunch seems like a fair deal good selection of salads soups also different types of foods.

ZNf9al4Kjc6R9YgiiwgYtA.text: This was the worst Buffett I have ever been  to. The sour cream was runny and spoiled..so much so that  it reminded me of seminal fluid expelled from a hobo. The taco shells were broken like my dreams of a good dinner. Nothing was edible and I was given a refund. What's worse is that it was expensive!!! Who would pay for this unless you enjoy punishment ... If that's the case save your money and invest in a domamatrix..it is Vegas after all.

6CzPR2k8Ds0gUkLCDmXZbg.text: We arrived in Vegas on 9/22/13 with a group of friends, long story short our room was not what we needed (we needed handicapp room) they changed our room 3 times til they got it right and our consulation prize was a $50 comp to More Buffet, me being excited not having to pay alot for dinner I jumped on it and called my siblings to join us.  Well it's $22/pp, when I was told that I had to get my own drinks that was my first thought of THIS SUCKS!!!  As I started going through the food area I was sooooooo disappointed - I AM IN VEGAS ARE YOU KIDDING ME!  The food was so so, not very happy with the types of food and/or the taste of the food.  No wonder they gave me a free comp to this place.  Do yourself a favor - do not, I repeat - DO NOT waste your money.

0a8O7i-XkgYecbAVRvxWzQ.text: I did breakfast a couple of times on my last Vegas trip since I was staying at the Luxor, pretty descent buffet by Vegas standards. They have a lot to choose from, and most of everything I tried was good. All of the servers were really nice and they keep this place really clean.

fqAo-DNwGbE0IRko5Y3TFw.text: MORE? Yeah they need to put MORE food out. Get here at 11:15 and get a little bit if breakfast before the lunch.  You'll be releasing demons between plates. Bye gotta go to the coke factory now.

eeoboPaybvj1Qx6fcPnG6g.text: As cheap as $29.99 or an entire day of eating is, do NOT go to this buffet.  I do not think anything there was good, except for the watermelon.  Grilled tilapia is somehow breaded.  Dessert looks like it was pulled out of a box and placed on a stand.  Sushi was still frozen.  Put it this way, I did not get any item from the buffet line more than once.  They messed up steamed rice.  wtf?  In case you are wondering how, there were so many hard uncooked rice morsels on my plate.  Save your money and eat elsewhere.    If you're wondering why I would even eat at a buffet like this after experiencing places like the bellagio or wynn buffet, it is because I was forced to purchase the all-inclusive package for the group I was with.  Which is worth it if you actually want to participate in all the stuff they offer, but who really does that while they are in vegas?

6p9vYpO5_0tVmCs2CfUkIw.text: It's OK if you are staying there but I wouldn't go out of my way. Bellagio is much better. Heck, a Golden Coral is better and cheaper!

7ifZreDg4nw-_7YxIeYxdw.text: One of our family members had a reunion at the restaurant, therefore we had no choice but to go.  After reading the reviews my wife and I felt a bit restrained from going.  After all, we are in Vegas, and we want to eat the best food available.  But we had to go.  22 Dollars a plate for  a Buffet in Vegas!  It doesn't get cheaper than that around this area.   The Service: It's a buffet, so its self served.  However, the staff is very quick to pick up the plates.  Also, the restaurant was very clean! The Restaurant: It looks like a giant elegant school cafeteria. The food: Obviously it won't compare with a 5 star acclaimed restaurant, but it's also not even 1/4 of the price.  However, its much better than the average country style buffet.  I actually enjoyed allot of the dished better than even food from chain restaurants such as apple bees, etc.. If you're looking to enjoy the best fine dining experience, then don't  go there.  If all you want is reasonable good food, then this is the place to go.  And let me tell you about deserts,  YUM...

SS8rjLUffnCPFSGq4kwb7Q.text: Oh my, where to start. This is like the Golden Corral's sad disease ridden cousin who lives under the stairs. When I made it over to the buffet it became apparent why they make you pay before you get into the restaurant. The "hot" meats were dry and only barely warm. The cold items were not really. If you eat seafood from this buffet, you are more brave than I am. After trying a several different things, including the taco chicken, and pizza (because how can you mess that up) I decided that the items on the buffet were all upsettingly distasteful and I would just eat salad. They had an olive salad (i love olives), tomato salad (also love tomato salad) and spinach salad. The Olive Salad actually tasted like garbage smells. The Tomato salad was not much better. The best things on the buffet were actually the enchiladas which tasted like they came from the freezer section at a shady grocery store. With all of the other choices around for food, pass on this one.

25USoJ4wSasR49qiljkeCQ.text: For breakfast it was bangin!  who thought to put cream angliase on oatmeal...I did and it was good!    Gluttoness yes but a good quick not to expensive spot to eat breakfast on the strip...  why only 3 stars...well I wont get into the rotten oranges or the wait on my way inn...and lets face it its the Luxor breakfast buffet.....

hAc5TshbtHGlITJniHDU3w.text: wouldn't come back unless I have another discount or coupon. only plus- mimosas are included with the price.

aEXyjO231OnWLHV-v-h3MQ.text: I normally don't write reviews,  but this buffet is a waste of money. The only decent thing was that the server was efficient at removing the half full plates of disgusting food from our table. For $22 + tax I suggest avoiding this buffet as if your life depended on it. Big disappointment indeed.

6vGqeeCfpWwq74uhpXqXow.text: This is a vegetarian's lunch review.  They have Asian, Italian, American, Greek, and Mexican foods, a number of fruits, salad bar, sandwich bar, and a number of drinks.  They have SO MANY options that I think anyone could find something tasty.  I liked the salads, and the Mexican/Greek sections were good.  The Asian section had veggie eggrolls, but they seemed to be mostly cabbage inside.  The fried rice was comparable to Panda Express etc.  I didn't eat American or Italian.  They had 3 kinds of soup (one unlabeled, two chicken noodle, one egg drop).  The dessert is great (10-15 types including flan, cheesecakes, creme brulee, danishes, soft serve, mousse, bread pudding...).  My biggest complaint is that half of the foods are mislabeled or unlabeled.  Most of the time this just meant that the beef said "chicken" and the chicken said "beef", and they were right next to each other.  I remember one of the soups wasn't labeled (and unidentifiable), and crepes were called "monkey bread".  Also, they had little blintzes labeled "eggs benedict".  If you have allergies, I would be worried about eating here, because of the lack of naming-finesse.  Oh also, every single line is different (i.e., they DON'T have two identical salad lines), so make sure you look everywhere for food.

xCOSZdtbc-q_JF5Ez2Tgjw.text: Pretty decent spread and its $30 all day per person. I am really not a fan of stuffing myself until i can no longer breathe.  Lunch time was a fiasco. We had wristbands and still had to wait like 25 minutes for a table. I was hot, hungry and grumpy... not a good combo.  Breakfast included mimosas, an omlette bar, belgian waffles, pancakes, bagles w/ lox, shrimp with cocktail sauce, and a few other random breakfast items. Lunch was pretty awesome. Taco bar, chinese food, pasta, salad, sushi (which looked questionable), salad, etc.   All in all, I think i got my money's worth because I cant fit into my skinny jeans anymore.

5CtZJ5KZM-B5o98_p2QU0Q.text: Most limited buffet I have ever seen for breakfast.  no strawberry, blueberry, etc.  Orange juice horrible,  go to dennys or ihop instead.

5JWEf7YEye24uYCVVezUnQ.text: I had fun here while I was in search of an inexpensive brunch before the long drive home. Great variety of dishes. One step up from the hometown buffet/golden corral type buffets.

MEdsqCsSs3InVpB-PYm6rw.text: For $19.99, I might have as well swinged over to the Rio or Wynn for a bit more money to better quality food. Don't get me wrong. The food was pretty decent but nothing on top grade when comparing the different buffets you can choose on the LV Strip.   The Cinnamon Monkey Bread was something of a different nature that gave this place some uniqueness. The unlimited mimosas is one you can't go wrong. The waitress who served the drinks was funny as hell but could taken the wrong way when joking about the champagne costing only $3 a bottle.   Anyways, not a bad place overall but you have better choices if you go to other places raved about. The buffet at the M hotel is what I hear is the place to go lately!

stEv-aTqmJ3j57pw0X4AUg.text: Save your money.  Not worth the 25$ per person. Go elsewhere!  Cold food. Crap service. Nothing made this worth it.  Even the desserts made me sad.  And I love dessert

JuHjsgBvnQfyp1kZ51S9tg.text: I went to this buffet for brunch on a weekday. Super disappointed. Not too many options overall. Some of the food was bland and dry. Maybe I'll try dinner next time I'm in town

UxHHgQAwdDB2JBIY9XgHSw.text: Reviews are correct, but slightly off!! There wasn't much of a food selection. However it was tasty and well prepped. I gave a 3 because I'm a customer service advocate and a foodie. Both were good just not great!!   The Asian cuisine only had fried rice, chow main, and spring rolls. I would of loved a variety of some of  Asia's Finest like beef broccoli or orange chicken. The Mexican Food only had a few of the same type of dishes. Get this, no beans either.    Overall the service was good. Laura took very great care of our table and area. Her lead wasn't pleasant with her, that wasn't cool, but she smiled and carried on. Never let us know she was bothered.   For $29 bucks or so, I left full and satisfied. Kids price, even the score and desserts were on point. Selection and service knocked this review from a low 4 to high 3. Out of convenience I'd come back.

8kFivfYW9NeBm1dWwT7v8g.text: On our most recent Vegas trip, we were offered 2 complimentary buffets with our stay at the Luxor so we figured why not! We ended up going for an early lunch on Saturday, around 11 AM.   The line for the buffet was surprisingly long. We were able to get a table in about 10 minutes and started grabbing our food. They had a bunch of breakfast options, which I really enjoyed. I loved the traditional eggs, bacon, waffles, etc... and the bottomless mimosas that came free with our meal.  The food wasn't bad at all! I thoroughly enjoyed all my selections and had a really great meal. Service was great too. Our plates were taken really quickly and we were given extra napkins when we got new plates of food.

acB8zdv1X75OlcbZsQrIPA.text: The food was awful. The pizza looked like tombstone brand and everything else was cold.  We paid 24 per person+18% tips Not worth it.

e8xNpnajCnZjD0ESxUKSVg.text: Not bad for a buffet and not too pricey, don't skip the desserts. Great customer service

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2n-kQr7cnjPwpHllU2CkTQ.text: Although  Ashley was very busy as a cashier - in a buffet line, too - she was still gracious, helpful and friendly.   Our servers, Heeyun and Tony were so kind. We felt right at home. The food was pretty good too!

rUgHw_xMebeWVgvAx-6qxQ.text: I'm a food snob. I really am. I had a MyVEGAS reward for bogo free. We had an absolutely delicious breakfast here. I have it 4 stars based on convenience, taste,freshness and price. Keeping in mind I had bogo.   They have an omelet station and will make cooked to order eggs and eggs Benedict. I ordered these and the cook made the most beautiful poached delicate eggs I've ever seen. I'm not kidding. Everyone in line clapped. They were gorgeous. I ate them right away and went for other things later. The benedicts were delicious. Yolk perfectly runny whites cooked through.   I went back for bacon,cheese blitz with blueberry sauce. Both great. I did not enjoy chicken fried steak. It was soft meat, obviously frozen and just meh.   The salad bar was open and had some crab seafood salads and lots of fresh fruits but I had two small potato pancakes and when I saw tzatziki with nice large chunks of cucumbers I got a good sized bowl and toasted some bread and this was great with the potatoes Pancakes!  Very good very fresh tzatziki. Blintzes were very good and stuffed full of ricotta and other yumminess.   I highly recommend breakfast here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. tzatziki!!!!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Potato pancakes and blintzes
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Made to order eggs Benedict

7J5qQmzvJG8jAOy_1Mr9dg.text: So far, the worst lunch meal I've had during my trip.  The cashier and service staff were pleasant and friendly but they weren't enough to ignore the poor quality of the food.  I started with a spinach salad with boiled egg yolk bits but the toppings were very limited.  I'm used to seeing mushrooms, bacon bits, peas and corn in a salad bar but they were non-existent here.  I had some "asian" food: fried rice, white rice, an egg roll, and a pot sticker.  The fried rice was average (hard to meds it up), the white rice was mushy, the egg roll was average and the pot sticker was overcooked, dry and tough.  I tried some "american" food: a piece of kielbasa sausage, slice of ham, and roasted chicken wings.  The sausage, ham and chicken were all overcooked and dry.  Definitely not worth spending your money here.

kxyutuXcCAa8UNrCRBggcA.text: Let me just say, expensive! For two people, we spent 60 dollars just for dinner. Two people. And then, the food was way less than to be desired.   It was often over cooked, lacking in flavor, soaking wet with god knows what. The only upside, was the crab legs, shrimp, and sushi.   All three were very well done, considering how basic of a fare they were. Breakfast was... Iffy at best, not any better than dinner. In fact, it was a little worse.   The dessert though, oh my goodness. The main event in this buffet, is the absolutely wonderful dessert.

774XIKQvQXwqIbSPbiHBHQ.text: It was just your typical buffet. Nothing special. Wait staff was just ok as well. Had to flag someone down for straws..etc. Don't know if we'll be back

OCsHthwXpoM6B6dpAFBWGw.text: Just ate Breakfast here and I wish I had looked on Yelp before hand. It was hands down the worst buffet I have ever been to.  Very few choices of really bad food, most of which was cold. You have to tip before you get in and your options start at 18 percent with no waiter.  You get your own coffee and everything,, only thing they do is clear the plates. Do yourself a favor and go to Mandalay Bay buffet, it is cheaper and much more selection of a much higher quality product. Unfortunately I have to give it a star.   So one it is.

xXhDunoa99eJKMQnSV5bRw.text: The website for the buffet at Luxor named off all kinds of food and made it sound like there was a large variety, but in fact the selection was very limited. There were several food containers that looked old or they were empty, and it wasn't even close to closing time. The food tasted bad and is not worth the price. I am not a picky eater and I had a very hard time finding something that tasted good  or looked appetizing.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LseEiC2LYLZtJ-TlFDSp1A.text: They had a really nice buffet overall. I was expecting a little more of a Mediterranean twist, but was not too disappointed, because they had a lovely array of various types of foods, including American, Italian, and more. There was a nice salad bar and a desert station.

7-n9TvPIx0D6f-C1kxP-TQ.text: Food was mediocre and over priced. I tried the crab legs and could finish them because they didn't taste right. The roast beef and ham were dry. The chicken tasted over cooked. The grilled veggies were well cooked and delicious and so was the sesame ginger chicken. They also have 11.99 all you can drink (draft beer, wine, and a couple mixed drinks).

4zWk5w5iB2Vh9bVDJpjpEA.text: Hostesses/Cashiers/Management  (4) standing around but they wouldn't open another register, lots of empty tables and still over a 30 minutes wait in line!   The food was mediocre at best.  Not worth the wait or the $$.

zxIckTRhhxgi3YJzlsovsw.text: Not a horrible deal being decent variety and all you can eat for 20 bucks but most of the dishes were dried out and flavorless. If I was staying at luxor and wasted id probably go out of convenience but theres far better options on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of veggie dishes
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Variety of meat dishes

8UiVyBfD-ZRZEFfjqXw7og.text: Props to CHEF THEO! I called the buffet a few weeks in advance to my visit to double check if they still carried turkey breakfast sausage as I don't eat beef and pork for health purposes. CHEF THEO was very friendly and helpful over the phone and advised me to call back a couple days before my visit to make extra sure they would carry it that day. So I followed his instructions. Although the day I was going to visit so happened to be his day off he still kept his word and alerted another cook of my special request. Sure enough when I arrived all I had to tell them was my name and my delicious turkey sausage patties were cooked fresh immediately and bought to my table....yum!  Not to mention the made to order omelet station hit the gooey spot! I had two of those fluffy and cheezy things and should be keeling over from a blocked artery at any moment, lol! This is a nicely decorated but no frills type of buffet. For the reasonable price, delicious and uniquely flavored homestyle fried chicken and my special request being honored so graciously I cannot say anything negative about this brunch buffet!   Free Mimosas on top of that....I'm sold! :)

eZRsW5VxTiv0LSzGpk45aw.text: The place was okay. Really nothing special, but a lot of food choices for breakfast. They don't use real eggs in dishes unless you go to the omelette bar. This was a big miss with my family and we could hear tables around us commenting about it also. I think it would be a huge improvement to the food quality if they did. We used my Vegas slot comps so it only cost us $12 for our daughter. The staff was very nice and attentive. The line took for ever because they only had one checker for both general and vip.

pyaff3K-y1al9OFbunIXNg.text: A few days later we went back for "More" but I wish we hadn't. This time around it was Saturday- just before the dinner rush.   We added on the "all you can drink for 4.99" beverage package from 4-6. This sounded like a good idea at the time, however it only included beer wine and champagne.     You had to get it from the bartender and after the first drink there was such a huge line up that we only ended up getting one more ( hardly all you can drink )   They should of serve yourself wine and champagne if it's all you can drink !   Also they had no frozen cocktails ( despite them being on the sign / menu ) and when I asked about a double White Russian I was told it was 20$ !   The food also wasn't nearly as good. It was "Steak night" and my husbands was not even cooked inside.   The seafood came with a cracker but not with tiny seafood forks to get the meat from inside. Imagine how much crap is wasted because of this !   The salad bar again was the best part of the meal, and it wasn't as good as the first time.   The desert bar was filthy from the self serve ice cream with dirty dishes piled up.  There was many items that were missing.  ( carrot cake for one )   The creme brulee was just custard. What a Let down!  There was no hard candied shell on top.   The most appealing thing was  the bubble gum behind the glass we couldn't access.    Wow we wished we had never returned. Sorry More- this time More was one more time too much : (

wu_0iuHJJBW1aN2kFlsAXg.text: This review is only for the BREAKFAST.  For $16, in a competitive environment like Las Vegas and especially within the Hotel Casinos, this place "More: The Buffet @ The Luxor" is sub-par to their peers in many aspects.  The price seems high for what you get, at least that's my opinion for the Breakfast selection.  That's what I'd imagine paying for a lunch, and/or for something with greater quantity of more diverse selection and better quality too.  The variety seems limited, very limited for a buffet.  They had for breakfast, from what I remember, only a few food stations including:  Fresh Omelet / Scramble Grill with a Chef, but otherwise just steam trays of:  Corned Beef Hash, Waffles, Pancakes, Apple Crepes, Cheese Crepes, PORK Based Meats (Bacon and Sausages), Eggs, Toast and some pastries, breads and fruit.  So, if you're Jewish or Muslim and can't eat the swine, know that there's not much selections other than their pork based breakfast meats.  If gambling income in a hotel subsidizes meals, this set-up should either be complimentary to those who gamble or are hotel guests, or cost no more than $5.99 to bring people in.  The food quality wasn't bad, it was edible, and as I like to say in a cliched way, "I wouldn't throw her outta bed" - - so, can't complain that it didn't do the trick to fulfill the ultimate goal of feeding an appetite.  The rating I'm giving this is more based on "in comparison to both what's available in the area and what you can get or that same price elsewhere nearby" so, if I were to make a suggestion, I'd say they need to improve to keep up with the competition in other hotel casinos.  It's located in a lower level, and had a line to wait in (not sure how many patrons were 1st time visitors as opposed to repeat visiting fans, i'd guess all were newbies) that went by fast to get seated.  The drinks are self service, as of course the buffet food is, so it does the job as far as being a fast way to get fed and get in and out quickly.  For those who are coming to the Luxor, the self-parking is not connected to the Hotel / Casino, so it's a tad off-site, where you have to walk outside a little bit and a short distance, but for those who that's an issue for, be warned or go to the Valet.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is the All you Can Eat, AYCE sign for a 24 Hour Buffet offer.  I&#39;m not sure if it&#39;s worth it or not unless you love buffets
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The corned beef hash looks like the canned variety, which oddly is my favorite style, and is most tasty
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Bacon... all you can eat for breakfast.

24zHkpoZRMzO4943C7E0rg.text: My husband and I tried the dinner and brunch buffets. There are a lot of options but the quality of the food is really lacking! First of all, the serving plates took forever to get refilled. Second of all, a lot of the food labels were missing, and you'd have to wait for one of the employees to help you out( which they gladly did).  Now, out of EVERYTHING we had for dinner, the only things that were good was the steak. The aisian section was only ok. For breakfast, I tried a wide variety of things and only 3 things were good in my opinion: the cake with cranberries in it and the honeydew melon( maybe because no one tried to make it into sth else) and the pancakes. The most horrific thing was the scrambled eggs with cheese. The waffles werent horrific but were chewy and sad.  Staff is really friendly though, which is why I gave this place a second star.

4FVSgXk7EECf4yLUiRPzzA.text: The worst buffet ever, don't do it! I usually read Yelp reviews prior however a friend decided to treat me and it was their last minute decision.   Just say no! If you re staying at Luxor I recommend you eat somewhere else because the selection and quality of food is HORRIBLE!   I sampled quite a few items and everything was bad. A lot of the food was cold, not cooked well and tasteless.   There is no selection and it must be the world's smallest and most sorry excuse for a buffet!  The name says it all, MORE BUFFET because you will be left feeling that there must be MORE than this buffet has to offer!  The best thing to eat at this buffet was their ranch dressing.  The best part of my night was when I grabbed 3 sugar cookies and stuck them in my tits and walked out.

tWCmXd9hngmGMdcHjNA-AQ.text: We enjoyed the buffet. It was easily accessible, well staffed and offered a great variety of yummy foods. We ate breakfast there everyday we were in Vegas. $24 a person, but worth it.

Su4o3o-PSdX3ZEGVRY0Org.text: Was looking forward to eating here with family...walked out disappointed. Went here on New Years holiday special. Omelette is 3.5/5, taste is heavily dependent on jalapeno and sausage...the cheese was half melted as well. Pizza is 2/5, crust is not crispy, light seasoning, practically no taste. You could see the flour on the bottom of the pizza as well. Bacon is soggy...and for all your dessert lovers....No Dessert!

DJ-fLLMunuXEr22LNEYZhQ.text: My husband and I came in just before lunch with our 5 kids, ranging from 12 to 4 years old. It was nice to have our 4 year old eat free since the amount she eats is minimal. Most buffets charge us full price for her, which is just a waste for us.  We found the area to be spacious and easy to move around in.  Negatives were that although it was lunch time, there were a lot of options still unavailable. Even when we left around 1pm. I don't expect the same spread for lunch as for dinner, but it did seem a bit limited.  Overall, the food was pretty good...except for their Mexican section. I am a huge fan of Mexican food and there was nothing there to brag about. We actually couldn't finish anything we grabbed from the Mexican food section, unfortunately.  Thankfully, there were some very yummy options that left us, and our kids, full regardless.  The Mexican food and lunch were a bit disappointing, but we would definitely go back. Maybe for dinner next time

kqGhsfnL8BjANL1iC8SMVw.text: You may be thinking to yourself, "Wow, that's odd. A buffet that's open 7AM to 10 PM with no afternoon close time. This is very convenient for me and my incredibly stoned boyfriend at 3PM."  This is food is HAZARDOUS.. im pretty sure most is left out ALL DAY.    We tried SO HARD to just have a good ol' munchy binge but it was disappointment after disappointment. We would bring back full plates of what should have been delicious food and ended up spitting half of it out into our napkins. What's that saying? "Water, water everywhere but not a drop to drink."  I know it's bad because I've happily eaten fried bread and ketchup when I've been this stoned.  I'm serious, even the soda machines tasted flat and watered down.  On the plus side, they do provide all you can drink alcohol. I'm going to get started on that.  The service is good. Friendly staff-- who obviously aren't used to being tipped. Boyfriend gave a 25% tip and was stopped 3x to ask if he meant to give the waitress that much.  It's weird. It's gross. It's perfect for the alcoholic your dating. The exotic decor will wow her and you won't break the bank! :)

33CwYmtnU1xGzHMJBCbWNQ.text: For one thing we got a free buffet voucher. Then we saw the stars given for this place and didn't care. The staff were very kind and gave us mimosas for $2 each. Decor is beautiful done it feels like we step on to a movie set.   Just wanted to say thank you Luxor for an amazing treat    P.S. my husband is a picky eat so you made him happy plus he tried some thing new.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad as a Stater

1jufRVDIXZF-ISJG9ylumg.text: Enjoyable!  I enjoyed that the brunch had a southern style of grits and crawfish. Delicious!

2E4otE0gBExwcXbIdts1-A.text: Since we were staying at the Luxor Hotel, we would met at MORE for our morning gathering to discuss the day's plan.  This buffet was very easy to find in the hotel - just follow the signs and head down stairs.  The decor was darker - needed more light - not an attractive place- definitely needed an update.  The breakfast items were okay.  For $17.99 per person, it was nothing to brag about. I should have checked out other buffets.  One day was enough.  The pancakes were generally dried out or saggy.  The bacon was generally under cooked and greasy. Even with salt and pepper, the scrambled eggs were missing something.

_zNrno0l3VbGxPitamufmA.text: Not that great of an experience.  To give them credit, it was very late in the day, as we were there for a very late dinner just 30 minutes before they were closing.  I know this isn't the best time to get buffet food, but since this is the only experience I've had with this place, I have to give an honest review.  The rice and potato dishes were fine, and I had some shrimp that wasn't too bad either.  The Peruvian chicken was ok as well.  The prime rib was terrible; too tough to chew.  Sushi was terrible.  It was pretty expensive for what we got, but since we were late getting into town and were really hungry, we just chose the closest buffet.  Oh well.

u0gOPkgzSJXlWEWwT1upKA.text: Well, I have to say I expected a bit better, esp. at a higher price for Thanksgiving dinner. The turkey was moist and not dried out, but I was expecting to see turkeys at carving stations, but the sliced turkey portions were at the serving stations. They had kielbasa that tasted more like regular sausage and kind of on the dry and overcooked side. The carved ham was good, and so were the grilled 4oz. steaks. I tried to get some stuffing for the turkey, but it would not come off of the serving spoon, even after a few shakes! LOL!!                Beyond what I had, there really wasn't much to choose from. Peeled shrimp were small, and kind of mushy. I passed over the Asian and Italian sections. It seemed as though they only had two soups to choose from(chicken vegetable and what I believed to be, butternut squash). Maybe there were more at other stations, and I just didn't look hard enough. Macaroni and potato salads were quite good. No room for desert, so I guess that means I did enjoy and fill up on what I did find, and at 30.00, it may have been better just to go back to Hooters for a third visit, or spend a few dollars more for maybe another restaurant or buffet, but I was leaving the next day and just wanted to save a few bucks for my week back to work! I can't really complain and if you see my pic, I had two plates of that, it obviously was not bad, just wished there was a bit more to choose from at, More the buffet! One other thing, the table with empty plates was not bussed very fast, and was not all that busy at around 5:00pm.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. It was decent. Guess I just miss my Grandma! LOL!!

Kj4mmsfNyheJLQiiijaxNQ.text: This was the most disappointing buffet I've ever had the displeasure of trying, in Vegas or otherwise.  The two of us paid $50 for a Weekend Brunch buffet and, between the two of us, we found exactly one thing that was halfway decent: the bread pudding.  Besides that, the food was on par with gas station fare or frozen microwaveable selections from the supermarket. Just awful. Avoid at all costs.   The eggs were tasteless. The sausage was hard, dry, and unseasoned. The pancakes ranked several places below McDonald's HotCakes, which is incredibly difficult to do.
