The bacon was flaccid and reeked of artificial smoke flavor. The biscuits were hard and crumbly. The biscuit gravy was watery and tasted of raw flour.  The cheese blintz was literally ricotta cheese stuffed into a sad, crusty crepe that tasted of Play-Doh -- and that's no exaggeration.   I desperately wanted to like this food, particularly considering the price we paid and the fact that I picked this place over my wife's objection -- so I decided to broaden my horizons and try the Asian and Dessert sections. First, I tried the Chow Mein, which seemed to consist of three low-quality ingredients: overcooked spaghetti, sesame oil and soy sauce. The "Veggie" Spring Roll was literally completely devoid of filling, as was the Apple Turnover. Finally, I tentatively took a forkful of the bread pudding -- it wasn't bad at all!  The Anglaise was nice and thick, the bread pudding wasn't too goopy, and the raisins seemed well distributed throughout the dish.   Please don't make the same mistake as we did. Run as far away as you can from this pathetic excuse for a buffet.

EDdY72U4sR_6iDMGR5IFCA.text: I'm so glad I got this buffet for free, otherwise I would have been very unhappy. The place was empty and cold. The food was nearly the same. I tried at least 15 different things  and nearly all of it either was kind of cold, or hard - because of sitting under the lights. Or just had no flavor at all. I think of everything I tried, only one thing was worth it, and that was the steak - solely because he was cooking it to order.   Unless they fix the lack of flavor and food in their buffet, I don't think I'd be back.

0A9frRhmttTs4Xo9S1Hhew.text: For a casino buffet, the food options were very good and tasted good as well. The chicken dishes were moist and everything looked fairly fresh and appetizing.   My daughter especially loved the many desserts there were to choose from and there were so many it was difficult to narrow it down to just a few.  There are options for anyone with any likes or dislikes and great for a diverse  group or family that all have different preferences.   I would recommend this buffet again while visiting.

wSxNKYRUneHLDkmo0s_DeA.text: Selection good, except for drinks after being spoiled at other buffets were we got the amazing coke selection of 200 flavours getting a selection of less then 10 Pepsi flavours was a downgrade. Really good dessert selection

ISOmn-InvE8jVcHblB3Hng.text: I said to my husband, seems people love or hate this place. How bad can it be? It's a buffet. There's always plenty to choose from.  Wrong. So wrong. Not much to choose from and none of it even tempting. I have never been so disappointed in a buffet. Tasteless. Boring. Just awful food. Would not return even if it was free, it was that bad.

aLGush1IE6hsMX5UzCj0pw.text: WARNING DO NOT ENTER... worst buffet ever. Food not good at all. The serves was great.

y3FdOxBzLvTHWg--LBPqTw.text: Pretty bland and unappealing weekend brunch buffet was included with our stay at the Luxor.    I'd say skip it

V0YQh1k-0cWKHl1x024xmA.text: We went here because we had a buy one get one free deal. & for that price it was totally worth it.   They had a very large selection of food, including seafood. I was looking for vegan food & i was surprisingly happy with the selection! They had asian food, some mexican food, hummus & a variety of salads.  I really liked the fact that you got your own drinks. They had all kinds of soda, juices & water.  Was the food the best ever? No- it's a buffet. The food was decent. But for $30 for 2 people for dinner we were happy!

b4AskIyh9dRBXaxa3SIvjA.text: Selection was poor, crab was cold and disgusting. Indian casino buffets are far superior. A True disappointment.

sKRuZ8NxIjqHVxeBRwrDEg.text: So people here are giving bad reviews but if they get free food or discounts they dont mind coming back??? ....love the place,great food specially during brunch,love their unlimited mimosas..coming back next year!!

SRyBT2fKprYqeO80BwUxHg.text: We were staying at the hotel so went to check out the buffet around 11 am. I've been going to Vegas for decades, so I've hit some buffets, but Luxor's ties with Circus Circus for the worst in the city. It's awful. To start with, many of the stations were empty, so they're charging people when it looks like 1/4 of the selections are missing. And what is there is just boring, like a school lunch.  But then the food that is suppose to be hot, like pasta, is barely warm. And tasteless. There were three of us and each of us was taking a bite of something and saying, "Don't bother with this."  The one thing I found that was tasty and the proper temperature was the couscous. If you respect your palate at all,  don't even consider this buffet. Go to M, Bellagio, Spice Market or the Main St downtown.

b6S9dmM662GBriN-yyd2Dg.text: This breakfeast here sucks, don't waste your $16 here to eat

D_NqkeDBxBnXRiWjR2QYbw.text: More is not always better. I think my taste buds are much more refined nowadays where I don't care anymore to get my moneys worth. I'd rather enjoy good food. We went here after an early morning of gambling (2 AM to 7 AM). It was a Saturday so they had the champagne brunch. It was $17.99. It's a steep price to pay for breakfast, plus I can't eat much in the morning. I got a mimosa with my buffet. The highlight was the omelet bar and the shrimp. They had decently fresh shrimp, maybe about 6-8 size. The have your standard salad and breakfast food bar. The only "meat" they had was the roast beef and it was a bit dry. The Asian food wasn't very good, especially the pad thai had no taste. There was nothing special about this place. It was hearty and feeling, but not worth the $17.99 brunch!

kakvWPAJ2fsF7DHgjytv4g.text: The best thing about this buffet is it's cheap. We had Sunday brunch for $19. FYI that is cheap by Vegas standards. The croissants were super good, everything else was just Mehhh. I would only choose to go back if I were watching my cash-o-la, otherwise steer clear. Service was not so good. Salad section was lame. Roast beef tasted weird. Eggs were watery. I don't remember anything else, that is how NOT amazing the MORE buffet was.

IFZHONTpro3uu5NB60vWSA.text: i dont think this is the worst buffet i've ever been to. but it's quite bad. However, i'll say that i have not been back since the bad experience.. i should go back at give it a 2nd try... maybe things have changed.

zUyphA9youXk62PnockxLg.text: MORE? How about a little LESS!!!  This place is disgusting. After one bite I already wanted to leave. The food taste old and had no flavor. I had to put hot sauce in my soup to get a taste.   The place didn't even look nice. It looked like a hospital cafeteria.   Waste of money. The buffet at Treasure Island tasted much better than this restaurant, if that's what you can even call it.

oE0fUPzTWNYAejeUiyEKsQ.text: Ha!, someone beat me to "'More' should be called 'Less'", and it's no better a name than the previous "Pharoah's Pheces".  Starving farm cats would walk away from the fish-labeled material that could be used to keep cotton sweaters safe from moths.  The prime rib could be used for knock-off Hong Kong Coach purses or for a lower-quality line of leather products it was so tough and dry.  Luxor at least could start a line of Egyptian-themed dog rawhide chews with the "prime rib" from "More-bid".  The morbid, morose "More" chicken legs were not quite as moist as the turkey Chevy Chase cut into for Christmas Vacation.  If you didn't know drosophila melanogaster was the scientific name for fruit flies you will become an expert entomologist on the little suckers at the morbid, morose "More".  Those aren't black sesame seeds on your dessert.  Opt-in and consume the comparably yummy & authentic African dung beetles and opt-out for eating "More".  Yes, I did notify the Filipina waitress my wife was chatting with in Tagalog of the issues and they were not new.

t6YBeZqhRHpz-hdXEcla7Q.text: Ick. Ick. Ick. Ick. Ick.   It was disgusting in 1999, and it's disgusting now in 2008.   Different name, same mediocre or just plain ole' disgusting salads and "food" dishes. Even the desserts suck. How hard is it to mess up a basic cheesecake and even more basic chocolate cake that I KNOW came from a frozen box??? I swear I remembered some of the nasty "dishes" from my first trip there.   "Phaerohs Pheast" and "More" same thing, same disappointment.  Go to Harrah's for cheap food instead.

WWQvW4MkjdP3Mm008WCUnw.text: Something to write home about? Hell yeah!!!!  I'd tell everyone how bad this food is!  This place was absolutely horrible! Maybe it was because I had just come from the Wynn buffet and the Burger Bar the day before and was expecting something more. Whatever the reason, there was no excuse for food to taste this bad. The food was cold and looked liked it had been sitting there for days. Don't let me get started on the taste {yuck :P}.  The only thing that was good here was the tiramasu. Other than that, this place sucked. The staff sucked, the food sucked. If I wanted food this bad, I would have stayed home.

uZtGYyrK7yCbFtbCyFVVag.text: One of the thing I completely despise is getting me in the buffet line!  That's a huge NO-NO! I mean seriously some of these people would cut me in line then take FOREVER choosing what they want to eat!   I witnessed a wedding reception at the restaurant which I thought was rather tacky given the fact the groomsmen attire was a standard black tuxedo with red sneaker(?), yeah ok whatever. Then our waitress was completely rude when we were trying to request a refill on our mimosa's because she seemed rather frustrated by and group around the corner from us.   Food selection was ok, plenty of seating, service could've been better, and they have a saturday/sunday brunch champagne special!

klGLVKyxt5D3Ol38tcp6IQ.text: Okay so the fools on here who are rating the buffet 2 stars or lower need to get off their high horse.  HELLO.....you're eating at damn buffet, not at some unique Euro-chique restaurant.  You're at the buffet because it's cheap and there's different types of food to choose from, you're not there for exotic dishes or the ambience.   My wife and I went to the buffet for lunch and we were more than happy with the food and the service.    Only downside is that they close at 10pm which is kinda silly considering that it's Vegas.

sKplXIx3GW9tP34DNvl6lw.text: We came for mimosa brunch and was refilled twice... we drink like fish while in las vegas and that made us unhappy.   other than that we wasted so much food due to lack of flavor... it looks great but what happened to the taste?

GSnu9paMgZaPWmzP2DuKkg.text: went for lunch. all the food was so salty and not even a good selection. on the other hand, dessert was awesome. i got tiramisu and flan

H5CsicQ3ytpaXcvKzCLPhw.text: I was really disappointed in their food selection :( But hey! At least I got to eat here using food vouchers!  I don't know, the buffet was really mediocre. Hometown Buffet has a better selection than they do. However, we did catch the champagne brunch, so I was down for the unlimited mimosas. It sucks for those who really don't want alcohol, but are compelled to order it because you're paying for it already. I ended up eating so much cocktail shrimp since there wasn't any more seafood. I was in the mood for something like crab or lobster, but they had neither.  I must say. Mimosa does not go well with everything ;(

Uc6lm5nUbmzCELYmO9YghA.text: Ew, gross, save your calories. I tried a little bit of a lot of things, and only the make-your-own-tacos were edible. Even the churros were gross!! Hard & stale. Tried a few desserts; fruit tart shell was inedible, flan tased weird, and the "tirimisu" was nasty. Ewwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwww, so not worth it. Walk yourself to the Mandalay Bay Buffet, SO worth it, all you can eat hot crab legs, totallllllly better, worth the $8 more & walk!

OK6fbEX1ht9GeM_zoA4Jsg.text: I will start out by saying that I have never been to a a dinner buffet at the nicest hotels on the strip. Saying this, I think the Luxor buffet was really good. I am a picky eater and they have options. My family will eat most anything and they love it as well. I have a nut allergy and did not have a problem here, which was rare for a buffet in Vegas. I love this place and find time to eat here every time I go to Vegas. I hope to try another meal besides dinner next time I am there.

qkwDiBit1YHbERI3F6T-uQ.text: Loved this buffet.  They have sooo many things to eat: Italian, American, Asian, Mexican, International...  Excellent price for being on the Strip.  Dessert was also yummy.  I would reccomend this buffet.

qDewZWejeCwbuEdJaTwb0Q.text: What you get vs. what you pay for is astounding.  As one of the lower-cost buffets in Vegas, this does not disappoint!  Everything is fresh, there's plenty of selection, it's not too loud, and you get plenty of space to enjoy your food!  I wouldn't go out of my way to come here, but if your staying at the Luxor, I wouldn't miss it!

oi-rVQPTsCLXDSYPc7ajLg.text: I've only eaten breakfast at the More buffet and it is okay.  More is convenient for us as we attend an annual conference that starts at 8 AM each morning and More opens  at 7.  The $15 breakfast price tag is not bad.    A venti coffee and pastry at Starbucks costs $10, so what the heck we can have whatever we want for $5 more.  Besides, it's hard to screw up breakfast!

0FVG3XPT3fEiSCNJJFLkwg.text: I really enjoyed the Buffet. There was plenty of food and not a big line. Cheap as well. They had a deal, eat two meals for 30 some dollars. Not bad.

oMvqJf2hIDLwsSTaj_Yb-w.text: I just had breakfast at More and paid $18 (with tax) and I feel that the Luxor should be ashamed of this place. The selection is incredibly sparse and bland. There are multiple stations with food, but they all have the same items: bacon, biscuits & gravy, breakfast potatoes, etc.. The only edible food available was the fresh fruit, and that's all I could eat after sampling the hot options. $18 for a banana and some melon. This experience has written me off of Las Vegas buffets; thank you More buffet.

am2e-58YnrfOieEsQk9hlg.text: I guess my original one-word review ("Disgusting.") wasn't quite elaborate enough, so let me be more specific about my experience here this past Sunday (10/7/12): We made our decision to go here based off of their website which of course made their buffet look AMAZING and the price was right for our group ($17) but after paying the fare I couldn't even find $17 worth of food that was edible. My husband got a slice of pizza, took a bite and the dough was completely RAW. Disgusting. I ended up having fruit and juice and a random dessert. When we were ready to leave I approached the hostess just to give her some feedback about how horrible the food was and she already knew! She nodded her head and without saying a word, she waved down the manager who offered my money back. If a place knows their food is THAT bad, and willingly gives you your money back, shouldn't that place just CLOSE? Why is it even open? Also, one of my friends ended up throwing up his food in the middle of eating. Yeah. It was that bad. Never ever ever again!

qRg_XYPqVXRD1M-fGLwawQ.text: We ate here for lunch.  So, this review does not apply to the dinner.  First of all, it's a buffet.  This inherently has the advantage of variety and quantity.  MORE has the typical american, asian, mexican, italian theme sections, and each section has about 4-5 choices.  The quality is variable, and I'd say ranges from "mediocre" to "not bad".  Nothing was stellar, though this could be expected for a $16 lunch buffet.  Service was fine, and the decor is passable.  Would I return? Maybe - if I happened to be waiting at the Luxor for a show or something.

_xxHGzJ8eKB8iTuFS2RtWQ.text: My b/f and I ate here on our trip to Vegas. I must say that out of all the buffets I've been to in my life this is the one that I was definitely worth the money! At $20 a person I will admit I was scared, so my b/f and I asked to see if we could see the food before we decided. They actually let us! It was great!   The variety is EXCELLENT! You had American, Italian, and Asian food all in one place. Talk about a delight. The choices were endless. The food was fresh and set at the perfect temperature. I must say after eating there we were stuffed. Definitely money well spent!

IBhFCV1ZUjo9S-QdArTDNA.text: Budget buffet.  Use coupon or discount to make it even cheaper.  (Lunch) Lots of cold dish choices such as salads.  Not as many hot dish choices.  No crab legs, lobster, and orange pork instead of orange chicken.  If you have a choice of a complimentary buffet, Don't pick Luxor over Aria... come on.

G0wJ57gSqKJIWuRC_jnvgw.text: Omlet bar lacks  ALWAYS CONSTRUCTION going on in this joint.  A new addition is the get your own drink station, I like that but that hurts the people working there since there is nobody to tip now.   DID I MENTION THERE IS ALWAYS CONSTRUCTION THERE?

0eFo2W-U-M1kL7VXg_lyQA.text: The lunch buffet made everyone in my party sick, and the food was only okay. However, they did had amazing steam pork buns (that's all that matters, right?). You also have to get your own drinks from the buffet, which is an alright idea because of the usual slow service at buffets. There are draw backs to that though, because it's more work than you really think it is until you try it.

gkG_80oBZmOH2Pus6x16pw.text: The worst buffet ever! I paid $17 for lunch for nothing! Mongolian beef was just salty, fish was under cooked. They only have three kinds of fruits. Their menus are so limited. I wouldn't recommend this to anyone!

HVLl8iygv3YUHkSaS6UGfg.text: If I can give a no star, I would. This place sucks! For the price you pay ($20), you are better off eating at Denny's. Not much of a selection. The sushi bar is pathetic (any chinese buffet will be better). The service is horrible! We asked for a straw and the waitress told us "it's by the soda machine". She could have said "go get it yourself". For this reason alone, we did not leave even a penny for tip. If you value your hard-earned money, please do not eat here!!!!

P5_FtiAq-07xiWMJyiDszw.text: Only giving it two stars because we got a comp for it. Otherwise I might have given it one. We went for lunch and there were not very many offerings set out. We could hardly find anything we wanted to eat. What we did try was very non-remarkable. Had a couple of decent desserts but as far as the food, BLAH.

EFVGLZ47WVLLn3VP5Wbgyg.text: I love that this place gives you a pass to eat all day. It was a decent good food buffet but it definitely is not your fancy 5 star dining experience.

PwBpOHXVlx6TUKMu5VNYPg.text: Having gone to the Studio B, Bellagio, and Rio's buffets, I would say: Spend the extra money. The ambiance is good, but the food is so-so. Not many choices in terms of meat, especially during lunch. The fruits weren't that fresh. Not one of the better buffets on the strip (the only one I can think of that's worse is Excalibur)

_n20LEcI5NfqL47i1b6LBg.text: Not worth it.  Did the sunday brunch.  No chsmpagne offerd, no service.  Very limited buffet.  Ive had better for less.

EotBk8a3wznl_Y6g_oG6uA.text: Alrighty then. As a general rule I always eat at a buffet in Vegas. I was stayed at the Excalibur and they were just a drag so instead of eating at their buffet I came to this one at the Luxor instead. I was really impressed by the decor. That is a big think for me when coming to a themed place in Vegas. They went all out here. We came for lunch and they had a decent selection of food. They had American, Mexican, Italian, Asian, etc. Very typical of a Vegas buffet. They had a large salad and fruit section and an area to make sandwiches should you want to. Some of the food was great while some of it sucked but I don't expect to like everything I try at a buffet so it was no biggie. They had a big enough selection of food and plenty of things I wanted to try to make up for the things I did not like. Their dessert selection was nothing short of awesome. Very overwhelmingly filled with tasty treats to try. The only thing I did not like was their flan. It was flavorless but their creme brulee was to die for. The prices were very typical for a Vegas buffet. You get your own drinks which I like alot because you do not have to wait around for anyone. They have sodas from the fountain, juices, and milk. The busboys collecting the plates were very nice and I liked the customer service there. Overall I would say I had a very enjoyable experience here and I will return to this buffet when I stay at the Luxor. If I stay elsewhere I will eat at their buffet because that is how I try to play it.

KJ2wRiX8Pzzem74KCSRZxA.text: Cold, horrible and small selection, staff are a bunch of grumps. $17.29 for lunch. Waste of a meal with so many wonderful options. Even the cooks are downers.  Staff hung out by our booth and ran their yaps about problems with work.  Much like the pyramids, should seal this dead space up too.  What happened?!  I gave this place five stars only four months ago!

1mZ6Bo6nQ5Dnm-sRZUlBSg.text: Went to this place and got the all day pass for $30. Breakfast was pretty good. They had basic things that you would expect, eggs, bacon, waffles, french toast. We were too late for the omelet bar.  Dinner was a little disappointing. Not as many choices as some of the other buffets in the area. For the price though, you could not go wrong. $30 all you can eat for the day is great.

uKnb3VZw6UAFiVY6rycqKg.text: Sub par! 2nd time there and second time someone in my party gets sick from their food. One of the worse buffets ever.

qHcx_eFkEESt_bTa6hMIaA.text: I won't write too much about this buffet. It got the job done as far as filling our tummies but it was nothing amazing. The only thing it had going for it was the mimosas and even those were meh...ok. Just expect your run of the mill cafeteria offerings and you won't be too disappointed.

5l6oOknOPhmxZEml2Wkw_A.text: I just came here for lunch and it was ok..  not a lot of food options but the service was really good.

whSKvmQGlpfnnFtvz_yOAg.text: I thought this buffet was great, they had it all! I appreciated the complimentary mimosas, was a little annoyed that I had to show my ID when I went up to the bar but I guess it is necessary as all ages enjoy the buffet. The chef at the omelette station made me a perfect omelette and I went to town at the dessert bar! Overall I think the price is reasonable for how much you get, would go back again if we stayed at the Luxor.

7iJmrhQf_LSMmKvbTLm1NA.text: Went for dinner on a Monday evening. $24.99. The buffet was self serve not only with your food but your drinks also. Not a lot of options and the options available were poor quality. Got the fried chicken which tasted like shake and bake. The roast beef was fatty and chewy. We had to fill up on salad and fruit. The honey dew melon was not cut properly, leaving a lot of the rind, salad was mediocre. The place was pretty empty and now I know why. I wouldn't recommend going. Only bright spot was the dessert where I had a decent piece of cheesecake.

iZ6OXizqqfImijl3e3RtxQ.text: Do you love having your time wasted? Enjoy spending your day in Vegas waiting in line?   You've found the perfect place!  To preface, let me explain that I've been to many buffets in Vegas over the years, so the price of this place wasn't shocking. Is it expensive? Kind of, but you can't be surprised, given the location.   Located downstairs in the LUXOR hotel & casino, this place is hardly ever crowded except for dinner time... However, that doesn't keep this place from having a line!   I would've given this place four stars, if not for the incredibly rude and inconsiderate woman at the register! If you're going to charge the Strip prices, make sure your service is on par. This place is just lucky they have great advertising.   She completely ignored my family, chatting to people BEHIND US in line! Wtf! Then rolled her eyes when we asked to be seated. Unbelievable.

vcdLoiz0lrN_4lhyFWFRUg.text: Enjoyed the breakfast/lunch cross over here, which what I recommend to all buffet goers.  You get the best of both worlds if you show up around 10:15ish.    I base the 4 stars on the price you pay compared to others in the area.  This one is on the lower price rage so you get what you pay for.  That being said, this place does a good job for the investment.    It's mainly comfort food.  The international foods have all been Americanized, which isn't bad if you're looking for a buffet of fast food.  For example, their Asian section had Orange Chicken, which I love.  The more expensive buffets generally put more exotic Asian cuisine out.    The atmosphere is fun as it's in the basement, but decorated with, again an Americanized, Egyptian feel.  But still fit the theme of the entire resort.  This buffet has a all day all you eat in combination with the Excalibur Buffet.  We didn't get that because we had plans to be elsewhere in the PM, but a good choice if you have kids and are staying at one of the 2 hotels.

d9qOUJTmUMtxZpt4b49LDw.text: If you're living in the Luxor, you definitely should check this buffet out, especially for dinner. The dinner Buffett is about $30 a person and is not a bad value compared to the restaurant venues in Vegas. One of the best things about the dinner Buffett is that there are crab legs, crab claws, mussels, and cocktail shrimp. Be prepared to go wild if you're a seafood foodie! In regards to the other food, they have a carving station with beef, ham and turkey. They also have an Italian, Asian and Mexican section as well. Most of the hot entrees were mediocre at best, but the turkey was definitely a hit. Another good thing about the Buffett is that there is unlimited soft drinks, coffee and tea, so get ready to drink up! One last thing I want to mention about the Buffett is that there is a large dessert station with a bunch of assorted cheesecakes, ice cream and various custards. Overall, if you want decent food at an affordable price, then I highly recommend trying this Buffett and gambling at the casino as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Front section of the Buffett

1du0VZSDBwg75SAO3clpAg.text: Revisit the buffet after more than a decade, I remembered that this place have a great desserts selection. Well nothing stay the same. For $22.99 brunch holiday event, was surprised that I can honestly say, that my local hometown buffet has more brunch selection than a Luxor Las Vegas buffet. Really sad. Definitely not worth the money.

8EaMh_HgoZdfTTMgOnlRYA.text: Had a bogo coupon for breakfast.  Well worth 20 dollars for both of us.  All the food was hot and tasted fresh.  I had a custom omelet and it was good.  Nothing fancy but everything tasted good.  Not a fan of having to get my own drink.  Place wasn't busy at all.

TYZqMnCYGuov1kSpsTIqmQ.text: If I could give 100 stars I would.  Buffets are usually my enemy because I'm a vegan but I had to come here for a work thing and lo and behold-not very many vegan options. And ingredients are not listed on the labels for any of the food. Which, if I had any criticism for them I would say to have the ingredients clearly listed for every food. But anyway, I asked JR if there's a way to find out if there's anything in certain foods that I can't have and he was more than happy to help me out and call out the chef, Rubin.  Rubin comes out and asks what I need to know so I tell him I'm vegan and was wondering about the rice and beans.  He tells me he used to be vegan (I get excited at this point cause now I know he knows what he's talking about).  This angel sent from heaven then offers to walk me around the buffet to show me everything that's vegan friendly.  He then says they have white rice and veggies that they could stir fry in olive oil for me if I want it.  Then, he offers to make the stir fry HIMSELF AND BRING IT OUT TO ME. Let me tell you, I'm from the Midwest and no one (especially at buffets) knows anything about veganism and they all act like I'm some kind of nuisance for having dietary restrictions.  I almost cried because I was so happy and he made me feel like my beliefs were valid and important- so did JR.  Please give Rubin and JR a raise or something. I wish all restaurant employees were like them.

iJg6HtMtjPaUI9NHeenysA.text: The main reason for me repeatedly coming here is due to my girlfriend's love of their decor as it reminds her of Disneyland's Indiana Jones ride and we gets tons of "2 for 1" offers using the MyVegas rewards or I'll get it comped.   I wouldn't choose to eat here [paying full price] as I feel that they are way over priced for what they serve. If you get the "Take 2 Pass" which allows you to eat here and at the Excalibur buffet for 24 hours, it might be worth it if you're able to eat at least 3 times. They have the standard buffet foods here and the drinks are self-serve. At best, they are a $14.95 per person buffet for brunch/dinner.  Service is somewhat slow in getting the dirty plates off the table but it's tolerable as the staff seems to be trying hard to get it done (they always seem to be short staffed). There are tons of better options but for comped or "2 for 1", go for it.

TrAEXyDH8P_JTTLHjhPLlA.text: I was a guest at the MGM and had the buffer and on a scale from 1-10 I'll give them a 5! I ended up winning some Luxor dining vouchers and I must say The Luxor food is much better and cheaper than the MGM.Another thing,MGM will freeze the hell out of u while the LUXOR is a more cozier atmosphere. .

L7u0ITIz7_1G2o_007SbXw.text: I had a myVegas comp for the buffet and used it last night.  I was surprised by the get your own drinks, but that's OK with me.  I didn't have to wait for anyone other than myself.  I started by doing a walk through of the entire area to see what they had.  I ended up starting with salads.  I had macaroni salad-pretty standard and OK.  The western salad was shredded lettuce with red bell pepper and fresh jalapeno rounds.  This salad had a nice kick and was quite good.  I also had some couscous which also was good.  I did find some bread sticks by the salad station.  In the regular roll area, they had standard large rolls.  They were out of butter packets so only small margarine containers were available.  The breadstick didn't need it.  I then went to the carving area and he had a new piece of beef.  This is not prime rib.  It looked like it was a rectangle of beef and it looked well done.  When I asked the gentleman where had all the nice rare meat gone that had been there when I did my walk through, he cut the beef in half and gave me a nice slice from the less done inside.  I got a piece of bok choy, some hush puppies, and a macadamia crusted chicken breast with apricot.  There was no  macadamia nut flavor at all.  The apricot gave the chicken some taste rather than being plain chicken.  I then went to the desserts.  They had a fairly nice selection of the small plastic cups that are appearing in buffets everywhere.  My first plate had a panna cotta with a lemon top filling with a fresh raspberry, flan with a fresh blackberry and some chopped nuts, and a small container of chocolate trifle.  The panna cotta and the chocolate trifle were great--the flan less so.  Second dessert plate had a macadamia nut cookie, a small pastry filled with vanilla cream and another fresh raspberry, and the star of the desserts, an Oreo cookie cheesecake.  The buffet was OK.  For the $22 they charge, you're not getting the kind of fare you'd get at the Bellagio or other property but they also charge $10 or more.  I wouldn't drive to the Strip to pay for this buffet.  We have a lot better choices in our locals casinos not on the Strip.  But for a comp, it was a nice dinner.  And I really did like the fact that I got more iced tea anytime I wanted without waiting.  Finally, every time I left my table, it was bussed before I got back.  That's not something that happens at all buffets.  I saw several people leaving last night without leaving even a dollar for the bus person.  I know I did most of the work, but he cleaned my table before, during, and after my dinner there last night.  He and the other wait staff deserve a tip!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall decoration.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Plate 2 - desserts.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Name plate.

3KyzISwyviwSUr-C6UPxxQ.text: We ate the brunch buffet.  Pretty good variety of food. Food was good but not great. There are definitely better places to eat while in Vegas, but if you are staying at the Luxor and looking for convenience it's worth it.

H0oGORG6x8UtolxvllUwSQ.text: A pretty disappointing experience.  The biggest highlight is that you can pay a little extra and visit for all your meal needs and that links with Excalibur's buffet as well.  They do have a large selection but they don't replace the trays nearly enough so the food sits out and gets cold.  I will say, it wasn't horrible, I've just had better.  Would I go again?  Yes.  Would it be my first choice?  No.

ez2J9WeK9PTz5PJH1sNtxg.text: Terrible, the roast beef was so tough my dog would have had to choke it down without chewing it. The selection of food was lacking also.

dGmb6HAUkxiwOyg3mzg5rA.text: It's not bad - but not great - I had three plates of crab legs which were fantastic, I had a ton of butter on my shirt which is typical for me - but it was really great - giving three stars because I didn't think the selection was great, the carpets were stained, kind of a ghetto buffet atmosphere and the creme brulee desert was zero stars and absolutely horrible.  However the crab legs and claws were awesome and I ate my fill!!!!

LFawJkYoH7dRAMgrLpZHDA.text: I am quite surprised this buffet has an average of 2 stars from other reviewers.  I got up on my first morning in Vegas and just couldn't decide what I wanted for breakfast so I chose the buffet to get a little of everything.  This breakfast buffet definitely has a little of everything!!!!  I can't think of one breakfast item that I didn't see.  I really enjoyed the french toast and pretty much all other breakfast items.  In addition to breakfast they had lots of other things including shrimp and chicken!    I was a little bummed with the advertised "unlimited mimosas" that came in small glasses and lots of pulp but for the price, I'll take it and refills!  Overall, if I stay at this hotel again and want a breakfast buffet, I will definitely come back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sooooo much food!!!

hBakOky_mFF95wzzKBXYIg.text: Total disappointment,  not worth it and NEVER going back!  Been going to Vegas every year for the past 8 years and would always stop to get breakfast at luxor. Each year its been getting worse and worse and yesterday topped it all. The breakfast buffet options seemed to have gotten less and the food quality isn't anything different than a hometown buffet. Example: they no longer serve eggs benedict...The fruit options were pretty much nonexisiten/little options, the cottage cheese looked disgusting and even the dessert section had little options.   The price for the buffet is outrageous. To top it all off no one even came by once to grab our plates. Never going back to that buffet as it's over priced for what your getting which is pretty much nothing.

R81ZobYnKrFFZxKzIkpHwA.text: Disgusting. Do not waste your money. Not many options. Food cold. Low quality. Worse than Golden Corral.

amwz5KK6stgM8VY9DDSiGg.text: We were really disappointed in the buffet. I haven't been to a ton of Vegas buffets, maybe four, but this was by far the worst. There were very few high end item, no crab or steak. They only served one fish dish which was inedible. The shrimp were unpeeled and not cleaned properly. The pasta was so bland. And we couldn't find one item on the entire dessert buffet that was decent.  The only redeeming things were the service and the bottomless drinks during happy hour ($7).

lXCJ5c2Kd6SbpcNPh1lIIw.text: Did nothing for me... average food, nothing spectacular...   All the dishes seem to taste the same in the Mexican section. Mashed potatoes seemed to be potatoes mixed instant potatoes. Sushi had more rice thanks the fried rice.... lol great effort thou!!

EwvTDMGvTPUYlndHlJSVhw.text: Came here around 2:30pm... we pay the weekday brunch which was $20.99 per person... since dinner starts at 3pm, not much food change... the items are pretty much the same... don't recommend unless you are staying at luxor... rather go try other hotel's buffet.

950Z_DsT2KUrl_nF8XDBVQ.text: All day buffet is around 50, but they don't really have any meat or interesting sides. The breakfast however is very good, omelet station basic breakfast and oddly tacos. Not exciting and even if you have the all day pass you have to wait all over again in line. Lots of screaming kids. Lots.

_PQYaSs8BQ2rls9ti1jMrQ.text: Not bad at all but the tip that I would give people is paid for the all day buffet . you pay like $45 , you can eat breakfast lunch dinner for that amount and if you really look at it for one sitdown is 35 , so it is worth it. I didn't have to wait for a long time and I must say you should give it a try worth your money

wNPyuGs8KqSbIGcGwSIzQg.text: This has got to be one of the worst buffets in both quality and value ever. I arrived late on Tuesday and did the brunch buffet on Wednesday morning. I was a bit disappointed with the selection, given the price of $20.99. The quality of the food was well below average. But it's a buffet, and these are never super great. I vowed to not eat here again. (The Pyramid Cafe is much better with fresh, made to order breakfasts!) But alas, Sunday rolls around, and I'm really tired of what's around me. There's a weekend brunch that costs $4 more, so I figured they must have more foods, right? Weekend brunches at other places generally are "special".  Wrong. They had even less food. On Wednesday, they had a ham and beef roast. There's none of that. There was nothing new that wasn't available on Wednesday. There's no omelet station or other place to get anything custom. You even have to make your own waffles and pancakes. So you pay more for less food, simply because it's the weekend, and they want to squeeze money money out of you. Sure, they have mimosa's included, but not everyone drinks alcohol. And especially not for breakfast!  I've been to far better Sunday brunch buffets at higher end restaurants that didn't cost any more and put this to shame.   I'd sure this up as an "all you dare to eat" buffet. And it's not much.

7FivZEVzksFUQKlCDtdT7Q.text: Not a big variety of hot food (lacks vegetable sides) but nicely priced for the fare. Desserts were yummy...especially the pannacotta!

J6gWAULBP1AoiFon8BAkNQ.text: Really bad Don't know about dinner but we came at brunch. There was not much choice and food were too dry. Really bad buffet, seriously!

dxWeQJRAgbxRA1zO4W5F_Q.text: Very basic food, sushi was frozen and the taste of the food it was not great.  I recommend you to avoid this buffet.

iDb9xeiRcZSvEFVAXes7-Q.text: This buffet was quite decent last year. However, not alot of choices which really makes me sad! I enjoy staying at the luxor, but now, will need to go to different buffets. Very inconvenient!!!

WfJ_WOISTegXZOJ_yjeSow.text: I had visited the Buffet while staying at the Luxor with some friends. For some reason, the food fell a little short in terms of quality.  I found the buffet slightly expensive for the quality it had to offer, but the theme inside is awesome. For the quality you get, the food falls a little short compared to the decor inside. The buffet was great, and offered a different variety of types of foods.   I would recommend the place if you have a little more cash to spend, but obviously there are better valued buffets in Vegas that have the ability to back up their quality

3LVtvLQ7Q6tBOjZhw-CGJg.text: We really enjoyed the buffet at Luxor. The food was good, the desserts were great. It was clean. Plenty of choices. I'll be going back for sure.

kGH-uiq91911_dMERbyXMQ.text: Dont listen to that other stuff below.. me and 2 friends ate here after eating at other buffets and this was by far the best quality food.  The only thing I can agree with was some of the food wasnt piping hot.  It's a pretty delicate balance on keeping a room in the desert cold while keeping the food hot... so we didnt mind that.  There were tons of options and we sampled everything except the seafood.  It was the one buffet we tried here that we would go back to.  And I didnt notice any issues with cleanliness.

C7V_ygpQ9d2eKFXsPV_sjw.text: Pretty good variety and their roast beef was really good. Surprisingly the Fajitas and salsa were very tasty. I liked everything I got to try except for their pizza.

DYFYCk-YEL_HspgSiXjrUA.text: They have so much to choose from . And I had an amazing experience as a vegan.The very knowledgeable Chef Ruben and his team always have delicious vegan options that they are happy to walk you through. Staff is kind, food is delicious and healthy. Recommend getting the day pass if you think you will have all your meals there.

SSC2Xa2WuVNCWdUVXAEU6g.text: The buffet was nice and they had a good variety of food. I arrived there at 1pm, had a plate, and then another plate around 2:30pm! They had mimosas at the serving station and regular drinks were self service. The staff were all good.

Va-xklqbe6pPebFvIkgAcg.text: Lousy buffet for the price.  They have a tip line when you pay up front but don't bother to tell you the wait staff only clears tables.  You have to get your own drinks and refills.  Not much fruit available on salad bar unless you want an apple. The food options were incomplete.  Who wants Asian fried rice without an Asian entree?  Eggs without hash browns?  Layout is weird also.

blI9TfzpBPfMF9VgqMGzFA.text: The food was good for the price  I had the breakfast and I enjoyed the variety as well as the egg order station

fFnzT4obMiuD837p_vfwbw.text: This is the absolute worst buffet I've been too in years! I usually go to San Manuel Casino in California, I was expecting this to be better because it's Vegas! Sadly it's an ultimate let down and extremely over priced. The food taste like budget buffet food you'd find in ghetto parts of the Inland Empire. A friendly staff and beautiful design can't save this place from being absolutely not tasty. The food is garbage!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eating awful food
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hidden face
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Wall painting

qshGn93GAesTLYaWsTAmlA.text: Enjoyed the breakfast buffet. There was a great selection and variety of foods, pastries, and fresh fruit. We arrived at the restaurant pretty early ( the restaurant opens at 7am) so there were not many people there. The food was fresh. The staff was somewhat friendly. The lady taking the money appeared frustrated.   When you enter the restaurant there is someone who takes your order and then a waitress or waiter comes to greet you and takes you to your table. You have the option to add your gratuity when you pay for the food. The breakfast buffet is $20 per person or you can pay $50 for the day ( meaning you are able to go the buffet at any point that day it is open). I'm not sure if this option for the "day" is always available.   Our waitress was friendly and gave us a tour of the buffet which was helpful. Again, there was a variety of food available as well as juices and soft drinks. I  recommend the breakfast bar and plan to come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. You are able to purchase an all day pass for $50. The cashier will explain that there are unlimited visits for the day with this pass.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Line forming at The Buffet
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Entrance to The Buffet

s1kSsfXVl7VMi7Vq4O2nrg.text: We got the all day pass / wrist band as we planned on staying at the hotel/casino (we are staying here) most of the day. The food is actually pretty fresh and it's pretty good for food made in bulk (I'm assuming it is..?). We were helped immediately for our second admission they and got our table literally right when we got there. There's plenty of options. It's a pretty good buffet - some of the options were the same for the different menu times but overall it was good.

ePC9nXHkuplAIriS1fJJ7A.text: This review is for the weekday all-day ayce deal.  The value (low, low price for unlimited trips) def earned the 3rd star.  Otherwise, the food quality, taste, and selection would have only garnered 2 stars.  Breakfast:  I thought it was really cool that they had oatmeal, grits, and malt-o-meal out :) Oldest son enjoyed the sausage patties. Eggs benedict sucked (my husbands exact words) The poached egg was cooked hard (I like mine runny) and the sauce was cold and coagulated. Fruit was really cold, and not as ripe as I would have liked.    Lunch: I enjoyed the wonton soup and the fact that they had red pepper flakes available.  Oldest and youngest loved the dessert bar - especially the chocolate mousse.  Husband found the garlic bread to be light and tasty.  Buffalo macaroni salad seemed to be nothing but pink macaroni salad.  Kids report that the pizza was hard :( And unfortunately someone at all the wontons out of the soup, so after the 1 I got in my first serving, I ate just plain broth for the rest of lunch and most of dinner.  Also, we happened to be eating lunch right when they started changing everything out for dinner, so for a big chunk of time there was even less selection as they pulled items and then took a while to replace them.  Dinner:  Selection really did not change very much from lunch.  Cole slaw was tasty :) Husband liked the pork chop quite a bit.  Service was pretty good, but we did wish that when we came back wearing our all-day wristbands that we could just walk right in.  Instead, we had to wait in line while everyone else paid for their meal.  All in all, good value if you are just looking to fill bellies without having to put much effort into deciding what to eat.  Foodies with $$ to spend should head elsewhere for sure!

IoUb_SmL9wGPlDnjATrjrQ.text: The food here is like any other buffet. Most of it was okay, some was good, and some was awful. But what I really appreciated was that they had several options for vegetarians, including bruschetta, greek salad, tabbouleh, couscous, etc. My trip to the salad bar was easily my favorite plate, although they were sadly lacking in options for my actual salad (no mushrooms, olives, etc.). This may not be the best buffet in Vegas, but it's one of the better ones for vegetarians and the most affordable.

H8NyBuiht9eyPMMOSaekig.text: Zero stars for this one please... We wasted our money for a salty place. I mean the sushi is not fresh and everything else taste like it's not newly cooked. I'm sorry Luxor. Your hotel is nice, service is good but you need to work on your food. Nasty!

c-U9AroDlNhmUl7UYZ6MyQ.text: Went for breakfast on three days of our stay, since it was included in the room rate we got.  While not exactly impressive, the More buffet had all the right things for breakfast.  Good bacon, potatoes, biscuits and sausage gravy.  Scrambled eggs - some say they are powdered, but they still tasted fine and had a good consistency.  Scrambled eggs and chorizo was delicious.  Avoid the eggs benedict, however, as the hollandaise was a strange orange color and had a funny taste.  Corned beef hash was the canned variety, but I like all kinds of CBH, and even canned CBH is still CBH.  Therefore, I liked the CBH.  At 9:00 a.m. the line was long with a 20 minute wait.  At 8:00 a.m. there was no line whatsoever.  Go early and get a head start on your day!

jqkGp63d5Y3-2tD80kBIvA.text: I bought the all day pass to the buffet. There's American,  Italian, and Asian food. There's chicken, pasta, noodles, crabs, cheese and pepperoni pizza, salad bar, 2 kinds of soups, egg rolls,  fruits, etc.. The best part of this buffet is the Deserts Bar w/c offers different delicacies that's will make your tummy crave just by looking at it.  We were seated faster during lunch time as compared to dinner time. They were short staff at dinner time. Overall,  the price of the buffet is a lot better compared to high end buffet.

5KQlcy82NKt7e7vHn9OYJg.text: Disapointment! Honestly can't say anything good about the place.   The food was bad, even for a buffet. Most of the juice machines where down. Fruit wasn't ripe. How do mess up fried chicken and mashed potatoes. On top of all that, most of the ladels had food on them so my hands were left sticky and gross. On top of that, it was over priced.

wr8v3WplHDXCH4oajGEBcg.text: The decor is kind of the most interesting part of the whole thing. We came at the tail end of breakfast it's all self served. The food was meh not the best. The reason they got two stars and not one is, I really wanted waffles. They where out but were able to scrounge up a few in the back. To bad they where soggy but they got a star for effort.

qMSeabPavQmU0wl-9pCBvg.text: This is a TOTAL waste of money. Thank god ours was comped and even then the food was horrible. If I had paid 16 bucks a person for breakfast I would have definitely requested a refund!

NhfHN8qY5gV0guE3XoZPPQ.text: I had a tough time rating this one.  We purchased the "eat all day" deal for the buffet, which included Sunday brunch and dinner.  This deal included mimosas at brunch and one glass of beer or wine with dinner, which I thought wasn't bad.  The package price for both meals together was very reasonable, especially for Vegas -- the package cost less than dinner at several other places we ate.    I would give brunch 3 stars, and dinner 2 stars.  Lots of good choices for things to eat for breakfast.  Dinner was another story...  They served many of the same dishes at dinner as at brunch!  That's a reason right there not to purchase an "eat all day" package, regardless of the included booze.  Also, the buffet looks like it can handle a much bigger spread (ie more food choices) for dinner, but the choices seemed limited.    Other notes:  Many dessert choices, with a few sugar-free/no sugar added options.  No wait service -- not even for drinks.  If you have picky children, More is an okay choice.  Foodie adults should definitely eat elsewhere.

NLkzfU6YcfngLeXLnMVCYg.text: Awful. Simply awful.   Food is cold, table and floor are dirty at all times, sad part I heard the floor  supervisor/manager comment to the food warmer (because food is bought premade, not cooked fresh) everything looks good.  Line pans were half empty and rice's was so dried out from sitting there on the line for what must have been hours and food was cold. $35 for two meals and all I could manage to choke down was one meal, save your money and go to Outback across the street or any other established restaurant. But on the positive note, the prim rib was excellent

d7vdFMtjbMI6iPDO227Y6w.text: Its not bad if you aren't expecting much. You will leave with a full belly, but its not the best buffet for the money. The buffet at the Excalibur is much better for the money.

PZL59qYIHEIjj2O1Q3Pdzw.text: Excellent! I had both breakfast and dinner here. For breakfast , I suggest heading immediately for the fresh omelette station. Cooked fresh and made to order. For dinner, there was a fresh pasta station , again cooked fresh and made to order. Coffee is strong and service is friendly

M3G-TgSDtoWhH9knnR4cvw.text: This place is reminiscent of Home Town Buffet with slightly wider variety at twice the price. As full disclosure, we were there on a Monday evening about an hour before closing. There were not any standout dishes that I just had to have more of. A surprising number of dishes were not that hot and slightly coagulated. We had free passes from a time share presentation otherwise we definitely would not have eaten there. Also, the name...More...really? Should have stuck with Pharaoh's Feast.

B0sxKQgtd1AkyWf8LuH3bg.text: Bad service (hostess)- we were standing in line to be seated next and a party of six came after us. They would seat people by turns and it was supposed to be our turn, but Betty the hostess took the party of six. so I said out loud to Betty that it was our turn and that we we're standing here first. Her answer was, "I didn't know" and continued to seat the group of six first. The party of six was kinda embarrassed and asked Betty if she would like to seat is first and she said, "no, I'll just seat you first". She didn't even apologize for her mistake but made a statement of I didn't know??? Like wtf. The when she was seating us which happened to be in a small corner with a small table that was missing a chair. She then asked if this table is okay? I responded with, I guess if that's all you got.  She then said go ahead and help yourself to the buffet line as I get you another chair.  It ruined my dinner cause everything didn't taste good for me being that I was upset. The old lady needs to retire or management needs to teach her customer service.

RKl-HemlNb9m8eeRI3dNag.text: Awful for lunch.... essentially a half-step away from cafeteria food.  Selections were sparse, and what was out was lukewarm at best.  No carving station, and no fresh fruit except for some apples and unripe bananas.  The only thing that saved it at all was the dessert station...  and that was just because it was in comparison to the sub-par food around it.  Yes, you can eat all you want for around $17... but if the food is so bad you don't want to eat it, it's not much of a bargain!

mu1-wEVZfpUuxYUpMWFKRA.text: As far as Vegas buffets go, this is better than some.  No complaints other than the variety of food really wasn't that deep.  The price was reasonable at $20/dinner.  I drank more chocolate milk than I thought humanly possible.  :-)  The bar closes at 10pm so keep this in mind if you want alcohol with your prime rib.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy Luxor pie.

jMEfm8Akiwgo2-Yf_nQgBQ.text: People are nice and the staff is in good shape but honestly we had dinner and breakfast there and it just isn't worth eating.  Minimal options and very slim on quality.  Stick with McDonald's if you have to eat inside the luxor

Zxig5PQGgUy6kw2s2-767Q.text: Bland, underseasoned, overcooked food. Bad selection. Not even close to worth the price of admission.

1gCB1y4L4wB_IifLsIC1fA.text: It's been a while since I last visited the Luxor Buffet and I was glad to see that the the whole place was rearranged. Seating is much more comfortable, with many small independent seating sections so the overall atmosphere is quiet. The soft lighting contributes to this effect.   Service was friendly and attentive.  The food was average to mediocre. Not a huge variety and overall most foods tended to be more on the bland side. There's Italian, Mexican and Chinese stations as well as more traditional stations with hot dogs and roasts.  The pizza is about as bland as it can get and so were the lasagna.  There were a couple items that I did enjoy though: chicken spring rolls and mongolian beef.  In the dessert station, the apple pie has a pleasant tanginess but the crust was bland. The cheesecake on the other hand was very filling and satiating with just about the right amount of sweetness.  Lunch costs about $17/person and dinner about $21.  While i appreciated the new layout the food is definitely not the same as it was about a year ago. Overall 2.5/5.

lQvYh334jUzrh1NcZg7OZA.text: I ate here twice, both times supper. The price is a bit much. With tip, over 20$. The overall quality of the food was average. Really, nothing jumped out at me as being great. The only items I went back for second on both times was the sausage and peppers and the country ribs where were tasty but still pretty basic. Their pizza looked worse than a froze Walmart brand pie. The children's section was terrible. Soggy pasta, soggy chicken nuggets ect. The fact that they had a wide array of drinks as part of the buffet made me happy. The desert selection looked pretty good, but I stuck to a small scoop of ice cream each time. I probably would try the Mandalay Bay buffet next time.

jxdTbWfVzxkKprLJlp9VOg.text: Tried a variety of the items from each bar. The waffles, pancakes, and french toast were "heat lamp hard". The salad bar was well stocked and fresh. Would like a low calorie drink option that is not soda. There were a lot of dessert options from cookies, soft serve ice cream, small parfait style treats as well.  For the price ($25.00), the hot food should be rotated more often and replaced with fresh.

ul6AUfFd7BmC5ynCYErsUA.text: This is the most terrible buffet food that me and my husband had ever experience..they said the lunch starts at 11am but still they serve breakfast even the the breakfast were so bad, that is why we will never come back again!

L8rotkkVKsw5YpAuuV-9wg.text: Decent buffet.  There weren't many options, for the size buffet this is.  Many stations were closed, even at dinner.  The options provided, however, were all great quality.  I would eat here again.

345UfvsCtS0Ne8m8IySZhw.text: I thought this place was great, and better than some of the pricey buffets we tried. We went for lunch and it was only like $18/pp and I had an Mlife B1G1 that made this a really great deal. There was a great selection of food and desserts. You get your own drink at this one. Plates were removed promptly. I would definitely go again!

f8HS1NmT5mwkgYHKdrhw-g.text: Food choices are pretty slim. Same as Excalibur, wack. Didn't have turkey ready for dinner. Who doesn't have turkey in a buffet? I got a refund.

StuCoBDzHco_504qs3vSUQ.text: Very standard little high of prices not much of verity of food. Morning on Sunday we go for breakfast but no they were serving a brunch witch fine but not much of food verity beside scrambled eggs with bacon and sausage with pancakes. And Bagle oat meal with no cinnamon service wasn't that great either however it's Vegas.

v6oQPEZitXi6_-vavLWvTQ.text: Pretty average , especially with the vegan/vegetarian options. The place is always packed, always a long line to get it, people seem to love it, my group usually always does. They could do better with labeling the food and adding some vegan/vegetarian options to their food line up. The staff is always friendly and I love their all-you-can-drink bar! It's a fun place to eat in groups for breakfast or brunch, but still feel it's over priced for the selection.

Pl-DJcQzq1iluUWhm1BqQA.text: Not bad. One star: Impressive lay out.  Two stars: The clams were awesome.  Three stars: Quick to pick up dirty dishes at the table. Hubby had the prime rib and he thought it was decent.  One star deducted because they were stingy with the cut of prime rib (I could almost see through his slice. Just saying) One star deducted: THEIR "CREME BRULEE" IS LIKE CREME BRULEE ON DOWNERS! Gross and disappointing! Do NOT be fooled. Ugh.

yxyljXez3HthDzUP-lXMAQ.text: I'm not a huge fan of buffets in general, but we were had a voucher and thought we'd give it a shot.  The carving station was wonderful.  The side dishes were tasty, with a large variety.  Most items were well stocked and the buffet was tidy.  It wasn't bad.      Low points:  very little choice on the salad bar.  I know I know, who goes to Vegas to eat salad?  I like having a little healthy/fresh food on vacation!  I was hoping for a little more variety.  The Asian selection - wow - everything tasted like it was covered in sugar.  It was disappointing and inedible.  Avoid it!!!    The usual turn-offs for me as far as buffets - hordes of rude children and adults who push and shove you to get to what they want despite the semblance of an orderly line or the fact that you're walking and happen to be in their path.    It's a little pricey for the quality, but with deals and vouchers it's not a bad way to pick and choose your way to an OK dinner.

thpLtxFTRq1QrpoTyAbcEQ.text: This place deserves a bad review since the food is not good. I went for lunch since I got free resort credit. I wish I could rewind the time and spend resort credit on something else. So disappointed:(

KaTfMkO-pjUWj91VQTukOw.text: I am not a big buffet person but ANY buffet would have to be better than this. I put a small scoop of things to test first and they all failed. Lacking in EVERY spot. I do not recommend even if it is free.

GrHKSOmFFHLG9ryEh93A7Q.text: Great buffet! Our server JR gave us the best customer service!  I would definitely refer this place to a friend or just anyone for great deals and quality food! Affordable prices too!  They even had free mimosas

gS3TJLqLqpgsOcvP9nrGvA.text: Buffet was awesome. We went to a few while out there, but this one was the cleanest and had the best variety of options. Will definitely go back

Stn5JCWO_rrjGg2sovV4_A.text: I actually remember this place being waaay better 2 years ago when I last visited. This time the food was mostly mediocre. Some items were good, and some were just meh. For the price I paid to eat here, I could have used that money to eat at a higher end buffet. Unfortunately this is where I have to part ways with More. I won't be back again.

C-Li3BUEbAOeNt0M6MU3xw.text: First, was disappointed with the quality of the food, the eggs were watery and tasteless, the biscuits were hard and stale, there were obvious entrees lacking, like in the Asian food section, there were holes where something should be, but only rice, chow mein and bakchoy were there. The sushi area was without, and the girl said that it all had to be gone before she could/would put out more, the "all" were tiny picked over pieces of sushi that were falling apart. Just like at the carving station, there was ham and turkey... what was the horseradish for? the beef gravy? Just about everything was lousy, bland, lukewarm, and depressing.   I did appreciate that the bacon is Gluten Free... the only item I actually noticed with the GF circle on it... I am not a GF person, but I found it amusing.   The highlight of our breakfast, the person before us dropped tongs into the syrup, and a guy in a chef coat (they all wear) with no nametag, that kinda looked like Mike Tyson, pulled them out and put them back for the next person, (my wife or I) to grab them and get our hands covered with syrup. So I pulled them out and slid them on the back of the counter... the actually ended up slipping off and onto the floor in front of him. He the got really belligerent and confrontational, wanting to know "what you do that for" to which I told him they were covered with syrup and people shouldn't have to use them. Also, I wonder about the hygiene standards... to me that seems the same as if someone were to have dipped their hands in the syrup, but really who knows how many people handled those tongs before they went in to the syrup. I would HOPE that if someone were dipping their bare hands into the food, it would be thrown out and replaced.  Afterwards, a quick stop at the dessert bar, and I don't know about that, completely pathetic. I could whip together better desserts, and I am not by any means a pastry chef.   There was not even ordinary about the buffet, it was entirely below average, and for the $20 or whatever a Saturday morning brunch is, totally not worth it. Even without the negative encounter, the missing food, the poor food, the horrible attitude of the staff...   Except for our server, I cannot recall her name, but my wife went up to the buffet leaving her purse unattended, the waitress stopped by to tell us she kept an eye on it for us. She received a nice tip, much nicer than if she hadn't said anything since the rest of the experience was so unsatisfactory. The 1 Star is completely for the waitress. The rest of the experience would rank a 0.

CDsVu4j2JSG2UHRELKCLNw.text: For $20 lunch buffet, I expected it to be at least half decent. NOPE. I should have suspected it wasn't that great since it was not busy with hungry patrons. I don't know why the previous reviewer said there was a variety of foods. C'mon they didn't even have General Tsao chicken, steak, or even fried chicken. Barely any meat dishes, just ham and turkey. They also did not have gelato ice cream. Most of the food was not even lukewarm.  I was also surprised to see that the drinks were self serve (which I don't mind) but they ask you if you want to pay a tip ahead of time when you pay for your entry, so no waitress available except the person who takes your finished plate away. The only good dish was the lasagna, veggie soup, and the limited dessert station.   Overall, highly regrettable buffet especially one that is on the strip.  I went to Red Rock casino buffet a couple days before for lunch which costs us $14.99, and it had a lot more variety and better quality food. Please save your money and pay the extra $5 at a different casino on the strip for a more worthwhile experience.

zjilxr7mtWO2OOBEtkL4zg.text: I went for breakfast and I have a nut allergy. It was a bit pricey for what you got but pretty good breakfast options that'll hold you over until dinner. I asked about peanuts and tree nuts when I walked in and they said to ask the chef. I then asked someone at the station who was helpful and the chef came out after a few minutes. Everything was made in house so it was all good except the desserts and bread pudding. Other than that pretty good and they had an omelette station.

kL8XgMo4HoUcJXjCTyAK3Q.text: I had a BOGO from mlife for this buffet and from reading the reviews I thought I was in for a disaster.   Nope!  I was here for lunch this past Thursday and I couldn't have been more delighted. Plenty of selections. Nothing high end at the tables, but everything was well made and flavorful.   Desserts... just wow. Kudos to your bake staff, and overall staff for bringing a good experience to my dining.  FYI... those of you comparing this buffet to aria, bellagio, or any other high end buffet, you can't compare apples to hub caps. This is a blue collar buffet for those of us who can't afford $40 for a small buffet and want to opt for a larger selection at a reasonable price.   I will be back next month when I return to Vegas!

kqefqNmBhyuaOtYfsYppFg.text: Staff was really nice and the restaurant was very pleasing to the eye but the food was baaadddd. Mac and cheese tasted like it was made from a box of kraft mac and cheese. Singapore noodles were NOT Singapore noodles and fried rice was bland and mushy. The only good thing was the deserts.

ttxWSg3vG7dE8JSGBun--w.text: We stayed at Luxor & enjoyed buffet lunch & dinner about 5-6 diff occasions! Very impressed considering we went to the Mirage & MGM buffets too. The Luxor is much better for variety, quality food & service! Well done Luxor

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yummo
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

PNlkygFXgX0UHQrBsjnhYA.text: Beautiful hotel. The buffet had a large selection and the food was pretty good. About $22 for a mid week brunch and is worth the money.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

UbbHLIh6oLrP8-IivfoSEQ.text: I should have read the reviews before coming here. A complete waste of 30 dollars. I think the best thing about this buffet was the soda. Completely disappointed.

sW9WQOgUsMUZxRvfOuD6SA.text: Nothing to brag about.  The cashier was friendly, but not helpful.  She asked if we were there for brunch and we said yes.  So she checked us out and gave us to the hostess.  We heard the people behind us say no all day.  All day?  That's an option?  They should have told us options.  The hostess was unfriendly and never smiled.   However, the guy waiting on tables was great!  The food had good moments and bad moments.  The salad bar was good, broccoli cheese soups was great, the prime rib was tasteless but adding A1 helped, the ham was good, the sausage was super dry, the chicken was very tasty and juicy, the mashed potatoes were awesome, and the dessert was awesome!  Everything else wasn't worth writing about.  For the money it wasn't great, but if you are just starving then it serves its purpose!

MCymLZdzui7vnA4Sgu-HgQ.text: Came here for Monday dinner. This review is based on other casino buffets on the Vegas strip.  Cons: The variety of food they have are on the cheap end; most are fast food style. Taste is on the lower end. Seafood was a joke, tiny shrimp with mainly breading, & clams were grainy Pro: they do have a carving station; only the turkey was very good and ham was ok. Place looks clean and there are plenty of seats.

4onYUA57JQiO6pBiSBTfTA.text: Food was average. Decor made the buffet area very dark (not a fan). Was there for breakfast and there wasn't a lot of selections.

c8YBipIGcSVfXLif2LT2BA.text: The spread at the Buffet at Luxor actually quite good but nothing special. The salad, soup and fruits are fresh and good variety. The American food section has good steak and sausage plus baked and mashed potatoes. The Italian section has pizza and pasta. Other than that this place also has South America and Chinese food section. At $24,99 per person it's include free flow soft drinks, dessert and coffee too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Minestrone soup, pizza and salad.

C3jUnxlUAlCKoRAunl0z_A.text: I came here due to using my MyVEGAS redemptions- Buy one get one Free. I paid $25 for two people to eat; decent price when doing Las Vegas on a budget.  If you're not looking for a top scale buffet, this is a place to go. I got here at the start of lunch and there wasn't many people here.  I personally enjoyed what they had and thought there was a great variety of food to choose from. Our server was on top of gathering the empty plates and had a great personality!  I would come here again even without using MyVEGAS rewards as I liked the food and service. At one point the executive chef, Clark Overton came out and walked around making sure we were enjoying the food! Again, if you have rewards or not, I would recommend it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

wh-NpGSbp6rbyG-8NtWhcA.text: Went to the buffet at the Luxor. Almost bought the day pass, thank god we didn't!! Went to get a bagel and there were bugs crawling on them. Lost my appetite and the manager was notified. The manager and head chef came to our table and did nothing for us. Hopefully they pulled the bagels. Absolutely disgusting.

-GfaZVVCb9dVoHReK7RrKQ.text: Pretty standard Vegas buffet. Food is meh, prices are steep. $40 for two for breakfast.   Apple crepes were good; cheese blintzes were awful. Bacon was okay. Oatmeal okay. Eggs okay. You get what I'm saying.   Real benefit was location.

LfhNgdv12TdUmbirNw86eA.text: We ran into this buffet before going to a show at the Luxor. Terribly disappointing.  More bare counter space than selections. Sub-par food. Their "taco" bar didn't even have sour cream. The fish was dry and no flavor. The prime rib was sub-prime. Hard to cut and no flavor. It felt like the end of the night and they were about to clean up, even though it was prime time for dinner on a Saturday. The servers were nice.  As the drinks are self serve, they only provided straws when asked, and cleaned up the tables. I expect more from a Vegas casino. I should have got the hint when they ask to pay a tip upon entry. Avoid the disappointment!

V8Coa0odXGA5Bo4t-z05Zg.text: Mike is the absolute worst! He works at the bar in the buffet and he totally ruins everything. He's rude and inconsiderate. Everyone else that works the buffet is amazing. Mike, however, should not be in the hospitality industry. I would be embarrassed to have him on my staff if I were management. Thanks for an awful experience, Mike.

tJLxCbZprAs30QvOVp0cVw.text: My first time to Vegas and wanted to eat at a good Buffet on the strip. Paid a good amount of money. The selection was way below par. The chocolate milk was watered down. And the pancakes tasted as if they came from the freezer.  Worst buffet I have ever had. I live in n Reno and all of there buffets are way better and cost less. I attempted to call and talk to someone and was hung up on. The mumisoas was flat and all you tasted was sour orange juice. There was no selection for lunch.

3GgUT1KFamSb4JMr97Hurw.text: For $24 Brunch Buffet, they had a lot of variety that made our group happy! Bottomless mimosas included in this weekend brunch price, they are premixed but it's 5 o'clock somewhere and a great start to a Vegas morning. I've been to a few buffet and this buffet is the best price point for what you get! Great decor, only flaws include: no expresso machine and coffee is just alright.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch at the Buffet at Luxor. Bottomless Mimosas all for $24 (weekends).

uMQIigORzox-Qny0duIT_g.text: We bought all-day wristbands and did our best to get our money's worth but it was tough.  We went for brunch on Sunday which was good but I was disappointed to find out there were no strawberries to be had for the cheese blintzes.  Ended up using strawberry yogurt on them.  The post-brunch offerings were less than spectacular.  The queso and chips were good but the variety was limited and by the time dinner rolled around everyone but the crab leg eaters had a problem finding something they still wanted to eat.

0iE3Ol9hU7jmmmBg5NPTnw.text: Definitely subpar food for din. Not sure if it was a bad night but many dishes were overcooked because unless the dish is being selected by customers, it sits there for a lot of time. I attempted to get crab twice, and both times, it was in the water for way too long. I even saw a cook leave older mixed veggies in a pan, and then throw fresh cooked veggies in a pan and mixed them. Why would someone want both fresh and over cooked/have been in a serving tray too long mixed together. I had crab (F), ginger chicken (which I enjoyed), white rice, chickpeas (which I really enjoyed), steak ( C), pesto pasta salad ( A), corn on the cob ( C). I gave it 2 stars because I mention the crab quality to the manager, and he really showed concern and tried to help. Also, the staff were pleasant (service is always important to me) and there some items that was ok.

4JfwzJKFqMBdXGiZG5SIfA.text: Wedding party here.  Many different types of cuisine but none of them were exceptional.  Condiments are spaced out oddly (the butter was far from the bread basket, for example).  Cheap, tacky frozen tamales in the plastic wrappers.  Carving station had ham, sausage, turkey, and roast beef.  Many of the signs identifying the food were inaccurate.  Service was friendly and efficient.  Also, an employee slipped on the floor and injured herself.  Other employees were very slow to help. Not a good scene.

EME6WjPyia0d4lF7Jk0GOw.text: Food wasn't great. Most of it was room temp. The desserts were good. Service was fine. Wouldn't go again.

0GXcvyhPnCjIRkR1209VHQ.text: I don't understand why this place gets such a bad rep. I've been here twice and I loved the food both times. Then again, I still have yet to visit the beloved Bacchanal buffet, but let's be objective here!  This buffet is definitely one of the cheaper buffets on the LV strip. Located at the unique Luxor, I was able to take the shuttle to the buffet from where I was staying (Mandalay Bay).   I was intrigued by the deals this place had. Check out the tips by fellow Yelpers below, apparently they have a 2 for 1 deal or something like that. I wish I could have taken advantage of the offer but I was only in LV for a short time.   Considering the price, I would give this place a solid 4 stars. They serve a variety of foods from Mexican, American, to Asian. No complaints. All the dishes I ate were delicious. They also serve crab, which they strip for you. They serve it cold but you can also request that they warm it up for you.  I took off one star because it took a while to get into the buffet even though there was such a short line. Not to mention, the lady who rung us up was totally rude and inconsiderate. Despite the lackluster customer service, I'm coming back for the food and the value!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crab legs are served chilled but you can ask for them to warm it up
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

7Oe1PvW4XtrsrOOUEpMKcw.text: There are many items to taste especially desserts. Within the budget overall good experience.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

WNu-sWyo9BgHowjpa-DXmQ.text: Came here for Thanksgiving and it was one of the best buffets I have been to! I was super bummed to think I might not be able to celebrate thanksgiving with family appropriately due to being on vacation but man they met the mark with what they were serving! It was great service and great food! Thanks to all the people who were working that day!

wqS7MSF8t7wn1mU9YknQfg.text: I'm not sure why a lot of people are hating but this buffet was pretty good in my opinion. There was a great selection of different food to choose from. You had everything from pasta, to pizza to seafood. I enjoyed the crab legs so much that I went back for seconds and thirds. If I stay at the Luxor again I would definitely eat there.

ZIyvR2seGft8Av6bh7UOow.text: Terrible food! After a long day's drive we stopped here for the buffet. Huge mistake. The food was tasteless and some had been sitting for what looked like hours. It looked like it was going to be a wonderful variety however it was all pretty much inedible. The best part of dinner was the cheesecake (which was a frozen one I'm sure.)

EFJhDSvOfBJFryEgjbqErA.text: I don't know about you but I thought it was A-ok! We went for dinner which is $20.00 (we received a military discount that made it $18.00) There are lots of selections that include American, Asian, Italian, Mexican, salad's, breads, and my favorite Sushi!  The sushi goes quick so be prepared to possibly have to go back up to grab some if none is available right away.  The dessert selection is also preety awesome.  Not bad at all for the price and quality of food.

GRDDXVGUpwcIto6VbpK91g.text: 2.5 stars actually. We went to Luxor lunch buffet on our 1st anniversary trip to Vegas. There was almost an hour long line. The ambiance inside was pretty good. But not many food choices comparatively. But price was low, when you compare with other big casino buffets

lZNczJbYnPxPQWNYIP07Tw.text: The buffet is located at the Luxor hotel. It is very convenient if you are staying at the Mandalay, Luxor, Excalibur or any of the surrounding hotels. The customer service is nothing special. It is easily accessible. I went with my grandfather and we had been to a few other more expensive buffets in Vegas, but on our last day in the city we decided to go to the MORE Buffet because it was the closest to our hotel. It is more affordable than the other buffets but it has a lot of variety, it keeps the Luxor style and the service is good.
