nS2QonPjg0xFVznhmwnN2A.text: The Luxor Buffet. Old Country Buffet at twice the price.  I was down here for my Dirty 30 with a couple of friends from high school. Part of our Vegas itinerary included a stop at a buffet. My inclination was to go to the Mandalay Bay buffet. I figured that with the Asian influence and theme, there ought to be some pretty palatable food there.  However, that wasn't the case. My cheap friends vetoed it and voted for the Luxor.  The buffet was very clean and the ambience was nice. Those are the high points. Unfortunately for the Luxor, buffets are all about food and this is where it fell flat. For $20, I expected a pretty decent buffet. Heck, Benihana in Seattle has all you can eat sushi for $15 at lunch. No. Not decent.  The Asian food all seemed like a generic "Super Lucky Grand Panda Buffet" that you see in a bad strip mall. Orange chicken? Egg rolls? Check and check. The pizza made Domino's look gourmet. The only food that was reasonably palatable was the Mexican food. If you get dragged to the Luxor, go to that station and fill up.  Two stars? Yeah. I didn't get food poisoning and got full. But that's it.

cH1BjR_UWxFVybuo-dGiRg.text: We had a 2-1 buffet through MyVegas, so wanted to try this for breakfast. It was okay... Should I have to pay full price, I'm not sure I would choose this buffet. The sausage patty was almost inedible, the apple crepe was rubbery and flavorless, and everything else was just "meh." I personally found the wheat toast to be the best thing and my husband says he only liked the raisin bran cereal. Not the worst there is, but I'm also sure there is much better.

LtLr9mg2-ZZRTQbthnTxkw.text: This place is over rated too, got here for dinner, not a lot of variety, not worth it! The only thing good there was the Pepsi and juices. Wouldn't come here again.

_pvNKFzg-1-wKr3qoNdBBw.text: Great seafood options for a buffet after 4pm! Service was so friendly!!! We bought the all day pass....totally worth it!

B73Uen4nKV_HEkSh4XelMA.text: Recently, received $25 certificate to go to the Luxor MORE buffet....  Ok...well...all I can say is this was terrible. Beyond terrible. Not just to Vegas standards,  but to any standard. I would have been disappointed if I had spent $4.95 for his buffet in the middle of North Dakota (no offense North Dakota). I would like to give this minus stars.  My wife and I both felt the same way and went to IN-n-Out Burger after the failed attempt to find food at the buffet.  I will say the Prime Rib was okay...but nothing to return for.   TERRIBLE TERRIBLE AND TERRIBLE. Take a smell at the top of the stairs before you enter, that weird smell is the best part of the buffet.

mRR5dcm9Ue2SIH4faot9tA.text: I was excited to find a moderatley priced buffet and this one, along with the Excalibur one, had a deal where you could eat at both all day for only $35. We tried this one for breakfast. I thought the food was good and there was a good variety. Since we got there close to the switch between breakfast and lunch I saw there was also a good lunch variety. We were so full from the morning that we decided to do a late lunch/early dinner during their dinner hours but I was disappointed with the variety of food. The little that was available was good though. And they had crab legs, shrimp and sushi. This buffet was miles better than Exaclibur though.

taen-nu7iDUGitgefNfIPg.text: I went during breakfast hours to this travesty of a buffet.  The food at Shoney's or Ponderosa is way, way better than this crop.    I only liked the beverages.  Cold food, nasty eggs, strange-tasting sausages, stale breads, and overripe fruit are the norm at this waste of time and money.  At least the staff are attentive and kind.

A5d4UYrlUKrELudUh6JzdA.text: I really enjoyed breakfast here. Champagne brunch came with unlimited mimosas, and the food was really good.   They've got a wide selection of things, so there's something for everyone.   I'd definitely go here again.

Xd8Yj5lyb5qQms22xFiqyg.text: Even if I was one of those Ethiopian kids on infomercials, you know, those little dudes with fat tummies and flies circling about, I wouldn't eat here. I firmly believe the executive chef at More is devoid of taste buds. There can be no other explanation for why everything is flavorless. Why hell, even I know you can make anything tasty with an assload of salt and butter. Not this chef.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                         How exactly does one fuck-up prime rib, or for that matter, white cake? I didn't think that was possible until now.  Anyway, I had the good fortune of gracing their trough recently, the result of an invitation to a wedding / reception. MORE does have a bar located at the west end of the building which helps make the food tolerable.  If you go, notwithstanding this review, I strongly urge you to smoke or drink something so potent, you're 'seeing things' prior to your binge.  I now know why the Roman Empire had vomitoriums located adjacent to the feasting halls. History came into focus after eating here.

N5bqzdPJOa6j6iNqyZI3UQ.text: I came here twice while I was staying at the Luxor...mostly roped in because it was only $12.99 on Friday and $18.99 on Saturday. (Which isn't bad compared to most breakfast places...that, and it seems like there isn't really an abundance of breakfast places because most people are still hungover and dead by then).   I was impressed by the food selection...but not so impressed by the quality. The breakfast food was all pretty decent. I had a lard-fest of potatoes, chorizo scrambled eggs, a spanish omelet, eggs benedict, and bacon on one occasion. Not bad...but it could have been because I was FAMISHED. Not the highest quality of food, like I said, but for the price, it was bearable.  The brunch with the mimosas and champagne was a little more sub-par. The mimosas were surprisingly good, even though they probably used sparkling apple juice or something equally weak. It was a little early in the AM for me...but I figured if I was paying for it, I might as well get it.  The food was BLEH. I had some weird kind of fried rice and lo mein that was covered in grease and very bland. The mac and cheese looked like it had been sitting out for a while. The pasta salads were the only thing that I was happy to eat...but I guess it's hard to mess up a pasta salad.  Not the worst food I've ever had...but very far from the best. Service was good though. We got our drinks very quickly and our plates were cleared when necessary.

D7xrlETHIRNpUkXz9gZdsw.text: We purchased the full day buffet special for $32 because we though it would be amazing food at a great price. While it was a good deal, the food was disappointingly average. The lunch and dinner menu were the exact same two days in a row, which got boring really fast.  Lastly, there was a Mexican section [enchiladas, beans, rice...], a Chinese, section [orange chicken, rice, egg rolls...], and an Italian section [spaghetti, meatballs...] with food that looked and tasted like something from Denny's. I recommend you only eat at the buffet once, probably breakfast.  Also, the dessert buffet was alright; apple pie, frozen yogurt, cheesecake, brownie bites, mousse pie, stuff bought from the store. This buffet is one step above the buffet at the  "Exacalibur," ...and that isn't saying much.

P5lJ3je6FlATH1ytCk97bQ.text: This isn't an expensive buffet you will find at other casinos, but it is good with good food. Plenty of seating and enough room to get around without tripping over other diners.

ZROrkAaQ8De-hZkDkeKOfg.text: Had the breakfast buffet twice while here.  Stayed at Mandaly.  First time was to try it out.  Then I wound up w a Luxor dining comp I didn't use and it was time to leave so needed something easy and went back.  hoping it would be better the second time around.  it wasn't.  Not bad buffet for the price, just not great.  Granted, I only did breakfast.  But Manadaly Bay and Main St Station were the  other two breakfast buffets i did while in town and they were way better.  Even the Stratosphere breakfast buffet last time I came to Vegas beat this.

7p9mERL2xsh-yVP9ZgUryQ.text: Awful.  Awful.  Bench seating was the most uncomfortable ever experienced.  Dreary bland breakfast food.  Hoping for better.  Mandalay Bay buffet 20x better.

daxhFV7vsCFO5WI0ladk7w.text: OMG what is this crap?!! Excuse my ruthlessness when it comes to reviewing this buffet...........but I think it's the worse food I've ever had.....come on Luxor...you gotta do better than that!   So I got 2 complimentary lunch buffet at the hotel we stayed at and the choices were Aria, Mandalay Bay, Luxor, Monte Carlo, Excalibur, Mirage and MGM Grand...We were getting lunch pretty late around 3pm...we wanted to try Aria or Mandalay Bay but we walked to both and they were closed for lunch already and I didn't feel like walking back to Mirage, MGM or Monte Carlo and I was starving by the time we reached Luxor/Excalibur/Mandalay Bay so we decided maybe Luxor was the better choice than Excalibur.   Well I don't know how the buffet is at Excalibur but omg barely anything was edible at this buffet....they served some crappy Mexican dishes...the tamale was super dry, there weren't many selections either....the pasta was undercooked....and they had Chinese food that was like from the $1 chinese express restaurants. Horrible!  Okay so the only thing I actually liked was their Creme Brulee.....but that was the only decent dessert they had...the rest of the desserts looked pretty unappetizing  =/  I should have filled up with the creme brulee...instead I gulped down the food that was on my plate just so I didn't have to waste it....-_-"  I'm so glad it was complimentary because if I had to pay $16 for this crap...I would be demanding for a refund! haha and yes I know it was only $16 dollars....you pay for what you get...cause most good buffets are at least $25 and up...but gah....it shouldn't be this horrid under $20 either. -_-"  So needless to say I would not come back here ever.!!!!!

DAsUUkCcERRPHSrq0eHlEw.text: Avoid. It reminds me of a Hometown Buffet chain. The food is plentiful as is the selection, and some of the items are good. But the it comes off as a cheap cafeteria. It looks old and run down, and some of the food looks like its been sitting there forever.

8lAUFpcR16bPCBL-6nggHw.text: We came on my Husbands birthday which also happened to be a Sunday Mimosa Brunch. The price was great in that it was just shy of $65 for 2 adults and 1 child. The food was hot and plentiful which can be hard to find at some buffets. Our daughter loved the bacon and I believe she ate about 2 plates full whereas my husband and I tried a little bit of everything. If we're ever in town again I think we'll come back.

w_IRuzhzRj-gVDTi9QyDoA.text: Had dinner here on 12/20/2014....   It was decent. Wide variety of every kind of food that you would want.   Pricey of course at around $56 for 2 people for dinner.   I would have to say that the food is served luke warm.... we were there for a late dinner I will give it that but the food looked hot when we put it on our plate but by the time we got back to the table it was on the verge of cold.   They have enough food to feed your inner fat kid and a wide enough variety to have exactly what you are in the mood for.

QeUj0qhOt_DLT5FPTUDXPw.text: Oh my god. What made me come here. I type this as I eat and I can singularly say that if I wasn't terribly broke from gambling the night away I would have never come here.  The food is plastic. The only success story here is oil and red color and that is what you get oodles of. Vegetables have been cut the size of apple slices by people who probably ran a jail kitchen before.   Eat here only if you are broke or if you particularly enjoy giving your stomach a hard time.   There are many many better places than this. Friendly tip just get McDonald's for 20$ and you will have a good time.

vEapcH6Ea3KZMkfzVUphOg.text: Mediocre food but a decent price so can't really complain. It's underground and a little hard to find so I had to ask someone where it was located exactly. I ended up just eating one or two things because it was all that really appealed to me. There wasn't a massive selection to choose from either. But like I said, for the price compared to other buffets can't complain. +1 star for the dessert selection which was the best part of the meal.

m9nCa5Vp1PGYZY7ywitWxA.text: I expected "MORE". I would honestly take GOLDEN CORRAL over this place. The food was bland and unimaginative. The decor and presentation created a depressing atmosphere. Take a time warp back to 1993, but take away all the good things about the 90's, and there you have it...luxor's premier buffet.

-vT55rVpBTkFVYJfKrhJ_A.text: don't recommend it, walked in trying to have lunch, there wasn't much to choose from, try the buffet at the mirage or the wynn instead, otherwise the hotel is nice on the outside

d2eQvLTwUGm6Oj3dO7j4cw.text: I don't know why this place averages only two stars, when clearly it is a noble effort of a great Vegas buffet. Why do I say this? The roast beef is rare and done perfectly. So is the spaghetti, and the paella with seafood. You can tell the place is designed for some privacy, some mystique of an Egyptian dig site, so ambiance rates a lot with me. Yes, they could have maximized the seating areas for more $$$ but chose to give their patrons a nicer environment. That effort is a lot in my book.  The staff have an organized system for the line, and that impresses me. There is nothing I hate more than a line with no order, no system, which allows others to come in at a haphazard and undefined point in time. A little wait, yes, but again they have a system in place.  As for the desserts, their wide selection is just more than you can tackle.  The only thing I did not like were the tiny, tiny sow crab legs They were so skinny. I was at the Rio seafood buffet the evening before so I have had my fill of crab legs so I did not try the ones here. I am glad I did not have to, as they were so thin and watery.  CANNOT compare this to buffets $35 and up. This belongs to the $14-$24 range. I really did enjoy my dinner there.

YvSF19fikUEReeEqNCItQA.text: The food was awful. I tried multiple different things everything was either salty, undercooked or dry. Do not recommend. So many good places to eat in Vegas, this is not one of them.

xfDR1XNr63qG-OOUB3iDFg.text: If only I could give no star..DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY ON THIS BUFFET..this was our first time eating this and we were not impressed..there were so many people so we thought it must be good.  No.  The food had no flavor whatsoever and there was hardly anything to choose from.  The tea tasted like it had been sitting in the container for days.  I am so disappointed that we spent $21.99 a person on the crappy excuse for a buffet.  Don't do it!!

9Cgn1sxUSjUNqNO9bmb9pA.text: Delicious buffet on Sunday morning and for. Dinner   Can't beat it. On Sunday you get mimosa. The staff is great. A wonderful place to eat

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heath bar cheesecake
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Beautiful decor   Fantastic food

eycTQAkz1qwK7-VSaL9qSQ.text: Id definitely give this place 5 stars for value but it solidly deserves 4 stars. $19 for weekend brunch unlimited mimosas and friendly attentive service??? Are you kidding? It doesn't exist in vegas. But it does at Luxor.   My buddy and I came here for breakfast after a late night out. The line took 5 minutes. (I wait longer than that for breakfast at the local diner by my house in San Diego.) We were given a booth for 2 ppl. (Always a plus)   Food for breakfast was eggs Benny waffles, pancakes, the basics. But tons of crispy bacon.   Beverage service is more like a cafeteria from college. Grab your own, which can get hard with coffee orange juice and breakfast. In one trip. Here's a tip, take more than one trip. Oh and take as many as you want, bc I said all you can drink mimosas right?   No, it's not ceasars. But even at the Bacchanal I waited an hour to sit at a bad table and 10 minutes before I was asked my drink order.

MbbEvtDKZM6VDq9NaSaKtg.text: No bargain on price, but food is good and pastries are to die for at the dessert bar - absolutely delicious! Lamb and pita bread and fixings for mini Greek style gyros nice touch. One of my favorite foods is pizza, but not the best here. Only thing available was a pizza with veggie toppings. Nice mix of American, Latin, Asian, and Italian food. Friendly service from staff. $40 on Friday, $26 for kids - about what you would expect in Vegas. No bargains here.

G_DxmNoAv2hA3vxJ2avaOQ.text: -Pricey (brunch $22/each -Not much to choose from -Bland -No one there to carve the turkey meat -Soup was cold -Long wait  -Will never return! -For best buffet, go to M Resort -- you won't be disappointed with the quality, choices, and taste. It's off the strip but so worth it!

hmSqNe6gjzYgKpXHSjc1Iw.text: Fresh food!  Cooked perfectly!  Affordable price!  So many selections!  Can't begin to try everything! Something for everyone.. EVEN the pickiest eater!   Luxor Buffet is a hidden gem.  Worth the parking drama to find a space at times.  Luxor is a very busy hotel/casino.  We've been 3x already in a year.

_iap9JZvREs3mBk6x3m2eA.text: This is the worst buffet that I have ever been to in my entire life. It's worst than Souplantation (way worst, actually), worst than Hometown, and of course ALL the other buffets in Vegas to date.  The food is bland, and everything doesn't taste like food. (For example, the eggs taste like they came from a box - made with water, the hot dogs were soggy and gross, even the pizza was old and nasty.) The drinks were watered down. Orange juice tasted like orange-colored water.  Desserts existed and looked OK, but when you ate it - they were bland and didn't have any taste. (empty calories).  We paid $40 for the two of us -$20 per person. NOT WORTH IT!  DON'T GO! There were just so many things wrong with this buffet.

NducEqxdHldWK9xyXI0v9Q.text: I had high hopes for this buffet because I heard that it had improved dramatically over what it used to be.  While that may be True for Friday/Saturday dinner, the quality is sorely lacking at other times.  I went during an off-peak time:  a weekday for breakfast.     I'll start off with the pros:  the staff is very friendly, and the Egyptian theming of the buffet is really nice. Also, there are lots of secluded areas so you're not right on top of other people.  The positives unfortunately end there.  Other than the fruit, the food was inedible.  The bacon and sausage were limp and extremely greasy.  The coffee was burnt.  The eggs were watery, too salty, and had a very strange aftertaste.  The waffles, pancakes, and hash browns were stale and also had a strange aftertaste.  And to top it all off, I also felt sick after eating the food there.  Will not go again.

aaB8LmmtE00-fkKHGuJ4nA.text: Ambience: The restaurant is held in the overall "Egyptian" style of the Luxor hotel.   Timing: We went in there around 10:45 so we paid for breakfast $18 but where able to sample both, breakfast and lunch as they started to switch at 11:00 am.  Waiters: One showed us our table, but nobody showed up afterwards to e.g. remove our plates, etc.   Food selection: Nothing special, selection was on the small side. Most of the selection was carried forward from breakfast.   Food quality: cheap, my taste buds were not amused. For example, the veal cutlet had a so thick crust that you were only able to taste the crust, and the bread pudding was half baked and had a strong egg taste.  Recommendation: We will not return

F7d1g9V1IOMPbXKazmVIkw.text: Firstly, I am particularly surprised at the number of bad reviews this place has.   My experience has been a complete contrast to those who disliked it, for example, the food choices here are very diverse and seemingly endless. They make all kinds of foods from different cultures, which is a big thumbs up for any buffet restaurant. The dessert section has all kinds of sweet delicacies, and the drink possibilities are numerous. There are some times where one menu runs out, but it is quickly refilled.   There is a gentleman who goes around busily putting away the dirty dishes and even singing happy birthday to the customers, my deepest respect goes to him!   I would definitely go here again! Definitely worth the price!

Q49TqV6fN-krQ6-Ch71-Lg.text: I would take an Old Country Buffet over the lunch at More buffet at Luxor. Some of the items fell into the "not too bad" category but more than half I was not putting on my plate and some only took one bite to know I didn't want a second bite.  The only things that were pretty good....mashed potatoes/gravy, meatballs, and the taquitos because anyone can deep fry something.  PS- the buffet at the Bellagio was fantastic. We should have just gone to the Bellagio again.

pEa3dO1avoR_2Kd9WxXB7w.text: 2-stars. Honestly for $18 (lunch) buffet on the strip it pretty much met my expectations.  None of the food was spectacular, some was better than others. Orange Chicken was pretty good, the taco bar was decent as well. The pizza was pretty meh, but they did have some great desserts.   Woudn't be my top choice for lunch, though I'd consider it for breakfast (since I paid more for breakfast at the pyramid cafe for a plate of eggs, hasbrowns and bacon).

9rHCPlYVSU99mNsz8zKg2g.text: @ Lunch Buffet on a weekday Desserts and salads were the only thing that was worth rating and they can get  2.5 stars American+Asian+Mexican+Italian food. Not the place to try the "Buffet in Vegas"... not worth it...I know its a less pricey one, but they can be different than look like a Hometown buffet or something of that sort

2o2I9aG785HGiB5VHYlY4w.text: We ate at MORE The buffet on a Saturday night. It was a great buffet for the price. Crab legs, mussels, clams, paella, prime rib, and shrimp. All the food was well prepared and very tasty. It is not as fancy as the Wynn or Caesars, but is a great buffet for the price. They also have a happy hour wrist band for all you can drink beer and wine that is a great deal!

4LUFsORhmgJmbDZrsNS1Lw.text: Worst buffet ever I can get the same for half the price I pay here. There is not much oh a food selection. Don't go here not unless you want to feel rip off. There are nothing else to say everyone else must have really bad taste bug or blind. Only one star cause I have no choice.

S6cW06unONFvDLeqF4Wkeg.text: I guess I thought it was better than most reviewers, but it seemed fine to me with decent selection and some good dishes like Korean short ribs and mango fish.  Might be a bit overpriced on its own, but it's a great deal as part of the all day combo with Excalibur for $35 if you eat at either a couple times.

iZUIF633to7zLM4lJE5Rww.text: Don't waste your money...so not worth it!  The food has no tastes and is dry! Treasure Island so much better!

Fd-AfP9fOra3wyQ-1-f_Kw.text: This meal became for flavor and none was found. We were hoping that one dish didn't taste like a microwaveable budget meal or hospital cafeteria food. The best part was the soft serve ice cream and Pepsi.

cvueZ1DwGfSwalnRa28CYA.text: Breakfast midweek is disappointing. No meat carving station. No desserts. No table drink service, had to get my own coffee and orange juice and own refills.   No bar, if that matters to you. Decor was nice. Food was just fine, nothing exciting.

1ew6D6GWC7yKZ0pl79jsOg.text: Unfortunately, all the other bad reviews are correct. The selection of food is poor and it is basically flavorless. We walked around to see what we wanted to eat and found nothing that looked good. I ended up with hummus and pita bread, bok choy and some sad egg rolls. I'm not going in for a second plate or even dessert. It wasn't the worst lunch I've ever eaten, but it was pretty close.

R7weNNhsuDsR4o7W5HsGZA.text: The name is just a name. Don't expect to get more for the price you pay for this place.  I wanted some sushi but it tasted like it was the same sushi that is bought in Costco.  Not very delectable.  I liked the whiskey infused steak but that's pretty much it.    I think there are other buffets around the strip for a much better price. My family and I all felt that way and we did end up finding better buffets. I suppose by the time we got here, it was late and a lot of place closed already so this was the only place to go since we were all famished.

8TeTiEAl4cTn7wuVZz-AZg.text: I experienced the Luxor Buffet back in September with my boyfriend and his parents visiting from England. We went for an early lunch and really it was just to get his parents in the same hotel as the Titanic Exhibit.  The Luxor buffet reminded me of the scene in National Lampoon's Vegas Vacation when the Cousin Eddie takes Walt to the buffet = "I'll have the blue stuff." Nothing was blue, but there was definitely a lot of mystery meat in sauce.   I really struggled to find food that looked appetizing and mostly stuck with bruised fruit and pizza. This buffet was terrible. The whole situation was made worse, since we had eaten at the Aria Buffet the day before. Naturally, we had not expected the Luxor to be on par with the Aria, but the difference was staggering.  I would not eat here again.

yJZxd34srfrh98m3qRPM9w.text: $39.99  weekend Dinner Buffet for THIS ?!?!?!?  The Roast beef was a mystery cut that had been tenderized to death, ending up with a very strange, chewy texture.   No seafood to speak off.  Oh yeah, Snow crab Legs.  Previously frozen, some of them STILL frozen (really?).   The salad pickings, breads, appetizers and dressings are the stuff of cafeterias and Smorgasbords. Even Fresh Choice has more imagination.  The hot entrees were ALL terrible. No taste, no texture, no flavor. The desserts were even worse.  What a disaster ! If this buffet were $9.99 I MIGHT not have complained as much.   But at the price they charge, it should be good.  It wasn't.

D-aAp91f4FDwqIqPPYOvNg.text: My family and I had the opportunity to try out MORE for brunch during our recent stay at the Luxor and we all thoroughly enjoyed it.  The selection of food items was abundant.  There was something for everyone.  My daughter enjoyed the red velvet dessert and I was extremely pleased with a veggie omelette.  The service was also top notch. I highly recommend this buffet.

Gq8bw6Q8UwyXSbri03TA3Q.text: We went for brunch on a Saturday (@10a). It was so bad!! It was cheap so we didn't expect too much. But, the food was cold by the time we got back to our seats, and were close to the Buffett. Cold eggs, cold waffles, cold syrup and cold over cooked bacon. The hummus was good. I ended up eating salad and hummus for brunch. Too bad!

iUXJgtmBttdOV0-ICt-HbQ.text: Only if you're outta money and receive two free buffet entre ,its worth it. Other than that its not anything special. The salad and desert is good ,but the food isnt so great. People are so friendly and nice because they know their food isnt that good. One of the cheaper buffets in the strip. If you're a healthy eater it should be okay but not if you like to eat good(meats).

6SEHAzkUD5SPF5dOy9MSHQ.text: Used my Vegas rewards for a buy one get one free buffet and was excited about eating at more. After eating at several other buffets around america, I would much rather eat at hometown buffet which is like eating burgers at McDonalds instead of In n Out burger. I am not trying to be mean but I feel that establishments like the MORE buffet take advantage of tourists. For the price and experience, does the luxor really consider this an example of american cuisine? The food should reflect the price and unfortunately, the food reflects low grade products. I did enjoy the ham but could not give you another example of things I enjoyed. The rolls were dry, the salad bar looked like wilted vegetables, the mexican food looked like a love child between taco bell and del taco. My wife tried the shrimp and she said it was gross. My response, be careful eating seafood at buffets like this. The ratings by other yelpers explain it all. Do not, I repeat, do not eat here unless you are okay with less than mediocre food. If you have a coupon...well...go for it. This is definitely more like a $15 buffet instead of the $25 asking price. I am an Mlife member and will stay clear of this place. Hey Luxor, look at the ratings and make some changes.

_jeIESlNcwjRWNLCYfse9A.text: Overpriced food that was only a step above something like a Golden Corral. Actually, I would prefer to eat at Golden Corral considering, quality and price.   We went to the dinner buffet prior to seeing Chris Angel's show Believe. It was something like $20 per person and the food was just ok. The show was just ok on that note! :) Not worth $20 at all. They have the expected and much anticipated by most snow crab legs but they were salty and about as good as your local Chinese buffet. The steamed shrimp was the highlight of my meal anyway. That was good. There was a good selection of food but the quality wasn't that good. The recipes were average, nothing special. I won't be back the next time I am in Vegas.  Definitely worth an extra $5 per person to eat at a buffet like the Bellagio. Very worth the extra cash.

DPuDtYxesahCvaeVul63Tg.text: Tried lunch and dinner, June 2013  The salad bar is good, but everything else....well you gotta be one of those people that pretty much likes all food.  It was very cold inside to where by the time we got back to our table our food was cold.   I doubt I would go back.

WKwqZCIDLPxD4JlR7v6fhA.text: I had asked local people in Vegas on where they would go for buffet, they said Luxor's More Buffet, from that we opted for the lunch and dinner buffet and what a surprise that both sessions had the same entrees with an addition of cocktail shrimp for the dinner session.   The food itself was mediocre and tasteless. The service was great and  they removed the dirty plates and filled our drinks fast. Luxor needs to do a cosmetic upgrade, the dining area looks dingy and dated.   I guess I should have known that local people have less standards in food than tourists. Next time I will ask the tourists what buffets they like. Lesson learned.

tQKXkBA6Yrv4E5-qAfBcbg.text: It was perfect for brunch! (and we did the champagne brunch which was an awesome way to start the day off) There were a TON of selections. While buffet food is not always my thing because it is never really the most fresh--It was good and since there was so many different things to try, all of the picky eaters I was with were able to satisfy themselves!  As with the rest of our Lux experience the service was really excellent. Very attentive and polite! right now they have deals that you can eat all day at both lux and excalibur for pretty cheap--worth checking out if you are hanging out at those hotels!

YhYiT7dXFuCJ4qw4nrBgpQ.text: We received two free buffets with our hotel stay, so we decided to give it a try.  The buffet is ok and about standard for what you would expect from a casino buffet.  The wait was not long and we were seated in a relatively quiet area.  The mimosas were nice and there were a decent amount of options.

XDNSOKgNjT4awunZcLV2uw.text: Arrived about 2:30 for the lunch buffet and enjoyed a good variety of food. We paced ourselves and stayed a while. Good conversations with a couple of staff members. That was my last meal of the day! Reasonable price and offered a military discount.

dH7bgvJcgKAote9nlaeK4g.text: [REVIEW FOR SUNDAY BRUNCH ONLY]  Positives + Plenty of Tables + MLife Line Access + All you can drink Mimosas included in price. + Price ($50 for 2 people)  Negatives - Food Quality - Drink Quality - Cleanliness - Variations  Overall not a great experience from the Buffet. You definitely get what you pay for. The major problem for this buffet is the variety and quality. There are out 15 selections of warm items to choose from. 3 of those are pizza. There are CARBS everywhere. No meat selections other than the carving station.  They do have an omelette station if you so desire to wait 15 minutes to get yours.  The carving station meat is tough and chewy and by the time you reach the table the meat is cold.  Besides the food complaint, the cups and plates were not cleaned properly. You can still see dirt spots and watermarks on the silverware and plates. NOT the MGM Resort standard  My Recommendations *Go to Another Buffet *Don't go to Brunch

7qGJrR0fpf46gaz1j7WKhw.text: The previous night we had a negative experience at the buffet at the Bellagio (which was very pricy and didn't have many options for gf or vegetarians).  But when we went the the buffet at the Luxor just scoping it out to see if they have more options regarding food allergies and restrictions. I asked a chef behind the counter about gf options and he told me to wait a moment as he gets the chef. A few minutes later this awesome man walked my family and I through the whole buffet telling us stories and showing us all that we could eat. He was very knowledgeable and helpful. We ended up eating there that night. Their gf/vegan cake desserts were splendid!!

r58eQduYDQFiPRAaUXkfkQ.text: We went to the brunch $25 pp, w/10% military discount. We could have choice the all day with was $45 pp but opted out. The breakfast portion was pretty good. Did not see an alternatives for non pork eaters but the Cheg was kind enough to slice a piece of roasted turkey from the kitchen for my daughter.  The sushi tasted fine but the shrimp were quite pitiful. The desserts were okay, didn't case much for the sugar free cookies.  If I had to choose a dessert, it would be the Cheese cake.

5MLzEh7-kilab07zFpq-gQ.text: 2.5 stars because the food is below average, but the servers are usually very nice and helpful.  Another somewhat hidden underground buffet this one can get busy, but it's nothing special. I can't think of one item that is memorable so you might as well eat until your heart is content then use the restrooms located nearby.   I think most people redeem their MyVegas rewards here because unless you have a special affinity for this place it's a bit below average in terms of food quality.   The fact this buffet (like Excalibur) is self serve drinks means the servers are just taking your dirty plates between trips. If they don't attempt to communicate with you I don't see the need to leave a tip.   We did, but I'm just saying...

mjtgqvPB2BzUKsHajddc9Q.text: I just stayed at the Luxor and they offered me two free buffets.... definitely not even worth the free. Their selection is not very big, you are very limited and the little they do have is not good. I'm giving this to stars because of the dessert, those were pretty tasty and the customer service was great! Other than that, this is a place I will not return to again, not even if it's free.

-4ASXd-fcFai7ZNWL0F6OA.text: Had been here before and wasn't impressed thought we would try it again and now I can say I like this buffet. We will be back

6fDEO4iTkubwCbg43gvoYg.text: Came here in July for my brother's birthday.  My brother was staying at the Luxor hotel while I was staying at another hotel near circus circus. We couldn't decide where to eat that night and my toddler and his gf were getting hangry.  We thought it would be quicker and easier if my family got in the car and drove to the Luxor to try The Buffet.    I don't remember the price but I think we paid around $140 for 5 adults and my kid was free.  After we paid, we had to wait to be seated. There was a family of 4 before us waiting to be seated as well.  Both parties had moved a little pass the register so that the people behind us could pay. Out of nowhere comes this lady who for the purpose of this story, will call Brenda.  Brenda goes to the line divider and pulls out the retractable belt and tells the family before us that they cannot go pass the line and tries to push them back.  The family tells Brenda that there isn't any room and that they paid but Brenda kept insisting that they go behind the line.  We try to make as much room for them but there is already people behind us.    The family before us gets seated and then it's our turn.  A lady who I'll call Nancy tell us to follow her then who I believe is the Manager tells Nancy that chairs cannot be placed on the side of booth and cannot block any walkways.  She tells us to following her but she we can tell she doesn't have a table for us as she looks lost.  She decides to have us wait in the middle of the place while she finds us a table.  She comes back and out of nowhere, Brenda comes too.  Both ladies are telling us they found us a table and to follow them and both start walking in opposite directions.  We all just stand there and ask who do we follow.  Nancy tell us to follow her so we do.  She leads us to a table that looks like a table for 2 but has 4 chairs around it.  I look at Nancy and I said we don't fit here.  She tells me that she cannot put a highchair at the end of a booth because she cannot block the walkway.  I told her I understand that but we are still a party of 5 adults without my child and how did she expect 5 adults to fit on that table.  She repeats that same thing and I again repeat the same thing.    Again, out of nowhere, here comes Brenda.  I ask her if she could show us the table that she found.  Turns out it a booth that can fit all 6 of us and did not require a chair to block the walkway.    The food was just ok.  They did not have much selections.  The place looked huge so I thought there was going to be lots of variety but there was not much.  They had about three bread stations. Typically, the Asian section has some sort of noodles, there wasn't any.  Typically, the Italian section has spaghetti noodles, there wasn't any of that either.  Each station had about three or four things.    We didn't eat much off our plate and again, out of nowhere, here comes Brenda taking away out plates.  I guess Brenda not only does security, a hostess, and the person that seats people, but is also the busgirl.  She notices that we are not eating much so she asked us why and about the food which i guess now makes her customer or guest services LOL.  Well she insists that we speak to the chef which we do.    I still gave it three stars because I am giving this place a review based on similar buffets with similar prices.  If I was going to pay $60/person and got the same food, then I would have gave one star.  I couldn't get mad at it.  I mean you get what you pay for, right?

07AUbyh7BceVTGC0DL0qEQ.text: My friend and I grabbed a quick dinner here, okay mostly because we had two free buffet vouchers. We weren't expecting much and it delivered on not being much. Selection. Food quality. All bad. Eek. Too pricey for what is offered. Spend the extra $5 and got to the Bellagio.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only edible items.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. We aren&#39;t sure. We think it was beef.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The only edible items.

D_Yp17BCHA9iutCClo9G5A.text: It's ok didn't have many options to choose from and the food options and taste were very basic. Don't waste your time coming to the buffet explore better options.

Kjgq1pjAcIisP4ajpz5lCw.text: When you go to Vegas and think about hitting up a buffet somewhere, you'll have a LOT of options. The Luxor happened to be the closest to us and so we tried. The ratings weren't all that great for it but we wanted to try it anyways. We came on a sunday and waited about 30min to be seated. At $20/person, I definitely got my money's worth. That's about it.  Nothing at the buffet really wow'd me. I tried all of the food options but the Mexican bar (it didn't look very appealing). I would have loved to see a bigger selection of asian food. All they had was fried rice, lo mein, and spring rolls. Pretty terrible selection.  Service was good. That's where most of the stars from this rating go towards. I won't be back. There are a lot of options in Vegas and this one didn't hit the mark.

AsR_O1hMEg1BPMa454fA6Q.text: Unfortunately, I gave this place a second chance. It's still a carb fest without any flavor.  And even the simplest things are overlooked. They offer a basket of corn chips and a tray of warm nacho cheese whiz... but there isn't a sliced jalapeno in the house!  The meats were dry, the seafood was very low quality, but the desert section was decent.  Still, I'd rather eat at a Golden Coral.

ybwdqeKv66QoSQ-U7biLVA.text: Decent buffet for a cheap price. We were tired upon arrival and stopped at the first food place we saw for lunch. Surprised by the large selection of food. Bottomless beverages cannot be shared with your partner.

-uJ0eNnDHZ5cNTKsYI1NiA.text: I'm gonna throw this happy two starts because bless the chefs and bless almost everyone else that worked in the buffet. But what can take away from an entire good experience you ask, one very aweful bartender. On the first day I came to the buffet and was provided the most excellent service by jet the bartender so good that it made me want to come back the next day. I wish I didn't! PENNY the bartender provided the worst service I've ever had not a smile to be found and an attitude every time we approached the bar. I'm sorry it's so hard to poor an already mixed mimosa out of an already mixed container and to ice the cake she cut me off after two mimosas... literally mimosas champagne and orange juice not strong enough to get a insect drunk lol And her reasoning behind cutting me off was because I mentioned how she could act like she cared even if she was having a bad day.  So yes the buffet in it's self all good but Penny should be canned I'd hate for her to ruin anyone else's $27 buffet.

37phPrRNDrGkIhXrei43LA.text: Buffets. They are the complete staple of what indulgent Vegas is. Buffets for me are a different beast. They satisfy literally every craving I have. I'm one of those people. You know the one, or know of a one. We're the ones that want to stop at every fast food joint so we can satisfy every sick craving. We're the ones that want a taco from Del taco, chicken nuggets from McDonalds, French fries from Wendy's, a cheeseburger from in n out, & to top of it, orange chicken from Panda Express. Yeah I'm that pain.  So for me, buffets are a complete necessity. I ended up doing the buffet on the Luxor since I had some myVEGAS points to spare. If I didn't end up having this buffet for free, the brunch price was a low price of $20.99. Seeing that and the reviews, I didn't have much hope for this place.  It's located underneath the casino, you travel down a too long corridor and a too long stairway entrance. You'll be greeted with your typical Vegas hospitality and be sat by an usher.   For this first place, I chose to go to the carving station. ( I couldn't believe they had this during a brunch. ) I opted for a slice of ham then continued to pile my plate with a dumpling ( didn't think they could mess this up ), some sauteed Chinese broccoli, and some bacon. Most of the things were pretty edible and surprisingly delicious. For example the ham & the sauteed Chinese broccoli had great flavor and seasoning. The other two, gross, gross, gross, did I mention gross?   The salad portion is your standard run of the mill with lettuce pieces that looked wilty and we're starting to brown.   The Mexican station, I did avoid completely. It looked like it would cause stomach problems and I was not willing to sacrifice my body for what would be a 30 seconds of tasty pleasure.   Surprisingly enough, their version of the California roll was edible and quite delicious. I went back for seconds. The second best thing? Their clam chowder. The pieces of clam were huge and the soup was consistently creamy; coating your tongue in every great way possible.  The only perk aside from the fact that I didn't have to pay for this ? The complimentary all you can drink mimosas. They came in deliciously handy in quenching my thirst.   Overall? This buffet doesn't claim to be the best. However, for the price, things are not bad and you'll be pleasantly surprised by the things that are great.

_5WJpU55lrqsvYd-jAzwsw.text: Everything was just absolutely donkey shit! All that tuition towards Le Cordon Bleu for absolute turd chefs and food. Look at this raw shit on my plate wtf! And the chefs giving a show of their experience lol can't cut shite!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nVfmuvSBicX2iEwLjCT0bg.text: Not bad. Everything was cooked properly. There was a great selection. The only complaint would be the desserts. There was no lava cakes like the advertising said there would be. Maybe the little brownie bites were suppose to be it. I don't know. I wish my Vegas app worked for the 2 for 1 pass. That option was gone when we went, but mysteriously was back up after we left Vegas.. hmmmmm.....

TuPUCTKcGVWxDFQvf7awTg.text: So the food not great but equivalent to most buffets of this sort. The staff, however, was amazing. I mentioned it was my husbands birthday so they came over with desserts and a candle and sang happy birthday and on our way out we got a hug!  Really sweet and we will remember that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Happy birthday cheesecake.

MXEbEz4IS-W8MZur7enxPQ.text: The buffet was absolutely terrible, I was charged $24.99 plus at the time you pay they ask for a tip even before you eat. Then I got an omelette were the put way to much spinach felt like I was eating a salad and the chef had a tip cup as well, then you felt obligated to pay the bus boy and hostess. The food was cold and I was the third customer in line. The hotel gave me a room on the 18th floor where the air conditioning barely was working so I called the front desk so they moved me to the 5th floor it felt like a  punishment for complaining. Your view was of the roof top and the view as you walk out the door you look at a maintenance ladder which looks like it's been there for 20 years due to the all the dust all over the area. The chairs at the bar were cracking and sagged in the middle. As I sat there play the 25 cent machine I had 3 7and 7  that were watered down and the bartenders keep looking at the jar for the tips another situation were they made you feel bad and I spent $80 for nothing and I tipped 20%.
