XaTC5XXwHKw5uFON59BIDQ.text: The food was either  over salted or bland. Won't be coming back here to eat. Staff was friendly and the place was clean. The layout of the floor wasn't the best and the food sign placement wasn't the best either. For the price of the buffet, rather have spent that money towards a slot machine.

ytPH6E4bjycO4wZnqOz-kw.text: Pretty good buffet with good atmosphere.  Self serve drinks and plenty of choices to choose from.  I'd recommend and I will return!!

O7qwKmJcS5xj9Lu6HdgwuQ.text: Not much choices of food here for the price we paid. Thought Go buffet for the snow crab leg but end up didn't have any. For the price we paid we can go better buffet

o9vvR8z8GIIVDD_pRXNTbg.text: Very good buffet, friendly staff, clean, food was fresh and overall very reasonably priced.  I have been for breakfast and lunch a few times.

iPNRbH1G-HmVWSzFrbXqUQ.text: I don't see how anyone could possibly think this Buffett is good. There is little variety, the food is mostly tasteless and undercooked. Really bad for $25.

hfJpL9xxqmUGcqEbuVaDQA.text: Dinner Mar 3    In my opinion Golden Corral is better, why because they have big yeast rolls & fried chicken - other than that - not much difference.  I hate to be so harsh, but I was starved after flying all day and really wanted a good solid meal.     Price wise the MORE Buffet is much better value than paying $23 at the Johnny Rockets for a burger, fries & shake..So if you are looking for mass consumption at a low price - this is your buffet.  But if you are looking for anything of substance and great quality go to the Rio Buffet.

9zXbLYhzfS-8nGVzDjNy9Q.text: When I visited Las Vegas recently in April we ate at this buffet because we stayed at the Luxor and wanted to get food before a long day. Little did I know I was going to not only enjoy the food but love the design and decoration of the buffet. Me and my girlfriend felt like we had the total pyramid experience when we ate here. The food quality is like any other buffet nothing amazing same thing all the other buffets have. We went for brunch timing and got a little bit of everything. I do like the fact you can pour your own drink I hate waiting for refills. If you stay at the Luxor I advice you to eat here to get the full pyramid experience (and stay in a pyramid suite!!)

fYwYq189HQ1GK67cxHEPTw.text: Very delicious lunch buffet. Wide selection of foods including much better fried chicken than another buffet I reviewed. Delicious pastas and yummy desserts too. I would come back here for lunch and breakfast.

nI65gNPnrY9DnDwCF1FsAA.text: Disappointed. There's a lot of options but nothing catch my eyes at all unfortunately. Price is also really high.  Definitely recommend other buffets over this

MVu17IwnOisGfU2mmO99Qw.text: Breakfast buffet is meh, standard fruit, eggs, sausage, bacon. Omelette station was best part. There dessert station for breakfast was muffins. Got there at 10:30 so we stayed for the change over to lunch. Still lack luster, beef was tough, potstickers were cold. Desserts were ok. Only thing going for it was the price $20 bucks for a buffet.

5CxzomsfsYyqajy9dnVwtQ.text: I guess I'm just not geared toward the buffet experience. I always find about 80% of the food to be bland, and uninventive. It's so mass-produced that it's just not going to amaze. And because so many tourists are from so many places, they play it VERY safe. Nothing is too spicy. Nothing is too flavorful. Nothing is too unique.  I always leave wishing I'd spent half the money on "one" regular meal elsewhere.  I mean, if buffets are your thing, this one is probably pretty middle-of-the-road. Good if you're staying in the Luxor and you're lazy. But I don't know that I'd make a special trip to go back. In fact, if we didn't have credits we had to use here, I don't think we'd have even bothered.

rLUJmWz3UdX-KH0LJlP0ag.text: Very good buffet.  Price is pretty reasonable also compared to others on the strip.  I would come again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

2gRUhNKiw2yBBUquuTbeTw.text: Over the years, I've eaten at a lot of restaurants & buffets in Las Vegas. This is by far the best buffet I've been to. The food is great. The price is reasonable. I'm with a very large group & we all agree. Best buffet in LV.

zkZV_t45W_MLe9-UIK7KqQ.text: So my review of the More Buffet at Luxor was apparently posted under my old account and Luxor replied, back so I'm going to provide more detail for them.  I'm going to give them another star for replying.  My original review :  Pretty bland and unappealing weekend brunch buffet was included with our stay at the Luxor.    I'd say skip it    The folks at Luxor replied:  We are disheartened to learn your impressions of MORE the Buffet at Luxor, proved unsatisfying and unremarkable. We value your insights and hope your next visit to Las Vegas will include a meal at our establishment, so that we might change your opinions and provide you with a more enjoyable experience.  Sincerely,  Seth L.  Guest Relations Specialist Luxor Hotel & Casino MGM Resorts International  ***************  Seth,  Thank you very much for responding.  While my wife and I overall enjoyed our stay at Luxor we did find the More Weekend Brunch disappointing.    First of all the coffee was horrible.  The tiny selection of sushi that was out tasted like cardboard, the shrimp were water logged. They also had mussels and crawfish out.  Both were not good.  I would say you need to put some effort into the seafood or skip it all together.  The fresh fruit selection needs to be fresh and ripe.  For fresh fruit they had cantaloupe and honeydew sliced up.  It wasn't ripe and flavorful.  It was crunchy and tasteless.  How about some blueberries, strawberries, mango, watermelon, etc?      We had a much better breakfast the next morning at the Pyramid Cafe upstairs.

1wtxPFZ10i3mZtHtvJj7RA.text: Saturday. 1/9/16. Because one buffet for brunch wasn't enough for gluttons in Vegas.  (To be fair we had spent 5+ hours walking the Strip, playing tourists with friends and kids.) We couldn't decide on dinner so we ended up here around 9:40 p.m. We had to clear out by 10:20 p.m.   Food = good.  Some items were hit or miss. They have an Asian bar, Latin bar, American bar, Italian bar, cold salad bar with fruit, snow crab legs, crawfish and shrimp, and a dessert bar.  Chinese was a greasy mess, but the Latin and salad bars were my favorite. Highlights: pork ragu, chili con carne, sweet corn medley, great salad bar choices.   Dessert = good. I tried their tiramisu, panna cotta, cannoli, eclairs and soft serve. Tiramisu and cannoli were great.  Eclairs were good, without the super sweet chocolate icing, and the custard inside was to die for.  Wish I could've had more room for dessert but it'd been a long day of eating.   Service = get your own drinks, too.  But we had a nice server nearby to bus the tables.  And turns out he's from the same little AL town as my Southern man.  Small world, ain't it?!   Pricing =  $23.99/pp  The convenience and the chance meeting made it worth a trip for us.  Food was okay.

llMMheCE3rpXQAN-psgSUw.text: Wow....this buffet is horrible. It is not worth the price at all. The Egyptian theme is nice and it is very spacious but that is the only thing worth noting here. The ONLY reason I gave this buffet one star is because of the omelette station. They have a station to create your own omelette...which was pretty good. Everything else was not good at all. They do not have a large selection. The fruit was warm (no watermelon or strawberries?!) the silverware was dirty and the server was very standoff is and had to be called multiple times for assistance. Please...go elsewhere for your meals! There are plenty of great buffets in Vegas. It's worth the extra penny!

Wu3e_5ewUVrPdt25Vq60vQ.text: This place was great!! All kinds of food. Service was pretty quick and I was able to eat lots of my favorite chocolate cream pie!! Highly recommend. This place made my stay here that much better.

M8eNYE_PKzwqe1DRgOeNnQ.text: Used a BOGO i got my MyVegas rewards.. the food was actually pretty good. I loved the Crab Legs! We went on a Sunday Evening around 7pm, we had to wait about 15-20 minutes.. mostly because they only had one cashier.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Carving station... love that bone sticking out lol
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. American, Asian, Italian, and some crab legs. Drinks are self serve.. which is amazing!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The deco and atmosphere was great!

Rp_vI50FKYOYA_aZeWCwwA.text: I've stayed at several hotels in Vegas and always enjoy trying their buffet for at least one meal. BIG mistake at the Luxor! I was overly impressed with everything about our 4-night stay at the facility, and sadly the lasting impression will be this terrible buffet we tried before heading to the airport.  Where do I start. Reasonably priced for a "good" buffet, but I wouldn't classify this as such. Let's go left to right. Breakfast items; no sausage left and the scrambled eggs were runny. Cold, soggy French toast and minimal syrup. Bacon was nicely cooked, and plentiful. Italian station, bland meatballs and sauce. Asian station, cold bone in teriyaki chicken and bland rice and over cooked book choy. No sushi to be found. Mexican station, cold tacitos, bland rice and cold posole!  Again - don't make this your last memory of your stay at the Luxor!

Td-L2qmvQQkB8UIzlKwGmg.text: Ehhh if your staying at the Luxor and can't be bothered to leave it's ok. It's not that expensive $22 weekend brunch with all you can drink mimosa's. It would be nice if they had more seafood options to choose from. Friendly staff, clean restaurant. Kind of a pain to get to...

uGloNL1MIkc323luNI-nDg.text: $37 and some change for Champaign Bruch and dinner! Not bad! The selection was great- but expected more! They have an Italian, Asian, Soul food section. Desert- and salad bar! The food was very good and fresh tasting!

v9eftu7wBDLT99Em4yWqcA.text: I'm not really into buffets, but this place ain't half bad. I've been here for both breakfast and dinner (not in the same day...I'm not THAT gluttonous).  It looks like an archaelogical dig, but it's got food!  Don't go here expecting 5-star quality food. I'm giving 4 stars for the really great, unpretenious servers, and the array of different foods.  Not too expensive, decent value

cWLzIturDYGDgmp-sci8Gg.text: I am still dreaming about the bacon from this buffet. It was so crispy and delicious. We did the $19.99 Champagne Brunch on a sunday morning around 11am. The place wasn't crowded at all which means we didnt have to navigate around too many people. You are seated with a waitress who brings you drinks so you don't have to worry about having someone guard your stuff. The mimosas were pretty nasty, but then again I hate champagne. It didnt help that they were using watered down OJ from concentrate. They had a great breakfast selection including the basics like bacon (omg), potatotoes, eggs benedict, sasage, scrambled eggs, smoked salmon, shrimp, waffles, crepes, etc. They also had a omelette bar where your own personalized omelette was cooked up right in front of you. I got ham and cheese, and it was goooood. The ham had really good flavor.  There was also a selection of cereal and granola which was nice.   In addition to brunch, there was also a selection of asian, tex mex, and american foods for lunch. All of which were mediocre. The desserts were TERRIBLE. They were all  single serving small and cute, but none of them had very much flavor. I shared a few with the boyfriend including chocolate mousse (the only relatively good one), tiramisu (ew), carrot cake (wtf), doughnut holes, and a pineapple tarte.  Overall I'd say it was just your average buffet food. I would reccomend the brunch after a night of drinking. It really hits the spot, but would probably avoid it for lunch and dinner.

JUZgQA7z1kOwCC0FJka07g.text: I'm actually glad that I didn't read other people's reviews before going here. I really enjoyed the champagne brunch. I thought that their food was very good. The sausage and bacon being above the bar from a lot of places that I have been. They have a lot to choose from and I tried to try it all, I thought it was pretty succesful. They have a decent sized dessert bar too. I will go again, when in town.

vsByuBNqN4o277_FGGmFqA.text: Went to their weekday dinner, very disappointed.  Food quality was poor, totally not worth $20. The shrimp tastes like buy one get one free on sale frozen shrimp in supermarket, some cold dishes were acceptable, fry stuff were not tasty at all, and sushi was average nothing special, no smoked salmon, crab, or any more special dishes. There are much more better choices in Vegas.   Also, they led us to a very small table when most of tables were still empty (we were two), which made me feel not well treated.  Bad experience, I won't go again.

X2l6-6qwJ5e392jxwHc7aQ.text: This is the worst buffet I've ever experienced in my life.   The frozen food section at Wal-Mart would have been better.  The selection was poor, the quality was terrible and there wasn't one good dessert offered.  Service was okay and fortunately we had a 2 for 1 coupon.   Anyway, I'll stick with Caesar's or Bellagio next time.

A-hdCqtoTQwsIOFQlQWnwg.text: Ate here during Thanksgiving a couple years back and paid the most money for the least value of any buffet I've been to in Las Vegas.  Food was poorly heated and the sliced roast definitely looked better at the buffet, then when it was sitting on my plate, turning my stomach with it's uneven cooking.  I don't know what happened to these guys since years ago they actuallyed seemed to know what they were doing, but we vowed it would be our last time to eat here.    Expensive too as buffets go (even during a Thanksgiving night).

UgHTWdAL9Y6GYMA6rHdPBg.text: Don't waste you time; this buffet is just bad. Low quality and nasty. Go to Bellagio or Paris and get a good buffet.

h2iImmfGSXaOJFZrJx2Bcg.text: Very similiar to a Fresh Choice but a little bit better. Not too much variety for a buffet. They let one of my friends in for free cause their credit card machine was down which was nice of the lady.

QSAMNJAY45AiIjYvYPxOHw.text: T. and I have eaten here a few times for dinner, brunch and breakfast.  I debated between 3 and 4 stars and decided to go with 3.  The food is good, but not great.  They have a good selection.  The wait staff is nice, they bring your drinks quickly and don't let them get empty.  They have a nice salad bar with lots of veggies and fruit.  The chocolate mousse is a must have.  I can't believe I forgot to get some Saturday night when we went there for dinner.  I think it's probably a good place for most kids.  Mine are real picky eaters, so they didn't find much that they liked.   Breakfast and brunch, there are several different preparations for eggs, scrambled(meh), scrambled with ham & cheese (good!), eggs benedict(T. said they were ok) and spanish omelets.  You can have champagne with brunch, it was pretty good.

cjU1BinEG1zUrp1vQaumVA.text: Loved it! More please indeed. One cannot go to Vegas without hitting up at least one buffet while there. My wife and I had heard bad things about our hotel's buffet (Excalibur), but wanted to try Luxor's buffet. It was great!!!! The prices were fair considering the quantity and quality of food at your fingertips. They had everything you could want: American, Italian, Asian, Mexican, Salads, Comfort, etc and an extensive drink and dessert area complete with FULL bar. Now I can just hear people complaining about the price... yes, if you get just one plate of food, it's not worth the $17 for lunch you would pay. That's why you go to a buffet when you are HUNGRY and can eat a couple plates over a decent length of time, dumbass! My favorites were the fried chicken, pizza, carnitas tacos, and the desserts were... to... die... for! I will for sure be returning to More, The Buffet at Luxor on my next trip to Vegas.

64Hrfcke9WC-TFhqqHYs6Q.text: The food was totally cool, but, like my boyfriend says, it was cafeteria food. We expected more from such a beautiful casino on the south strip. OK price ($14.99 / lunch) and pleasant atmosphere, but hot dogs floating in a pot of boiling water?.... dry chicken fried steak patties aching for some kind of country gravy?.... the smallest dessert bar I have ever seen at a Las Vegas casino buffet? My boyfriend doesn't ever want to go back, but I would. Together, he and I will go across the street to the MGM.

D4DtPxbxphw1oxKWl67A7A.text: Did I really pay $17.60 to eat at a "buffet" worse than my college dorm's offering circa 2005?

lWtsmiCzt79d1yFHZKG8pw.text: Its alright. Nothing substantial. If you love seafood, go somewhere else. This place doesn't have it unless you like fried shrimp or salmon. No crab or oysters. I ate here for dinner and champagne breakfast. Lots of your standard foods like mashed potatoes, rice, carving board meats. During breakfast I had less than a plate of food but I had 8 glasses of mimosas. They sucked, basically some unknown champagne and OJ with no real fruit but whatever. Me and a friend were there for like 2 hrs until the rest came down to eat.

SVTCHCB1za6MFEOHpfBiKg.text: I rather go to Old Country Buffet than More. Same quality but More charge a lot more.

hDwjoogvykAPUMRPU5RIMQ.text: Bottom of the barrel. I would not even eat here if the KGB escorted me here by gunpoint.

2hUf29IhC_VUDbfnzdJJ3A.text: Gross! Was worse than a Golden Corral. Thought I could at least eat salad, but they messed that up too.

aGrIVOcLRca0XUrAOk4UnQ.text: Uggg disgusting. Service was bad, food was bad and even the drinks were undrinkable. Go to the buffet at Paris. This place is dated and disgusting not to mention poor quality.

FVbbURP361PxPkHuJtucPw.text: i cant believe I never wrote about this place before... oh well, i went last week and the experience was the same as before.   "meh. i've experienced better."  no wonder they have the $30 eat all day package...i mean for $20 per meal, why wouldn't you get that? Because it might be suicide.  J/K, it's not that bad. Don't get me wrong, there is some variety here, and it looks pretty good to eat, but it doesn't taste that good.  The servers are nice though, so thank you for being nice and refilling our drinks a lot.  That is awesome.

DChwdqlOh1ja76g3PxNttQ.text: It's OK. You get what you pay for. We went Christmas day because it was the only Buffet we could find without a line. All the food was average except for the stuffing, how on earth do you mess up stuffing that bad? It tasted like cereal with gravy. It was not edible. I would think that's like a recipe 101. Personally I don't like Turkey without stuffing and the stuffing sucked so I didn't want any Turkey and I'm not a prime rib person so there was little main dishes left to eat. They had steak but I was told from others in my party it was cold and plain tasting.  However,  I should note that those in my party that do like prime rib thought that it was delicious.   It's kind of funny you get your own drinks, tea, coffee soda, and I think there is a bar if you want to order cash drinks. We tipped the waiter when we paid at the front. I'm not sure what we were tipping him for, giving us straws maybe. They might as well have us clear our own plates and put them somewhere and they will not need waiters, the prices will be even cheaper and it will be a full on cafeteria. It pretty much is anyways. Nothing wrong with the food, but nothing great about  it either. Except for that stuffing Christmas day!!!!!

iFSjXsnc3jTUJoYD6MIUlA.text: The decor is a big part of the experience.  The colors are gray, white, going to light green.  I think the decor is bland and nauseating. Food is really not tasty, overcooked.  Nothing taste good.  Salty foods are too salty.  Sweet foods are too sweet.  Not a lot of fruit or veggies.  No seafood at all.  But I went at lunchtime.  I hope Luxor changes the color and lighting.  I hope they hire a good cook.  I hope food has a good turnover.  And I hope they change the price.  Eating elsewhere is definitely more preferable.

-fN9NyKmNKGsHhIK7TarqQ.text: I have to be honest, this place has a lot of bad reviews, but I didn't experience a horrendous experience. I do have to admit that my friends and I were at a large pool party drinking non-stop from 1 until about 6 when we stumbled downstairs into this buffet and paid about $30 including tax and tip each. My meal actually cost an extra $300 because I left my beloved Carrera's on the table and they were snatched within 5 minutes.  I remember the food being averagely satisfying and I was constantly making trips for California Rolls. Again, remember I had been drinking all day, so most food tastes like heaven when you're hungry.  A friend and I were discussing buffet's while we were in Vegas this weekend and it has been 5 months since my first and last visit, so was surprised by the reviews.  We will be trying something different tonight, possibly Aria or CircusCircus if we go budget.

GnSq5_m0Q4e269l_XaScBA.text: This is a $25 buffet with the lowest quality food I have ever seen. Take the worst cafeteria food, let it sit out and get crusty, and then pay $25.

DlQRmhFqfR2NnN1BdTqeFg.text: Food was good. It could be better. Just some of the steak was dry. Corn on the cob over cooked. Just a few minor stuff. Need new flooring.

wIJiXC5i7DouLMxXuNZk0A.text: We have lived in Las Vegas for 24+ years and have been to many buffet's, but none worse than MORE the Buffet at Luxor!!!  The cashier was fast and pleasant and that was the only good thing about it.  The person who seated us didn't say a word and waddled us slowly to our table.  The salad bar was not replenished and you had to dig to the bottom of each container to get anything out of it.  The food stations all served what seemed like food out of a box, nothing good at all!  This is the only buffet that they don't bring drinks to you, you have to get those yourself here.  And the desserts were all like rubber, ick!!  We had about $35 per person for this garbage!  Whomever runs this buffet needs to take a serious look at this!!  Very disappointed and don't recommend at all.

PcfkPICAANru2ms2XfrCAQ.text: We came to this place on our first night in Vegas. Originally we were supposed to hit up the seafood buffet at the Rio, but we ended up going to this buffet that night. In all honesty, I was craving McDonald's that night lol, but the hubby said I was crazy and talked me into trying the buffet. I'm not much of a fan of buffets just because I don't know how long the food has been sitting out for, if its at the right temperature, especially because I've seen people stick their bare hand in the food versus using the tongs or serving spoons. We paid $50 for the both of us and I was like ok... lets see what this place has to offer.   I browsed around just to see if anything looked appetizing. My first round, I got a slice of pizza, a piece of white lasagna and a slice of some sort of roast beef. It was all GROSS!!! The pizza was so dry and cold that I didn't even swallow it, the actual pasta in the lasagna wasn't cooked all the way and was still hard and the roast beef was dry and disgusting!!   Then I decided to try the crab legs (since they're my fav!!). I was sad to see they were cut in half and looked pretty crappy. I tried them anyway and was totally disappointed. I ended up saying screw it, time for dessert. I got a slice of cheese cake and some frozen yogurt with fruit. GROSS GROSS GROSS!!!!!   It was a shame we had to pay so much for such crappy food. Hometown Buffet is better (and I hate HTB) I mean we did go kind of late so I don't know if the food was the last batch of the day and we just happened to get the left overs or if its just bad food period. You would think the hostess would at least say its close to closing time and they're not going to be bringing out fresh food before going in. But I guess when you're desperate for business, you forget about being courteous to your customers. As we left, I tell my Hubs, "I told you we should've gone to McDonalds...."  Always read reviews before trying a new place and wasting your money folks!!!

9U4rAYdM_mbWKSNhQUec8w.text: Worst buffet ever! OMG.  We had a big group of 25 people eating there.   Big mistake!! Food were microwaved or refried.  I  would not pay$40 to eat there.  Period!!!

Au4-Awoku3dFQmQDVIctHg.text: Food bland and cold.  Pastries and breads were tough....as if they were stale.  Limited items, not much to pick from.  Buffet design stations are apart from each other, confusing.  VEry disappointing for the price.  I didn't enjoy my breakfast buffet....left hungry and irritated.  The ambience is also a bit trashy, not what I expected from the Luxor.  This place is so underwhelming, boring, and just about useless....NEVER EVER going back to More Buffet at Luxor.  If I could give it ZERO STARS I WOULD!!!  Please be warned, not worth your visit while in VEGAS, so many other better locations!

EmjEZMsIyrD-gGek1f6CWA.text: My boyfriend and I ate here on Thursday around 4pm. No line. Got in right away. Drinks included in meal. $18 per person.   Dining area is nice and spacious. Clean and open. Food....not so great. There wasn't much variety. Asian area had fried rice, white rice, veggie egg rolls, dumplings, and chewy gross Korean bbq meat. The spaghetti sauce had no flavor. Meats were so little. Sushi selection was ok, small. Mexican had no cheese sauce, just grated cheese. Taco meat looked dry.  Pizza crust was not fresh. Desserts selection was ok. Not impressive.   I would not come here again, nor would I recommend it to anyone else. Space and environment is fine.. it's the food that is plain. Nothing left to be desired.

aTplLFEjYUbpQTd32yGtug.text: Fresh hot food, a good variety of drinks, dinner, and dessert. This place is big and clean, quick cleaning plates off the table.very full, and satisfied leaving

7PhD_I2BBDBxt0RlWvO8Og.text: For breakfast, nothing exceptional, but everything OK. The place was clean and employees helpful and friendly. There was a decent selection of breakfast meats, eggs, grits, breads and pastries, cereals, fruits, etc. The coffee was good. A chef was available if you wanted a specialty omlette. All you can eat breakfast was $17.99.

Kp7FNoEVLarMWQr9-2MNsw.text: This is NOT food.  I'm vegan, so this place had scant options.  I ate hummus the three times we went; breakfast, lunch and dinner.  Even it was lumpy.  What little else I could eat consisted primarily of various low-quality salads, including some spinach I had seen at breakfast and finally lacked an alternative and had to eat at dinner.    My friend and I literally farted our way around the Luxor for that day and the next.  If your strategy at slots is to move between machines with great regularity, you'll find the fuel at More Buffet to amply supply you with enough Methane to force your hand.    I'm pretty sure that I smelled the emanations of a few fellow gamblers who had gone, the results are rather unmistakeable.  So go to More Buffet.  Then have a tee-shirt made: I was poisoned at More Buffet and all I got was this lousy tee-shirt.  Or join the team and chant a new mantra with me: "No way More Buffet!  You're not gunna make me fart today!"  Oye Ve!

5jF2Q0SEWB6R4kfdCfMyAA.text: Went here for breakfast, lunch and dinner (bought an all day buffet pass). It's a decent buffet with lots of choices. For breakfast, there's an omelet station and lots of pastry choices. For dinner, there's shrimp cocktail, muscles, snow crab legs and stone crab claws. A great value! Definitely worth a visit.

slfIiiv8HTK5J8w_WWThvA.text: people are just snobs and expect caesars food at luxor prices. The dinner has improved 90% from 2013 when the food was not edible. I went in feburary for lunch and had a great experience. Now for dinner it was same experience. Endless amounts of food and all great. Food was fresh hot and tasty. As always the deserts are still the best in town. My friend said her coffee was the best she had in a vegas buffet. many choices for the soft serve drinks. the bar prices are reasonable too. our meals were free but if paying the prices are the cheapest on the strip.  Two thumbs up for bringing back a great dinner buffet as well as the lunch.

hddKYOmO3hoRt-3Y5vna8Q.text: Would you like some coffee with your meal? Orange juice? Hot chocolate? Soft drinks? You need to go get it yourself wayyyyyy overrrrrrrr thereeee. Keep going, you'll see the sign. Drinks are self-serve city here. No problem. I'll tip myself and use it in the slots. At least they still clear your plates.  I went here for breakfast. They have all the generic breakfast choices and I mean generic. I have all this stuff inside my freezer at home. I didn't expect Bellagio but I did expect more than Dennys. They ran out of bacon. Even the bar was closed. It was 10.30AM. It's Vegas. I want my beer. Don't hate.

OYputmqYDMLmGejjrXIm7w.text: Just very low quality breakfast foods. For the price I'd recommend going to a nice restaurant and ordering a meal.

sQw20Ib1zgzrgT6D2EWiYw.text: This shit is goooood they have a lot of different types of fresh food, a bar, and desserts like creme brulee it's only about $20 per person

Di9MfxpubYXerIBmwpI08w.text: I have been coming to the buffet at the Luxor for many years now, and my expectations have been consistently met.  It is affordable, but the selection is not as varied as you will find at other Vegas buffets.  The staff is friendly, the decor is cool, and the food stations are clean and organized.  Nice to see they still have some salad options, it seems the trend in Vegas buffets is to eliminate the salad options.

A026tYTlnS1VB4B-mhfpGA.text: We enjoyed the all day pass for both Luxor and Excalibur buffets and both were excellent. We do like the lunch options at More than at the Excalibur. Wish we could have made it to More for dinner.

vF3QKKaPgCh8TtDmrsM8CA.text: It was convenient as I stayed at the hotel, and opted for the all day pass since we decided for a pool day.. food is mediocre, but had more options than the buffet at Excalibur (all day pass gets you in to their buffet as well). The day I got it, unlimited drinks were included, so that was nice. All in all, it was just okay.

kV6yqpqtfOojFfdwAkl0jA.text: No, it's not MGM or Mandalay Bay. It is a good buffet for the money. The lunch buffet had a lot of good options. They have Middle Eastern, Asian, Mexican, Italian and American standards. For $35 you can get three buffets in a day. I wouldn't suggest it, but you could!

raRANxVkhPqvaus-5jnJ6A.text: I'm talking about B R U N C H !!!!!  I'm giving this 4 Stars to bring up the average and I think everyone here is pretty harsh about the MORE Buffet, three things: 1) Its ONLY $17!   2) Its unlimited champagne and mimosas! 3) Its unlimited champagne and mimosas!  Yes, you're gonna hear about the Wynn or the Bellagio being so much fricken better blah blah blah, but you're also gonna pay more than twice as much!  Sure a BMW M3 is better than my Ford Mustang and maybe my wife's ass isn't as small and tight as Jessica Alba's(before her kid) or Angelina Jolie's(before her 12 kids), but thats just life and you enjoy what you have and can afford.    If you're objective is eat enough decent food for to last till dinner time, get drunk off your ass, and then head down to the nice pool area and bask in the sun and look at beautiful people(and some realy ugly ones) for the rest of the afternoon, then the MORE Buffet is your starting place.  Caesars has a nicer brunch for $33, but I was too hungover and quesy(AVOID the $1 Margaritas at Bills Gamblin Hall & Casino) to enjoy any mimosas or champagne.  Paris's Brunch is also really good for just under $30.  Good Bang for the Buck! :)

836-umI6bxwzo176uNZBpQ.text: Easily the best value for money meal on the Vegas strip. Very good seafood selections and friendly staff.

XF5rSgaIgA66RsqjnK91cw.text: Had dinner here about 9:30 pm.  Place was not very busy.  Good selection of salads and entree items.  Most food was not hot, but barely lukewarm.  When I first went to carving station, no one was there to carve.  Waited 2 or 3 minutes,  then left to eat at table.  Went back later and tried roast beef and ham.  Beef had good flavor but not hot.  Ham not even lukewarm.  Chicken and tilapia had good flavor but not hot enough.  May try Mandalay Bay buffet next time.

tIbpAO8SRq0UxZp7Zw-2MQ.text: Just sat down and had my first plate.  The food is awesome. Sadly we missed breakfast but who can complain when their turkey is so juicy and delicious.  Can you cater.   Just kidding but in all honesty. Thr staff is friendly and thr food great. And for the price.  Its worth it.

XnYyMKrXqRgw_pB029qUyw.text: Reasonably priced (for the strip, I guess) cafeteria food.  Even the salad bar was lame.  Don't bother, the Mirage and cravings isn't that far off and is way better.

X4nqDeiKWtsILEigPt5S5A.text: Okay, first of all. If you are going to charge that much money, you better try a little bit harder to make the food taste good. Almost $20 per person!!! They take advantage of the fact that they are on the strip and just charge extra for it. Maybe if they made better food it wouldn't be much a big deal for $20. The food was so bad that we were still hungry after we left because we couldn't finish it. Save yourselves the trouble (and money) and go somewhere else.

lYf648nlaJmReQxD8qdugw.text: Literally the worst buffet I have ever been to. Went there for dinner the other night and everything was just terrible. Half the food was cold and the whole place smelled like old fish. Couldn't even finish one plate of food, ended up going to get pizza elsewhere. Avoid at all costs.

K1xhsnwmSlZL2QPz3ZnD-g.text: Had read so many of the poor reviews.  So I didn't really expect to like the buffet at all.  I came and used a 2 free buffet from My Vegas.  We got there right at the end of breakfast and from what I read in these reviews I may not have liked their breakfast.  What I saw as they were changing things out didn't do anything for me. (the breakfast food, not the lunch) But I didn't eat breakfast, I had the lunch menu and it was pretty good.  Nothing tasted odd of off.  Everything was tasty and yes I would even go back again.

EgRZqt7kgjGrIo3bM2cStw.text: Thank goodness that they have no limits on the amount of Ranch dressing you can use at this buffet. Mama always said that Ranch dressing makes anything taste good. Unfortunately, it only serves to bring the food at MORE up to palatable status. I have certain expectations of all buffet food... low expectations. So it's usually not difficult to exceed them. MORE was LESS than my lowest expectations.  I expected at least crab legs and prime rib. They had prime rib at a carving station, but no crab legs. Isn't there some Nevada law against buffets failing to have crab legs?   The food seemed like it had been sitting out longer than usual, although it was busy. I tried a small salad with Ranch dressing. The lettuce acted like it had been frozen at some point. The shrimp was a touch soggy, and the cocktail sauce tasted like it had been stretched with ketchup.   The turkey was ok, along with boiled potatoes, but the cranberry sauce was crunchy in places. The Ranch dressing helped with the turkey, but not the cranberry sauce.  I wanted to try the desserts and report on those, but we'd wasted 20 minutes in line waiting for a table. That pushed us almost late for the Criss Angel show, so I didn't have time for dessert. Plus, I didn't think Ranch dressing would be too good on a cheesecake.

X1TkzF4BHoCbll118NkNLg.text: I haven't previously reviewed this, however in years past I would have given this buffet a 2star rating. On our visit this past month we decided to give it another try (mostly out of convenience because we were hungry) and we were pleasantly surprised at the quality of food this time. It feels like it's gotten an upgrade and we left satisfied and feeling like it was worth what we paid. It's a large buffet as well, probably the largest one we've been to. Will come back again!

-95VRMdPY-MHlXI6HqIQnQ.text: Had two comps from MyVegas for lunch, and the food was pretty good.  Not gourmet by any standard, but filling, and didn't have to go to the bathroom afterwards, unlike previous years.  If you're really into buffets, and just want something no frills and just enough to tide you over until dinner, it'll do.  I just couldn't imagine paying $17 for lunch here.  The plus was the beverage selection and the desserts.

pWmorb3tWC5898XymVUNag.text: Variety is lacking. Many items are quite bland. And not the cleanest buffet either. Highlights include the SLIDERS w/CHS SAUCE yummy! The CHOCOLATE MOUSSE is a petite serving of chocolatey goodness. There is also a S'MORES dessert that is warm and delicious. Other than that, Mexican sta is sub par and Asian station is a travesty. Seems like the place skimps on pricier meat options. This place is not worth a dime unfortunately.

vKphWH3GGpkQESB-A83tVQ.text: The buffet was horrible the only good thing I had was a ham and cheese omelette and wheat toast. For the $22 dollars that they charge for their buffet they should have more of a selection. I tried the fried chicken, Italian sausage, tacos, strawberry cheesecake. And all of it was horrible need a new cook!!!

20Dr4je0wbgrm8Cue5ZrZA.text: A buffet is a buffet:  With that being said, people should not arrive at any buffet with high expectations and delusions of fancy dining.   What I enjoyed the most about this particular buffet was the vast array of options available. From American classics, to Indian dishes, there was something for every palate.The Italian food was not too great, however. The  tomato sauce used in the spaghetti and meatballs and lasagna dish was bland and watery. What I did enjoy was the dessert section! The cookies were moist and fresh-tasting, as were the little brownie bites.

Pk6zxs2WQHcxhSPC5Te3sA.text: Came here for breakfast this morning & it was pretty good for a breakfast buffet. Lots of choices! It was about $30 for my husband & I. Which is really cheap in my opinion since breakfast ranges around $30 elsewhere for two plates & two beverages & here it's obviously all you can eat. There is a chef that makes eggs/ omelets & eggs Benedict fresh for you! They have an extensive array of different items to choose from. French toast, pancakes, chorizo & eggs, breakfast burritos, ham, bacon, sausage, chicken fried steak, potatoes & a full breakfast fruit salad bar just to name a few!!! Beverage wise they had fresh hot coffee, OJ, chocolate milk, white milk, and more! The food was good, not spectacular (with the exception of the fresh omelets; those were so delicious) but it wasn't bad for the price! We left full & happy!

ogSLP4UKAt1thGd9kXaGLg.text: I have been here twice and I love it. They have a variety of food from Mexican to Chinese and they have a carving station. They also have a variety of salads and different kinds of meat and bread so you can make your own sandwich. The price is good and definitely worth it for a buffet.

cnsr4ytXFlp5F4LIfWJXIw.text: Only reason I gave this place one star is because it was free. The only thing worth eating was the deserts. All the food I tried was horrible.  Avoid unless they give you it for free.

4zIvW-p7jupPrRi3rdjTkg.text: This is a pretty lackluster buffet.  I remember it being good but that was probably over 10 years ago.  A lot can change in 10 years.  The only positive is that it is cheaper than the other buffets, I think $15.99 per person and there isn't too much of a line.  There was a basic selection of breakfast items, bacon, sausage, omelettes, eggs, etc.  There aren't any signature items and there isn't anything "MORE" about it.  The food tasted old like it had  been sitting for a while.  With all the buffet options in town, this one can definitely be skipped.

naJWgKGVn7wmNtWvfxPisg.text: Ew. Worse than Hometown Buffet. We only went there because the one at our hotel was closed. I got my money back.

OZUh997w86AfXWiaF70fPA.text: I didn't think it was all that bad really.  The buffet for dinner wasn't anything fancy but everything I ate tasted good and the staff, tho not the most hospitable,  made sure we were seated promptly away from children since it was obvious we didn't have any in our party and made sure there was never a buildup of dirty plates on our table like most buffets seem to like to do. I have them a 3 rating mainly because there wasn't a very large selection of food choices.  I'd come back again tho.

OUx7HNjGbwq05MwzASJGgw.text: Lol overall this buffet only gets 2 stars out of 300+ reviews! I will give it more credit than that. I will say it's not better than Hometown Buffet but it's better than most buffets in areas like Vegas. Other than the juices were watered down, prices are high and eggs are soft cooked everything else was good. Like of different of things to choose from and desserts. With a few cooks on deck, you can have them make an omelette for you. California rolls as well. Bar too. Huge restaurant that is kept pretty clean. Nice employees.

_EaXjLDpC9v-HtuLZC67Nw.text: Don't waste your money here. Go to the buffet at Ceasar's.   Food was bland, service terrible, and the cost is nowhere near reasonable for what you get.  The staff was not helpful.  Many of the dishes did not have a tag telling you what it was.    Come on Luxor...step it up.

AyTWbKgLrm1LGNNU_Ovhlg.text: This is absolutely abysmal. I'm sitting at the table trying to figure out how to get my money back...

6zabJ_bgVi6tVXwdCOxxyQ.text: I come to Vegas at least once every two months. I love the buffets and the convenience that you get in this city.  However quality os important at the buffet. Of course you get what you pay for. The buffet at Luxur "MORE" is on the lower end of the scale. The food consists mainly of pasta and salads. Very few meet items. One being a hotdog! Waffles and eggs were soggy. No waitresses so if you are out of cream for your coffee you better snatch it from your neighbors.  The price of $15.99 for lunch is low enough that you can get full with without complaining but don't look for a dining experience. So far my top two buffets are Mirage and Planet hollywood. They are semi pricy but worth every penny.  Viva Las Vegas ;)

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This tastes delishhh. Just the right amount of sugar.

g0KC-bOfdXeqpQdWkkb6CQ.text: Standard Vegas Buffet.....I mean you are mass producing food from 8am-11pm every day...I'm not going to write a snobby review about pig-slop; but for 39.99 (mine was actually cheaper cause we were the last seating)...you get ALL U CAN DRINK WINE AND BEER!!!!!!!!!  And I did..for 2 hours....worst best idea ever.....and the sole reason I bothered to rate this buffet.  Bon Appe-drink!

ZDG4BIsedZG4GOcu2OPHuA.text: Okay, my rating is really around 2.5 I have eaten here many times and it goes from 2 stars to 3.5. The food is so-so. The deserts not a very good selection. As far as value goes in Las Vegas it's reasonable. The hostess that seats you always crams everyone together like cattle and if you ask for another table she will say that stations closed.  I never understand this since the bus help rarely does anything.  My thoughts are okay, it's closed, what's the difference?

DwTq3oMMhxrreiYV0srefA.text: If you looked up the word "crap" in the dictionary then the Luxor Buffet would be listed as one of the synonyms....along with rotten onions, half smoked cigars from a 90 year old, and belly button lint.  Seriously...this was the worst meal I have ever eaten in Vegas.  It is my own fault.  I planned a trip to Vegas and did not even care about food.  For some reason I didn't think they served horrible food in Vegas.  Wrong.  If you want great food then try restaurants (IE: Eiffel Tower, Bartolotta, Mon Ami Gabi, Bouchon, Spago, Nobu).  If you are not in the mood for restaurants and want a buffet then go for Buchannel at Caesar's or the Buffet at Bellagio.  Also, the seafood buffet is not bad at the Rio.  Whatever you do...please do not visit the Luxor Buffet.  I think they take all of the stuff that is thrown down Criss Angel's garbage disposal and recook it with grease and fake sugar.  Somehow there are tons of people there too!  I think it is a big practical joke and the punchline is 5 years away. Luxor reps will get on TV and say "ha!  We tried to make the worst buffet imaginable and people still ate..we didn't expect that, but it was all a joke.  The real buffet is in another room."  Seriously...stay away.

g-VCnVJT5a7ILP6nLQS9xA.text: This place was not "awesome." The bread stuff were stale, veggies were bland, and meat were overcooked. Plus, they messed up on table decor that was particularly requested by my mom. Luckily, the two stars was for the service lady who stuck wit us for two hours.  Not comin here again though :(

v43Pfs4xCd7b95pxxfP33Q.text: I basically didn't have anything in the buffet that I liked and that includes The deserts. The place looks nice but the food lacks everything just everything. It's bland it's bad even the mimosas that were unlimited on Sunday brunch was bad, did I tell you that the Sunday brunch had nothing brunch related. Ha

mWiCvNP7Pb0MP_V8ic9aRg.text: I recently stayed at the Luxor on a trip to Vegas.  I was pleasantly surprised by how nice the hotel was that I expected a lot better from the buffet.  I did not see much I liked at the buffet.  Out of the stuff I did pick out, it was cold and tasteless.  I love desserts, so despite my disappointing dinner experience, I was looking forward to dessert, hoping it would be better.  The desserts weren't really any better.  I had a brownie that was okay, but other than that, it was just as disappointing as my dinner.  The Luxor needs to step up its game with the buffet.

A5p7I6DLzRdf0BnjIs_4_A.text: Large buffet, but not many food items. The items they had were not that great ... The food quality is comparable to any regular cheap buffet. Definitely not worth the price !

SXoV7QwjDWMzsdVJUQVbTg.text: Pretty typical Vegas buffet. Lots of options and variety. A bit on the pricey side. They offer a day pass that allows you to go multiple times throughout the day which actually saves money if you eat all your meals there.

6lblEtO6z2LX8ITbb21YeA.text: Have gone here every time I have come to Vegas. Italian was great and I liked the albondigas soup.  Orange juice was not that good and no Dr. Pepper lol.  Will come back again.

0-ZEak27ru0F6ApKwzXirA.text: Can't understand the bad reviews.. Tried many things and all were good, some really good.. We had the dinner buffet, used theMlife apps (slots/blackjack) on my phone to earn comps for but one get one.. Still would have been good at full price. You get what you pay for, not tons of seafood, but it's 24 for a dinner with drink and desert.. Great for the price. Decent selection and looks fresh.

BRo_4CckwSLywPYSaLq47A.text: I went here because I got a 2 for 1 deal and this earned them a star from me. My review can be described best by the following lyrical reference, "Have you ever went over a friends house to eat and the food just ain't that good? The macaroni's soggy, the peas are mushed, and the chicken tastes like wood!" (Rappers Delight, The Sugarhill Gang)

T5Kspttbl4qatHe64t8VEQ.text: I have gone out of my way the last two times I was in Vegas to visit the Luxor's More Buffet.  It is located downstairs from the casino floor and has a killer decor. I love how they have created an ancient Egyptian dig site to add to the dinning experience. I've had both lunch and dinner and was incredibly satisfied with both trips. The best part...this is a very affordable buffet!  I recommend it to anybody looking for tasty food with a budget in mind!  I'm planning on trying their breakfast buffet the next time I'm in Vegas!

-q5tGLmP6XUHZwYevluGog.text: More is not exactly it but when your hungry eat like a beast.    I was so hungry that i came here but it was okay.  You pay what you eat for it.   My favorites were the shrimps and crab legs.  :)

fXi_F1B7k6kC5u_FXbteqw.text: This was our first stop after a long flight from New York.  We checked in, got our room, and headed downstairs to the buffet.  Luckily, they were having a champagne brunch.  I remember the food being decent, but the unlimited champagne and mimosas were really the story here.  The price wasn't bad either.    As far as the quality of the food goes, well, I can't comment because this is the only buffet we sampled during our trip.  However, from the outside it definitely doesn't look as bad as the buffet in the Excalibur.

BQtFC_U41emlnUzeAmUQyQ.text: This buffet is amazing. It has endless food options. I was surprised to see it had lasagna and sushi. I got a whole plate of both. Of everything I tried (which was nearly everything) was amazing. The food was in no way bland, everything tasted amazing. The desserts were exceptional. I tried every single one of them. There was even a soft serve ice cream machine which I topped my desserts with. Luxor is by far my favorite hotel casino and you cannot beat the price of the buffet. $27 on a Friday night with that good of quality of food is rare in Vegas nowadays. You may be able to get slightly better food or slightly more options, but you'll pay $50+. I highly recommend.

gSbFqDKF7u_YGykqpA0pig.text: Used a MyVEGAS reward for this place. Had to go to MLife desk to redeem. Wanted to go Thursday night however the clerk at desk failed to mention they were already closed. We went Friday night instead and it was worth the wait. Apparently they have steak night on Friday. Steak was perfect, seasoned well.

5WFPBnSITJybyXMDhGG6Wg.text: The crab legs and service was excellent. The deserts was delicious. But the rest of the food was bad. The fried chicken was salty. The roast beef was chewy. And the sushi was always out. It was good for free but I would not pay for it.

_dbIwKtmxCb890YgbOi96g.text: I give this buffet 4 stars based off of its pricing and its quality of the food served. The place was clean and the selection of food was good for the price. The last time I was there a few years back I was not impressed, but they must have made some changes.

DbQfE9i1muEKRpl0id87jw.text: An odd and not entirely appetizing assortment of world foods. The food quality resembles third grade cafeteria more than Vegas. We ate here twice. On the plus side, kids liked the simple pizza, pasta and make-your-own sandwich areas. Also the assortment of salads was reasonable, if you don't expect too many vegetables. However the sushi was dry and its rice still crunchy. The sausage was cold and Spanish rice not fully cooked. Two of my favorite dishes, bok choy and eggplant parmesan were overcooked beyond recognition. I wanted to give it one star but the service was good and kids liked some of the food.

nEIDKKRbNjn451v40jkrHQ.text: I stayed at the Luxor before and I remember the Buffet being better?  I was not impressed with the breakfast buffet. Bacon was paper-thin and too crispy to enjoy. Eggs were wet and not cooked all the way, French toast was ok but the whole experience was mediocre.   Will not be back.

yC84kc49XBfXgXirS36Ocg.text: Buffet brunch was delicious...so much variety and bottomless mimosas. Great service,  and everything we tried was delicious.  As a matter of fact every employee we met at the Luxor was helpful and friendly.

zgrWyNgYl5xSB2TDWY3EYQ.text: Ouch - 2 stars seems a bit harsh.  We had the buffet at the Luxor on the last day of our trip for convenience as we would be leaving right after lunch. Breakfast was probably the weakest showing, with limited options and underwhelming execution.  All the standards were available: Eggs, meats, breads, potatoes, pancakes, etc.  But nothing was awesome.  I'm a big biscuits and gravy guy, so when the biscuits were small and dry and the gravy didn't have much flavor, I was bummed.  Coffee was good though :)  Lunch was a bit of redemption.  Much wider variety:  Mexican, Asian, Pasta, Greek, American, etc.  Nearly everything I tried from the lunch buffet was tasty.  I specifically recall the vegetable spring rolls being really good.  The star may have been the dessert - Chocolate Molten Lava "cake", which was basically a pan of chocolate cake, fudge filling, graham crackers, and marshmallow.   You can't beat the value and if you're looking to stick close to the Luxor, you could probably do much worse.

YTn0Ilo7Sg1eOiVGzXyMQg.text: The MORE buffet at the Luxor is definitely not good. The price is around $30 a person which is not cheap but not as expensive as other buffets. For less you can get way better food anywhere near or on the strip.  Let me start with the environment, it is a bit outdated and the seats are not very comfortable. It appeared clean however and there is ample seating as it wasn't busy at all, which should have told me something as it was peak dinner time.  There is not really anything to write about in regards of the staff. You pay, get seated and get your own drinks so there isn't much interaction there.  Getting to the food... More like what food? The selection was HORRIBLE. It was so disappointing. They have a small carving section with turkey, sausage, beef and chicken, noting elaborate. Literally a plate of assorted sushi which at SAMs you could probably get a better platter. The sides seemed to consist of squash cooked with an Asian, Mediterranean, Mexican, & whatever else influence you can think of, and I love squash, but I love a variety of different sides to choose from even better. I think I also saw mashed potatoes and rice. They had menudo, which I got a bowl of and couldn't eat, it had so much salt I think it may have been cooked in sea water. Disgusting.  Just bad, bad all around.  If you're going to hit up a buffet here in Vegas, don't come to the Luxor. Spend your money elsewhere, it's not worth it here. Minimal selection and what they have tastes badly.

36vo9VC6ycfGSND3c1SUOw.text: Pretty decent buffet for Las Vegas. The food was tasty and nice selection of foods to choose from (Chinese, Italian, American, Mexican, etc). Plenty of vegetarian options as well. Desserts were ok, the cannoli was my favorite. For under $20.00 it's a good deal.

maTiy6-jVKZBJXTmuUloqg.text: MORE = LESS!  With a name like MORE, isn't it supposed to be MORE?  The downstairs/lower-level area at the hotel makes a HUGE area of buffet dining.  But with the center area of salads, and fruits, and breads, then about 4 stations of various drink machines, and then the hot food area/service line...you'll quickly realize the items have been duplicated two to four times throughout....making it one of the slimmest selections at a buffet I've ever been to.  Quality is just 'okay', with sub-par bakery goods.  Unless you have a free buffet coupon, I would look elsewhere.

kQdTr4Gvi1uOvTuPv2XAPw.text: Went there for Sunday brunch. Nothing to write home about. Just an average buffet,, I expected more from the Luxor. The mimosas are served in very small cup and you have to walk all the way to the bar for a refill, they will only give you 1 at a time. Nothing like the Wyn's buffet.

oPc5Zrcb4eL6TpivbXCoQw.text: The food was mediocre, but better than some buffets. The thing that sucks is it costs $27 a person, and we had three which totalled to $85 when it was time to pay for parking. My suggestion, if your on a tight budget, no. If you want a good buffet and willing to pay for it, then yes.

eoxtqnJm6NlbaAf2ZH1blQ.text: Great food only thing I felt was odd was the layout of the restaurant. Walking to get drinks was different but overall great experience. I'd definitely go again.

3Gcb1USy1HN08xLszFMA3A.text: What a great experience we had today after reading the reviews I was curious to see if some of them were True we found this place great the food was fresh the place was clean the staff was friendly and the best part was the price I'll definitely be back and recommend this place to friends and family 5 +

ENS1s9Fq_JXCh6J-_nHQ_g.text: Convenient, tasty, good atmosphere. Offered us military discount, and the food was really good. With so much to chose from you will walk out satisfied.

4ZZ3R30Txdd2vgzBVVAdVw.text: Old country buffet is way better.  Price is ridiculous for the food.  Go somewhere else.

qKj7L1hcpF_TWRR3N8uU1A.text: This was for July, 2015. I reviewed this first back in 2011 when it was an excellent experience and am sad to say this place has gone downhill terribly! The food used to be a great selection any time of the day - tasty, and really fresh. Now this has become a very minimal selection anytime you visit, hardly anything to choose from on the salad bar, and the same bland food served for lunch and dinner. I got the one price all day pass so I observed this. The best meal here was breakfast with which I was not disappointed and had a great selection, but the other meals sucked. They need a food makeover ASAP because the location is still nice looking. I have been visiting here since 2009 and really hope they improve!

7vuaxtcK9zQxl3_bTwwAzQ.text: I love this place!!!! The food is soooo good and I am a very picky eater and buffets are not my cup of tea when it comes to places to eat... BUT..... "MORE" Buffet at Luxor is a place my wife and I come to eat every time we come and visit Vegas!!! The price is good compared to some other buffets here in Vegas... There is always plenty to choose from and several variations of styles as well... the food is hot and never cold... the grill station is a great touch when you want something done a certain way.... the carving station is to die for!!!! The variety of side dishes is a great way to decorate the finishing touches on plate after plate of food!!!! The fountain drinks are cold and and the bar is always ready to serve you!!!! Now for you desert lovers out there.... let me tell you..... OH MY GOD!!!! Soft moist sweet all at the same time with deserts!!!! Cookies cakes pies mmmmmmm!!!!! I think I just gained 3 pounds writing this review talking about all this food!!!

qRno8awuZBP7ZIwOnSwkQw.text: Food was horrible. I expected much better from a Vegas buffet. We had dinner buffet so maybe breakfast or lunch is better but my guess is probably not.

8W2JVSo3qOD5q697f4S_mw.text: Awesome buffet with crab legs, sushi, shrimp and dishes from all over the world and they actually have Gluten Free chocolate cake that's DELICIOUS! Love it!!  Funny how the majority of the bad reviews come from "out of staters" who will just end up driving drunk on our roads anyway, what a waste.

3J7W3khYzSeOUkUXRYGOvw.text: Sunday brunch.  Food average especially for price. Mimosas were good.

5k5F_nhidX0nvxlav07pyA.text: Buffett was good for the price....I prefer the one at the Bellagio!

67aw1aHKtnWe3h8dazG61Q.text: We got a Voucher to the buffet, decided to use it for breakfast thinking that people can't really screw up breakfast...and I was wrong! The donut holes were dry, orange juice luke warm, are the scrambled eggs real? The only good part of the breakfast was the bacon. Thank goodness it was all paid for by a voucher.

QqZQLl-T8KTcWimC6Jekew.text: Alright so I have read alot of people reviews and I have to laugh at some and agree with others. The food is not bad at this place. I have eaten here at least 5 times and you have no complains from me. Yes the hot dogs in a buffett are a little weird but come on lots of people have kids and you know most kids will eat hot dogs. For the price and when you are in a lazy mood and dont want to leavr the hotel the food is good. If you are wanting high end classy plates then  the have a McDonald a few floors up

DYeRn1WcxMjSJd5nv5hbeQ.text: Well, after eating at two very good buffets during our most recent trip to Vegas, this one was really pretty mediocre.  I am only giving it a 3 star because it is a much better deal for the price than spending $10 on a crummy hot dog located two floors up.  Yeah, still peeved about that.  After desperately looking for something cheap to eat, and seeing that the buffet line (and everything else) at Excalibur would probably take 1 hour to get through, having a very hungry and tired 3 year old on our hands, we settled for the buffet at Luxor.  Fortunately, my husband couldn't have been happier.  The selection was not great, the food was only so so, but it was better quality than the $10 fish sandwich he had almost bought and a lot more food too.  The one saving grace of this buffet is that they must have a decent pastry chef because their desserts were a lot better than the ones we found at the Spice Market Buffet or Seasons.  We were very impressed by the desserts and had way too many of them! That and the coffee was excellent!

pK4L64_FIgzG2d3QYS0b_w.text: More is definitely less. I can find a better buffer in like Bakersfield. The selection is small and the food taste a little better than what they prepare at a high school cafeteria. The cocktail shrimp are half the size of those of the other buffets and the prime rib overcooked to perfection. If it wasn't for the $5 off coupon and the reasonable price, this is definitely a one star.

Ta5sx5D-Tiaemz5BDWI3Nw.text: I almost gave this place a 3 after comparing it to the buffet at TI, but then my boyfriend and I went home and were queasy all night. I like this buffet more than the TI buffet because their food is overall more flavored and well-presented, and they also have Chef's Specials. The salad bar is also large and impressive compared to the sad buffet at TI. I downed a couple mimosas and ate mostly breakfast food (and their eggs benedict was way better than TIs). I wouldn't go back here but it is WAY more bang for the buck than other buffets so if you have to choose a cheap one, go here. Also, another downside is the crazy maze of tables and the fact that you have to wait so long to get one. I liked our happy server though - she may have refilled my mimosa more than twice now that I think about it...

32MbskyhRkfxGZ_QnZjySQ.text: i dont know that i love this place.  we shoes up for the champagne brunch on a sunday with just minutes to spare, by the time we ordered our omlettes all of the breakfast food had been switched out with lunch. this means i enjoyed my omlette with a side of nachos, but still. i WAS hoping for some bacon.  but on the plus side, we had bottomless mimosas and, per usual while at a buffet, i got sick from too much desert so id say it worked out ok.  its not fantastic but its not awful either, and its affordable!

AfDE2zHukoQJTRJKe8thew.text: Ok so I normally don't go to buffets because typically they're overpriced and I never eat enough to make up the money but this one is awesome because for $30 you can eat ALL day as much as you want. Only drawback is that even on a weekend night they close at 10pm. BOO! Can't do that guys, it's Vegas! WTH! Oh well good food though honestly like almost every single thing I ate was delicious ranging from soups to sushi to pasta and even deserts. I def recommend the strawberry cheesecake even if you don't like it because OMG soooooooooooo yummy it hits the spot even with just one bite. Since we were staying at the hotel as well we got free drink tickets too and in the morning we both got complimentary champagne! How cool is that right? So yeah I think we'll be back :)

R8J1OrqwvQ92tA0wQLWuRg.text: Had I yelped this buffet before shelling out the cash, I might not have found myself sitting at the table wondering whether the executive chef graduated from the Culinary Institute of Hometown.

rRodQESgRGtZCfAXMuYUvQ.text: It's okay. Nuthin' that special. The watermelon was good. The desserts were pretty good.

M2l6nRyrbfy-2tCwznGf1w.text: Went here last weekend for my honeymoon. What a disaster of a buffet! $30 dollars for food that tasted like it had been prepped a week in advance and over nuked in a microwave. This is the WORST buffet I have ever ate at. DON'T WASTE YOUR MONEY when you go to Vegas. Can't say it enough...bad...Bad..BAD!!!

YJRmgsgbNhpe0fP2j9I_Ow.text: We went here the week of 3/24/10. We got the $29.99 all the day pass but went there only for lunch and dinner. The lunch was very decent food. They had all different sorts of choice..american, chinese, mexican, along with a fruit and dessert bar. My favorite dessert is the bread pudding! All the other food was decent, not fantastic. However, for the price, you just can't beat it. The dinner was not impressive but I didn't think it was a waste of money because I was still full. I would recommend eating here at least once during your visit to Vegas. It's affordable and decent tasting food.

-3_rLSjj0xHYE4JUAMTYdA.text: This was the worst buffet I've eaten at.  The food was gross and old.  There was nothing special about it.  Skip this place!

PjzlnzgjaoaxpivWT6LZeA.text: This buffet is a good deal. It is the cheapest buffet on the strip that still tastes good.  There is a good selection and the buffet is reasonably priced. The lines are long at this buffet so you will want to go early. They have a champagne Sunday brunch that is worth mentioning. It is not exceptional but  you won't be disappointed if you go.

tyzcWyNHurxDf4ph4QIdRQ.text: We ended up here for brunch when we discovered that our own hotel expects people on vacation to be up for breakfast before 10.    2 things I did not like:  1) There is one flat price for the champagne brunch.  Whether you want bubbly alcohol first thing in the morning or not, you feel pressured to order it because you paid for it (other buffets let you pay a reduced fee if you don't need alcohol with your eggs).  2) You pay for your meal before you sit down, and the computer asks you how much you want to tip.  Umm, nothing, I haven't been waited on yet.  Unless you bring cash, there is no way to tip your waiter after you eat, so you either have to assume the service will be good or stiff your waiter.  The Egyptian decor was nice, and the food itself was fine but not memorable.  We only ate breakfast, which had all the basics like eggs, bacon, waffles, etc.  We didn't eat any lunch but it was also basic stuff, mac and cheese, potatoes, tacos.    It wasn't bad but it wasn't special, so we wouldn't bother to go back here, especially after we discovered the wonderful Bellagio buffet that only costs a few dollars more.

gjPivbKO0yu4wLjXh3Tagg.text: HORRIBLE!  do not eat here.  there is no selection, food is below average.  severe dissapointment. the star is for our bus man.  he was so friendly & helpful.

3hCr6d9qNIORa6230XsYLg.text: Do NOT waste your $ here!  The food was of poor quality and probably been sitting out all day.    We went there for dinner and it was not packed at all...should of taken that as a sign.  We had the morning brunch at LV Hilton with lobsters, king crab...there was nothing good worth mentioning at Luxor.  To make things worse, my 1 yr old got the stomach flu 3 hrs after eating here and was vomiting/diarrhea all night for 1 week straight!!  I think she had bad, unfresh Mahi Mahi.  My husband was a bit sick as well, but he recovered quickly; toxins in a small body is detrimental!    The service was so poor, they didn't even bother to refill our drinks or take our plates.  STAY AWAY FROM LUXOR BUFFET!!  I hear Caesar's, Paris, Bellagio has the best buffet!

NwQrrLl2i9fWeJ6abrzr_w.text: It is ok buffet. We had champagne buffet on christmas day. Not worth it, but some items were edible. Nothing to write home about. Would not eat there again, unless it is a freebie.

2jCESZwHj2xq8WDc1WYM1A.text: In 5 years of coming to LV, this has to be the saddest buffet in LV.  We had enjoyed the Spice World Buffet at Planet Hollywood the morning before but opted to "eat local" Sunday morning.  What a mistake!  I don't know where Ryan T.  ate as there was NO wait service at all. The food and drinks were totally self service.   No half and half for coffee (non dairy creamer only).  An extremely limited selection with powdered scrambled eggs, frozen pastries, no egg white omelets, watered down juices, Eggo waffles, soupy oatmeal and a fruit bar consisting of  tired looking melon evoked a Days Inn free breakfast buffet rather than a $20+ Vegas Sunday brunch.The shrimp looked so old no one in my party dared take anything from the fish area (lox and two kinds of boiled shirmp)  The carvery had a Hormel type ham and a turkey breast evoking Louis Rich, but no one to cut it. It was truly pitiful.  The take away is ask to view the buffet before committing to purchasing and avoid the Luxor MORE as a breakfast option,

brrWqykiewvInVv5zVrJ1w.text: It was super basic food. For how much it is, the food is terrible. They ask for a tip when you first pay yet theres no servers or anyone who brings food to you or refills your drinks so why ask for a tip? The only thing that was good there was the dessert. Do not waste your money there.

jBZOVlZOMUEXp1wxTKAmlg.text: So eat at the Luxor Buffet on NYE very disappointed. Quality of food and choices were horrible the only redeeming quality is that you can drink as much soft drinks you want(sarcasm). The shrimp was not good quality and yes they had crab legs but if they miss the mark on the shrimp why chance the crab legs. For what they charge I would have expected a good meal not great but I have had Hometown Buffet serve better food.

QqWq6nG1OZkrSD0xSOolag.text: Very dissatisfied. The line to get in was long  which is fine but when I finally got to the front of the line I had apparently been waiting in the VIP line which I'm not a VIP. They told me I had to go to the back of a different line.I had already stood in line for 30 min ,she just said she was sorry but she cant put me through in front of the other line.I had her get the manager in which she informed me that she will do it for me this time but not again.(Fine because After actually eating here I wont ever be returning anyways  .)  I did brunch ,not a lot of food options the meat choices were only  fried chicken(very greasy)  and turkey breast which was the only good choice  at the buffet. They had a taco bar with greasy old taco meat and discusting nacho cheese sauce. I would have been better satisfied with  taco bell to be honest! Waste of $28.00.

jrc_knnYmqIV_y_QHFRIow.text: So this is a fairly average buffet. Just under $20 breakfast. I'd say overpriced but this is a buffet on the strip so... There's a salad and fruit bar where you could get the standard salad, fruit, yogurt, smoked salmon (cream cheese is by the bagels in the bread station) hummus, etc. The actual buffet had most your standard stuff... Only ironically I didn't see any pancakes. French toast and waffles tho. The french toast was pretty good. There's a to-order egg and omelet station plus a few varieties on the line. Bacon, sausage, and hash were your meat options on the line. And in a small "healthy" section chicken breast. Overall nothing blew my mind except maybe the quiche but also nothing was bad and everything was the correct temperature. Drinks are self-serve and include sodas,a couple different juices, coffee, milk and chocolate milk, and teas.   Oh and the dessert bar is kinda set off from main area but they got banana bread so it's worth a trip.

RqbcCejjFzeq99I0fIV4IQ.text: We happened to stay at the Luxor for the weekend. We had brunch on a Sunday for 22.99. It's was good. Nothing extravagant although you get unlimited mimosas. They have an omelette station and carving area. They also had some Mexican food like pork Pozole and chilaquiles. You can buy the all day pass for 39.99 on week days and 45.99 for Sunday. They close at 10:00 pm.
