ZClhDyZY-gNxri-5NAUYTw.text: Food was terrible. Cold, stale, nasty. We paid $71 for 2 people... you WILL leave feeling shortchanged. And to top it off, on our way out, I slipped in a random puddle of vomit on the floor that apparently no one noticed...Seriously, where is the health department??

hYey0e09oDRQ5C8AgPc-7w.text: When you charge $19 for a BREAKFAST buffet and have people waiting 30 minutes for bacon, among other breakfast items, you get 1 star. Never coming back.  MORE buffet at Luxor...do you know what happens to breakfast buffets that don't have bacon?!?!?   Do you know what happens?!?!?  MORE Buffet at Luxor...   YOU JUST MADE THE LIST!

9qeZWgrPXZsKcanWS6RNeQ.text: Brought the family here 5/10/17.   Bleh! 25$ each for subpar Golden Corral ! Bread was stale, sausage was old, potstickers were hard as rocks! Come on people get your shit together! As soon as I got back to the table with my plate I spent the whole time apologizing to my family for suggesting we eat there.   While I was getting food one of the ladies slammed a pan of rice into to the steam table and splashed hot water all over my arm and shirt!! Hurt like hell!!! Manager was right there and heard me yell at her and said nothing to her or me!!! Crappy food and bad customer service! You are not supposed to burn the customers!! Basically wasted 100$    Never again for this place!

ChV3vO7_rTGPDoGduzl_Bg.text: 3.5 stars is more accurate ("it's OK and I'm almost a fan"), but I rounded up because, compared to other Las Vegas buffets, the dining area here is peaceful and pleasant and devoid of residual cigarette smoke (the buffet is on the floor below the casino).  As a local who has been to way too many buffets, I generally hate them all. My husband, on the other hand, loves buffets; if he could, he would ONLY eat at buffets.  He was able to convince me to try "More" (the official name of the buffet at Luxor), and I didn't hate it, which is saying a lot. The food was fine--edible, varied, with a few surprises. I tried a chicken curry that was surprisingly spicy, in a good way. And I was surprised to find a chickpea stew and some other Mediterranean-influenced dishes.  What I liked best, however, was the sense of personal space that I felt once I brought my food to our booth. The spacing between tables is generous, and there's lots of room to navigate when getting up to check out the food. For once, I felt as if I was dining at a buffet, rather than just diving into a feeding frenzy. And the dining area seemed relatively quiet--Las Vegas quiet, meaning that the general din was low-grade and not overly obvious.  My mother would say I'm "damning with faint praise," which I essentially am, but it still amounts to praise: I find eating at buffets an excruciating experience; they are generally loud, crowded, dirty, and nerve-wracking. But if you're on the southern end of the Strip and you need to eat, "More" isn't a bad choice. It's much more pleasant than, say, eating at the Bellagio buffet, where the food is better but the crowds and noise are absolutely awful.

Qh5PEdCZJzJIq8pCg4lURQ.text: Went for the lunch buffet. Not expecting much but were very surprised . A wide selection of very tasty foods. Something for everyones taste. Enjoyed it alot

LztkKM-lvRraBbS9TVXzcg.text: With buffets like Wicked Spoon at Cosmopolitan and Bucchanal at Ceaser's, buffets like this one can't compare...  My family and I used to eat here often... when it used to be upstairs. Ate here a few more times when they moved it downstairs... unfortunately, it seemed like the quality had gone down a bit. For the price, it's not all that bad, but then, you get what you pay for. Most recently, I came here for Sunday brunch with my boyfriend. We had a buy one get one free deal so at $20 for both of it, it was a much better deal than going to other places. Even without the deal, $20 for Sunday champange brunch is much cheaper than most other hotels. At the high-end buffets, you are looking at $30-40 a head.   Anyways, there was much more people here than I thought seeing the bad reviews and not having eaten here for many years. I do think that the buffet is much better than the likes of Old Country Buffet, Home Town Buffets, Golden Corral and other buffets of those sorts. I think the reason this buffet is reviewed so low is because it is being compared to the high-end buffets.   I only had brunch, so I can't comment on the current dinner selections. Brunch had all the basics... breakfast food and some lunch items. The had an omelet station and prime rib at the craving station. There was a Chinese food section, American food, salad, soup, and breakfast foods and dessert section. True, the food is not of the high end caliber, but you are also paying half the costs... I ate various items such as fried chicken, potatoes, has browns, sausage, prime rib, omelet, waffles, egg rolls, fried rice, and some desserts. Nothing stood out as particularly great to me... but nothing stood out as terrible either. Yes, the drinks are self serve as others have stated. Personally, I do not mind that as sometimes it's a pain to ask! I was glad I was able to get 2 glasses of orange juice at a time instead of repeatedly having to ask someone for drinks.   Would I come here again... if I had a discount... but for full price, it is a bit pricey for what you get. I'm spoiled when in Vegas, so unless I had a discount or it was comped... I probably wouldn't come here again. If you are on a budget... maybe...

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Brunch
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

LWUscTlWL5smNPPGup0q2A.text: Had a show, so we came early to eat. I would say this is the worst buffet I have ever been to. Poor food selection (bare minimum) very expensive for what you get.  Service was fine just poor buffet selection.

IDim-BZY1VLDMIP1cGow8Q.text: I have never been to a restaurant and regretted spending my money as much as I have here. The buffet is pretty big, but there wasn't a single food item that actually tasted good. It's like they have a buffet for the sake of having a buffet, and don't actually put in any effort into making the food taste any good. The only redeeming thing this buffet would have is the Omelet Bar during its lunch service. The omelet tastes pretty good, and the cook is very good at what he does. If you want to come to an omelet buffet for $25, this is the place to be.

rG1vUYU-C6KWfwU2_uhOyA.text: I have tried maybe 4-5 buffets in vegas... Not many. Of course time of day matters, dinners are better than lunch. That being said i cant compare them side by side because i visited some breakfast lunch or dinner.  We tried this one for dinner and i think it is probably the best i have had so far. Great carving station, good mashed potatoes not just mush (important to me), split crab legs, and nice desserts.   I would highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I dont usually take pics of buffet food but these cream puffs were the bomb!

yE0YH98JMEqwcvJS3nb6QA.text: This was the only part of our stay we didn't love.  We came here for the weekend Brunch buffet.  There are few options for vegetarians. Except for the salad bar there is very little. Everything is meat or contains chicken broth or beef broth, even what should normally be vegetarian, (ex: the beans and rice are not vegetarian). The desserts were somewhat decent. And the rest of the food was just ok. My husband eats meat and isn't very picky (like he eats fast food), and he thought the meat was relatively dry. It was all pretty bland, and based on how hungry we were, it should have tasted much better.   The Luxor is obviously aimed at the middle class/upper middle class crowd, so why does the buffet taste like something that would be at Circus Circus or Buffalo Bills?  Next time we might try a slightly more expensive buffet. Though we got full, this felt like a waste of money.

Ak7hlbrLq4afnbxM3ZntuA.text: Not good at all. First you are asked if you want to leave a tip when you pre-pay for your meal and soon realize that you have to get your own drinks at a soda fountain. For $30 that's ridiculous. Food was no better then a Golden Corral Buffet for more then twice the money. Decor is nice and price is on the lower end for the strip casino buffets but that's no excuse for the quality of the food. You can't take a dump on a plate and claim it's cheaper. Looked and tasted like everything was prepared by short order cooks with no creativity. Better food and this could be amongst the better ones to visit

-b8for1Q10_DFFJ2fZbcIw.text: How in the world do they even call this a buffet. It's a discrace for Vegas! I can totally understand paying $10.00 but $25.00 is ridiculously overpriced! The food is worst than golden corral, selection is weak and the seafood was horrible. Do yourself a favor and walk over to madalay bay.

qyqnoAeHUN1IVKD8oA6J4Q.text: Unsurprisingly underwhelming. Outrageous cost, as this is barely a step above a Golden Corral. Really disappointing.   Only saving grace was their Banana Creampuff, and the hosting staff was very nice.   Oh, and the mashed potatoes. Those were pretty good, too.

KUS37zBrCBTs6PCNe_3KqA.text: Decent selection, but for the price and location you should already know you are not getting the best quality. It's fine but don't go here if you're looking for an amazing meal.

KtfrbQf9mDJ5CRbn5fFNVw.text: Our service was so poor. We had service dogs for our son and brain trauma issues. The serve staff would not serve us unless from over the wall and sat us as far away from people as they could. We had one server come over to hand us napkins from over wall by yelling hey miss to me. Our dishes were not cleared not even once and no one even once asked if we needed anything. We had six of us and our service dogs laid quiet the entire time. We are very sad at this. We also felt food was very poor compared to past experiences :(. Overall I am sad at the treatment we received and hope it is resolved for others in the future. My son felt awful as though he caused it and we had to damage control as a result.

LHIJfLRi5k-k8GUF_b7H1Q.text: We did Sunday brunch buffet. The food is okay,  it had pretty good variety. Their design for the free mimosas is idiotic however. The girl at the bar carded both of us the first time, okay, understandable.  I went back to get one for my husband a scant 20 minutes later, and she insisted on carding me again. I gave her some contextual clues but she refused. However, there was a gentleman ahead of me in line that also got a mimosa, but she did not card him. I watched her, and she only carded certain people. I am 45 years old, and can no longer pass for 20-anything. She actually made me go get ID. There was another lady who I saw did not have her purse, it was on the table adjacent to us, and she did not have pockets. She was probably 5-6 years older, but no carding, no making her go get her ID. She walked back with her mimosa with no issues.   The inconsistency really pissed me off more than anything else, but why do they want the bartender to card every guest, every time., for what can best be described as just over a shot glass worth of mimosas? Why don't they card you at the cashier and stamp you? Or why not give the bartender a stamp? Why in the world would you have all you can drink mimosas and require an ID check EVERY. SINGLE. TIME??????  And for the record, I had one mimosa, and even that was just over half a glass.  Stupid, idiotic design that made brunch feel like a chore rather than vacation.  Epic fail.

YfKhnJsO4Yje5xJFAHJ5cQ.text: pretty decent if you are trying to stuff your face but the quality is not there, a lot of the food was mushy or without flavor and felt like i was a discount buffet with nice surroundings

zbANuXK7nHbsDnqNICCaCg.text: Nice, clean, and decent buffet! And best thing besides it being a buffet is that it's a great price! $20 per person (lunch) you can't beat that here in Las Vegas.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Deserts!

MpacXmWDyIN3hFrzN1VjrA.text: The buffet is very okay, and if I was to just rate the buffet alone I would give it 2-stars.   The four stars is PURELY for the bar and bartender. It was a gentleman with tattoos, a sleeve, and short hair dark hair. He served my wife and I almost all day - talking to us and constantly being kind.   He would even had some drinks ready before we asked! (We had free complimentary drinks for 2).   I definitely tipped him almost every time we went up there just because he was a great guy who knew how to make us laugh. I wish I could remember his name to give him a shout-out but he definitely made our day!

d3yas8pTNhkBe3GcO2VOqg.text: This buffet is your average buffet. It's one of the cheaper ones and had a good selection but it was nothing to wow us. We chose to eat here our first day because we had been driving for 5 hours and were starving (hadn't eaten all day) we had a free buffet and decided to go anyways. If you're looking for cheap and no frills then this is it for you. It fills you up without breaking the bank. Now if you're a dessert person like me, don't expect much, out of the three buffers we went to while on vacation here, they had the smallest dessert area.

Rx5TROELUtPm0BTVEuMnpw.text: Very impressive. On our last trip out we did several of the caesars buffets and were quite disappointed in what they had degraded to over the years. We checked out this buffet for weekend brunch and it was quite impressive. Food had flavor, decor was cool, wait times not too bad, price was right. Worth checking out if you're on this end of the strip

1MmMaIyeQPctV_TzZDVjhQ.text: Okay we are staying at the Excalibur and bought the all day buffet and was told that it's good at the Lexor so we gave it a try... Sadly disappointed. The layout does not flow well. The food was below average in regards to quality. They didn't have Bubly like at the Excalibur. I am not a desert person but what I saw didn't look great. I have to also say the place was dirty... Food on the floor everywhere.. also the place needs a good dusting lots of fuzz bunnies on the decor. Maybe my expectations were set based on my above average experience at the other location but honestly I think we will stick with our hotel.

PWC_mI6nWv6QjuIqgup_yA.text: Expensive and the food is not worth it, its better at hometown buffet or any cheap Chinese buffet cause the price here is the same in bbq korean buffet.

-pFWhSDysuWX1pPgP-73uw.text: The buffet at Luxor is somewhere I always look forward to visiting. There are no bad seats , the salad bar flows endlessly in an oval walk around setup and consists of toppings galore. I personally am a fan of the food options and make it a point to feast as much as I possibly can when I come to visit. Here is my trick I arrive very early right when the buffet opens and then I get the all day food pass they put a little wristband on your arm and you can get in all day until they close up shop, The wristband also allows you to eat at Excalibar but that's another review... And I tell you what they are not making any profit off of me in the food area I tell you I gorge myself over and over because I am in Las Vegas and that's exactly what I am here for. Who needs to gamble when you have an unlimited access food pass?  Also when you get the food past wristband you get faster entry which for a lot of people could be a good thing if you want quick and easy access to drinks and sodas and water because we all know how much water can cost and even a good glass of orange juice can be super expensive but the all day wristband also includes unlimited non-alcoholic drinks   Oh and the desserts my goodness they are delicious the selection isn't as large as some other places but what they do have is excellent especially the creme brulee it always tastes amazing  But enough about me and how much I love this place I also want to say that the customer service is truly world class, The host has always taking the time to be genuine and thoughtful. It is a great operation with a well trained staff !  Sometimes the lines can be a little long but it does help to have an mLife card, because once you make  pearl, you get dedicated entry which is a time saver.    If you come to Vegas you definitely should give this buffet a try

Li4jJmEzd7jRSeeJ_rw4Vg.text: Sometimes you just can't beat convenience and that's what the buffet at Luxor offered. Everyone can get what they want and the only wait was the line to be seated.   My recommendation is to go during the breakfast buffet since who doesn't love all you can eat French toast and bacon? They also have bottomless mimosas.   It's hard for a buffet to have amazing food, but here was pretty good.

cSO787PRWanrGOr5E6nvHA.text: Just your basic staple food Nothing special but good service  Just one of Las Vegas cheaper family buffets It ain't Ceaser Buffett or Wynn's but is about the third if the price

7GwoGOTnXa74YqXAhFTfVw.text: It's okay- overpriced but easy to feed a large group. Not as many options as you hope but enough. Service is nice but being seated in a quiet area to talk is non existent.

ybruIS5bJHW0TEDXrIKv7A.text: When in Vegas I always plan to go here for dinner or lunch. The buffet is reasonably priced and you can always find a deal in addition (such as a two for one deal through the Mlife My Vegas games). There is a great selection of food at this buffet, ranging from Italian, Mexican, American, Chinese and more. A lot of the options are tasty and the variety ensures there is something for everyone. Great dessert selection as well! Good drink options and a walk up bar for those who would like to spend a little extra for alcohol. I recommend if you are looking for a solid buffet and don't want to spend too much money.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Clams

0c2QAjntpTtWGY0CmePapw.text: This buffet is absolute trash. It is an expensive dumpster fire. The only redeeming quality is that the service is acceptable. My biggest issue other than the garbage I put on my plate is that servers do not bring you drinks. Essentially, there are no servers, only bussers.  I've been to buffets at other hotels and they blow this one out of the water. It almost as if the Luxor isn't even trying to compete.  Take my recommendation and pass on this buffet. The only thing you will find is sub par food, disappointment, and a large bill. If you must eat at the Luxor there are plenty of other cheaper or comparably priced options that have edible food. Visit one of those other retaurants.

Q0RQAZk6CQLLIo-GwezISQ.text: This place is pretty cool beans. They have lots of awesome food that taste very great. I definitely got my money's worth, and I really enjoyed myself. Not the best, since it's kind of hard to get to, but definitely one of the best buffets I have ever been to.

P7MRm28psS8sA9K6JdE_aQ.text: If I could put 0 stars I would, all I got to say is the buffet is really really SAD , the waitress are really nice but  you can tell they get there cooks off the street, be PREPARED TO PAY 25$ for OLD  COLD MICROWAVE food that will give Diarrhea all day, just the smell walking in will make you gag , honestly only because I have a voucher I forced myself to come down to this buffet, don't be disappointed save you're money this place is literally trash they really let this place go. This lady littrely flicked trash from the dirty dishes into my eyes idk if it was on purpose put its discussing experience.  UPDATE literally came up to my room and started sweating with horrible nausea threw everything I had in my stomach up, picture to prove it , hope you have a better time first time in VEGAS

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

tTlJzVb3ADzpTSNhuPK-Bw.text: This was a great buffet. We went around 11 am and there was a long line however, it moved fast. We waited no longer than 20 minutes.  They had a great selection of breakfast and their lunch was being put out. The dessert has a great variety as well. The staff was really fast at cleaning any messes made by customers and as the food was running low it was constantly being refilled.  I will be returning to this buffet.

W6fZ2HQJ9rFfBJkw2eX8Pw.text: The buffet wasn't as good as I remembered in our last visit 3 years ago. The food quality has dipped quite low. I remember how crazy the queue was the last time we visited and this time, there were hardly any people. Now I know why!  The food lacked basic seasoning. Apart from the desserts, there was nothing really special about the buffet. Waste of money. Not returning back again.

nLeM2ystETIfTV2HQKlAow.text: The 'American' bar chef told us there was no more meat available at 8PM. Further all the other dishes like the pizza slices and mac&cheese were cold.  Only thing positive was the desserts, those were delicous.  Please read other reviews before visiting here, in my opinion your money is well spend better elsewhere.

URhp4HK8JigsXBRslrs06Q.text: Food was good,  only issue I had was there was a heavy set Asian lady working our area. She was really rude and was yelling at a guest that didn't speak English . People at booths around us kept talking about how rude she was. Best food I had was probably the prime rib and loved the desserts.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert,  the best part!

FcDfulC3-aIRftjMT9LKyQ.text: Came here with our niece and her family.  They have a LARGE selection of food and the only thing I didn't like was the Asian spare-ribs.  They were all fat and I couldn't swallow it. I wouldn't bring it up but it happened to another patron that was with us.  Other than that all of the food we got was good.  Beer is over-priced but cold.

Y5SjF75uLFuOSiiAh-3-Pg.text: Not a fan of buffets but people I was with wanted to go. Breakfast buffet $18.99 Friday morning, $21.99 on Saturday. I piled a plate but it still isn't worth those prices. I recommend you turn yourself around and go have a freshly made breakfast at the Backstage Deli tucked in a corner of the casino floor at Luxor, near the ticket area for Criss Angel's Believe. Way cheaper, tastier, made to order, and more enjoyable.  The More buffet is 2 sided. Both sides are not quite the same. If you are still going to get the buffet, I highly recommend you head straight to the Omelet station and have the chef make you a fresh omelet because the eggs on the buffet are watery and tasteless. Then you have Brown 'n Serve sausage and bacon. Cheese blintz with blueberry sauce, apple pie filling crepes, biscuits, southern white gravy, home fries, grits, mini pancakes, french toast, corned beef hash. I tried a little of everything the first day. Much of it seems frozen/packaged/heat & serve.  Day 2 I went right to the highlights: Omelet, corned beef hash was REALLY good, add some country gravy on top, lots of bacon, and if you try something sweet go ahead and dump a ladle of the blueberry sauce on it.  Fresh fruit, salads, and mediteranean dips on the center aisle.  On weekends they use 1 side for a few more lunch style hot dishes to make it "brunch" plus chilled shrimp, muscles, crawfish and 2 types of sushi, one was plain cucumber, the other looked like California Roll. Go ahead and skip all that nonsense. Unless your plan is to just take an empty plate up to the chilled shrimp display and go hog wild on it. Then maybe its worth those prices....nah. Still isn't.

dKl4zSPKbQ2z-RVrO0Qz3w.text: Food is crap as well as the mimosa's they offer in the Brunch. They should have more variety. By the way, where is the milk, coffee, croissants, etc? At least I was hoping to find some of this since I went to the Brunch.  I had an omelet and a few sips of the mimosa before run away from this place. It says a lot about how I liked this buffet.  For the price you pay you should not have high expectations anyway. The next time I hope to remind to check the reviews beforehand.

Y7YtWM_6TxteVBEls57i9Q.text: Great buffet, will definitely come back. Prompt service and unique items. Self- beverages was a good surprise. There is even takeout to go, but the container seemed small. One of the best buffets on the strip. My wife is not a buffet person but she even somewhat enjoyed it.

scXMO2LPAkKmfqwuOQnq4Q.text: Buffet was very limited and at dinner time too.  Half the desserts were melting looking and the carving station meat was cold, like out of the refrigerator cold. The busser took my husbands plate but not mine, but she had nothing else in her hands. The only good thing there seemed to be the Mac n cheese and even that was a little cold. Won't be back.

LMfYgsc76My5nLOwVDNMLw.text: I would recommend staying away from this buffet.   I've been here a few times, when I was younger and also more recently about a year or two ago.  Every time I've been here I really wanted to like it but I really didn't. The lights are way too dim and it's very awkward.  The food is also disappointing - there isn't much selection and the food is rather dry and the sushi is not very good.  I would recommend skipping this place and going to another great Vegas buffet - like the Rio international buffet or the buffet at the Bellagio. The Luxor hotel is a great place to stay, though, and it's just disappointing that the buffet isn't better.

ok3LXLAUHyRFDM9NputjWA.text: Food was OK. I've ate here a few times.... It will do the trick but food just tasted like it was food from any typical buffet.

QwArmIQ3cbVIUlyaWBGB-A.text: Average at best. Went here because the lines at the Deli were endless and I can skip the Line downstairs with my MLife NOIR card. In any way the buffet was comped from the Casino side. It was breakfast time and even though I have seen plenty of breakfast buffets in Vegas before this was one of the worst. Not horrible but very average and depending on where you are sitting you have to walk endlessly to your table. Not a comfortable environment either, it feels like a giant mess hall. Can not recommend it, not even for free.

yZ_VaJtmosNpMWdCoE35gQ.text: I thought it was a nice enough buffet. We got a deal through Southwest that included a free buffet everyday we were staying at any MGM property, and since we were here, we tried it out for breakfast and lunch. It is sort of in the basement, but it's cool.  They have a pretty good spread. Breakfast had eggs, burritos, sausage etc, but they also have crepes, biscuits and gravy etc. I was happy with the spread. They keep the salad bar open as well and have a few Greek dishes too.  Lunch brings out chicken, noodles, Asian food, pasta and the same Greek food.   Overall, it was filling and had enough choices. Definitely glad I tried it, but there are more buffets out there to try.  If you're staying at the Luxor, worth trying.

-FXXflODT-YqYWIpazIRpQ.text: This buffet was worse than cafeteria food.  We used a buy one get one free coupon from the MyVegas app for dinner, but were told it could only be used if we got to the buffet by 4pm.  We decided to go to an early dinner to still use it, but even at half price this buffet is not worth it. Truly worse than most cafeteria food.  The best thing at the buffet was stale tortilla chips with ball park nacho cheese.  There are supposedly multiple nationalities of food there, but even the American was inedible looking roast beef and cauliflower.  The salad bar looks like grocery salad that has expired, and the Asian and Mexican foods were inedible (strange enchiladas and greasy vegetables sitting under heat warmers). The only thing worth eating was the dessert bar, and even that was unimpressive.  Small chocolate cookies were labeled as tiramisu and even the soft serve ice cream was less than ideal. In a city with a lot of great restaurants, this is not worth your time or money.  You would be better off eating at a fast food restaurant than this place.

jqbqyACPQJ_8beIhejqMcw.text: This buffet was free for me and certainly ended up being A LOT better than the one I paid for at The Palms.  They offer classic buffet fare and not a lot of frills. That's ok...sometimes that's all I want. They even have a kids food area - which I have to admit, some of the adults in my party visited!

i0pK2P7RhXKAAa0NXwCwaQ.text: Wide selection on the menu. I used a myvegas reward coupon. I think i would of not came if i didnt have a rewards. My husband enjoyed the steak bar. My cousin said the salmon was dry. They had a big selection but i was having acid reflux and couldnt enjoy like i wanted too!! Of course no vegas buffett isnt complete without shrimp and crab legs! I did indulge in that! I wouldnt pay for it though. Im glad for the myvegas reward!

bZgScaaQHWqCyrN291zFpQ.text: We got a free meal from the hotel so why not?  While I haven't had a number of buffets in Vegas, those that I have had scored higher on the score cards. More The Buffet is the bottom of the wash barrel, worse than bath water. We came in during dinner and upon walking up to the register, was pretty surprised to see the $20 price tag. However, the yellow tinted lighting should have given me a the red flag. None of the food there is memorable, it's a self serve beverage station- I should've ordered alcohol, and we sat across two table that have not been bussed from the moment we arrived to the time we left. Imagine, stacks and stacks of plates with half eaten portions. Bleh.  Next time, if there ever is one, I will have to exchange that offer for something more palatable like play credits or show tickets.  Note: pay the extra $10 and go to another buffet.

zmzgfN8yz2MpYBfl1FFv_A.text: Sunday dinner sucks. Totally under whelmed. The items looked good at first sight. The hotest thing on the line was the warmed plates. Every thing else was luke warm at most. The music belonged in a teen dance club. When I asked one of the waitresses to see the manager, and request the music be turned down. The waitress came back and said the manager does not control the music,  someone in upper management does.  The manager never did show up.

nFHUNNRWrj7_vxtYgIskDQ.text: I did not like the person who is cleaning the tables, he shout to us and he wants his tips because his shift ended and we still eating  He want us to finish our food he can get his tips before he leaves that is what we discovered later when we found him so nervous and get us bad looks

-OCsLXDvCxW3_z6mj1Z41w.text: Okay, I can go on and on about this place.  Just believe me when I tell you:  THIS. PLACE. SUCKS.  Worse food ever.

dg977EFyH8F5y3cCW8mbPQ.text: We came here because we heard the food and price was good. It was! We went during the week, I paid $40 for my wife and I. It was worth it!

Oz82aLB8ztRWXpOpJcaraw.text: We did the More buffet at the Luxor on Saturday (brunch).  It was a much nicer buffet.  They had a nice selection of both breakfast and lunch items.    The waiters/waitress should check to see how you are doing during the meal though.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

JCT0pKv1i5DaBrb-Gy81Ng.text: Literally have never been so disappointed by a buffet in my life. Food had been out too long and was terrible. There was about one thing that I could stomach and that was the food at the carving station. Everything else was soggy, dry and or very bland. I will never eat here again. Not even worth the buy one get one free coupon we had.

De7wbLptAlYe-l6XmvArxA.text: Not the same any more. Use to be called the Pharohs Feast, and its called the More Buffet...Should be call the Less Buffet...I use to like the fresh fruits, now they offer canned fruits. Waste of my $20 bucks. The waffle was so hard, I could hv used it for a sponge to wash my dishes. Yuck!

gfWdPy_C4sCNAgNH1HzTSg.text: I don't know why a lot of people seemed to really dislike this buffet. I loved the variety, the price was pretty good (considering we paid one price to eat all day) and the food was always the right temperature. Unlimited mimosas and champagne on the weekends? YES! Who can complain about that? Even the desserts were delicious. The variety enabled us to try some things we've never had before, which was quite nice. No complaints here!

7lTfvqbbQKNvXl645ZvHEw.text: $20 champaign brunch on Sunday. The wallet loved it after the $42 dinner on Sat for Wynn BUffet Dinner The food was ok. Nothing to WOW you....  For the price it was good. NO long line (unlike Wynn) We went around 2.30pm - 2.45pm so we got both brunch / dinner. But believe me not a big difference in variety offood here. The big diference was  removed the eggs items for breakfasta nd added a taco bar...?? and Mahi mahi that was it.   Like the spicy tuna sushi, salad bar ok good but not great, deserts were very good. I think I liked the thuramisu better than in Wynn. good selection of deserts.   unlimited chmpaign, coffee, ice tea included.  overall decent meal for 19.99 .. if you can afford to pay  pay $20 more go to the Wynn Buffet. You will not regret it.

Oynfy9BtHrL5L99nH_uRMQ.text: This is a review of the $14.99 lunch buffet.  More might not have the biggest selections but they cook the simple buffet entrees really well.  Most buffets only do a few things well but More does many things well.  Best Dessert (for a buffet): Creme Brulee (rare to find at a buffet) and why More The Buffet gets 5 stars when others deserve 4 or much less.  The Creme Brulee is worth the price of admission, when you have to pay close to $10 for one serving at a fancy restaurant.  I usually eat $30.00 worth of Creme Brulee when I eat at More.  Best Fried Chicken (better than KFC)...center-cut, double-breasted pieces (even KFC doen't have those premium cuts).    Best Macaroni & Cheese (like homemade)...no other buffet does this better.  Best Watermelon & Canteloupe (ripe & juicy)  Best Fish: Tilapia(well-seasoned) and Snapper  Best Pasta: Alfredo and spaghetti with meatballs...good marinara sauce.  Best Mexican station:  Spanish rice was tasty.  Best Soups: Anything chowder is good  Best Coffee (tasted like gourmet) and goes great with dessert.  Best salad bar spread.  Bottomline, you can pay $10 and eat at numerous 1 or 2 star buffets or you can pay a few bucks more and eat at a 5-star buffet.

aomInvb42MYZF7wKPtSaWw.text: Very shitty buffet... the fried chicken was an insult to me it had no taste same goes for the mac n cheese,asian food. do yourself a favor and go to the MGM Grand buffet way better.

LxZBR650nQsuP7RVYIlsfQ.text: epic disappointment.... although my standards were not high on this one... similar opinion to Gold Nugget buffet heading in....  somehow they managed to really let me down.... food was bad quality, service was subpar and just an overall forgettable experience...   definitely go somewhere else.... you can do a ton better within a 10 minute walk on the strip.....

-UeN7mZTceZZMTIsj00VlA.text: We happen to be in the Luxor around dinner time ,the buffet was 20.00 so decided to try it.All the meat at the carving station was very good,prime rib & turkey.the mashed potatoes were real .not a lot of veg choices tho.some desserts very good with fresh berries ,some not so good like tiramisu.It was worth the money.

DNJpkKM7mk-YSEalV8WVTw.text: we tried the breakfest buffet and wow it was stunning!!  It wasnt as good as TI''s buffet but it was still up  there.  great omelets and breakfest burritos here...the french toast i couldnt put down..it was so good.  gonna check it out for lunch next week.

L1x5VGOy3_x-HKxdnJRhRw.text: Blech!!! Unfortunately ate here twice while staying at Luxor for a conference. The worst buffet in Vegas!! Everything tastes like it was frozen then defrosted and plopped into serving dishes!! Yuck.....lunch offerings were dry and over cooked pork loin, fried chicken  and beef stroganoff. Both my husband an I hated everything that was sampled.....EVEN dessert!! How do you mess up dessert!!!! Well ask Luxor cause they seem to have it down! Sundays champagne brunch was better....only because with all the alcohol everything tastes better!

zqdVj7i8d2BuS5EKCLSJqA.text: I don't want to spend a lot of time talking down about this buffet. I willingly admit to being a general buffet hater, but seriously. There is a such thing as a good buffet in Las Vegas, this is not it.

eVzkDN0hC8o6LTpMDJnDJA.text: We stayed at Luxor for a few days and happen to come across a terrific deal for this buffet. I'm not sure how long it will last but they have an all day pass (10AM-10PM) all-you-can-eat buffet deal for $35 per person, that means unlimited visits for 12 hours, includes unlimited house wine & beer! We ended up hitting the buffets 3 times in one day, by the last visit I couldn't even eat anymore... I was good with a soda, but my friends were drinking beer and hitting the nacho bar lol Now they didn't have any crab legs or anything but I thought it was a pretty good buffet for the price. I will list the foods that I like to eat: French toast, pancakes, waffles, bacon, sausages, biscuits & gravy, corned beef hash, chorizo & eggs, ribs, fried chicken, prime rib, grilled mahi mahi, tacos, nachos, baked potatoes, chili, and the most surpringly good thing was... wait for it... CHICKEN NOODLE SOUP, yes, I know! I'm thinking why would anyone waste their stomach space for chicken noodle soup at a buffet, I mean I wasn't sick with the swine flu or anything, we are in the middle of the desert, it's hotter than heck... but something drew me to the soup, and I'm glad it did, because it was the best chicken noodle soup I've ever had. If I can put it in my my pocket and take it home with me I would. The service is excellent, we had 3 different servers and all were wonderful. We will be back for MORE!

xvPEIHmmsqF1J8biPqlo0Q.text: loved the food for the money you pay great deal i highly recommend this place

7TsPTkSGEXAWTN8uNqcYMg.text: Dont waste your money!  Terrible!  Looked like the food has been sitting there the whole day. Most of the stuff was empty. Service was not good. Complete waste of $$$$....

mY4IDZXccWP-2eNkoyXPdA.text: Not very good buffet. Crab are very small and carving station has small pieces that are thought. Went to Mandalay buffet for lunch and that is miles better for an extra few dollars. Don't waste your money here.  Stations are empty half the time at luxe. Supposedly they have sysco when I was there, there was one plate with about 15 pieces of California roll in it and that was there sushi station. They also ran out of potstickers and other items during dinner and did not replace hem.  Dry poorly run buffet

7Iylct2hVRD41DL0m7JYwg.text: Probably the nastiest food I've had. Coffee is worst than the complimentary coffee at our office. On a positive note; fruit and broccoli  is good.

t12jLs1SwinwKgnxOfMHSw.text: One of the WORST breakfast buffets we have been to... the breakfast at a best western is 100 times better then here... arrived at 830 am paid $43.28 for 2 people, willing to pay the price if the food is eatable... had a decent amount of options, a lot of repeat dishes ie plain scrambled eggs or biscuits and gravy in multiple locations... everything was lukewarm and either hard or chewy. Be aware they ask for a tip when you pay at the beginning but you'll never see a server or busboy after your seated... you have to get your own drinks and be prepared to have a stack of dirty plates on your table if you go back for a second plate (doubtful because the food is so bad)

gOkN5g2eouIGpplIJKc1Rw.text: WoW!  What a waste of time and money.   We stayed at the Luxor and decided to drag ourselves downstairs to the buffet looking for some good food after a LONG Vegas Night but we were thoroughly disappointed.    Brunch is what they call it but I call it Pitiful! Runny runny eggs next to soggy bread trying to pass for French Toast. Mounds of greasy bacon and sausage and some ok pancakes. The hot syrup was the best from that section.   Elsewhere, there was mediocre Asian and Mexican food. There was a randomly placed roll of sushi next to crates of whole fruit. You mean to tell me you couldn't take the time cut the fruit up!?!?    Save Your Money....Eat Somewhere Else!!!'

KGJjkD6H52iOxtaCzdETuA.text: Not much of a selection to choose from and what they did have wasn't very good, we had to ask for the steak because it was hidden away behind the counter, then it was cold, the fried chicken tasted like undercooked shake and bake, and the Asian cuisine was just totally disappointing, the best part of this dining experience was the crab legs, don't waste your time and most importantly your money, thank God my food was free on a voucher or I would've  been really pissed.

7Hq2_ta2StwofmkvSE-5bw.text: Thank you to the amazing staff here at the Luxor!! They were extremely courteous and friendly. We mentioned we were here celebrating our Anniversary and they surprised us with champagne.

apM-EVHqHqvHOPHTCXy14w.text: Worst buffet ever. Terrible food no choices. Overpriced. Good for kids only. Taste like cafeteria food from school.

66QvtRrSaTB-HkrKXQKn0A.text: It's alright.  Great food and awesome customer service they also have a very good buffet bar

gSJNnf_lX7TnH2K-xfgTAA.text: very disappointed with the food. I don't ever go to buffets and this is why. I was comped a buffet because my room was dirty when I arrived and this is more offensive then the mess in my room. This is what it must taste like to lose all your money on the penny slots. Bon Appetit.

r8zGBa4sjF4ji3XrwShHVg.text: I am a big fan of buffets so whenever I get to travel someplace, I always go visit restaurants that offer buffet.  The Buffet at Luxor offers a good number of food variety. I especially liked the chicken tenders by the Kid's section! However, I feel like most of the viands are a bit bland.  The ambiance is a little sad. It was quiet and the decor is very dated. For a wonderful property, this place has potential. Perhaps management should pay attention to this F&B section.

UQYuNFqkyqIu59uWN1xfvg.text: I would of rather went to McDonalds.  Poor selection, the meat carver cut portions so thin had to make several trips.   I would recommend not wasting your money.  Breakfast no better juice machine out no one filling them there are five them go figure.  No coffee cups you think that is something you would want to keep up with.

KVoTyk7YvD89yOk2ug0j9A.text: So  we visited 2 days in a row. One day for brunch in which neither of us enjoyed and than the next day for breakfast which was top of the line awesome.

43Xi1ZvkgBQDpAj5hE6Uxg.text: I come to Vegas on average 2 times a year. I enjoy staying at the Luxor and prefer the Luxor over most locations because of its location. I have a routine that I keep to where I will get the all day buffet at the Luxor which also includes the option to eat at Excalibur's buffet also. The price has always been reasonable and the options plenty at both locations. It is with regret the the quality of food has diminished. They both have excellent breakfast at is still my go to for that. Lunch and dinner has nothing to offer it appears that they try to offer a variety of foods such as Italian, American, and Asian dishes and have failed miserably. I would like to see one kind of food per day with more selections I.e. Monday's American, Tuesday Asian, Wednesday Mexican, Thursday Italian, And then mix varieties Friday thru Sunday since more people stay with kids and would appreciate it. They still have the best service and I would love to see better more positive changes.

A4Z0CXh7-wRn9-xKRoiE3A.text: If you want a good buffet.... Unless you're on an insanely tight budget and just craving a buffet for the fun of variety, skip this. You'll pay double for dinner elsewhere but it will be a million times better.  On the other hand, if you're just going for a fast, four course meal: salad, soup, entree and dessert you WILL find one yummy option in each genre and be satisfied.  Most of the meats were over cooked and tough or flavorless, or both. Fried chicken was good and the chicken Marsala was too. Roast beef was "just okay", the horseradish sauce was weak sadly.  Mashed potatoes were kind of lumpy. Gravy had minimal taste. They only had one vegetable side that I saw, corn with onions???   Pasta dishes were blah but: shockingly they had *awesome breadsticks* and decent pizza.  Mexican station was nice. Nachos were pretty good with all the fixings. Well. Not all. They had no guacamole.  One major gripe: something insane happened to the guacamole (like maybe a kid put something weird in it) and they refused to put any more out even though the buffet was going to be open two more hours. The lady who pointed it out and a few other people nearby were obviously disappointed. It wasn't worth saving the $ on not putting more out to piss like 5 people off.   I skipped most cold/salad options as food born illness is usually found in uncooked food. My fiance tried the ambrosia salad and liked it and wasn't ill or anything.  The tomato bisque was like a jazzed up version of Campbell's but I liked it. Chicken soup was fairly pleasant as was the Mexican meatball soup.  Desserts. They ran out of the only thing I was interested in: pistachio Creme brulee and left the sign out to torture me. Running out so early in the night seems lame. Leaving the sign up to prove it is a fail.   Some cakes were dry (I'm looking at you carrot cake) and others were plushly moist (yes you hot smores lava cake).  They had good drinks (those included in buffet), Mt dew was really fizzy and had plenty of syrup to soda water ratio. Hot chocolate and coffee was available as well as milk and Pepsi products.  Overall, I wouldn't visit again because they didn't have enough well prepared meats or variety of side dishes. However, I don't regret going because we did have plenty of food to nosh on and the smores lava cake saved me from utter dessert disappointment.

AXJ-cDxuVsNbhBHLWGDJbg.text: On our first night in Vegas, my boyfriend, his best friend, and I decided to head to the Luxor buffet to celebrate both their birthdays. Little did we know it was steak night and they had steamed crab as well! The food was so amazing that each of us got a little from every section that they offered. Our waiter was phenomenal and treated the boys to glasses of champagne for their birthday and was very attentive with removing all of our plates and checking on us. For less than $30 this is probably the best buffet I've been to on the strip thus far!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

rp2J0VcyfzZ-IekdvVgPXw.text: I didn't know Friday lunch was brunch, so, they're serving breakfast and lunch.  I didn't want breakfast.  At least the fried chicken is good.  I'm surprised they serve soft serve ice cream and not real one like other buffets in Vegas, even the less fancy ones.

MnPZbxKbPvibANKlQ8zmkA.text: You get what you pay for. Sub-par buffet. Price was cheap compared to other buffets. Selection was terrible and what was available was old and sitting out for some time. We found a hard foreign object in a dessert that we initially thought was a needle. We brought it to the attention of the staff and they confirmed it was a piece of packaging. We did not get a picture of it before they took it away to "examine" it. They did address it and refunded us a portion of our bill. Crab legs were wimpy, picture attached. Two of the chefs were arguing in front of customers. I found this to be very unprofessional and demeaning to the omelette chef. The dessert selection was large in comparison to the rest of the food selection and frankly would have been the best part of the buffet if we hadn't found a piece of hard plastic in it.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

y7kVJCYbyHTMNeZfyEN7xQ.text: Overpriced and not much of a selection.. The seafood and shrimp tasted a bit rubbery the carving section was underwhelming.

XF2QQhr1iqpFBOWGBSnRRw.text: We always come here if we are on a family Vegas trip because the kids love the food.   If I'm on an adult only trip I prefer the bayside buffet at Mandalay Bay. Only because it's classy and has comp drinks. Let me say beer and wine lol.   Here at MORE the kids like the huge amount of breakfast food and the large selection of of different food that they have.   Right now I have one kid eating waffles and breakfast potatoes. The oldest is eating seafood for breakfast. He has had sushi, crab legs, and shrimp.   I had breakfast foods and before we leave I always have a salad.  They have really good salads here.   The prices are good, but my meal is always comped here. Get MyVegas and take a lot of trips to Vegas and get your Mlife card upgraded. It helps when it comes to paying for meals.   When we were at the counter to pay the guy even comped a few beers.   They are super sweet here.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Weekend bunch has mimosas :)
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HnL2PvYVhXNbRpzugrAaDw.text: Disgusting! So gross! Pay the extra couple of bucks and go to a nicer casino. Nothing good, shrimp is soggy, crab legs are so small and ribs are fatty! Chinese Food smelled funny and only thing to choose from were noodles, egg rolls and ginger chicken. Fruit had three options and orange slices were hard and old.

Rzp4BBFUpdk1GdsUqFT19g.text: Just at the Brunch Hour, I found this Buffet. Being  August in Las Vegas, the number of guests was low. The buffet was clean; the staff worked diligently wiping, replacing, and adjusting quantity.  My table was clean.  The price was in line with usual buffets in Vegas.  The beef was just fine, tasty and easy to cut.  Grilled veges were perfect, and their placement right beside the beef was a wise.The salad bar cold shrimp were plentiful but watery. Fruit was plentiful and pleasantly displayed.  Breads were beautiful, but of the two types I tried, both were dry and hard.  Great choice of drinks including milks and 100% juice and the customer could refill. Pizza looked good, but turned out to be cool and the toppings thin with no real taste. I'm a pizza lover, I picked two different, but it was just tomato paste and basil or oregano. Yuck. I gave 3 stars only because of the blah...the routine foods.   But a Huge Negative:  to exit the buffet or to go to the rest room-a person must walk up about six stairs.  Perhaps I missed a ramp, perhaps a disabled person could exit through the entrance?

iIPMaMkSGR-GtaFh2rStCg.text: I don't think there are words really for how bad this buffet is.    Yep, I went back.  Because I like staying at the Luxor and I'm a Gold level player and I get free stuff and I like free stuff...  but this...  is just really getting worse if that is even possible.    I walked around with a plate full of mashed potatoes and was at a loss to find anything else that even looked remotely appetizing.  The one trick I think is to get the fajitas when they first come out - decide if the chicken or the beef looks OK - get some tortillas (you'll have to find them - they're hidden in the back of a station and aren't easy to reach), put on some pseudo-guac and sour cream and make the best of it.    Please...  I implore you.  Do not spend money here.  And if you get it for free, see if you can get a better offer.  I am not even sure this is human-grade food.

aOZ4qDCQqTo6d54-ChG4DQ.text: Giving this buffet 4 out of 5 stars  in comparison to other buffets I've had on the strip before in the same price range. I'm not comparing w/$100 buffets, wouldn't be fair.   We purchased the all you can eat option from 7a-10p only at this buffet.  $40 for adults 12yrs old and up  $27 for 2yrs-11yrs old  However we started our day very late and our first meal was at brunch (11a-3p) which included all u can drink mimosas.  We missed their mini pancakes (I saw the pancake maker put away) & omelette station.   All in all, we've eaten at Circus Circus & Mirage buffets (that are about the same price range) & this buffet was much better than those 2.   BRUNCH was good, your standard. Italian (pasta, pizza) Mexican (nachos, churros, etc) Chinese Food, (pot stickers, fried rice, salmon) American tri-tip, bacon, scrambled eggs, French toast, sausage) salad, cold pasta & fruit & yogurt station. Desserts: ice cream machine, cheesecakes.  Gluten free options & Full size cakes for celebrations were the only desserts behind the counter. UNLIMITED Mimosas!  DINNER mostly the same main courses with a small variety in each section. They added orange chicken, mashed potatoes, gravy, corn, turkey, fish, grilled veggies, sushi, cold cooked shrimp (peeled), an addtnl ice cream machine was opened with coconut & lychee option.  Pros: - Cleanliness (times we were there our tables & chairs/ booths were very clean) & the floors were clean and all buffet areas were clean. - Salad bar options were great and all fresh fruit & salads were green and fresh. Good salad dressings - Family favorites salad bar, bacon & eggs, pot stickers, shrimp, tri-tip (had them place on the grill after carving) desserts: coconut ice cream was delicious! Gluten free apple crumb cake & custard filled cone shaped puff pastry (not sure of exact name) cheesecakes were pretty good for buffet.  Cons: - Wish it was a 24hr wristband all you can eat. Since we started late after 12p, wish it would've ended at 12p the next day.  - I wish they had 1 more protein option during dinner  - wish salad bar had bacon pieces, cold chopped ham or turkey options to add to your salad.  All in all the whole family enjoyed their meals here and would eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tri-tip (asked for them to grill for me), au jus, mashed potatoes, grilled zucchini &amp; corn. Very good!

a1o6XCv1YUU_SZtM5G8DZg.text: This brunch buffet on this day (actually did it 2 days in a row) satisfied the HUNGER.  An affordable price that I didn't mind paying at all. *Complimentary mimosas may have contributed*  The choices can be endless. The tastes are decadent. From pizza to soup to salad bar to my all time favorite the caramel cookies and ice cream at the dessert station! I walked out of here about 5 lbs heavier and I am ok with that. Our server took plates and refilled drinks as needed. They do have a bottomless alcohol package you can add to the buffet. I declined as I was already feeling good.  The Latin choices was pretty delicious. I will return when I am in Vegas again in that area.  Thank you for satisfying my hunger!  Respectfully, Bryan  Oklahoma City

qgTk8rSFLQsbKaNwk0b_iA.text: Runaway. The food has an institutional flavor to it. Crab legs were the diameter of a #2 pencil and tough to crack/peel. You can do better in Vegas than here.

cwyv24wBIamW6-txnaKqOA.text: The atmosphere here is really awesome u feel like you should be hunting for buried treasures of the anunaki or something! I love you at first tho it's gonna be so so cuz the theme is so amped up and you pay for ambiance in most places but I like how the chefs collaboration has a few cultures Goin on basic Chinese, Mexican, Italian, and a great salad bar normally I don't dive to salad like I did but the watermelon radishes were dope taste buds popping from the must have in my house tarragon vinagreta and I the  olive oil infused yes please more.. Thank you very much, N

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

joyNZ24mTDLnxyms7L6qOg.text: This buffet was really disappointing for a Vegas buffet.   I wish I had thought to do a quick walk through before paying for it. The set up looks nice and there is plenty of room to sit but the food is not very good.   We tried everything from the fajitas, and sushi to the steak and potatoes. I think the mashed potatoes were probably the best thing I tried which is very sad when potatoes end up being the highlight of a buffet. There was nothing that I put on my plate that I would have gone back for seconds of. Overall, for a buffet, there really isn't a lot to choose from. It's very spread out over a long area but some carts are empty and other sections are just fillers.   We also tried several desserts. Out of everything we tried the play dough looking brownie and the strawberry cheese cake were the only things we ate a whole piece of.   I give 2 stars because we didn't get sick. That's always a plus! We also had bottomless drink passes for the bar that were worth about $25 for 2 that I earned for free. The bartenders were friendly and fast. The beer, wine and small cocktails earned a star as well.   I've lived all over the county and I've been to some really fantastic buffets so maybe I'm spoiled in my ratings of buffets but I wouldn't ever come back to this one.

-FXCq9pOptEFfzAhOOTn1A.text: I would never and I mean never come here again. $55 for 2 is a fair price for a meal for 2 but yuck.   Sea food tasted OFF  lots of empty dishes. Please don't come here  they could do better. Staff was great

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Empty dishes and coffee was like water

zFGsIA88BhDtOUHk6av2wg.text: I'm a big fan of buffets. It's like a fun place to come and hate yourself when you leave. I was very excited to eat at my first Las Vegas buffet and since I was at the Luxor, I figured why not the buffet at Luxor! I came here Thursday night and the place wasn't very busy. The price was around $45 for 2 and that's not bad for a casino buffet. I'm going to be very blunt here, this buffet is not good. The service was good, the design was good, and the food was just well, not good. My first venture to the bar made me realize that this buffet doesn't actually have that many options (compared to other casino buffets), and that was big disappointment number 1. My second problem was that most of the food I picked up (meatballs, chicken, dumpling, pizza, and macaroni and cheese) was not even warm, in fact the meatball was room temperature. I'm not saying it was all bad, in fact I did enjoy the chicken, although it would of tasted much better if it was actually hot (or at least warm). The steak wasn't terrible, in fact that and the mashed potatoes were definitely the highlight of the visit (although not much of one). For dessert I did get a little mint chocolate chip cup that was pretty alright, though also not that great.   Overall, if you find yourself reading this and looking for a buffet to stop it, you should probably go somewhere else.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Buffet cluster.

MCroMuZL51RdSng6E8uKXA.text: Dear luxor buffet (brunch)... Please don't put NANCY (if that's her real name) in front of the house staff (08/15) specially on the MLife + member line cashier, we were gonna put one star because of her' as we stepped in her rude UNwelcoming face eventhough there's no line behind us, our first time to try luxor aswell. If only we can put 3-4stars for food/dessert and our server we will but we got greeted by oh wait NOY greeted but Showed an unwelcoming face. "First impression last and will always get remembered"

MsSKzThB_uH0JSewSdCllQ.text: Buffet is a meal consisting of several dishes from which guest serves themselves. There are several options one can have while in Vegas. We opted to try the Luxor Buffet.  At Luxor buffet, you get your own drinks...soda, water, iced tea, coffee or chocolate drink. I like the concept because I don't have to wait for the server for refills and I have the option to change drinks at any point of my meal.  It wasn't busy early dinner and yes I redeemed myVegas slots rewards, nothing wrong with that. Weekend dinner cost about $31 which for the kind of food and the quality is a bit expensive. There's nothing special with their food selection and not too many choices, I even think it was designed that way to control wastage. One way or the other we have at one point had more food than we can eat in a buffet setting. Like the crab legs...it was served on to one's plate...eat what you can finish. It wasn't the best but 2 plates wasn't bad haha!  The had a sort of kinda Mediterranean section of hummus, tabouleh, tzantziki sauce and missing the Warah Enab or the stuffed grapes leaves or falafel, kebab or shawarma ...I mean Egyptian food or at least real Mediterranean food.  It has the usual Asian/Chinese section of egg roll, orange chicken and fried dumpling. Italian section of spaghetti, fettuccine Alfredo, and pizza. Mexican section of nachos and cheese, corn, tacos, and shredded beef. They had 2 selection of soup for tonight, chicken noodle and another I can't remember. It has a decent salad bar I must say and has the prime rib, ham, and bbq rib section. The dessert section is always a section of delight for me...they can mess up some but not all dessert...always haha!  The experience wasn't bad nor good. It's ok. We won't make a special trip for it, we're just glad the place was clean.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. After a full tummy exit here
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My dessert plate gone in a snap!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Yup he watches too when you exit

lOpoi7wCd5Y7DTH68PQEoQ.text: My wife and I was comp the buffet at the Luxor for the day. We had the pleasure of eating breakfast, lunch and dinner. Each meal had plenty of choices to choose from. The staff was great and the place was very clean. The best buffet I ever ate at. Great thing we were comp cause this hidden jewel we knew nothing about. If you are ever on the strip in Las Vegas do your self a favor and visit the buffet in the Luxor Hotel.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HlDxSS4tvljAIkFAPNnZrw.text: Lunch Buffet is vry nice , there is italian , mexican , Chinese , American brkfast, Salads, fresh fruits.  My favorites are spaghetti, mac &cheese , teriyaki chicken, tacos. And all desserts. Especially all icecream and cheese cake.  We got our free mimosas . There are coffee & soda vending machines.  Place is vry dim and accommodating . Staff are welcomeing. Overall vry good experience.

Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. More desserts
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

qiEgedSVuUdp1uUeIDiRZg.text: I've been to Vegas so many times. I think I just finished my 12th visit in 11 years. It's either 12th or 11th visit. Anyway...I've tried every buffet several times and there are two I love: Luxor and Flamingo.   The Flamingo only serves breakfast and lunch, but the Luxor serves all three meals (breakfast, lunch, and dinner). Every time I've eaten at the Luxor the quality is the same: tasty, hot, variety.   One of the hostesses, Ida, always knows me, even when it's been a year since my last visit. She takes the time to make me feel special and is a big reason I keep coming back instead of branching out and trying new places.   The chefs are always available to answer questions. Once when there was slim pickings of a popular dish, they told me to wait a minute and brought out fresh. The point being, I didn't even have to ask.   Another time, I got there just as lunch was switching to dinner and they were taking a yummy Mac and cheese dish away. When I came up (looking sad), they took my plate and gave me some.   While there are other buffets that boast over 500 options, or world class chefs, or some other snazzy marketing ploy, the Luxor is consistent with a good price, great people, excellent food. Overall, it's the best buffet on the strip.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream puff with banana
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cream horn
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chocolate eclair

G7KRlXVObc2Y1FhLfI3cpw.text: I was here for brunch.  The variety of foods was excellent.  The service of that staff was great. The buffet it self was super clean, well stocked, and presented well. The Decor is pretty cool to look at as well. I recommend stopping in for this buffet.  PS The brunch buffet has bottomless mimosas.

HrI0mdJW_5w84FPK5AFptQ.text: I am actually thoroughly impressed with the Luxor Buffet.   I had gone here on more than occasion but never during a weekend dinner which is probably why I always thought it was relatively subpar. In all honesty, the food selection is very small in comparison to its MGM counterparts. The truly amazing part, however, is the crab legs! Man, they were so worth it.  If you're a myVegas player, you can use your loyalty points to redeem a comped lunch or dinner here. I highly recommend it since the dinner includes the weekend and costs a very few amount of points to redeem. There's a VIP/handicapped entrance which I believe is likely for those at the Mlife rank of Pearl and above, but I didn't need to use that line since it was pretty empty.   The service was great. From the cashier to the busser to the chef, they were all very friendly and courteous.   The chicken noodle soup was delicious! Definitely one of my favorite selections. Their prime rib was also better than expected but of course, there is better out there. The crab legs were incredibly meaty and very hard to open. In fact, I would argue that these legs were even better than Aria's because they also had Cajun seasoning (and plain if you're not into that).  I had to give them a 5-star review simply because out of all the buffets I've ever been to that have had crab legs, they are the ONLY ones to ever go to the back of house to get white vinegar for me. That is some amazing service!  I would definitely come back here for this very underrated buffet on the weekend and hope that you will get to experience the same thing I did!  (34/100 - 2018)

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. When using the MyVegas BOGO free offer comes out to $17.27 which is cheaper than the regular lunch price of $18.99 plus tax!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Some desserts!

bVS7nTR_RNZ-T5gehzM8aQ.text: Came here while at my stay in the Luxor and purchase the all day pass $40 and you can come anytime same day until 10pm.   Awesome decor and huge buffet They offer salad bar, desserts, drinks, all you can drink mimosas until 3pm, Latin food, Asian, American and a carving station.   It's a carb fest so if that's not what you're looking for, this is not for you. Some of the food items need a bit more authentic flavor...otherwise it's a decent buffet with lots of options and variety.  You get your money's worth for sure.   One thing that bothered me was the cleanliness of the cups, probably the dish washer machines fault but still.

Ze0wNlVAY4NRfwIxX0tguA.text: Hands down the worst lunch buffet I have ever had. 20$+ for very limited choices and subpar food. Do yourself a favor and find another spot for lunch.  You are better off eating a sandwich from the gift shop.

kYiD8iDyp1M0EZKBTYRzsQ.text: I was really hesitant to try the buffet here because I had heard multiple bad reviews. However, after I paid $11 at Starbucks in the resort for my regular ice coffee & croissant and checked the prices at the regular cafe, $20 for a breakfast buffet didn't sound unreasonable. I'm here for the weekend, so it was an additional $3 and includes unlimited mimosas (really not bad for alcohol).   Drinks: non-alcoholic drinks are self-serve from machines. The coffee could be better, but I'm a coffee snob. The orange juice was totally fine and was nice & cold straight from the machine. They also have hot chocolate, tea, standard juices, & soda. The mimosas are served at the bar, but unlimited.   Food: First, I'm here at 8am and they're already serving dinner items like salmon and sushi and full dessert. I guess some people are still up. It just seems peculiar. I got the traditional breakfast items. They have a cook to order omelette station, but unfortunately, it wasn't cooked very well and the egg taste really salty. I did, however, love the veggie frittata! The regular eggs looked pretty sad. The breakfast potatoes are bland. Bacon's ok.   Although, except for the frittata, everything was ok/mediocre, I still feel like it's a pretty good value for the selection & considering it includes champagne or mimosas. I feel like I've paid $20 for more disappointing food. Did it change my life? Would I eat here again if I wasn't staying at the hotel? Absolutely not.

gwDDatlFEKUNjhcckB_SlA.text: We've only had breakfast at the Luxor. The three times we've eaten here we made sure to come as soon as the Buffet opened. I love the omlette bar and I dont like waiting in line so that's why we come early. There is a variety of the usual breakfast foods as well as a fruit & salad bar and a dessert station. I like how the dining area is partitioned so you can have privacy when you eat. I dislike open dining areas where everyone is in your face and watching you eat. Luxor, Bellagio and Mirage are currently my favorite places for breakfast.

-76i5nt7iDuDNfzwdmHWTw.text: Buffet sucks. Its like a bunch of cafeteria food served in warming dishes. Definitely not going to repeat.

9txqlxR_BX2jWsaQWY9fmQ.text: The breakfast I had here ended up being the most expensive croissant I have ever purchased. I'm a vegetarian and we went for "brunch" but there were so few options for me that I had to settle for a croissant and a few fortune cookies. All of the stereotypically hot food was cold and hard. Not recommended.

_mlIbHw6eDdfPaJUMR2X3w.text: I seriously have no clue why there's some many one stars around here. I went with my husband during lunch time and we LOVED it. They have a great variety, their drinks are yummy and fresh and their desserts are just mouth watering. The price compared to other buffets I'd say is extremely worth it!

9YqQUrtlMcgizb6ibvHZLQ.text: Went for the champagne brunch.  Smoked salmon but no wasabi.  Waffles weren't crisp but the bacon was awesome. Can rarely go wrong with Applewood Smoked Bacon.  The variety of food was excellent.  Staff was very friendly and made the dining experience a memorable one.

QZW8RYy_jfLOSZAv37p-vw.text: My husband and I decided to get the wristband deal which allows you to eat at the buffet at the Luxor and at the Excalibur whenever you want until 10pm. It seemed like a good deal, $35 a person for what was lunch and dinner for us. We ate lunch at the More buffet. It was no Bellagio buffet but it wasn't bad. The orange chicken was the best thing out, and it was probably the best orange chicken I've had. There were some taquitos out that looked just like the ones I have in the freezer at home for the kids. The dessert was pretty good, we had some pannacotta and creme brulee.  Overall the lunch was ok and so we were tricked into thinking that the dinner would be much the same. This was a total bait and switch on the Luxor's part as the dinner had things that tasted worse than the crappiest things I was forced to eat as a kid. The sausage was the same that they had out at lunch, I could tell because it was rock hard, and all the salad items and fried rice were from lunch. The sushi had no fish in it only cucumber. I guess because there is also a sushi place in the hotel, and don't want to compete? Not sure. The only redeeming item, the orange chicken, was nowhere to be found. I looked around and all I saw was disappointment. Overall, the dinner food tasted like failure and wasted money. Oh, and I almost forgot, the little hostess woman sat me and my husband at the smallest table, when there were open booths, and we are fairly tall. The paramedics were there treating some lady when we arrived as well; should have taken that as a sign and gone elsewhere. Why don't I ever read yelp BEFORE I blow my money? Much gross So waste Such disappoint  Wow

E6PyXa6CzGvIt-I9FvE_gQ.text: We came here on our vegas trip last weekend and were pleasantly surprised! I'm a huge yelper and check the reviews on everything so I was a little nervous at this one, but I have to say the food was way better than expected.  The crab legs were small but juicy and cooked perfect, carnitas were good, nachos were great especially when you put carnitas on them.  The flan and creme brulee were awesome as were the cream puffs with fresh raspberries. We came right as brunch was ending and dinner was starting so everything was fresh.  Avoid the lasagna and prime rib though both were no good.

b5F8_zzRmoes-y04f80XaA.text: Great for the price great selection clean great desert selection too. Definitely do this one again.

m9QdTsBTdT-cMX6GqaQYGw.text: Awful.  It goes to show, don't ignore Yelp reviews! I went in having read the reviews, but thinking "How bad could it be really?"  ...well...pretty bad to be honest.  We went for the breakfast sitting of the buffet, it's hard to do breakfast wrong, but well this was pretty gross.  The food quality was poor. We'd waited in a fairly long line and it was clear people had come in for the breakfast sitting but at 11am they stopped breakfast, closed the omelette station despite the long line and apparent demand for breakfast.  The staff were very friendly and attentive, but the lack of variety and poor food quality garners the low rating - especially in a city known for its buffets.  I felt bad for going on about how amazing Vegas buffets were to my boyfriend and then this to be his first experience of one. Luckily this was made up for with a later visit to Wicked Spoon in the Cosmopolitan.  Save your money and avoid More at the Luxor. If it's the convenience factor (we were staying at the Luxor) you're better off buying an overpriced muffin and Starbucks coffee, it'll be a lot more enjoyable!

bTKIJquRoVMkzctgobB9vw.text: This isn't one of the best buffets I've had in Vegas, but I play the My Vegas Slots game on my phone and earned enough gold coins to get a buy one get one free pass at the More buffet inside Luxor. My husband and I went during lunch and it was a disappointment. There wasn't that many options so I don't even know why it's even called "More Buffet". I guess I can't really complain because my husband and I only paid $10 each, thanks to my Vegas slots!

HCRmrs7-fvb4aqf6ApJkSA.text: The cashiers and wait staff are very friendly. We were wondering why this was down in the basement.   It's appearance is like a dungeon.  I know that many times people make fun of hospital food but this was worse.  The only thing I can tell you that was any good was the salad and mashed potatoes.  A lot of food looks like it has been sitting there for a long time. The gravy had a film over the top of it. Staff were standing around most of the food stands and you would think they would at least stir the food.  I had the AM and it tasted like paper can like you have been sitting there since yesterday.  Sorry but I would not go there again.

B2GsTtIHfft2LiNU2Fe0pQ.text: I ate here yesterday and the cottage cheese was spoiled! I have never tasted such bitter and sour cottage cheese. Someone could seriously get sick from eating spoiled dairy products. It's very serious that the buffet is not checking their products and looking out for the safety of their guests. I was so disgusted I will never be back to the buffet and because of this experience I definitely will not choose to stay at this hotel. If they put spoiled cottage cheese on the buffet I would hate to see the quality of the rooms. Overall just a very nasty and awful experience.

37B_1zQgPdVbNTR8TElPOQ.text: Hometown Buffet is horrible, but this buffet is even worse. Food was gross, cold and way over priced. The absolute worst part was as we finished our meal we saw a lady clearing and wiping dirty tables. She then took the dirty rag she used to wipe the table, and use that same dirty rag to wipe silverware for the table for the next guests to use. Complained to Luxor and they seem to care less, not even willing to comp us for the money we spent on a meal we ate with forks wiped from a dirty rag. Go to McDonalds, go anywhere else other than here.

U2SDK0opbD-P3UK8gI7Yzw.text: Awful buffet. Was here for lunch today and the food was all fried and disgusting! They even messed up mac and cheese. (They don't even use decent fake cheese)!!!!!  Booths are annoying and uncomfortable.   Overall, it may be cheap but spend a little more for a higher quality buffet.

hNfxW8EJ9s2MXyR6cncrgA.text: Been to many buffets all over and this is by far the worst one for what the cost is. Breakfast was disgusting, everything is cold by the time you sit to eat it. Hometown buffet at home is better than this. Waste of money.

DH2vndZTrh48_iy_E8qs_A.text: This place was just bad. Stayed at the hotel and tried using their $20 off coupon featured in their booklet only to find out after waiting 30+ minutes in line that the coupon is only accepted if you buy the whole day meal deal so having waited so long I bit the bullet and still went with it. Big mistake on my part. Over scrambled eggs, rubbery pancakes,  dry waffles, bland sausages. Maybe I picked the wrong things but just seemed all over poor quality for a meal that's usually hard to mess up. Even the chocolate milk tasted off (how do you mess up chocolate milk!!) would recommend looking up better places.

8dksF56-DNqeDzr4scW-PA.text: Wow! Lots of one and two star reviews. I agree this is not the best buffet in terms of variety and perhaps quality to a certain extent but for its price I would consider that the food here was A-OK.  Well, I can't speak for breakfast or dinner but we ate here for lunch. My partners-in-crime and I were able to have a military discount which knocked off about three dollars off of our meal. Make sure you ask and let the hostess know that you're military or else she won't honor it.  Not much of a variety compared to other hotel buffets that I have been to. Average food here, but not as bad as many of the other reviewers are making it out to be. To me, you get what you pay for and you should have known what you were getting yourself into for its lower end price (by Vegas standards at least). The price for lunch was about $16.00.  My favorite was the BBQ pulled pork and the alfredo pasta. The oreo cheesecake was delicious as well. The food was not terrible and I would consider eating here again. The good outweight the bad overall.

8BgtG51ydPETkdRbSsF5bA.text: Absolutely great. Loved the Saturday brunch. They had a fair selection with great tasting foods and bottomless mimosas to top it off. No complaints here.

VijQtmkboM1R21QOxNWa3w.text: Waste of your money. Crappy food. Better go to in n out and eat a cheeseburger. Highly overrated.

ZyifCv4Xml5PObKaeMT-Gw.text: One star because I have to. This is the worst buffet ever, seriously. $22 a person. Nothing labeled correctly, nothing at the carving station, dirty, rude staff. By far the worst food and dining experience in Vegas. Avoid this place like the plague.

W-wmPO__ZrTXguNVHvMaUA.text: Worse buffet ever!! The one star is for the staff and the place was pretty clean that's it!!!
