IvHfXrf0nZXC2bTz-PtfpA.text: So I went to LV for a few days just to get away from it all andI didn't want to spend too much money, but I also didn't want to eat garbage fast food! I looked up some popular buffets and saw this one so I decided to come here for dinner and give it a try! I think it doesn't deserve the two stars it has now! At the very least it deserves three stars, because compared to many other buffets in the area, this one isn't all that bad! It's a clean buffet with a good variety of foods and desserts! My favourites have to be their grilled beef steak and roast beef! Of all the food choices, The Latin section was pretty good! They had this beef flank steak which was So good! They had a good variety of seafood including crab, shrimp, and mussels, but they weren't that great (not a seafood type of guy)! I also tried out the made to order pasta, and I found it to be worse than cafeteria pasta. Overall, this buffet is pretty good, and is definitely worth the price! If you want to have a good, satisfying meal without giving an arm and a leg, give this place a try!

kYMkh1_i3Ju4G1NCKJqHKA.text: Let me preface this by saying I got the all day buffet for free, and normally it runs $38. And free food always tastes anywhere from 2-2.5x better than food you pay for.   Our first day in Vegas we hit up the Studio B Buffet at the M Resort, so needless to say More at Luxor was a step down...literally because the place is located in the basement of the Luxor. That said, it is easily the best food I've ever eaten inside of a basement.   If you stick to the normal food here, it's hard to find much to complain about. First we had the breakfast buffet and the sausage, eggs, bacon, and omelette bar were solid and great for filling up to start the day.   There were only two things on the breakfast buffet that were so bad I couldn't swallow a bite: the biscuits and gravy, and the sausage and egg "burrito." I don't know what was inside of that so-called burrito, but it damn sure wasn't anything I would ever use at home. The biscuits and gravy was more bland than disgusting, and after a night of downing straight shots of tequila with no problem, it should say a lot that I didn't have the courage to take more than one bite of their hard biscuit or nasty gravy.   For dinner, it's pretty much standard Hometown Buffet or Golden Corrall food. Nothing here is going to blow you away like you would find at Wicked Spoon or Studio B, but  there are a few tasty items to be tried. First, the Buffalo Shrimp are pretty amazing. I've never had Buffalo Shrimp but I had to have eaten 2 plates of the shrimp alone. Second, the carved turkey was very good and paired with the mashed potatoes and gravy, I have to say was surprisingly Thanksgiving-like. So definitely some decent food for dinner to be had but there were more than a few duds.   The pizza - Imagine if Digiorno came out with a new pizza called "Flavorless." That's More's pizza in a nutshell. The crust and texture were Digiorno, but the sauce and everything else tasted like moist paper towels.   The Chicken - I don't know how you fuck up chicken because it has to be up there with scrambled eggs on the list of "The Most Impossible Foods to Ruin" but More manages to do a great job at doing a poor job preparing chicken. Tons of fat, no flavor, gooey texture, etc. It tasted the way I would imagine chewing on a human kidney would be.   So all in all, More is great if you can get it at a discount and stick to basic foods offered in order to recharge your batteries and get something in your stomach. However, if you're spending the full $26 to get int he buffet, I would suggest the extra $14 at Wicked Spoon or heading down the road to Flamingo's Paradise Buffet for the same price.

ZMWp5dQso8-IvkzO5_mNPA.text: If you love Hospital Food eat here, didn't like the food, not eating here again. Came for dinner. The food wasn't so good it didn't really have flavor it was bland. Maybe they should spice up menu or get a new cook.

jcLUlfTrpShDvXjAUJSLrA.text: We attended a lunch Buffett and the flavors were amazing. The roasted turkey and the orange chicken were way good. Staff was nice and it was clean. Thank you

PDKVgrOBAo7GmgJdGbkyDg.text: If you've been following my recent review rampage, you'll see that I've been extremely generous in doling out 5 or 4 star reviews. But let this be the combo breaker I've been waiting for in months.  It all started with a random meet up with my friends, we've been planning to go to Vegas for tomorrow morning. Our schedules left us doing nothing that night, so we all unanimously agreed with a simple "F*ck it" and took the trip that night. I still think back on that weekend, it was one of the best vegas trips of my life.  My lowest point was the morning of, we woke up and decided to get a breakfast brunch. We stayed at the Luxor, and considering the temperature outside was between "Melting your face" and "Heat Stroke time", we didn't want to travel far. We got to the buffet and it was surprisingly empty. We got our table, overpaid our buffet meals because it was a hallmark holiday *Mother's Day* and tried out the food. The food was pretty bad.   Yeah there you go, I give great detail into the background about how we got there more than the food. I mean what do you expect from me?   The food sucked, pasta was bland, the international foods were crap, the desserts were ok, and the ham was awful. Why do I have to mention the ham? Because there was no meat left, and I kept telling my friends that the ham sucks so bad they loved it and turned it into a little inside joke. They keep wanting me to "Try the ham" at every restaurant we go because of it.   Go here if you lost money from gambling so you can feel like twice the sucker.

X2PRjEnxsMrpwOgMP_Tq5Q.text: Was there for breakfast. First off, we waited at the cattle chutes at the entrance took FOREVER before a hostess finally came to release the rope to herd us to our table. Went to the breakfast area, there was a decent assortment of standard breakfast fare as well as a 'design your own omlete' area. The line for omlettes was ridiculously  huge. Pretty much everything we put on our plates tasted pretty institutional and plain. The grits was the only thing that was actually good. Definitely don't think it was worth $16. I think there should be a half price option for those that do not want an omelette .

m7kGzXkjEvDCCMBAchl__w.text: While I have no aspirations to become a professional Las Vegas buffet critic, I'm fairly certain that this was a graduated step above what middle school cafeterias serve for lunch on an average Wednesday.   I suggest going to Golden Corral or Fresh Choice. The food is likely better and about half the price. Go there instead.  Beyond this, the interior was a dismal cross between your discarded Denny's furniture from the mid 1990s, the interior decorator of a pyramid and the lighting expert of a haunted house.

uHcRS3yk7HbtofSlC0IBag.text: It's not bad, but it's not great. It's like a step or two higher than Excalibur's buffet.  The good:  There was edible food. Somewhere.  The food that was out was okay, nothing stood out as yum, but nothing stood out as blegh. I guess that's what we're all aiming for these days.  The bad:  They ran out of nearly everything. Keep in mind, I was there at the beginning of dinner and that really shouldn't be a problem.   I felt like the ceiling was going to just fall down. And why the hell is it so gloomy and dark in there? I get it, we're in a pyramid, but I'm trying to eat, not feel uncomfortable.  They sat us right next to the kitchen door, even though there were plenty of tables and we asked to be seated elsewhere.  Still, you're better than Excalibur. Give yourself a high five!

faJyqNooFm0eUEZ4O_gcGw.text: PEGGY IS AMAZING if she is there please request her as a server. Made my experience 10x better

vj7EX1yd9m7FvzdfC13now.text: I have been to a lot of buffets here in Vegas this one is not good at at all for breakfast nothing tastes good in my opinion you are better off going to grab breakfast from the food court, but if you are looking for good buffets go to the bellagio or Wynn. The one good thing about this buffet at the Luxor is the staff is really nice from the interaction I had with them.

_QrnCGmhx0cONH_vaIHpVQ.text: Overpriced buffet.  On top of this since they monetized parking, it costs $5 extra to eat here.  The same things repeat on the buffet stations so they have 25% of the selections of Golden Corral.  And they are hitting you for a tip up front when you pay and suggest 20 or 25 percent.  Not paying $7 to be led to the worst seats in the place and me stuck self servicing.

R85WsHLtUbOUZBulvRUouw.text: It's not terrible, but its certainly not good. It's a bit pricey but its Vegas, and most people who come to the Luxor have money to burn. When I went, I bought an all day pass (just a wristband) for $35. This just meant I could come any time that day and eat as much as I want.  Honestly? After the first time of stuffing myself for breakfast, I ate little to nothing when I went for dinner. It's not worth it to get it if you don't think you can eat multiple times throughout the day, in my opinion. The food isn't amazing, but it is convenient if you're staying at the Luxor.  There's different foods that they classify as Mexican, American, Asian, etc. They also have a lot of desserts and soft serve ice cream. A salad bar (which I never visited).   What can you expect from a buffet? That's really all there is to it! It's a typical buffet that I could've done without. I didn't hate it, but I didn't love it. If I had a choice, I wouldn't choose to go here again and I definitely would not get an all day wrist band again. I recommend it for anyone who just wants convenience, and knows that this is just typical buffet food.

iEJ2lZM_7Zysj0NXsUgeAA.text: This was a no frills cheap buffet, with surprisingly decent food and quality.  You wont find anything special here but it was better than eating in the food court. Prices are pretty low as well.

lowAKXneplmzFFJgob4Lqw.text: Had breakfast there a couple days ago using free rewards from MyVegas. Lots to choose from, and everything tasted okay. Not terrible, not amazing, just average quality breakfast food.

cDFfvs4Uh-b5yKqUUOr__g.text: More The Buffet at Luxor was one of the worst buffets I have ever had the displeasure of visiting.  There are so few items in the breakfast buffet.  For $16 a person, it is really ridiculous that there are just a handful of things from which to choose.  I dished out the most watery Cream of Wheat I have ever had.  There was not much else for me to eat.  The french toast was stale, even when I got a piece from the new tray that was being opened as I waited.  It made it too hard to chew for my daughter.  It was barely digestible to me.  There were no positives to this buffet.    And, the waitress was nowhere to be found to clear dishes for most of the meal.    If you MUST eat at a buffet on this side of the strip, Mandalay Bay and Excalibur both have more and better offerings.  Excalibur's breakfast buffet was $1 cheaper and was at least five times as good as More.  I left More in complete disgust.  I will avoid it completely in the future.

p9aPUp4F3Cb6F7UgLbmp5w.text: Ask for fresh eggs. I didn't know I wasn't eating fresh eggs until I heard a guy ask for some and they broke out the whites and cracked 'em in the pan.

e58Oh8_xc5gBRa-0SNS1LQ.text: Came here for lunch exactly at 11:00 am. On a Monday. There was a lot of choices, food was pretty good the only thing I didn't like was that they took a while to bring out lunch there was still breakfast items. Decor is cool and the employees were nice. I will come back.

-ev8yvuK4TBTT5-Oqhltww.text: Don't get me wrong, there are plenty of options, the problem is the options don't taste very well. This review only goes for the breakfast buffet.....I personally only enjoyed the plain scrambled eggs. The sausage links and bacon was was greasy I could oil my scalp with it if it called for desperate times.

7gk7w4zW03Ts3lnTmT3E1Q.text: Cold crab legs ugh. Me and my sis were so disappointed the only thing good is the steak otherwise this buffet sucks I knew because it was in the luxor it was going to be good. NO DESSERT SELECTIONS AT ALL. Like 1 or 2 items thats it ....a waste of my $30 you live and you learn.....

vJrJWACXfrBOYPcqTvuShw.text: First off, I want to know what kind of royal buffets some of these people are going to. MORE is by far one of the best buffets I've been to.  My husband and I went for a Friday lunch. We got there about an hour and a half after they opened and we thought it was going to be busy already. We walked right up, paid and were seated. I love the layout of this buffet with all the side dining areas, I mentioned to my husband that there were a lot of people here but it was so quiet. They have it spaced out that it really reduces the noise level and you don't have to yell at the person sitting across from you.  The place was clean, we didn't see anything on the ground or food on the counters. The employees were making sure the food didn't sit, they were walking around stirring and changing out spoons. Usually when I go to a buffet I pick up a couple of plates that are still dirty and put them to the side, not once for either of us.  Our only complaint was the gentleman at the meat counter, my husband said 4 times pork sausage and the guy repeated it and then cut him a piece of turkey and was trying to hand it to him. I ended up taking, I wanted it anyways but he got an attitude when my husband told him, "No thank you, I had asked for the pork sausage." Then when I came back to get another piece of turkey he was standing chit chatting with a woman and he watched me walk up and he stayed there for about 45 seconds to finish his conversation. He never greeted me and said he would be right over, just stared at me when I walked up. Very rude. Had he said he would be right over I wouldn't have taken a point away from them.  Other than that, all of the food was cooked properly, everything was presentable, everything was clean, and for the most part the employees were all nice and greeted us.

umWd37FMiXWgxHuvpCqGig.text: We always stay here when in Vegas. Love this buffett, bottomless mimosas, the food was good...The luxor buffett gives you bang for your buck!!! My mom enjoyed it too...

lInxSAJAnEPq1d0ti3nlKA.text: The salad was crisp and pretty good. The mashed potatoes were warm and buttery. The rice was dry and inedible, the sushi was dry and old and the taco bar was just disgusting. Things were running out and I was scraping the bottom trying to get most toppings. When I asked about replenishing, the staff was gruff and not accommodating. I was excited for dessert but it was dry and tasteless too. Not a good experience for $25. First time I've left a buffet hungry.

GwUAU1rBhLwUHxCo1hJg8w.text: We went here for Thanksgiving Buffet with our youth football team. My expectations were definitely not high. We waited in line for a bit...it went relatively quick. They accommodated our large party to a room in the back which was very nice for us to all be together. The food- I was pleasantly surprised. The food was very good. Fresh and everything that should be hot was hot and cold was cold....meat was perfect, seafood tasted very good and the desserts were super yummy. I would do this buffet again. Keep in mind- the place was busy so food was turning over quickly. I cannot say for just a normal dinner buffet where food may not be changed out as quick- but I would do this again for next years tournament. Great job Luxor on this holiday buffet.

pdOSeSqKYtExdOPKSG0hgQ.text: My husband, his sister and her boyfriend and I all went to eat at the buffet a hour and a half before it closed. Not a good time to go some of the food looked gross because it was siting there for a while is my guess. The staff wasn't being attentive they were cleaning up or just not around. The food was overall ok there mash potatoes were good, the meats were good I enjoyed the turkey. The desert area was pretty much empty, but again they were closing soon. I did get a chance to try the tiramisu pudding and I liked it. Not the worst buffet but due to the time I attended my experience wasn't so great. I would not recommend you to go late to this buffet, but on the other side this is a more affordable buffet.

DwTT46x0iFjkhl02J16wPA.text: We ate here for dinner before we watched the Blue Man Group  Food was mediocre.  They could charge less and I'd probably give them another star.  Though, I've ate at local Chinese restaurants that can probably outdo this place.  There's nothing else I remember that was good about this place.  I guess I'll come back and write something if I remember.

LchKTqB1Tp_QV9gTtd2GBw.text: This is your place to go if you don't mind spending a little more than on the cheap,   but the ambiance and cleanliness is much better than a place like The Orleans buffet,  which it's a cheaper option.    The desserts are the best thing about this buffet!  They had a wide assortment of creamy goodness concoctions like deconstructed canolli, and surprise cake flavors at the bottom,  like red velvet and chocolate.   The gluten free chocolate torte was to die for.  The soft serve ice cream was very good,  although there were not a lot of toppings available.   The savory food was tasty too. ..I loved the fresh salad bar and my kids loved the variety of hot dishes.   We were there right around 11:30, so there were still some breakfast options out.   My husband thought the bacon was cooked perfectly.   They have a large variety of salad,  pasta and other.  My favorite was the kale salad.

9PM75ufRXz1l-vxpOZeKHg.text: Just say no to More, as in No More!  No More! Perhaps the WORST buffet I've ever had.  I was short on time, so I ducked in for a quick bite, but in hindsight, I would've been better off eating discarded gum on The Strip than eating at More.  The food tasted like it was re-heated from frozen grocery stock and was either bland or cold or both.  The only thing I found that I could stomach was the fried corn (oh, and the fortune cookie because it was packaged in plastic).  I think the cooks (if you could call them that), should be forced to eat every meal there (and pay full price for it) until they realize that people shouldn't be eating this dog food.  Better yet, I would fire them all as well as the manager for being rip-off artists.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Don&#39;t go down there.  It&#39;s a dungeon of culinary horrors.

cKLR0dDQxY9gPb4JimGWyw.text: Had a free (comp'd) breakfast buffet. Options were pretty limited and the quality of the food was not great. We didn't have to wait too long, but there are much better options in nearby casinos.

0xncMBsl9NMpQSJjOaJANw.text: Formerly Pharoah's Pheast.  Definately spacious dining area.  But the food was just OK.

-emAPM544tX98kK1b_R8IQ.text: The cashier ANH TU N was very helpful, and respectful! The food was also great and the Omelets amazing!

azfeJwsUI-afjFTzYsFJdQ.text: I was here last week with my girlfriend. As a person with dietary restrictions buffets are usually something I avoid, mostly due to the tremendous headache I get from having to be bounced around from person to person trying to figure out what I can eat without getting sick. THIS EXPERIENCE WAS COMPLETELY DIFFERENT... I approached the head chef, William, who just happened to be out on the floor. Within the first few seconds of our exchange I knew I was in good hands. He literally took me on a walk through of every single dish out on the floor and explained to me which dishes would fit my needs. He was knowledgable on food items permissible to my particular diet. Alongside this he had extensive knowledge of every single item on the floor. These two traits combined with his overall attentiveness and welcoming attitude made this buffet experience absolutely amazing. If you are reading this William, thank you so much! I'll be back in January   P.s. It goes without saying that the food was AMAZING especially the stir fry

WL9LVkAUpwvnkFJBq24_yw.text: It's ok...OK price...some good things....some bad...I hate it's Bachanaal or wicked spoon or nothing...no middle class in vegas..

ev_CvGGCBcfEKtUlGCaXvw.text: not too bad actually. i thought it was a little pricey for a breakfast at 16.99. but, they had some good stuff. they had all kinds of american breakfast faire including the ubiqutous omelet station. they also had some special salads section that had caprese and asian slaw. nice change of pace after eating bacon and cornbeef hash the first round.   some old dude passed out twice here while trying to make it to the bathroom. he ended up throwing up all his food. poor old guy. i was fine, i stopped eating after that obviously. just saying.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast

7ILRsr-x5YCBvzTx0fGJAQ.text: HORRIBLE. NOT EVEN WORTH IT. We went for dinner on 12/23/15 Reminds me of Buffalo Bills a very low budget buffet. Yuck. Can't believe we wasted money here

0vSd85VP5HzP6W1Ip9Z-eQ.text: Food here was pretty awful. Bad texture and it tasted pretty bad.  I didn't try the omelet bar so the food there might have been better.   Even trying to get in we had to wait in line while the cashier argued with some customers on whether meal was going to be comped.

P9zuvyFsxQEd6qZXXokwzA.text: The food is terrible. There's not a lot of selection. It was $28 a person for dinner and I barely ate because it was just gross.

u7ggyJoDPMSozbnYTUbulA.text: The worst Vegas buffet I've ever had. Had breakfast and supper comped through an online game I play. Breakfast was bad but since I had a comped supper I went back hoping for the best. Boy, do I regret it. Very minimal selection of plain, unseasoned, cheap food. Cafeteria food at best. The meatloaf and meatballs were flavorless and had absolutely no texture, didn't resemble hamburger at all. It was like eating a flour dumplings or something. The only items that were halfway decent were the ginger soy chicken and the carrot raisin slaw. Usually dessert is my favorite part of a Vegas buffet,  but this junk was cheap, whipped cream filled horrible tasting crap. Wouldn't go back to this buffet for anything. Give me the Rio, Golden Nugget, or Gold Coast buffet anytime!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No taste or texture. Minimal selection. Did like the carrot raisin slaw and the ginger soy chicken. Everything else was yuck!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Everything just tasted like whipped cream. No real taste.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. No taste eggs, waffles had a weird, sweet, cake batter like taste. Not good stuff!

j9GIyoGcxdkbfqtGgoZ6SQ.text: Poor selection for a buffet place. Food was cold, and the food looked absolutely un-appeasing. There was basically no server to help us... Drinks are self served also and lunch was supposed to be 10:30, but started at 11.. the teriyaki chicken was also cold. Overall, wouldnt imagine coming back here when there is bachannal and orhef good buffets around. I only gave 2 stars if it wasnt for the desserts... wouldn't recommend to anyone!

KfjxhyJQnNuJy_wu2V2VAg.text: This buffet used to be THE BUFFET, the place that you had to go when you came to Vegas, now it's one the worst buffets in town, what happened?

FRMvA6yO5Uwo8W2ATgcQfw.text: The food, while bland, wasn't bad. The end result, however, was the 1-star-o-matic for this.   I'll grant that the buffet here is cheap (especially compared to LVH's), but there honestly didn't feel like that many decent food selections.   The ice tea sucked but whatever. I WAS just going to write it off as another 2-star, but then came the gas.   So. Much. Gas. And it all hit me when I was on the casino floor, so thank God I was able to get to a bathroom, lest they need to drop air freshening bombs as a result. I had more gas than a Chevron station!   Part of me thought it could have been something else, but after reading another review complaining about gas, I know that More is the guilty party.   To think the Luxor (Which in itself is a nice place) was on my bucket list. Still, I shall not venture anywhere with a buffet that causes nuclear digestive explosions, and neither should you.

M6Anz8kdM2u5-xgFr93Abw.text: Came for Saturday brunch and was pleasantly surprised. For 21.99 it is well worth the money. The selection and variety was great. Desserts were very tasty. Service was also on point. Will definitely come again. I don't understand why the low reviews by others. It's not fancy shmansy like the Aria but it is tasty and economical.

ceNqygttb_75jQCCYBOOMg.text: Disappointed. I know this place isn't aiming to be a Michelin rated restaurant, but I came here a few years ago, long enough that the MORE name was fairly new (previously it was "Pharaoh's Pheast," at least that's what I hear)- Remembered it being decent, basically a step above the neighborhood Golden Corral. On this return trip, the best I can give it is "Mediocre". The selection was a bit underwhelming, and several items just weren't good, and that's after accounting for the fact it is a casino buffet. Some "lowlights"- The steaks were full of gristle, the sushi rice was gummy and over vinegared, the gratin potatoes were bland and oily, and the sweet/sour chicken basically tasted like someone cut a chicken sandwich patty into pieces and covered it with watered down generic sauce. The one bright spot was the dessert, and I'm not sure if that was just because everything else had disappointed me so. Doubly insulting was the fact we paid an upcharge due to it being NYE. I likely won't be back anytime soon, even if I got a comp. Like I said earlier, I don't expect gourmet food, just markedly better than I'd get at a chain buffet.  And somehow they failed in that. :(

aQ7a35vmzzv9MLypAYu3lg.text: Had a pilgrimage to Vegas a couple weeks back and my stay at the Luxor yielded a free meal with More Buffet. I showed up during the weekend brunch and I have to say that it was a pretty good spread.  They had a large breakfast selection, decent non-breakfast items, and (most importantly) endless mimosas. How can you go wrong there? The balance of champagne and orange juice was just right, it was great conversation with friends, and it was followed by a wonderful gambling experience. Can't complain when it's free. Really, I can't complain at $19.99. Kudos.

9stPM6-qskJdv3OAgpBZ9w.text: This place is fine.  Has good variety, salad bar is above average.  Has crab legs, carving station, Mexican, Asian, and Indian food.  I don't see why the reviews are so low.  Yes the Wynn Buffett is bigger but, it's less than half the price.  I was satisfied and compared to the other restaurants in this casino, thought is was a good value.

PvTzyLP6lErm0N0Uym94lw.text: The food and selection at the buffet are good, but the staff are not as good as at Excalibur. There is a line for VIP, rewards members, and day passes, but they make them all wait in the normal line due to staffing.

UP9l0kRama4ZYrOEbge8lQ.text: Very disappointed, pizza was not cooked all the way through. Three times I stood at the turkey carving station and no one came to help me.

HR1hhGrnY8kzBHj0AFGE3w.text: Convenience brought us to this buffet, two weeks ago on vacation.   Let's just say from this point on I'm going to call it "THE BUFFET THAT TIME FORGOT."    Sure, it looked like nice food ... but it was completely tasteless.  Seriously!  Devoid of any flavor whatsoever!  It's a sad thing when you pay $17 and the most flavorful thing you experience is the bowl full of watermelon chunks.    I remember a time, many years ago, when the Luxor was a pretty decent buffet for the price.  Those days are gone.  Spend a few extra dollars are go somewhere else.

g52lJS3tMsvgnbf33m3shw.text: Hey, it's a Vegas buffet - what do you expect - Home Town?  I expected a ton of food - warm or cold as appropriate  - good tableservice - and this place delivered on all counts. Can't remember the prices - probably around 20 bucks - but what the hell it's a place to go for a lot of food without the pretentiousness of most Vegas restaurants.  Added bonus - it was well removed from the casino floor. So the smell of smoke was not in all objectionable - like other places that have the buffet right next to their casino.

XxU7MKERbN1ymRgHnee3Qg.text: This place sucks.  The place was 2/3 full and we still had to wait about 30 minutes to get through the line to be seated.  I made a round and they had a lots of empty trays.  With what I did get, it was cold and flavorless and just poor quality.  I went back for a second trip to try some different items and the results were the same.  Deserts were the best part.  The buffet at Sizzler is better and that's saying a lot.  Definitely not worth the $24.

IzixMdYMLT6lp-49d33aRA.text: For breakfast, it wasn't bad, but wasn't great either.  Everything seemed just greasy, and being that it's located in the basement of the Luxor, not much for ambiance here.    My suggestion - spend the extra few bucks and head over to Mandalay Bay.  Better food and they have windows there.

5ypWZctvS7dveBpxKVDKjg.text: Sunday champagne brunch had unlimited mimosas. Otherwise, food is better at other Vegas buffets. Also why does the cocktail shrimp still have skin on?

23oCzXAkFIDBA4x3CaMjCg.text: My fiance and I went to the Bodies exhibit at the Luxor. We planned to then go over to The Wicked Spoon in the Cosmopolitan for dinner, as it was highly recommended. However, we felt we might be pressed for time, so we decided to stay at the Luxor and go to More instead.   HUGE mistake! The buffet is way overpriced and the food is not even Golden Corral level. The Teryaki salmon was dry as chalk and I stopped at one bite. My fiance found her breadsticks stale and her wine cheap tasting. We were kicking ourselves the rest of our vacation for not taking our frends' advice.   Avoid More at all costs!!

EOpC2kigwT2vQXGcVfPqCg.text: What was I thinking to eat here without reading the other reviews. Yep this place has earned its low rating with other Yelpers.  Every soup and sauce they had they felt they had to have meat in it. With a poor selection of food choices that left me, the vegetarian, with. My meal consisted of bread and some salad.  Whoopee.   Vegetarians BEWARE- you can ask the workers if there is meat in something and they will say no.  Example I asked if the egg drop soup was vegetarian, she said "Yes"  I said oh so it has a vegetable stock base, she said  "no Chicken".  Last time I checked Chickens were made of flesh.   Then at the Pasta station the only sauce they had was bolognese, I was pretty sure I saw meat in it, but  I asked anyway.  I said is that vegetarian, she said "yes" to which I replied so there is no meat in it.  She said "no,meat there is BEEF in it".  Ok so I guess Beef like Chicken is not meat...........  Hubby, the meat eater, did not like his choices either.  Our first and last time to ever eat here.

mQHphctOsXNZU2eK39jJRw.text: If i spent almost the same amount of money.! This place definitely is not my choice. Food choice and quality r bad.! Dont waste ur money.!

ZR6MOL26dvDJezJ1IbamXQ.text: The breakfast buffet was okay. There are much nicer buffets in Vegas for the same price. Try the Bellagio buffett, it is wonderful! This buffet did have an omelet station, which was nice. The bread pudding was great and there were a variety of juices to choose from. The rest of the food was mediocre.

W7p0UCIhDg305fwKer2rzQ.text: Coffee sucked ass! Bagels I took home because they were so hard I could beat the kids with them.....lol

Kqd2Y42wRDPoKTWb9bNstQ.text: Not impressed. We paid 50 for two people so it wasn't bad but the food wasn't very good and the selection wasn't very big. Most of the food was or had shellfish which I couldn't eat so I only got to enjoy ham and mashed potatoes. The dessert bar is the best part, there is a large variety and lots of cheesecake! The service was very poor. When we walked in the woman who seated us decided to tell me I don't need a high chair instead of ask, and I did in fact need a high chair. And when I went to get dessert for my husband and I one of the workers was hovering over me and rudely asked if he should just go get me a bigger plate. I had two pieces of cheesecake and a cookie...

L3XozAwKNtqCSStDIhRAog.text: Surprisingly good food and good value as well.  Went on a Monday afternoon and got in for $20 per person before taxes before 4pm.  The salad bar was the highlight of the buffet.  Winter root salad, hummus and baba ganush, and various other cold foods were perfectly made.  Sea food included shrimp and mussels, they were good.  The sushi and sashimi were just ok, but probably because I eat those too much.  From the hot foods I got fried chicken and prime rib, both delicious.  I noticed the staff checking the food temperature, a plus in my book.  Some parts of the buffet I didn't sample was the Mexican food section, they had pozole and tamales but wasn't really in the mood for that.  The soup seemed to be a basic chicken noodle and another veggie soup I didn't try as well.  I did try various other Asian hot foods and they were all very good.  I ate a lot and got a single chocolate chip cookie for dessert.  Entry includes soft drinks, milk, and coffee.  Staff appeared friendly.  Overall I would definitely recommend this buffet, even at $25 I think it's a value compared to the more expensive buffets I've tried.

vwGN2LpWDzKxRUtLRz3HZw.text: We love the buffet at the Luxor. Sure there are fancier places on the strip but when you have a family of five the Wynn just ain't the destination besides which I don't think they want kids there anyway. At MORE a kid for $20 and an adult for $24 is not bad for a good all you can eat. The kids just love the endless choice and the desert station. The carvery could do a better job with the meat quality but that would be our only complaint. Beyond that the kids have Mac and cheese, pizza, panini, Chinese food etc etc.  Worth the try if you are nearby but wouldn't necessarily travel to it. They have a great all day deal to eat at this buffet and Excalibur for 39

opbWFUPx5DEJQjJ5_cxGDg.text: While the Luxor works well as a hotel and a casino, it fails miserably as a place to eat.  Their buffet should be avoided all together unless unlimited champagne really means that much to you.    The food selection was extensively American and extensively bland.  Reflecting back, there were no memorable dishes at all.  It was clear that inferior ingredients were used where possible to keep the overall cost to a minimum.  Even the omelet station offered up wounded omelets.  Any Embassy Suites in America has this place beat for breakfast.  Alas, there is the champagne.  Bottomless, but the quality of the champagne is hardly worth the effort.  I would have been much happier buying a bottle or two of Veuve and staying in the hotel room with my girlfriend.    Probably the worst buffet in Vegas -- avoid.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QaPRxcibkzncSUx4tlzRxg.text: Solid buffet. Not a top tier but it isn't trying to be. Pay attention to which line you're in, because if you're a card holder or MyVegas player, there's a different line for you. The other people waiting will simply stand in the main line because they think they should, even though they can go to the much shorter, quicker line because they have the card.  Best surprise at this buffet was the yogurt bar, and the other was probably the coffee. The coffee was way better than it needed to be. Bold, smooth, fresh. This buffet is a really good value.

dg9LZ8icCzufMN-HfbbdvQ.text: I had the opportunity to get a free Breakfast buffet with the myVegas Rewards. I got to the buffet at 9:30 am. The breakfast offerings is primarily breakfast items plus a full array of Mexican dishes which stay on the line all day. Pizza is also available at breakfast a well as through out the day. These items were all average in quality. At 11:00 am the breakfast items start disappearing and lunch fare is replaced including Fried Chicken  mashed potatoes and gravy plus the carving station is open with ham, beef and Turkey. The beef roast was excellent. The roast Turkey tasted like Thanksgiving. The fried chicken tasted like mine at home too..a Banquet TV dinner. Sushi was added and some seafood. The deserts also expanded when breakfast turned to lunch at 11:00. The bonus is getting there early for the cheaper breakfast and rolling over to lunch. As a my Vegas rewards comp it was well worth it. As a $19.99 cash breakfast not sure it's worth it..unless you roll over at 11:00.

xLc7aEzee955oKEVxGA8ew.text: Stayed at Luxor on our recent trip to Vegas and thought we would try the buffet for breakfast on a Monday morning. I was surprised at the lack of choices. Bacon (cold), sausage links, eggs (powdered), potatoes, pancakes (super dry and 1 was actually hard), chicken fried steak (cold). Fruit was sliced oranges, sliced cantaloupe and sliced honeydew, oh and whole apples and bananas. Plain yogurt was really watery and bitter. We were seated in a back section that actually had no lights so it was extremely dark. The waitress/attendant came over for the first time (after we were done) and said "it's really dark over here. Sorry, we're short staffed too". I wasn't sure if we should tip her b/c she only saw us once AND you get your own drinks (they don't serve you drinks). But we saw her busting her hump to get the tables cleaned and turn them over quickly. Thankfully we used our M Life rewards from My Slots and got buy one get one free. Full price ($20) is not worth it for breakfast.

gAZ0PwlfuAqttJT3UYu6AA.text: I have had a better buffet at Golden Corral.  Chicken was good once i drowned it in Cholula sauce. Selections for a buffet are minimal! Can't even get a burger or fries... I was thoroughly disappointed. If you like salad, too bad the salad bar selections are not impressive either. To make it worse, my salad had a dirt grit!!! Completely appalling. There are some deserts and the selections are better than the dinner course. Wont be back

0pElHdp_pUxDIUCPtrFplQ.text: The absolute worst food I have ever eaten in my life. We ate at the Luxor buffet after a wedding a couple of weeks ago and the food was so terrible that I couldn't forget to log into yelp and warn others after 14 days. The food has no flavor and I could probably count the number of food options on my fingers. I paid for 3 which included 2 adults and my 7 year old son and we were charged $98 for our meal. The "waiter" came by once to clear plates from our tables and the rest of the meal the entire wedding party was left to take their used plates to dump their leftover food in the trash and then to a plastic tub to leave their plates. Save your money, there are plenty of great places to eat in Vegas for half the price.

lH2gzpRMBEnE0Gi-SYIQ9g.text: I never quite trust a low rating for a buffet here in Vegas because people get super picky. However, in this case, this low rating is pretty accurate. Here are the problems...  1. The selection is so-so. Nothing special.   2. The quality - this is what really does this place in. Not only did just about everything have little to no flavor, but EVERYTHING was super dry from sitting out too long.   3. The women's restroom was closed the entire two hours we were there. ????  4. Atmosphere. This place is in the basement and it feels like it. It feels like a tomb. What a fun place to eat, right?  The only saving grace was their S'mores Dump Cake. I don't know how something almost magical came out of this place. It was a pretty basic chocolate cake that was absolutely smothered in hot fudge, a very think layer of toasted mini marshmallows and huge Graham crackers. Unfortunately, this one dessert, as good as it is, isn't worth the price of $18.99 and the risk that they might not have it that day.

eEljwRNYmApnntNB2HzXXw.text: Good service. Never had an issues here. Would return again. I  really enjoyed the variety of food that was offered. The staff would check on you but not be too pushy about it all. They always made sure that everything was stocked very well. I'm going to say that this is a good place to come sit and talk and relax and eat and not feel rushed at all to leave.

t0ArNLa9I5UVx1-pHPrR7g.text: I never thought I would ever take my precious time to leave a review, a bad review on Yelp. I don't know about their breakfast or lunch buffet quality but their dinner foods were just so so bad, my parents and I were beyond disappointed- it ruined our night. On top of the terrible food(we barely ate anything), to make the experience even worse, the waitress seemed like she hated working there. Well... I could understand her a bit why but don't give us your attitude when serving us. We tip you for your service which was close to none. Anyways, this will be my first and the very last visit to Luxor to get any food or service. Never again

oShvV-bcL1zScVt1lmsBBg.text: Regardless of where you are staying on the strip in Vegas, the Luxor Hotel More Buffet is exceptional. The chef John Houck is spectacular and aims to accommodate every guests! I love good food, and I'm a vegan! So, usually I just accept that it's difficult to accommodate my appetite. However, the Luxor had an array of amazing dishes on the buffet for my entire family! To top it off, chef John actually prepared several vegan dishes for us without any added cost or request. The experience left is feeling great and the food was exceptional! We ate fresh vegetables, fresh fruit and all sorts of creative dishes! I'm outdone! I will definitely return, and to top it off, we ate all food that gives life, nutrients, and protein. Hats off to Luxor!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

Eb1I-bEVTDx1eLzlCn_lGg.text: Loved it. Love the food selection. Everything tasted good. Dessert table was so neat and organized. Whole family had a great time and walked out of here full and happy!

sS2u5Ub3pTy1AeEIUCp1Sg.text: The Sunday brunch is like cafeteria food!  It's horrible!   The limited sushi selection is very cold and look a lot like packaged food!  The hot selection is very bland, like no flavor! The breakfast like eggs, muffins, waffles etc are decent.  The salad bar is ok and deserts are better.  This is the first time I ate here and it will be the last time will eat at Luxor's buffet. Also service is slow!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Dessert

vCGDHiDpjyKiQl4vcn2KQg.text: Wow. Worse buffet I've ever ate at. Not allot of choices. Food was just okay. Very little choices at each so called station. Cold pizza and no red sausage for pasta at the Italian section. Only 3 choices at each station. Not good. Will not eat here again and I come to Vegas once a month. To bad.

v99tMqyThhRJQUvm-9l8yQ.text: The buffet was way over priced. We went on a Wednesday evening and it was $25.99 per person. The wait time isn't so bad and we were seated pretty quickly. They had very limited options and the food didn't taste good. It lacked basic seasoning and was awful. The only thing that was good was the dessert but was definitely not worth the price. Just got out to the strip they have better restaurants and options.

2SRwMr84gv4_a-1bqSCiyQ.text: 29.00 for comfort food is a bit too much for a buffet. Service was poor and quality of food was low

5TExkDSSNb9X2glnPsBP6g.text: Sunday brunch. All you can drink mimosas plus decent food for $22.99. As long as you go in with realistic expectations you will be satisfied. I've been to $10 buffets and $50-60 buffets in Vegas and everything in between.   The price matches what you get. Decent brunch options. I tried the French toast, chicken fried steak,  guacamole and chips. All were tasty and above average. The desserts were a bit disappointing and not very flavorful. There is a frozen yogurt station in place of a gelato station which is an option you will find at higher priced buffets

PfyhlTR0hSauxSvetsktMQ.text: What a bunch of caca! Luckily this buffet was free or I would of been very upset. The lunch buffet was the saddest thing to ever happen to food. It was cold, looked old, and abused. The best thing I had was some very basic chicken and a roll with butter. DO NOT COME HERE!

FacNpPr0C4tttTM0_xhU2Q.text: More really should be called Less because I was less than thrilled with my experience here.   I spent $19 for breakfast here and to be honest I thought I was getting a deal. They have a sign that says $35 for all you can eat all day which sounded like a good deal as well.  I paid for my meal and was seated. I noticed that the wait staff only took your plates. They didn't get your drinks. The drinks were self serve which was a plus to me but a minus in terms of their tip. When you pay they ask for the tip up front- now I see why. Fortunately I wanted to tip in cash.  Anyway, the buffet seemed huge but I'm guessing because it was breakfast a lot of the items were empty. What I did see was of the food items that were there, there wasn't actually much food to take. I was surprised being that I was in Vegas- the city of excess.  The food reminded me of hospital food. Not very flavorful and not very hot. Honestly, everything tastes like I made it at home. If you ever ate at my house you'd know what I mean, and that's not a good thing. There was no seasoning on anything. It was just bland.  There are many, many options to choose from on the strip and you definitely can find a buffet for this price or less that is much better. I would steer clear of More and definitely wouldn't recommend it to anyone anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Self serve beverages
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

t4OkjDIhSB3U_FsBD6s1cw.text: The food was decent but not was I was expecting from a Vegas buffet let alone a Vegas strip hotel buffet. The selection was also very disappointing. It is nice that you can get the all you can eat all day pass that also gets you into Excalibur's buffet which had better selections and better tasting food.

89MxmxSJhzKluEB9vUtEcw.text: The food here is sub par even for a buffet.  The meat is over cooked and there is no sight of vegetables anywhere.   Don't waste your money on this and honestly it's not even worth visiting if they give it for free.

r3rK5rY_fz_HvlZ8iz_AjQ.text: This buffet is a joke. It is over priced for what you pay. We got there just after 11am which is when it should be lunch items. The only lunch items that they had out was asian and Mexican. Most of the buffet was breakfast items. Lunch items didnt come out till almost noon. What lunch items they did have where nasty. Pizza crust was not fully cooked, asian noodles where overly salty, and the fried chicken legs where way over cooked.  The only reason we stopped at the buffet was we had some 2 for 1 comps. If I would have paid full price for the buffet we would of been asking for our money back. There are better places on the strip to eat than here.  We have been to buffets at MGM, Mandalay Bay, Excalibur which where all better thank Luxor.  Should of went to Jack in the box.

CCWSFnn4yw92wSg0J6bOKw.text: Reasonably priced breakfast buffet however, the buffet out of all hotel buffets on the strip is considered in my opinion as I'd say lower quality compared to for example the Mandalay bay. Food kinda blows and if you want breakfast here, you better come early to snag a table otherwise you'll be waiting forever.

HkhSi-ibWhsxDEwJX0SlzQ.text: As I said in a review on the hotel itself, their buffet again has some very hard working and kind people that provide great service but the food and quality was not worth the cost.  It fed a group of hungry people but it was just like going to an old country buffet

91JQakXcKmIrlHWgQgo1Tw.text: I wasn't expecting much with a buffet, but food that makes me puke can't be good.  I had orange chicken (soggy), spanish rice, fried rice, and some alfredo noodles. The noodles were delicous but I still ended up having to run to the restroom and puke, which is a definite warning sign.   I didn't eat here again after that and probably won't. If you insist on a buffet try the one at the Excalibur maybe?

hhqM2UiVD2s6l7Erel8-OA.text: Honesty, I would want to give this place 1 star...but the Excalibur buffet is worse...which automatically bumps this place up to two stars....but let me tell you....it a VERY low 2 stars. NOTHING was exciting about this buffet. I do feel like I need to provide at least one positive thing, however the only positive thing I can think of is the seating arrangement. The seating is arranged so that it is not so "Cafeteria style". IDK if thats so much of a positive but that is the best I could do.   The food is bland, not seasoned well. Plain boring "Comforter food". Waaaaaaaay over priced for the food they provide. I paid $38 for the all you can eat day pass, but will NEVER do that again. It is NOT a deal if you don't like the food and don't eat it. I tried a little bit of everything (My buffet ritual) But I literally took one bite and put it down and moved to the next. I honestly don't remember taking more than one bite of anything. It was gross.  I went to McDonald's an hour later and had the best meal I had that day. And I don't even eat McDonald's. Ok so perhaps I'm being a little harsh....but to be honest, you can pay that same exact price to eat at the Wicked Spoon (BEST BUFFET ON THE STRIP, Don't believe yelp it)  anyways like I was saying, you can pay the same price, and eat like a Queen or King until you are stuffed!! And you still will want to eat because EVERYTHING is so tasty, you'll be so stuffed you won't need to eat for the rest of the day. ( At least that is what happened to me on several occasions) There fore, you are pretty much paying the same price for the days worth of food, but with a better experience. \  But bottom line, even if I were to get a free pass for this buffet, I would probably try to sell it to a foolish person for $5, take that and go put it in a slot machine. I wouldn't eat this food again if it were free, now, if I were starving...maybe...but then again,  it's Vegas...no such thing as starving....so nope...won't be eating here again EVER.   BLAH

kF7AxfUs5EyvCetcf85Szg.text: One star for the soda and clean bathroom...but are you kidding me...this place brought back memories of school and their "hot lunches". Very disappointing for 22 bucks each. Stomachs were upset all night. Time to revamp Luxor!

w5RtpSfYVMsHsf72Zh5AFg.text: We stayed at the Luxor so we decided to try the buffet downstairs for lunch . It was OK...Not much to choose from.  It came out to $98 and some change for 4 people.  It satisfied our hunger for the time being but I don't think I would go back.

u4N7mNo6eBjDXa8K7VoWLg.text: The food is fresh and the buffet is clean, but make sure you're super hungry so that you get your $$ worth. It's just a buffet...

RT4q1F6rZ9rrf6w-yGpIGg.text: giant improvement in this buffet. The lunch buffet has been  bad for some years now. But I went this passed monday and was very impressed. First and foremost they now have a carving station during lunch hours. The salad bar is huge so many good choices especially the middle eastern stuff. Just wish they put out the pita bread for the hummus and things. The choices were endless and kept bringing out more things between 1130 and 1230. good selection of self serve drinks. the bar prices are decent and of course the dessert section was awesome. Better than aria and bellagio's desserts.  the cashier was outstanding. talked to us asked how our stay is. When saw my ID saw where I was from and said has friends and family there and struck up a conversation since there was no other people in line. She was a delight. Thats how vegas was before they treated you like people not a room number.  Great value selection and service. I recommend this buffet.

G6MWWZBV23ibgs6nvO2twA.text: I like this buffet. It doesn't have a wide, wide selection but it still has great food. The first time I got up to get food I came back with a full plate and two full bowls of salads.  Since the price is reasonable I would recommend this place, especially since the place itself is really nice.

Kjyo6WdS0auPSyaZVGS1vA.text: Buffet is definitely worth the price!  Lunch $16+tax, dinner $20+tax. There are a ton of different options to choose from.  Mexican, Chinese, Japanese rolls, Italian, Greek, salad bar, carving station and not to mention variety of drinks like juices and soft drinks.  The list goes on.  There was a long line last time I was there with one register opened, but they opened 2 more and the line moved a little faster.  It was clean and the dirty plates were taken away quite fast, it was a good experience.

wCzVCNMUM5fq9LIHahox6Q.text: The service was good, the food not so much! Reminds me of high school cafeteria food! Not recommended at all!

ZH8Ziy6uH0U40f30Xnu-3g.text: We are here right now. We just ate so much food. Shrimp, crab legs, oysters, flank steak, fried chicken, barbecue pork ribs, really good pound cake, a large variety of desserts. We didn't know where to begin. Food was great and the place wasn't overcrowded, which I expected on the holiday weekend. Best dinner of the weekend.

BvIBRepKEpvvn0iakv5Egw.text: good buffet . not exellent but fair enough if u re hungry and u re staying in luxor. me and my wife and 3 years daughter  ( free under 4) . total wad 41$ tx included . drink also except of alcohol. . the amazing thing was the desert section . the rest was ok

vHIjUQR8KCJwrMncL3PeTQ.text: We paid I believe $15 per person for breakfast. I barely found anything to put on my plate and whatever I did find, i didn't enjoy it. Breakfast is supposed to plentiful and amazing food! Didn't find either of those here. I would suggest paying a little more and going somewhere nicer with a lot more food, I mean it IS a BUFFET! Kids pay $12.

dzXkOTeFfiGpFo4fjTs0Tg.text: Had to try this place for breakfast since casino's in Vegas are supposed to have awesome buffets, right?! Wrong. We went a couple years ago and thought it was adequate enough, but upon this voyage to breakfast my mind definitely changed. Nothing really tasted like anything.  Honestly, the selection was redundant. If you like semi-gross bacon (how can bacon be gross!?) sausage and powdered eggs with "chorizo" this place could be Eden. I say "chorizo" because I've had chorizo and that was not chorizo! Biscuits were somewhat stale, gravy was... gravy.... haha. Pretty much says it all!  Would be one star, but we got filled up so it can't be that bad right (wrong!)? And the chocolate milk tasted sooooo good! Not that it's great or anything special, but I hadn't had it in so long! Definitely the highlight for this meal though. Just keep in mind the ceiling for this "high"light is pretty low...watch your head...   Spend the $15 apiece up in the Luxor cafe instead and you'll get food that's at least marginally tastier!

Tftqj7Z194uJ__yCvW47rw.text: Not worth it, eat somewhere else. We bought a day pass thinking maybe breakfast was a fluke. It wasn't, and there is one thing I have to say abou this place : GROSS !

S5_DknHacRdWKQAAKDq28w.text: Meh... nothing to write home about. Perfect to curb the hangover a bit, but the quality of food wasn't stellar.  However, the Cinnamon Monkey Bread I could've rubbed all over my body it was that good.  I'd go back here if I didn't have any other option, but ah well.

qNbm_5OSKudlIEWkqAS7Cw.text: This place sucks!!!!! Food is horrible and wayyyyy over priced. Fast food taste better.

NEL6AJkyww8spZWl9wwZXg.text: Just gross...expensive crap had the brunch just wanted my money back and vomit. Thought it would be good considering there was line to get settled in should have looked at the reviews first and went somewhere else. Beware

4A476bPX7LnihaDqhfpJng.text: You know the buffet is bad when the best option is to make a ham sandwich and you still can't eat it.

7HCzFXdbK_pGewHVAeQQmQ.text: I don't know a  good awsssws sssssss sure esessss was ra s was a great time for you and you guys are so sweet y'all are so sweet and sour cream cheese

JGozo427-_0-FzOXiDSfWg.text: Not worth the price! We came for dinner, small selection and bland food. Even my kids were disappointed! Go somewhere else.

-rOzFB5Z6QOPDOxm03Gf1g.text: Food selection was less than average in my opinion.  I was expecting "More" since we were in Vegas and it is in The Strip.  Went back several times for a dish and the serving tray was empty.  Disappointed but will give them another chance.

2kHb9W_akSj9mSA8mJXi3Q.text: Lunch buffet was average, selection was good however not what I prefer, tacos were good, dessert was good, ham was dry, would not come again for lunch

PFzvaInj0cRsH7t3OE3RRQ.text: Been to Vegas a few this isn't one of my favorite buffets.  Not to much of selection.  They slacked since earlier years. It ok for when you don't feel like walking elsewhere.

Dtz8R_lNrp0C4-qFA_Ny2A.text: The MORE buffet at Luxor is truly terrible, bottom-tier food.  We went on a Saturday night, and the place was deserted.  I'm not sure what they think justified the $26.99 price tag (we had our meals comped, fortunately); it would be a questionable call at $16.99, honestly.  It is the worst buffet I've ever experienced.  The meat was low quality across the board  and the desserts are poorly conceptualized.  Pluses for chocolate milk and soft serve, but you can't base an entire meal on that.    Not disappointing per se, since the reviews are pretty miserable, so my expectations were low.  But I wouldn't eat here again if they were giving the food away.  Everything was a little depressing, like eating at the food court of an abandoned mall.  That being said, the staff is very friendly.  I feel sorry for them.  They deserve better.

uj4RzxwWJsqjwzwZsyvjSg.text: Overall an average buffet. Restaurant was clean, had a few good dishes a few not so great (mashed potatoes...not a winner)   Not bad, not great. That's the final word.

7y9tBsuHVq_SFOoRo3QLBw.text: Let me start off with this; YES we did eat at many of the other "top" buffets, and of course they are better.. but you get what you pay for! But for $22.99 you can't go wrong with this place either.... We ate here the 1st night we got to Vegas, we were staying at the Luxor so it was just convenient for us. For the price we both thought it was pretty decent. They also serve Crab legs! I will also note they were way LESS Saltier then the crab legs at the Cravings Buffet @ The Mirage (which I hated) The food was all warm, and we even arrived there with only 1 hour left to be open and they were still constantly changing out the food ( Tuesday night) It also wasn't very busy. I was impressed with the selection of food, it wasn't obviously as large as other buffets, but it was satisfying. Even the deserts were good. (as you can see by my face in one of the photos lol) We actually ate there again on our last day before going to the air port. & It didn't leave us feeling shitty or tired afterwords.  If I was trying to have a non-super expensive meal and I was pretty hungry or to lazy to leave the hotel, I would defiantly eat here again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I was having a pretty good time eating the deserts (check the funny face) Plus the crab legs, very tastey!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Very to busy, but they were still changing out the food pretty constant.
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. He was a happy man. Lots of different things on his plate!

G8bRJX3UmHn6jNg8fFevUg.text: Worst lunch buffet I have ever been to.  Do not waste your money or calories on this place. The salad bar was the best part. Hit and miss on the desserts.

24qD6fQmzxxb22ii4x1IIA.text: Not so bad not so bad. I wouldn't get the white rice or the noodles as they were a bit crunchy. Everything else was great. We did the Saturday / Sunday brunch ... Saturday we weren't offered Mamosa's but on Sunday we were .. for the same price as Saturday. Thought it was weird. While we were eating some executive chef Overton came up to us as asked how everything  was, an gave us a cookie... but I'm the type of person that if I'm sitting eating ... don't ask me a whole bunch of questions as he did. I just think that's rude. On Sunday when we went .. two of the workers were arguing right next to us... overhearing everything on how she was upset another worker took a break before her... then the worker was raising her voice so the other worker can hear her as she was walking on the other side of the boots .... EXTREMELY UNPROFESSIONAL!!!! I would come again, because it kept me full for a whole day! But the workplace in general is very unprofessional!

A592pZG5nCU_j_cOLh_W8g.text: The Luxor buffet and Excalibur had a promotion were we could eat all day for just $40. So we ate at Luxor and Excalibur. The Luxor buffet was not as nice as Excalibur. It was good though for the price. I prefer the Excalibur buffet.

dhw7fJJa1qK_A0DgYNWNXw.text: Wanted to eat nearby since I was going to see the Criss Angel show. The food was below average. Food was cold or Luke warm. I was so hungry. I ate. The best thing of this meal was the ice cream. For $25 a person, maybe you can get dinner somewhere else.

bphJ13DqekVhk_3KHM-LTA.text: Standard fare buffet. Really 2 1/2 star On weekend, you get the campaign treatment.  The breakfast items included omelets made to order, plus usual meats.  Add a couple of Mexican flavored items and salads, you have a meal to hold you over til dinner

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mimosa are small so drink plenty

uRFyZNUPKycfAOTKhm6GMQ.text: Worst buffet I have been to in Vegas. Very old and cold food. The best thing was the dessert and even that wasn't great. The creme brulee was just vanilla pudding. Very, very disappointing. I would rather eat fast food. Highly suggest going to another buffet.

5qWvrnZJPOKtBrpaBwLd5Q.text: Tourists may enjoy the mediocre food at More Buffet; but locals, such as myself, won't understand how any buffet can charge double the price of most other buffets in town, and offer half the value. The food was MEH, and skimpy adult beverage selection was overpriced.

eOD4woTKi77opQ3bZlkqEQ.text: From the other reviews, there must be some sort of elitist buffet crowd I didn't know existed.  This buffet is not priced not promised to be in the league of Caesars buffet.  I enjoyed the decor, and the price was right.  We got there at the end of brunch when they transitioned into dinner.  Food was tasty for the most part (skip the tasteless pizza) and desserts were decent.   Barbacoa, turkey, roast beef all good.  I would definitely come back.  My coworker and I agreed this buffet is better than Aria as well which is another mid range buffet.   For real people, go, enjoy, and leave as full as we were!

Uk8UM06ILBXqU1kzRgiiaA.text: We really enjoyed brunch here. Bottomless mimosas fir weekend brunch. The mimosas are small, but they was fine with us. The omelets and eggs Benedict was very fresh and tasty. They also had a variety of Asian style food, tacos, etc. We tried a bunch if stuff and really liked most of it. The bread pudding was fantastic! The wait staff was fun and helpful, especially JR, and since we liked the food so much RJ went to get the chef so we could compliment him. Was worth the price, especially with the mimosas.

d4xN3IEsyhudrR5s4oYhkg.text: Weekend brunch with a good selection of food for a reasonable price. The food quality wasn't exactly gourmet but still good. The bottomless mimosas were also a nice touch to get the day started off right. We wouldn't seek it out again but it certainly fit our needs on this occasion.

45us-wSSrFslGXhzC5Ed4g.text: The juices and coffee were decent, the food was OK but nothing too great. I did enjoy my egg white omelette and the muffins near the desert looked excellent but I was already full at that point =)   I found the grits to be watery and overall it's just a standard buffet. I prefer the Pyramid Cafe upstairs.

PTlOHSTKNBWOTzEEJfYCRA.text: The food is just okay and the service is pretty bad. We went 3 times during our stay because it was continent but finally gave up on them. For the quality of food and lack of servie I'd expect to pay much less

oy-NKPzZQWklSWjvVQdIuQ.text: What made this buffet great was our wonderful table attendant. We has to pay $20 for the mimosa brunch, and the food was sadly not worth it. But our lovely attendant kept refilling our mimosa flutes within a minute of being empty. She was funny and perky, and we left her a nice tip.  We spent an hour or so just walking back and forth to try to force feed ourselves $20 worth of crappy food, which was very hard. But all the boys in my party seemed to be in heaven as they piled their plates high with fried everything. I tried a bunch of things but they were all very cafeteria quality. The only things I enjoyed were the shrimps and cocktail sauce, which I stuffed my face with, and the mashed potatoes.   Oh well, lesson well learned. But thank you to our wonderful waitress!

D_-JXUpq4pCWjFODUCplAw.text: After dropping our bags off at the bell desk until it was time to check into our room, Ape and I headed to the buffet. We got the $35 all you can eat/all day wristbands. This was a very good deal! We came here twice that day and easily ate our $70 worth. I probably ate the weight of my head in shrimp cocktail.   Highlights:  -salad bar is fresh and very good  -shrimp cocktail is delicious  -the selection of food is impressive, some type of dish from every continent  -the house wine is included and was surprisingly good  -value  -service was good   Lowlights:  -decor is a bit dated  -the food is only slightly above average tasting  -the sushi looks dangerous  Overall, a very good deal. It's exactly what you'd expect from a buffet at the Luxor... Only cheaper.

sJ23Fh1tvVuu7GibooH8uQ.text: It is in the basement of the hotel which gives it a closed in feeling. It was a good deal with good service. The food was fair. Sadly, the whole family had upset tummies after so we can't recommend.

EWD1HJVAB9Behk6Xc_sr5g.text: The food selection was average, bu the price is very reasonable.  19.99 got me a huge slab of prime rib, with bbq ribs, and chow mein.  An odd blend of flavors, but gooood none the less..   Deserts were ok but not specatular...  Overall, not bad for the price but nothing special.

Od0zZ3om4j4aMbH4z-cF0g.text: Less quality, less service, less drink refills, less items.   Less crowded, but that's due to the above.  They must have put the Excalibur restaurant manager in charge of this place.  You can do better than tacos, pasta, rice, fried shrimp, and cafeteria style chicken and fish for $20 in Vegas.

oBRgAA5BF7E5OnsCGS1pPg.text: I went here for lunch.  I was hungry and ready to eat.  I noticed that there was no line to this place.  That should have been my first sign.  I never leave a tip when I pay.  I want to see how the service is first.  Well, I never saw a waiter.  Glad I didn't leave a tip.  I served my own drink, got my own napkins and refilled my own drink.  The food sucked.  This is the worst food I have ever had in Vegas.  There was no selection, it was cold and it was horrible.  NEVER EAT HERE!!!

E0_UaNvubK4zb1ceJeTqqw.text: Hmm this buffet was worth the 20.00 I paid for dinner. There was nothing spectacular, but it was doable. I don't think I really have any complaints. It was better than the Flamingo buffet and If I remember correctly slightly cheaper.  There is less variety than many of of the other nicer buffets, but I guess you get what you pay for.  Just a warning there were no Alaskan crab legs or that many choices for shellfish, only the cold shrimp they have at every buffet.  Here is something new I tried for the first time tho, asking the cashiers to take a look at their buffet, before actually choosing where to eat.  They actually allow you to do that, so I thought that was awesome. If they're not looking you might be able to sneak some bread or cookies out in your purse haha, while previewing. JK!

-VOx3rhCspgvHfbI6dR2TA.text: My husband and I ate at the Luxor last night and it was horrible. It was $19.99 per person for dinner. There was no crab legs, nothing special. They had breaded calamari, but the calamari was no more than 1/10th of it. You could pull apart the calamari (it looks like onion rings) and its all breading. I don't understand how this luxorious hotel/casino buffet think that people are not going to notice.  They did have prime rib, but half of it was covered with fat. Their sushi was absolutely amateur. I was impressed that they had creme brulee, but they didn't even bother to caramelize the sugar on top. All in all, I think it's only one step up from HomeTown Buffet because their food was actually hot when we showed up at 9 and they had a lot of freshly made condiments. That's all.  Oh, and watch out for the staff!  Their waitress was rude! This blond older lady came by and asked me what drink I wanted and what my husband wanted (who was still getting his food from the buffet).  I told her my drink and told her I didn't know what he wanted. Then she said to me, "Well, you guys keep disappearing so I'll just come back later." She said it in a rude irritated tone. There was no need for that. She could've said, "Oh, well I'll just come back in a little bit so I can get both your drinks." I think she realized my shock so she game back and asked what he usually gets and she came back with 2 drinks for each of us. When I thanks her she replied, "Yeah." Back in her irritated rude voice. I was so upset that we didn't tip her, which is sad for her because my husband and I at least tip 20%.  Don't bother with More! Their logo is, "Less is not more. More is more. More" Yeah, more waste of money and more disappointment.

5nduiBv2Zn184jAGx9DCkw.text: If you want upscale food, do not go the Luxor's buffet.  They do not have Alaskan king crab legs, filet mignon medallions, or roasted endangered species in an orange-cranberry glaze.  If you want abundant reasonably well-prepared comfort foods, then the Luxor's buffet is just the ticket.  If you're in Vegas for two days, skipping it is probably recommended.  Any longer than that though, it's not a bad option if you want a break from pretentious food.

cTm7WP1BIoySv_7JEv78bw.text: I'm kind of surprised that people didn't rate this buffet higher??  Maybe it's because I don't really like chicken / other meats... but love seafood.  For a 16 dollar champagne brunch, I'd say this place was pretty good!  We had 3 dollars off staying here because we were staying in Luxor.  I would recommend just finding one of the coupon booklets lying around the hotel / maybe near the concierge to get one of these coupons if you want to save a couple bucks!  We got seated relatively quickly despite there being a line.  Since I had been craving shrimp cocktail forEVER, I went straight to the seafood, and was very satisfied!  I had SO much shrimp / smoked salmon to my heart's content.  After that, I opted to get some salad, of which they had MANY varieties.  After making my own salad, I decided to go for their seafood pasta salad which was SO FUCKING GOOD.  I would literally come back to this buffet just to eat their seafood salad.    Since I was pretty hung over, I did not take advantage of the champagne brunch that much.  I think I had half a glass.  But had I NOT been hung over, I very well could have been by the end of the meal because I'd have gotten drunk and then gotten hung over... since we were there for so long just eating.  I wish I could tell you guys more about the other food, but I really have no idea how it was.  However, the seafood was great.  No king crab or anything like that, but it's not what you're paying for.  I came out of here feeling incredibly full, but still "light" and somewhat "healthy" and not weighed down too much.  I also sneaked some sandwiches out for later... yay!

p-Ysa6fv8tWVi3HwKp2pGw.text: Saw Believe here and needed a place to eat. The BF wanted a buffet so we just went here since we were already at the hotel. We had the dinner buffet and it was okay. The shrimp was awesome. The roasted chicken was really good. The carnitas were surprisingly good for a buffet. Overall the food was good enough, nothing fabulous but it satisfied the appetite.  The dessert although was awesome. The chocolate mousse, flan some type of white/raspberry thing was amazing. The oreo cheesecake was real thick and I didnt like it.

lztmfuqOmt-aZFdORB6LDg.text: Simply put, the food at this buffet is disgusting. Trust me, if I could give a 0 star score, I would.

35w499krgfmg4DxjqGWqHQ.text: Wish this site had a minus star.  This buffet was terrible.  The food was mediocre, food stations were dirty and not well stocked. The salad bar was the biggest disappointment.   Certainly NOT worth the $20 dinner price.  I would not recommed this to anyone.

_4TxuD4q0VM_xDWQ4vm5ew.text: For $35 for the day, all you can drink mimosas with breakfast, and all you can drink wine or beer at dinner, I think this buffet was excellent.  Some of the food sucked, but what I didn't like was left on the plate and I moved on to something better.  Some of the food was really good.  Stuffed crepes and omelettes at breakfast were good, good sausage too.  I will skip the sushi and shrimp next time.  The pot roast was nice, and the tacos too.  It's not always easy to get good food at a low price in this town, so when I stay at the Luxor it's the buffet all day.  And if you take advantage of the drinks it's an amazing deal.  Do it.

DjhxJAz8M9vf484KG_EYwA.text: The food is pretty bland, although there is a decent variety.  I'm not sure how they could make food that is worse than Golden Corral or even Ponderosa.  Please do yourself a favor, travel a littler further, and spend a little more money to go to a better buffet.

MmmYNT6vK82G5rS4mvtxKw.text: I'm the worst person to bring to a buffet. I eat one tiny plate and that's it. I like More, bc they had a sammich station and alot of options. Oh and a chocolate milk machine. I may have only gotten a baked potato but it was bomb and I defiantly drank $17 worth of chocolate milk.  They don't have any seafood or carving station at lunch but they do have fried chicken and tamales so I think that makes up for it. Pop in if you're in the mood for a quick yummy bite.

3xAredUHSFM8d0FajJKyHw.text: I think the name MORE is so appropriate for a buffet.  $29.99 for all day access to the buffet.  Just flash your wristband and get seated.  The food ranges from Italian, Chinese, American, Mexican etc.    Their salads were tasty.  The bean salad and the sweet potato salad were good.    The dessert bar was decent.  I enjoyed their attempt at creme brulee.  For breakfast they had all the standards.  The monkey bread was awesome and I nom nom nommed the doughnut holes.  It was buffet food.  They are feeding the masses here.  Can't expect to much.  Three stars for a great all day deal.

NlRn0tMVJ0DDe0OJ0SCvCw.text: So NOT the buffet that I want when I got to Vegas (TAXI!!! quick! take me to the buffet at the RIo!)  After waiting for what seemed like forever in line that morning for brunch, we finally got seated.  Then we went thru the buffet - it was so so.  There was nothing spectacular about the food, nothing interesting, or unusual that would make it stand out - nothing that would make me ever want to come back.    Vegas is about trying new foods, and experiencing things, this was not something that I would consider new - or an experience.  it was just blah.

lEhvifcLWsdskw9j-cYRhA.text: everything that i had was very dry.  we went at the beginning of dinner time so it all should have been fresh after they changed over.

yAny4A6NfbK_5ogRWkTLpg.text: Ate here on a Saturday for Brunch. We actually got the all day buffet which was $35 a head - that included champagne brunch and also dinner. The brunch alone woulda been $20 a head. But we figured we would maybe save more money if we jus do the all day instead of goin sumwhere else for dinner. DAMN WAS I WRONG!!!! If u aint a big eater, then this would not be a good deal for u.   Lemme start with the food. For Brunch, there was a quite a variety. But out of everything i ate, there wasnt anything that was really good.... the only thing i liked was the yogurt with granola... BOY was i killn that!!!! For dinner, it seemed like they had some of the stuff from brunch and jus kept it for dinner. THAS SOO NAST!!!! so i really didnt eat much for dinner. Plus I was still full from that luvly yogurt and granola. Anywho, the selection for dinner wasnt even that great. I prolly woulda enjoyed McDo-Do's(McDonalds) more than that!!!!  oh and another thing, wen u get the all day buffet, u gotta wear this yellow bracelet kuz thats how they keep track of u. SO WACK!!!! i asked the lady, "wat if i gotta shower" and she said its water resistant...now, aint that a be-otch!!! that damn yellow paper bracelet was killn my look! And i felt like a fat@ss kuz it aint like i was wearin one of them bracelets for a club, it was a damn bracelet for a damn buffet!!!! NOW TELL ME THAT DONT SOUND FAT TO U?!!!!!!  I aint messn with this buffet no more!!!! this place should be called "MORE(leftovers) Buffet at Luxor"

qLR1RaVeAfISms0HW4wNcw.text: We received two complementary buffet passes for staying there tonight. We were only able to use it for either breakfast or lunch. We ended up having breakfast quite early.  Everything was fresh they had a large variety of breakfast items which I really enjoyed got a little bit of everything. Everything was very clean , customer service was OK. Would consider coming back.

TD9Rg_fxNAjKG1N6tfj2jg.text: Had dinner here and I have say that it's way overpriced for subpar food. We tried a variety of dishes and they were all pretty bad. I've had better fried rice at Panda Express. Save yourself a lot of money and eat elsewhere.

8OfvdY_vCGs-fP6Ysmbk0A.text: Nasty, bland, and old food!!! For your money, you're better off eating at the other smaller deli or restaurants. Selection is horrible. Sushi is hard and not even edible.

0l7fJC_9JvfrcDmAMjLkQQ.text: I had really wanted to go to the buffet at Caesar's Palace but had to settle for this one as my boyfriend and I were going to see Criss Angel and didn't have enough time to do both. We were pleasantly surprised at how cheap the dinner was, $22.95 including drinks, compared with other buffets on the strip which get up to $60 and $70.   The room itself is a bit tired and looks a little gross but other than that the areas where the food is kept is the same as everywhere else.  Pretty standard selection of food- Asian, Mexican, Italian, Seafood etc but nothing stand out and nothing overly impressive.
