I'm glad it was only $22.95 otherwise I would have been pretty upset at quality of food. Then again, it is a buffet AND we didn't have to stand in line for an hour- win win really.

ESy8I_9j84fzPFqKJOs4vg.text: I went to the buffet in the afternoon on Saturday during weekend brunch. The food was really good in my opinion. I was able to have breakfast & lunch. The french toast is very good. I recommend everyone to get the french toast with syrup. The food was hot, the dessert I had was delicious. I had the strawberry cheesecake & it was great. I recommend coming to the Luxor buffet & enjoying the delicious, tasty food. Had great service as well. I paid $24.98 for the buffet. I didn't get the pass.

TobUemtf_2Z6levk1w84iA.text: Go spend your money elsewhere! This is the worst buffet I've been in Vegas so far. First off we googled times and prices for lunch and dinner and decided to go there because in their webpage it said lunch was until 4pm and was 20.99 Well we got there well before 4 just to realize their lunch buffet ended at 3 now but they just hadn't updated their page. Uuhm ok, so for dinner it was 27.99 but it said it was steak night dinner every night and since we were already there and hungry we decided to stay. Big mistake. Their food selection was very limited and worst of all there was NO steak to be found anywhere!!! We payed almost 30dlls a piece and there isn't even steak on their steak night?? I finally approach someone from the staff and ask about were the steak is and they say they'll check for me. He came back some minutes later and told me they were putting steak out now (even though it was past 4pm and they made us pay for steak dinner after 3pm) and proceeds to explain that the Chef wasn't even aware that they had changed their lunch and dinner times and he didn't even know he was supposed to be serving dinner buffet for the past hour! So we payed dinner price just to receive lunch menu and it wasn't even good! We finally were able to get some steak and we weren't impressed by it either. Overall a bad experience and waste of money. They only reason I'm giving 2 stars instead of 1 is because staff was nice.

iJkL1elurdpJuGy-bIQhCw.text: We went there during Independence Day long weekend.. This place is pretty good for dinner. They have Asian, Mediterranean, Mexican, Italian in addition to others. Steak corner was little small but I am not a biggest fan of steaks so that was okay to me. It's the sushi bar I enjoyed most. Also desserts were great here. Dinner costs 31$ per person. The interior was good, stuffs were friendly. I will recommend this place to my friends.

mEcJiK0rGS_rvV6wLBjmMA.text: Too expensive for bad quality food. Not much food to choose from, the food was also very cold, nice bus boy Juan S.

I8VHtvC7EZ-ZkiZI-5mrzg.text: Straight to the point. Great selection of food, and everything we tried was tasty. Self serve drinks, coffee, and hot chocolate was also a nice touch. The desserts were really well made. At $16.99, this is one of the cheapest buffest on the strip, but you'll get excellent food value for your bucks.  -1 because I didn't see a large selection of fruits.

bTm3QXLavH7oVhpcukC9Pw.text: This place is always pretty good every time I come. All the staff is polite and helpful. Some of the food can be lacking a little flavor but it's rare I've had that happen to me. On weekends they have brunch and unlimited mimosas. Download my Vegas blackjack or slots and you can earn Bogo free which makes the worth it. It ends up costing me about 30 bucks including tip for 2 of us with a myvegas reward. Which is great for a Vegas buffet. It can get a little crowded from time to time but it's Vegas what do you expect.

VzmaB29BcOF8D5XxwT6FyQ.text: I don't see why it's 2.5 stars. Came in for brunch. Went right thru the line. Gold status on Mlife. Food was really good. Paid for breakfast price. Fresh food. Had lunch too. Gabriel was very attentive and polite. Loved it! Will be back. Thanks #thebuffet@luxor

uenQXuPYGRlDsHXRUlAd4A.text: Absolutely horrid don't make the same mistake I did and pay for this please don't. If you're a vegetarian don't expect eating anything other than the ice cream and even that is sub par. As the entrees they just don't pass. You can see the Luxor decided on quantity over quality without the quantity because there are no real options here.

_EgHGvnSurMguL0LOJv7qA.text: Everything about this place was amazing. One of the best breakfast experiences I've had. Everything was fresh, the staff was pleasant, and the design of the restaurant was beautiful.

CooJT0UtxcwDhs5xcPAXQg.text: Service was good. Omelet bar very good. Everything else sucked. No variety and cold potatoes. Actually the desert bar was okay. This was breakfast.

SLSo8AhUbwvdRevk_R-kMg.text: Please do not eat here. I never leave low reviews but holy cow this place sucks. Selection of food is broad but the quality is lacking. Reminds me of hospital cafeteria food. The only thing I do recommend is the freshly cut fruit. Food looks like it sits under a hot lamp all day. Non seasoned and bland food. Overall my experience of this buffet was not impressive. I would be very upset if we did have to pay for the buffet but they were complimentary.

jIokBpcvHdOTmqkNp5FBIA.text: N Ice breakfast buffet. Expensive so go with a hungry stomach and get you monies worth. There is a lot to choose from so you can definitely make it worth it.

NFdKuxBYi8V2rCFmZMU1Mg.text: This place needs a food upgrade. They serve a tough fake prime rib. Looks like it comes off a huge cow leg. It's gross with no flavor at all. Breakfast is not the best either but better then lunch or dinner. The cashiers and waitstaff are very friendly and helpful but food is gross!

DvlcSyeHcNdTolSmqkdIBw.text: I have had the buffet a few times it has always been worth the price. Some of the items have been outstanding have never had anything not good. Being a diabetic I found the sugar free deserts to be excellent. The people have always been friendly and very helpful. If your at the Luxor I would recommend it.

-x_1wyEHqKpKQRxHFZdW-A.text: Dear Lord, stay away. I'm reminded of the commissary in college eating here. Granted, the dishes and variety is far superior to what we had in college. The quality is not up to standard. The lunch price of $19.99 is fair for a buffet but, the overall quality of the dishes still doesn't support it.   The Luxor could spend a bit more effort in delivering a higher quality experience

hfur7RslRJdFreoOP9r2oQ.text: We had some resort credit and wanted to make the most of it. For two adults and two kids, $100 doesn't go far in Vegas. We decided to get the all day pass on a Friday. Normally you can use it both here and Excalibur, but it was two days before Christmas, and could only use it here. All day, traffic was light. Minimal lines, ample food availability.   Food quality: for a buffet? Actually pretty good. Every meal, there were hit and misses. Breakfast, pancakes were better than waffles. Scrambled eggs had good flavor. Oatmeal way overcooked. Fruit was a nice touch. Muffins were all tasty, bacon and sausage were all hits.  Lunch: today was an odd brunch deal which was out of the norm, so lots of breakfast still, no sandwiches like my son expected, but I asked our server about it and she checked and came back with a specially made sandwich just for him. Dessert were pretty good. The tiramisu was shockingly tasty. I also really liked the chicken noodle. The fried chicken was kind of eh, but wasn't terrible. Beware any rice dishes.  Dinner on a Friday was quite good. The steaks, though small, were really good. Lots of crab legs, though I didn't have any. I saw many people going to town on them. A wide assortment of tacos, lasagna, BBQ, Asian, sandwich station.   Also, from 4-6 is all you can drink beer, wine, and champagne. Go nuts! Overall, it's a buffet. Let's not forget that. It's going to be hit or miss. But we tend to feel yucky living off burgers and fried foods for several day, so it was nice to have a day of more regular meals.

yBjLW-cGwe2aJdr6b0l6oA.text: This is by FAR...the worst buffet in Las Vegas...even the little, nasty buffets are better than this one. AND they try to get you to tip %18 up front...for WHAT? They don't even get your drinks for you.Tip for pointing you to a table? AND they were supposed to give me a free buffet for with my room and now I see my hotel bill and they charged me over $40 for my FREE BUFFET...I have stayed in this hotel over 100 times...I think I'm done..What? I have to call them now? I JUST DID...it said they were CLOSED! The food is Horrible...they have like 3 or 4 kitchens and they ALL serve the SAME 2nd rate food...the people in charge of this buffet should be let go...I could do a better job myself, fact.

L9pd2Lfp3EdIuAlg34TKgQ.text: Waited in line on a Wednesday at 9:30 am....took a half hour plus to get seated. Once seated the food was mostly cold, very minimal selection standard of American, Latin and Mexican. Went to get coffee, one mug left and creamer was complete out? My Opinion is simply at the Luxor they are under staffed and management simply can not manage there employees and there day to day business. They appear not to realize people come from all Over the world for a Vegas experience paying a decent amount for this hotel expecting better service and quality.

i3pZo9EkeprnH519F865PA.text: I used to love this buffet.  Last visit was few years ago. I ate the buffet last night at Luxor.  Many horrible things I encountered last night. 1.  I came here mainly for prime rib beef, but It was cool & raw. 2. Steamed rice was at room temp.  The rice cooker was turned off. 3. Some of salads were really old.  I am a restaurant owner, so I know exactly what foods are good, what aren't.  Also, "cool" foods violated health guidelines.  Be careful, Health will come check out and shut down the buffet.  Luxor should reorganize the system and people at buffet kitchen.  Otherwise, it will be in big troubles soon.

290mZAsS_2YUyvrmr2UZgw.text: This place is about 5/10 on their service. 2/10 on their food and that's only because I made a salad and ate fruit. The food ALL OF IT is cold. The flavor is terrible. It's price is way overrated for the quality of food I ate and I'm very disappointed.

kOiJGxppVbzKqwztxpdJiw.text: My wife and I just had a really terrible experience here.  Price was reasonable for a strip buffet and it was close to a show we were heading to so we tried it out. The food quality and service was about as bad as could be.  Pretty disappointing...  beware.

dpHkfC1bWY5JKOICnqTfoQ.text: We had breakfast there. The food was ok for the price. The buffet mostly consisted of different eggs, sausage links and potatoes. There was an omelette station which I did not try. The salads where actually not bad. The deserts were very limited but not bad either.

DRB_2btDqgcmLXqlXGc7xw.text: Absolutely amazing.  Best meal during our time in Vegas!!!  Staff was friendly buffet clean and plenty of choices.

UvPQGcw4yPSaVyyOdjmC6g.text: We stayed at Excalibur the day before and can say honestly, this buffet is 100X better for the price. The atmosphere was great and the food was fresh with lots of options. Decent for the price and pleasantly surprised after the horrible dinner buffet we had the night before.

mrsf6YLY11hxvjwspVllww.text: At a recent visit to Las Vegas for a convention, my group decided to eat dinner at the Luxor Buffet. I was very surprised and happy to find a place that accommodated food allergies because you don't find places like that very often. My girlfriend has a soy allergy and was wary to eat here at first. The chef that came to help her was very cautious and patient going with her to each food station and told her which foods definitely didn't have soy. Also, if they did have it in the food, he would quickly list out alternate solutions to make the food soy-free for her. He even went to each cook and double-checked what certain ingredients went into the dishes. Unfortunately, I didn't catch his name, but he made her experience less worrisome. It became what she could eat, not what she couldn't eat , which made me less worried about going to another place to eat that night. And top off the whole night, he sauteed chicken fajitas in just oil and salt/pepper for her and brought it to the table with our party. (It was equally as delicious, if not more, than what was served at the buffet)This really brought an overall great experience for us and I hope that other places will follow suit when it comes to accommodating food allergies. Thank you for a great experience!

TOXKf44uNyzjAiYG4xIZfg.text: This place is actually my go-to buffet in Vegas. I'm not saying it's the best ever, but for price, quality, and convenience, there's a a reason I keep coming back.   Convenience is a big plus for me. I normally stay at Mandalay Bay or the Delano, and the Luxor buffet is a really short walk away. I don't even have to leave the building since the casinos are attached. If I stayed elsewhere on the strip, I would admittedly change my go-to spot though.  Quality- I stay at Mandalay Bay and I'd still rather walk over than eat at Mandalay's own Bayside Buffet. Yes, Luxor isn't extravagant. If you're looking for king crab legs and lobster and the best cuts of steak, you're definitely going to be disappointed. Walk in knowing that this place offers the basic international fare, and you'll be satisfied.   Pricing- This place is expensive by your hometown standards, but it's not bad by Vegas standards. Plus, I always get the $40-45 all day wristband that lets you back in. If you time it right, that's at least three full meals! That's a steal in Vegas! The wristband also lets you into the buffet at Excalibur, but I believe Luxor is the better choice.  Service is usually alright, too. Even when there's a long line, the wait doesn't feel that bad, I'm usually seated within a reasonable amount of time for my group size. Everything, including drinks, is self service so you don't really have to interact with the staff. They're usually quick with picking up the empty plates on the table. There's nothing to really complain about.

6oVMJ8hTNEgXE_bEl9I5EA.text: Pretty cool theme. as you walk downstairs to the buffet it is themed to feel as if your walking down under the pyramid ruins. As far as the food, Ill tell it the way it is. This place has a great buffet for the price they charge! I'd take this buffet compared to any back at home! Now if we are ganna compare this with other buffets on the strip, I feel its only fair we compare dollar for dollar. Sure you may find something more down the street but NOT at this price!      At "MORE" you'll find the happy median of affordable dinning, and eating good food for a good bang for your buck!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

d-ul8rp20eJDG0hdUJNnDw.text: I don't mind spending money on a good buffet; however, thirty dollars for mediocre food is definitely no bueno in my book, and sadly that's what we received here. By the end of the meal I realized I paid for the vibe of the place and not the food itself.   We had to wait in line for about twenty minutes, even though multiple tables were already open. The cause of our extended wait time stemmed from two things. The first one was a family ahead of us who didn't know how to pay, didn't know what was going on, and couldn't understand what the woman behind the register was explaining to her. The second cause of the wait was the use of only one register, with a second one opening up much later.   The food was of the same standard of Hometown Buffet, and that is not something I want to pay thirty dollars apiece for. The only thing this buffet offers that Hometown does not is a wider selection of international cuisine. The buffet is broken up by ethnic regions (Italian, Chinese, Mexican, and American), with a separate section for sushi and salad, and of course the ever so popular dessert section. The best thing I tasted all night was the sausage and peppers, and even that was painfully bland. The desserts were fine, but I was hoping for something unique; something I can't find at other buffets.   The only thing this buffet has to offer that others do not is a full bar. Even though I didn't use it, and I didn't see anyone else use it, the fact that booze is served on premises is a godsend.   There are much better buffets in Vegas. My advice: Shop around before you settle.

0dDaEW9dJ1J66S--9uvs9Q.text: The buffet at LUXOR is very mediocre.  There is a big variety of dishes but unfortunately they aren't properly cooked.  The meat is dried, many other dishes have very poor flavor, ...  I won't come back, I rather invest more money in a more enjoyable experience.   Cheers!

1xb12tRfvxZsHPQp_VKoGQ.text: It was good to eat here for breakfast. We were on our way out after checking out of the hotel and just wanted to eat  so we found the nearest buffet. Price is good if you take advantage and get 2 to 3 plates( or more idk). Wish they had more breakfast options though. If im in this casino in the future might check it out again. The staff was also friendly. And everything looked clean.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ok options for breakfast

UtDKjEhk9Mu5w00bwq7CYg.text: Horrible experience. Extremely pricey ($23.00 per person for breakfast or lunch)The food lacks meats, meals are cold, dry and will get you to the bathroom in a hurry. The term unlimited is defined by the bartender as 1 every 20 minutes and not more than 3. Worst food at the strip.

hmPofpQG2BteAPMm36OK9Q.text: At $23 for the brunch buffet, I was glad we had M-Life 2 for 1 credits. You can go to the Breakfast or Lunch buffet Mon-Fri for $19, but the weekends only offer brunch and dinner ($25). For the most part if you've been to one buffet in Vegas, you've been to them all. Unless you want to pay top dollar for the Bellagio or Caesar's, you can expect the same fare at any buffet. Having eaten at the Flamingo one day and now the Luxor, they are quite comparable.  The Buffet at Luxor is hidden away from the rambunctiousness of the casino, located on a quieter lower level. I really liked the atmosphere in here, it felt like a family restaurant on a Saturday morning rather than a noisy casino buffet. The staff were friendly and fast; this buffet allows you to get your own beverages (soft drinks, milk, coffees, teas) and on Saturday offered free Mimosas at the bar. There is a huge salad bar and then the typical eggs, bacon, sausages, biscuits & gravy. There were a couple of twists here, like made-to-order omelets, curried chicken, potato pancakes, and Eggs Benedict with salmon instead of Canadian bacon. That *sounded good, but it turns out I did not care for smoky salmon on my otherwise delicious Eggs Benedict. The chef is a master at making perfectly poached eggs, I'll give him that! The scrambled eggs were fluffy and perfect, not curdled and hard the way some buffet eggs are, and the bacon was crispy. There is a huge selection of beautiful, whimsical little dessert pastries that had some surprises inside, delighting my kids.    The whole meal was a relaxing, delicious escape from the frenetic casinos and I would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

1STMuB-5jK9p9wsd7tfgSw.text: OK, so my general take on MGM buffets (with few exceptions) is that they are over priced and not that great. This buffet is no exception. It is OK, just OK, nothing remarkable, but nothing spectacular either. For the price, you can get much better off strip. MGM should kick their buffet game up a notch or three. By looking at the 2 and a half star rating, it would seem that most Yelpers agree. Live It Up You Are In Las Vegas For Cryin' Out Loud!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States

pivFgHX57hXXTMk-h4GMIA.text: Bar none, the worst buffet ever. For the price i paid for 2 people which was like $50 made it even worse. Absolutely nothing redeeming at this place. Seriously, spend your money elsewhere. There is nothing worth talking about.

UPurK-60EskyueRxn0gfdA.text: Horrible food ! No many options the staff seen so unhappy and when you make a question sounds like you are asking for a favor . The desserts taste like " bah" and the cherry on the top of all this was a long piece of hair that I found in the middle of my rice .

i52TwmEkoJkP7Ig2mSIDVg.text: Great service, food was decent. No wait on a Sunday afternoon brunch. A good option if you're staying at the Luxor and want something close.

K5EKSWM0uHcg1oqMtfnSZA.text: Cold food, over priced. Why the hell did I eat here.....leaving now to find some good hot food.

f9XUmuhOob0iM2mmcgMSJQ.text: Since Yelp doesn't let us give half stars I'm giving it a 4 star but 3.5 stars is more accurate. We decided to come here since we were staying at the Excalibur and their buffet didn't look as good. Google reviews had higher ratings for Luxor so we decided to check it out. We initially planned to go to Caesar but found out from online forums / Yelp / reviews that the wait is 2+ hours on Thanksgiving and the price is hiked to $80/person. I can't imagine Thanksgiving food can differ that much so didn't feel like waiting that long or paying that much to check it out. The food was pretty standard for a hotel - they had an American station, Italian station, BBQ, different meat they were carving, and Mexican station. I admit it wasn't really high quality or luxury, but it was great comfort food and a good number of selections. They did have sushi which was a bit nasty and the turkey was way too salty, but everything else tasted good. We also took advantage of the free mimosas for the first 30 minutes and tried the free alcoholic eggnog after dinner started. For less than $60 for 2 people we were pretty pleased with the variety and taste. Nothing spectacular or unique but a hearty holiday dinner. The wait was only 30 minutes and I think we came at peak lunch time. Great service from attentive waiters who took your dirty plates away ASAP.

RJfz2zwcjlOxvQBC3m-Tag.text: For the price I would expect a lot more. Turned out to be a lot of simple, bland food. Certain things were great-- the deserts and drink machines in particular. But considering the ads and prices, I would think there would be a LOT more food to chose from compared to what was offered. Also some food was just meh. Some fruit wasn't fresh either.

IXaKHAETBLhwgsFhZsPLVg.text: I stayed at the Luxor for my birthday and it was almost $90 USD for 3 of us for the buffet. The food was just ok. Not the best...but not someplace i will go again. I expected more from the Luxor. I am however enjoying my stay here. There's plenty of other stuff to do and other places to dine.

J_i4P3z8UpJWL26G1Yd0-g.text: Currently writing this review from the buffet. For starters I'm not a buffet person(usually food is very bland) but I thought I'd give it a shot. I was surprised to find that all of the meat was very flavorful. The pizza was ok. Presentation on revealed bar was very beautiful. I enjoyed being able to get my own drinks. The breakfast food was edible but nothing to write home about. Sitting next to cleaning area was kind of annoying with constant clunking of dishes. All in all, I'd come back again for brunch. $20.99 for adults $13.99 for children.

G4vzbquCxgc2I2I-z2wOEw.text: The Only reason I give it Two Stars is because of the Cleanliness and Server......  Otherwise not happy at all.  Food is blah and Horrible Selection.   Not Very tasty at all....... For the Price there should have been a way better Selection of items.  Definitely not worth the money. ($24.99)  I should have listened to most of the Comments and skipped it but we were in a hurry because we had Tickets for Blue Man Group.   I don't know how Anyone could have commented that it was good.

lMP5gC4jOh5baQ6-HotUcQ.text: Received complimentary buffet passes with my stay. I expected a slightly better than Golden Corral buffet but was pleasantly surprised to find it was a decent Vegas style buffet to include the split crab legs that only the Wynn used to offer. Needless to say once I discovered this I indulged forgetting about the rest of the buffet.  If you are seeking a reasonably priced buffet with Vegas variety this is not a bad option at all. Another thing that sets their buffet aside is an all you can drink beer or wine option with your buffet.

NDR3gtd8gaHYCqWynvpovg.text: I feel sorry for anyone who actually paid for this lame excuse for food. If this wasn't comped with my room i would be demanding a full refund.    The food is bland and just shy of not passing for food at all.    The roast beef was like chewing bubble gum that had been smacked on for hours. It was seriously just flavorless fluff.    The pizza almost tasted like a grocery store Red Baron pizza but not as good.   The Alfredo also had no flavor so it just tasted like empty noodles.    The bread sticks were hard and had no taste as well.    If you go be prepared to waste 25 dollars.  That money would be much better spent at another dinning facility.   If this was 5 dollars for all you could eat it would still be too expensive.    This has been the only bad part of our stay at the Luxor.  Stay away from their poor attempt at cafeteria food.

nZ5SgX4tb3XMv23JuJyHkA.text: This was the worse buffet ever. I basically paid $60 for 2 salads because they didn't have much. Pizza tasted like raw with no taste. Would never recommend this place.

1FZmszPllUmeQZmjp5xXlw.text: Don't do it.  We came for breakfast and it was terrible.  The food was nasty.  I tried the chicken fried steak and it was old and not fresh.  Of course the scrambled eggs were fake.  We got all this for $18.  Save your money.

8aIL1jGySg00xLHWosfuwA.text: Disappointed is the perfect word to describe the buffet.  First, we needed directions to find it. There is 1 giant sign but then you take the escalator down stairs (Basement Buffet). When we got down there we were super impressed with the decor, you truly felt like you were in Egypt at a dig site. We used Myvegas rewards to do a 2 for 1 buffet on a Sunday Dinner so instead of paying $60, we paid $30 ($27.99 plus tax) and even at $15 a person we were less then impressed.   Good: This is the first buffet I have seen curry at a buffet and it was pretty good. Spaghetti and meatballs were delicious. So was the cold mussels and the ribs. The desserts were the most impressive. Good job pastry chef.  Bad: Our buffet was more expensive because it was a steak and crab buffet. The Crab was yellow! I eat tons of crab and I've never seen it yellow. I tried both steamed and chilled and both made me worry I'd get sick if I ate it. It also feel apart (disintegrated)...might be old. Also the shell on both hot and cold, bent and refused to break (snap). Anyway, the rest of the food (besides the good) was mediocre. The bread was HARD, my husband struggled to break it. Oh and the light in the ceiling above our table kept going out then turning back on which was very annoying. I had to start timing when to take photos  To know: You have to get your own drinks.  I definitely would not pay full price and it take a TON of convincing to go back for a 2 for 1.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Red velvet is delicious
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Desserts! The one with white balls and raspberry is delicious!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Our check for a Sunday night Dinner with 2 for 1 coupon

pPVSE02R5P2aVHVDcB2i2w.text: The buffet here at Luxor is one of my top (cheap under $20 dollars for lunch) 5 buffets in Las Vegas. They have really good quality food and fresh ingredients and a wide viarity of dishes. The buffet is very easy to get to and is always very clean. Service, well it's like everywhere else. If you get a good waiter or waitress then you'll have a perfect unregretable exprience. If you don't, well you'll get ok service but the delicious food makes up for it you won't care about the service that much. In my exprience, service has been very decent. This buffet is a must try. I was going to post pictures but i tore it up.

McEJ_efNmziow32Q_NXHOg.text: It was average. Few good choices to choose from, but I really like the fact that you could take the cold grab over to the grill guy, and he would heat it up in boiling water for a few minutes for you. Not a lot of dessert choices to choose from, or toppings. It served its purpose, but if you were looking for more of a variety of foods, and the fixens to go with it, you'll be disappointed.

kjOCrCozQbCLeYfNehbbOQ.text: Never again rude management not a welcoming experience at all. Justin was very rude and very discriminant towards our request.

dmCVx_jJhWjQIBAOSbU-PQ.text: Average buffet. Had a pretty good selection not the best but not bad! A lot of fresh fruits. Nothing was absolutely amazing but nothing was awful. The seating area was very nice, not just the typical cafeteria looking buffet area. The desserts were very good! And so were the mashed potatoes!

96AY1pGVuVOQcoCYqHwxJA.text: Ugh this buffet has gone down in quality. Food was warm at best, every chicken plate was dry, the pizza looked old and cold, the prime rib I couldn't even cut so I refused to even try it. The waiters were nice and that's the only thing making this 2 stars. So many good buffets in Vegas, skip this and go to the Mandalay Bay next door.

caAR9DQmg9HihqHz1nA3Qg.text: The buffet was just a pretty average buffet, the food was nothing to special in my eyes. They did have a lot to offer though, from pizzas & pastas to fried rice and chicken. They also had plenty of deserts. All the food did taste good & was warm so there is no complaints there but it was just not my favorite buffet that I have been to in Vegas. It is not as spendy as some buffets are as well so if you are looking for a cheaper-middle price buffet this may be for you. Would I go back? Maybe, but it just wouldn't be my first choice. Staff was friendly & made sure to clear our plates off our table as soon as we were done with them! The buffet looked nice inside, and was clean.

Ddfyun-a_mS9Ng8raREcyg.text: The food here is limited and tastes something like a TV Dinner. The only thing that actually has taste is their drinks and desserts. I was not impressed.

M2U1gatO4GpTHrhSbny97Q.text: Ambiance is what this buffet steals from others.  First, let me start by saying this one is called "More" not just The Buffet.  To get to this location, you have to travel down to the "basement" level beneath the main casino floor.  Once downstairs and at the registers you are transported to a nice Egyptian theme.  From the walls to pillars, ceiling to decor, this location has an encompassing theme.  Due to the moderate pricing g and decent quality, this buffet can see quite a bit of a line, particularly during brunch hours, and Fri-Sun dinner hours.  I have yet to visit during peak seasons so I intend to update my review when that happens.  FOOD QUALITY This buffet has a handful of your standard stations, especially carving station, Italian, Asian, American.  The unique feature here is the Mediterranean and Gluten-free station.  It may not be fancy or over the top, but has a small handful of different options.  Food may not be as fresh-tasting as Aria or Bellagio's, but it is not as bland and dry as Circus Circus or even sometimes Excalibur's. I was fairly impressed with their salad and fruit section, as it was the largest of all.  One side had all salad, one side all breads, one side a mix of non-green salads (potato, macaroni, etc) and fruits, and the end closest to the registers has seafood.  This buffet may not have as exquisite seafood as some other locations, but for the price paid, you really can't expect much more and it is still fresh quality.  Your standard drinks are self-serve, but like with Mirage, there is a bar available for purchase, and the unlimited drinks deal is very worth it!  STAFF The staff at this location is friendly, but not over the top.  They are fairly quick to clear your table of old dishes, as it seems each server is assigned to a smaller section of tables than some of these other buffets.  They are very polite, and I have noticed when confronted with a lack of space to pass through, they take the extra step and instead of simply standing aside for you, they will either engage in very small talk to ease the tension, or will stop, turn, and go a different direction.  I am not sure if this is all intentional and psychological, or if it is just a random chance to witness, but it is something that I saw that I don't see at other buffets.  Serving station staff tend to engage with patrons a bit more and will give the basic salutation and thanks.   At the carving station, the person did make smaller comments like "great choice!" Or "fantastic option, it's really good!" These small comments go a long way, and I think other carving stations can learn from this!  ALL IN ALL You get a bit more than you pay for, but if you are expecting the over the top experience then it may be best to spend the extra to go for a top of the line like Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal, Bellagio, or Aria.  With this buffet, pricing is decent, food selection and quality is above average, and staff may not be over the top, but are respectful and pleasant to converse with.

WzDz0hnH7-uM-FfI48L3EQ.text: Underwhelming best describes this lackluster buffet experience. I expected more options on a Easter Sunday, there was a very limited selection and it wasn't that busy. Most of the food was bland and reminded me of reheated costco items. I'd skip this one and try out Aria, Bellagio or Caesars for a better selection.

LzMGbHACsq8xg143kHjWXw.text: Would give a minus star if i could. Total waste of money. The only thing fresh at the buffet was the salad. Poor service. The "M Life players club" told me I would get 5% off with my players card which the buffet attendant did not honor. DONT WASTE YOUR MONEY. Cost me $54 for 2 people. I would have rather went to the food court and had Mc Donald's or pizza. Luxor buffet is garbage!

XnIg8tXp6-BFIdwSFJ1B6g.text: The food taste is just ok, and i think all filipina work here is very rude like today the cashier the name Annie oohh sitt (she look like latina but for sure native filipina) not even say thank you when got my money and just tell to wait until the hostess take me to the table available the hostess is filipina too the same rude .

uroYhbXNBx-vT3TnCZDkGQ.text: I went right for the Caesar salad since it's always a favorite, then added spinach salad on the side of that. A small sampling of the following: Chicken Marsala, spaghetti and meat ball, General Tzo chicken, fried rice, fried won ton, chow mien, ginger chicken. Except for the Ginger Chicken the all the rest was awful. Chicken was rubber, pasta overdone, meatballs horrid. Sadly although it looked good the Caesar salad had absolutely no flavor. So for dinner I had Spinach salad and Ginger chicken. We are staying here so we went here. My advice skip this place, you can eat better food anyplace else!  Ps. The Egyptians didn't have concrete so your decor was disappointing!

CD90EtRqjxDGDO366EiDkw.text: The wife and I have gotten buy 1 get 1 free Brunch from playing Myvegas, so we decided to give More Buffet a try.  Service: 5/5 - Everyone seem super nice and interactive  Atmosphere: 2/5 - the light keep dimming and turning back on. We don't know if it's the special effect to make it seem like we are eating under candlelight (Ancient Egypt) or the light switch is broken....but it's hard to eat in the dark  Food: 1/5 - Little selection. Everything was salty and dried.   Recommendation: Fix the light. Don't let the food look like it been sitting there since the pharaoh time.

xhbwjtiWVEx5sSKT0J_rzA.text: I'm not a fan off buffets, but after a long trip to get here, I just wanted FOOD. The  food was just ok. I felt even though you saw the steam coming off the stations the food was lukewarm at best.  The shrimp were good, the caprese salad, carved meats, but again cold.  The crab legs were frozen, mushy and fishy smelling.   The Asian station was good as was the dessert.   The theme is nice.

FMZX04uNWUbRo_Bcz01b2g.text: $23.99 dinner buffet. Don't expect too much paying this price. I considered this is a reasonable price for the food and location on the strip, but if you want better food and service, u gotta go to a different hotel and pay.  Self service drinks as well which I don't mind. Just feel like our service wasn't welcoming, he just come and take away our dishes, no smile or anything, we said thank you and he respond a cold *you are welcome*. That's ok. Don't expect too much .

x6h92Lc9vUlMD95GZXX9xg.text: Sigh.....we came here because our group wristbands we got at the excalibur worked here as well and the buffet at excalibur was horrible, so we made the  trek over to Luxor and tried it. There was more variety and it seemed that a lot of the food was more fresh and stayed warmer longer. The desserts were way better. The service still sucked...and they still expect a tip just as they did at excalibur.  I was juggling my three year old twins and asked for an extra plate and the waitress just told me to go get one off the buffet....okie dokie, no tip for you!  One thing that was disappointing was that while they did have crab claws, legs, and crawfish, half of what we got was cold and still frozen. So, with that, it got knocked down several pegs and made it not worth the trip. We MIGHT try it again next time we are here, if I happen to see a ton of rave reviews.

nXD92hMQ-ckb2NIwWA_4Bg.text: Dirty Filthy. Food choice are poor and bland. $29 bucks for this filthy place. I was afraid to touch anything it was so filthy. It was a Tuesday night and was not very busy so no excuse. Look at these pictures. The deserts were not bad but I won't go back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. can&#39;t get these images out of my taste buds
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. can&#39;t get these images out of my taste buds
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. can&#39;t get these images out of my taste buds

UORcmVvd_OuVs7U59EIT6A.text: They were out of a lot of stuff. Food was good for the price. Their chocolate lava cake and strawberry cheesecake deserve 5 stars. Overall, good place to eat when on a budget.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Lava cake!!!
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Strawberry Cheesecake
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A little bit of everything.

S1wHdoq8tGJwutUirGjAWw.text: Better than expected from the reviews. We were in Vegas for a quasi-family reunion. They older generation mostly loves this place.  We found it to be a good deal with MyVegas coupons, would be of questionable value without.  Our aunt thinks the Chinese food is great but we found it to be the cheapest of the cheap.  Mexican food was hit or miss.  Went out on a limb and tried "Hawaiian pasta salad" which turned out to be mayonnaise-based macaroni salad with cut up grapes mixed in.  Desserts carried widely in quality, with the creme brulee being our favorite of the many we tried.  Soft serve was notable: we chose the regular (not low or non fat) and found it a cut above many other soft serves, which we attributed to the fat and the actual dairy content.  By the second round, however, it stopped tasting too good.  Of note was the small Mediterranean mezze section: hummus, tabbouleh, baba ganouj, couscous, caprese, and more.  These were all fantastic (not in situ fantastic, but definitely stateside fantastic) and by far our favorite part if both meals.  Would we go there again?  Only if our relatives dragged us kicking and screaming.  We thrive in variety and would try something different.  (Most of the food was the same lunch and dinner.  Dinner just had shrimp, mediocre sushi, crab legs and a big hunk of meat).  One final note: we never tried the tomato soup because the lid had fallen into it sideways and no one ever cleaned it up.  It looked pretty gross.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mediterranean spreads and shellfish from the dinner buffet

e8zgb1zJnL7i8Jzu1aQOwg.text: Well stocked on the menu that was offered. Salad bar had few toppings to choose from. Prime rib was over cooked. Staff friendly and accomdating

VRkjoOJG0G8_DnGKzYQU7A.text: Okay, guys, don't tell me in the ad' that the bar opens at 12:30 and then declare that I can't get my drink till 4:30 "because it's Friday". I'll attach the picture of the ad' as a reminder to the management. Thanks!

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The injustice: told me I couldn&#39;t get my drink till 4:30. It&#39;s Friday, 1:17 pm and I deserve my birthday celebration dammit.

hrrBDQmNA49Ve5fJHTiXVA.text: Bad bad bad!!  The golden coral is better than this place!!  We were starved when we arrived and between the five of us in the party, we couldn't come up with one thing that was good. The so called Italian sausage and peppers was cheap, dry kielbasa. The only seafood on the buffet were baby shrimp and crawfish - gross. Even the salad bar was horrible!  Don't waste your money people!!

YhXtea2O10Ftaro_YXfzdQ.text: Very disappointing! I spoke to a manager about having a food allergy  (gluten) when we arrived and was told, "no problem, there's plenty you can eat...even a lot of desserts!"...so...not so much. I tried to eat my $20 worth in pot stickers and taco meat...absolutely ridiculous.  then, I go to eat dessert...the soft serve is not gluten free...the puddings are not gluten free...cant have the flan, or the creme brule...they have 2 options for gluten free but can't tell me what the ingredients are ( I can't do oats either). So...the only option for dessert is yucky,  way-too-sweet, sorbet. Not happy at all. What a waste of my money. I WILL NOT be back.

oGUu2rYe63UC6GxkJOUgVQ.text: this buffet is affordable and has a good amount of selection. The busser/server Daisy was very friendly and helpful :) We will be back before the new year because of her!

Q7sgWpBSpRTX0fFLXy0ZtQ.text: Date & Time:  Monday July 25, 2016 @ 9pm Dining Companions:  In- Laws, Mommy & Husband Scene:  Families in Tee Shirts & Shorts Decor:  6 Buffet Stations:  Salad, Raw Bar, Chinese, Italian, Mexican & Dessert Service:  Friendly Imbibe:  Self-Serve Fountain Soda & Iced Tea Devour:  Panna Cotta Mediocre:  Tortilla Soup, Corn-on-The-Cob, Apple Pie Total:  $125

B2CWJlkE12Ddke2Y-w2Yrw.text: The selection was a bit lacking. The Cajun spiced Steamship looks impressive but tasted like bland roast beef. The rest of the food was bland and I didn't find any hidden gems that I couldn't get enough of. The desserts were pretty nice. Overpriced for the selection and quality. Nice staff. Wife enjoyed the seafood. Second star is because we didn't get sick eating here.

0kiN_EDKlyFqK6vdSX9xgQ.text: Well what can I say...you get what you pay for. Starving and not wanting to walk far, I stumbled upon the MORE Buffet...and quickly regretted it.  For around $20 I came in for an early dinner. They had seafood...in terms of some crab legs, cold mussels and peel & eat shrimp. No melted butter for the crab!? Sad. However you could walk your open crab legs to the other side of the buffet and get them warmed up in a boiling pot of water...oooook.  Overall the buffet  food tasted bland and like things I could make better at home. Like most they have an array of international foods...but they were not good. Extremely chewy short ribs, bland pastas, over cooked prime rib, dried out breads, soggy salads just to name a few. Some items didn't look very fresh and had not been replenished.  If you wanted alcohol...luckily it was somewhat inexpensive, but you needed to walk up to the bar and pay for yourself.  The cleaning crew kept taking away all my silverware and drink cup...then leaving their dirty trays and towels on my table every time I walked away for more food. Maybe it was because I was by myself? Still annoying.  If you really want to get a True Vegas buffet experience, pay the extra money and go elsewhere. The food here was not worth it.

IpTrlzw1dRynX_ZuXclHCQ.text: Worst buffet ever!  Worst!  $83 for three people. Pork chops were like shoe leather. No one cleared one single plate. Fried chicken was so dry it hurt to chew. Ginger chicken was hard as a rock!  At the noodle bar I overheard the cook talk back to a patron when she complained. I watched as new corn and bean combo dish was updated with shriveled up corn. The salad bar was missing most normal items for a salad. When we complained we received no reply. Lady just shrugged her shoulders. We ate at 5:35pm on March 15th. Thank God Criss Angel was amazing!

08-Y4ICQbuP7iwN0Ky6rMw.text: The food was okay, but the booth where my husband and two friends sat in was nasty food on the floor, soda on the wall and on the back of the cushion it was caked with food on it.  I just felt sick and couldn't eat anymore because I put my finger on it..

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Soda on the wall
Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Food on the cushions

VsQ3FV_uVxORQfNh8sSmWw.text: Buffet dinner selection is limited. The Chinese section is not edible. BBQ pork tastes like jerky. Only thing descent is the dessert selections. Not worth the money.

cWmCedhEuhFksYqPMAEEBw.text: You should def. avoid this place unless you have a comp. I tried to like it, but I just could not. First of all when we arrived it was empty, and they still sat us as far away from the buffet as possible. Still scratching my head on that one.... The food is bland, and honestly some of it was just down right inedible. The only thing that was worth eating was the bacon. However, I can hardly justify paying 26.99 or more for just bacon. I actually had to spit some of the food out ( sorry, but True). It may be a large selection, but it is a large selection of crap. The desserts were even bad, it's hard to mess up desert? Lol. I also had cranberry juice which I could not drink, it tasted like it came out of a moldy well or something. It just wasn't right. I would not just make this stuff up, people need to know how bad the Luxor is. They deserve No business until they clean up their act. Offer fewer selections of better quality instead of a whole lot of grossness. It was really terrible. I would just do without eating if this was my only choice.

dHJ4IvS9X5TXMVUNAU-rCg.text: Worse buffet experience in Vegas.. Usually you can never go wrong with buffets in Vegas.. this was a bad choice.   Food section.. quality was bad.. overpriced..   Never come here again.

nVwRf6f6LecKZGYHqrBRDA.text: all the food was good. shredded pork wowwww ;)

RukKw2z4uPAj9JsdkTGntA.text: Terrible! Worse buffet I have ever been too. would not go back. Very disappointing. Most of the food choices were empty trays, no one spoke english, just an awful place.

2V_5PouWuarXbRSx3BPSXg.text: Dinner Buffet was very limited.  What they did have was good, but who ever heard of a dinner Buffer without fried chicken or baked potatoes?  Salad bar was weak.  Breakfast Buffet was much better with French toast, 3 types of scrambled eggs, 3 types of sausage, pancakes, waffles.  Breakfast - Yes.  Dinner - No.

54JXmnow250kcFQGpW-SEg.text: We went for breakfast and it was okay, edible I suppose. Especially considering we were up all night partying. Everything we got was cold, especially the eggs. I did like they had different breakfast sauasages. We got the $32 pass to eat here and at excalibur buffet all day. Great deal even if you only going to eat there 2 times that day.

zLwccHu1tMMMs9uvMlecug.text: This place is a HUGE waste of space in the basement of the Luxor. All the warm food was cold and the cold food warm. Save your appetite and your money for something better.

1COMe8iRE5GQQzBisIc3Ow.text: We went on New Year's Day, which apparently means the price is higher.  The best part was that my bloody Mary's were included (I think because it was a holiday).  The food, however, was overwhelmingly mediocre.  It was okay, but certainly not worth the money we spent.  It was mostly pasta based, with very little flavor.

kbh-PFHAwxDRejuVv7kRwA.text: Food was not bad for the price but the atmosphere leaves a lot to be desired.  You feel like you are in a dungeon.  The lady at the front desk was very nice and only charged me for one of my kids when both were of the age to pay.

cm6_hgv0hSyyAqNa261hRA.text: You couldn't pay me to come back here.  The food was below average at best.  I tried everything from Italian, Mexican, Asian, American food.  Everything was sub par and the desert was bad.  I would think if you like home town buffet then this place is for you.  If not, head over to Wynn or Bellagio for their buffet.

9A1s0QM5K-Afv8UlI-6Ifg.text: Don't go unless it's free or a comp.  Unless you like frozen convenience food baked fresh for you, this isn't a real restaurant.  I went because of the 30 foot salad bar that they supposedly had.  Yes, it could have been 30 foot station, but that doesn't mean they have 30 feet of salad bar offerings.  The day I went, there was fresh spinach and fresh lettuce, dressings and toppings, and a make your own sandwich offering.  This occupied about 5 feet. Why brag about a 30 foot build out with only 5 feet worth of fresh food?  FYI-I went for lunch.

obooUhq57XUPYl3Ifl25CQ.text: we were in vegas and had another day and half the night before we caught a red eye flight back home. we stayed at the mgm and had an issue with the air conditioner in the room. when the maintenance man came up i asked him for a reasonable priced buffet that had good food  he said to check out the luxor and Excalibur you get a whole day of buffet for one price.   we went on our last day and hit up Excalibur for breakfast which was very good eggs pancakes so much to choose from.  we had the all day thing and filled up on a huge breakfast and skipped lunch. for dinner we went to the luxor to try them out the food was ok choices were limited. the only veggie option was corn on the cob. i am big on veggies with my meal and the lack of them was disappointing. they had way to many beef choices and limited chicken choices. the bread basket was empty both times i went up and there were hardly anyone in  there eating.   the plus side was the deserts they had so much to choose from the cream puffs were out of this world the mouse cups so yummy and the cakes you just have to have the desert there.  if i had known that the luxors dinner choices were limited i would have gone back to Excalibur on the way to luxor we saw the buffet at Excalibur and it look like more food options

O9rlSgEV0I-wXph6GBH2PQ.text: This was the most surreal experience I have ever had. I went to Luxor for old times sake (I had stayed 10 years ago as a minor) to eat a few hours before my flight. I was leaving at 1am Saturday and I got here at about 10pm. Its in the basement and kind of dreary. Theres 80s music playing, dark 80s music (Piano in the Dark by Brenda Russell). It is not crowded and felt fairly empty from where I was. It was like a dream...eating picked over food alone in a buffet in Vegas thats about to close down while listening to dark 80s music. It was like I was in a music video for In the Air Tonight by Phil Collins - thats the best way to describe the feeling I got here. It was in one word, awesome.

6isMtIUMW2FY2P97qyz-dQ.text: Not too much selections for lunch, no prime rib.  Food is okay but their desserts are to die for.  I love creme brulee and this place has it.  The Rio which is bigger doesn't even have it and it costs more than MORE and at MORE you can get your own drinks without waiting for the waiter to bring you one!  I believe only at dinner time they have the prime rib which is to die for too.

1wSAufOs87ditvb7Y-AXaw.text: I wasn't expecting a lot here, but was still disappointed.  My first tip-off was when I picked up a plate at the front of the buffet and it had little crumbs of wet food and water on it....got grossed out....picked up another....same thing.  EWW.  Now I'm used to getting wet plates at buffets...not sure why that is, but it is expected.  But water AND food?!  Definitely didn't get my appetite going.  : (    We went to fill our plates and as we were walking back to our table from "round 1", my husband decided that our table was a little too far from all the food (he was right, it was).  I agreed and he politely asked if we could be moved to another area where most of the other people were seated.  The host kind of sighed and acted like this was the most difficult request in history, but moved us anyway.  The new table had lots of crumbs, food scraps and grease on the booth seats, as well as on the table.  YUM.  But it WAS closer to the buffet!  lol  Got settled in at the new table (after using all our napkins wiping it off) and started checking out the food we had chosen.  Nothing that I had really stood out, but most of it was edible.  They had pretty much the standard buffet fare...  -Salads (I didn't have any, but tried the hubby's seafood salad...that was surprisingly tasty) -Sushi rolls (was scared to try at a buffet....hubby did and said they were "really good"...I took his word for it) -Cold shrimp (passed on that too....seemed like food poisoning waiting to happen) -A couple of hot pasta dishes (the penne pasta with cream sauce and mushrooms was good) -Grilled salmon (YUCK... only ate one bite.  Too fishy smelling/tasting...salmon isn't normally like that) -Mashed potatoes & various sides (decent, basic stuff) -Chinese food (eggrolls were good...fried rice and noodle dish, not so much) -Mexican food (HELL NO) -Fried shrimp (not bad) -Lots of dessert (I got all excited because they had a TON of mini desserts...and I am the dessert QUEEN.  ; )  Problem: none of them are really any good!  BOO....)  So, we did our 2nd and 3rd rounds and tried to get as full as humanly possible to get our $19.99 worth.  As I kept walking back and forth, I noticed something else...my shoes kept sticking to the floor really badly, which was a precarious situation while carrying a full plate of food.  : (   It definitely gave me even more reason to think this place definitely hadn't been cleaned properly in a long time.    While the place was pretty gross and the food was mediocre at best, the kicker was sitting there watching the server dude chat it up with EVERY. SINGLE. TABLE. except for ours, refilling drinks when they were half empty, bringing more napkins, etc, etc....the works....all the while leaving us completely unattended and, towards the end, drink-less too.  I finally had to flag him down to ask for a refill after waiting 10+ minutes to see if he'd get a clue.  He did come grab our empty plates when we were gone at the buffet, but that was IT.  I don't know if we pissed someone off by asking (very nicely) to switch tables, or if we looked young and like we wouldn't leave a tip....I have no clue.  It was so odd and so blatant that it started to feel like one of those hidden camera situations or something!  Weird.    All I know is that we weren't treated very well here, the food wasn't worth it and the whole place needs a good scrub down.  Find another place to get your buffet on in Vegas because MORE doesn't live up to its name....

DibBBQtGO1S6ndUujtS2LA.text: Let me start off by saying that the food itself is not terrible. It's not great either..like another reviewer mentioned Hometown Buffet is better than this place. What's IS terrible is the fact that these people are charging $22 a person for food that is not worth that price. They have crab legs so you'd figure you make up the money by stuffing your face with them but honestly the crab legs there are a JOKE. They're skinny little twiggy looking things and they're served cold. The chow mein was really weird because it was made with fettuccine noodles and didn't taste authentic at all. The fried rice was terribly overcooked. I've cooked better prime rib than the one offered here.There's just really no way that you're gonna eat anywhere near $22 worth of food. They didn't really have a variety of foods when I went either. They had many types of salads which were okay. The deserts are also okay but nothing spectacular. I liked that they had real fruit juices available by the fountain drink area. Next time I'll spend more money and head over to the Bacchanal.

-6boFt_KhKrhoS6OG-QXog.text: We ate here for breakfast twice and dinner once.  It was pretty cheap for strip buffets. The food was decent, the atmosphere was good it was a decent time. The food was good, and you can get your own drinks which can be a pro.  It wasn't super fancy, but sometimes that's a good thing.

9tDH14oYQ5x7hY-QMMmcVA.text: So this is my first time in Vegas, and only got to eat one buffet,  I was psyched, I love buffets, except they are usually so shitty.   It was in my top 5 reasons to come to Vegas, to rock out a good buffet, and boy were we fucked.    It just sucks, to reason to go into particulars, it tastes like any other buffet in the city that is known for making buffets sweet.  For shame Luxor, I actually now have to go back to this screwed up fake city just to walk down the hallway to Mandalay or Wynn and actually get good food.

zbgkh1S2z5GXJbJZGxWgBQ.text: I didn't hate my food, but i wouldn't suggest people to come here. I had the chinese food and my tummy is slightly angry right now about that. but it was still OK. the cheese cake was good and some brownie cookie thing for dessert. decent price, but the wicked spoon at cosmpolitan was MUCH better (and only a little more money)

V6on40MNpZLhIjhqC5YToQ.text: This place gets 2 stars, because it is a step up from the Excalibur buffet.  The Excalibur buffet sadly only gets 1 star.  At the Luxor buffet, everything is self served.  From the drinks, to the food, to everything in between.  The staff just takes away your plates.  Do not expect anything fancy here.  You will not see food items that you see at the Wicked Spoon Buffet or the Bellagio Buffet.  You get what you pay for.  I got an all day pass to be used at the Luxor buffet or the Excalibur buffet for free courtesy of MyVegas rewards.  My favorite thing that they had here would probably be the mini chimichangas or the cheesecake.  Yes, it was actually pretty good.  As for the other food, don't expect much.  :D  Update:  My friends and I came here for dinner.  They actually had shrimp and sliced crab legs.  I was not brave enough to try and though.  One of my friends ended up with a stomach ache.  But, I think Excalibur is to blame from that stomach ache, not the Luxor.    Some people say to always try things at least once.  I agree, and eating at the Luxor buffet has been checked off my bucket list.  I will not be returning here again though.

3UZPoHUHBfnHpSzj9V70ag.text: Wait staff is awful and so is the food. Don't waste your time. The decor is so so and nothing like the rest of the hotel. Over priced for no selection and poor tasting food.

1KdAbG0fHgBCE5yPvWnHPQ.text: Very MEDIOCRE Buffet  ! It was the second worst Casino Buffet I've ever had in my life !  I had the luck to go to 2 of the worst buffets in one single weekend !  Disgusting ! It is not that hard to crest , especially , the Italian section . Why not a good variety of pastas ?! So easy to make and everybody likes it .  I am not picky ! Good food can be simple and delicious. If you are very desperate and hungry , they go eat t this buffet , if not RUN for your life !

Qr9BWH_bcpzCkVFQTDMuMA.text: I have been to their breakfast buffet which is 17.99 but we got a buy one get one coupon. There was a wide selection of entrees and champagne was included in the price I would give that 4 stars.   However, we went again for Memorial Day dinner. First off we called the hotel twice to confirm the price and we were told it was 17.99. However, when we arrived the price was 26.99 and alcoholic drinks were not included. The selection was the same as regular days except they included seafood. Their seafood was bland and didn't taste fresh. I definitely think it was not worth the money. I would only come here again if we had the buy one get one coupon.

mRmArT_ED9U2BS2oc5aVYg.text: The guy from the wine bar pretend not understand what we said, but I know he understand. The food quality and choice is poor, comparing to other buffets on the strip. It is one we tried and wont come again.

21HjOlbWOC-d6LVb0gKlgw.text: Good variety, loved the decor.  It was nicer seating than a lot of other buffets, a little more secluded.  Cheesecake desserts were delicious.  Desserts were all fresh.

qkyaaBcUWtdq8ok7q3nYPA.text: Terrible food! At a $21.99 price point I expected much more choices. There was lackluster breakfast options and even more lackluster lunch options. All the food had 0 seasoning. I will never return to this buffet, if there was an option to give 0 stars without a doubt. My group will need to go get food after eating this overly priced buffet .

lFcdrVWNCsQMYAOlZvdcag.text: Food here is average, basic, and simple.  It has many choices and conveniently located next door to Mandalay Bay where we were staying.  It was too hot to walk around looking for food.  We just wanted light simple foods and close to our hotel.  Recommended to pay $40 per person for whole day service, where you can stop by anytime to eat or snack or for refreshment.  We had breakfast,  lunch, and dinner here.  Our servers are amazingly sweet, friendly, and attentive.  Don't expect gourmet or mind blowing life changing food experience.   Very relax atmosphere so you can just sit and chat with your family.

eTBuAVtnoLjG1_zjPsJ0NA.text: Horribly dry and tasteless food. The only enjoyable foods were some of the desserts. NOT worth the money.

8BxT6okezOMpAvwASC6eng.text: I love this place Paul was amazing. He kept coming to check on us and was taking all our plates as we were done. I just really appreciate great customer service. He was extremely sweet and such a hard working person. It's hard to come across people like that. The food was great I had steak it was so good thanks I'll be back.

YL9VuUI0ESWsedJC1rYoJw.text: This place gets more and more disappointing. My husband, myself, and two of our friends decided to eat here our first night in Vegas. $22 a person. All you can eat. $22 a person and the food is complete shit. For $22 I could have eaten somewhere else and had better food and it wouldn't have been all you can eat. I had a feeling I'd be adorning the porcelain throne later that night and I was completely right. One of our friends spent the next morning throwing it all up. My husband, who is a vegetarian, didn't have many options but when he saw the mac and cheese he got excited. There's nothing exciting about eating tasteless, chewy mac and cheese. The corn was soggy and tasted like it had been sitting out for 6 hours. Another friend had some steak which she said was so bad she never wants to eat there again.   It's 4:00 the next day and I'm still paying for it. Ugh.   Yuck yuck yuck!

hcMsjwQxrTRLZYTfH1-C1Q.text: We ate here with my kid's 15 yr old soccer team.  For two of us it was $89, but that included all you can drink beer/wine for me.  The beer was Budweiser on tap.  The wine was decent.  The kids loved it and loaded up mostly on pizza, pasta dishes and they crushed the dessert area.  The adults stuck to the crab legs, shrimp, steak, chow mein/potstickers.    Overall it served its purpose for our group.  The food was decent, kind of bland and nothing blew me away.  However, I would not eat here if my kid was not with me.

ZALt3tWWf26U62sDN2SiyQ.text: This is not your typical neighborhood buffet...this is high end food that is constantly maintained by the staff. Everything must be timed for freshness because I seen them replace items that were not depleted yet. Endless Mimosa's! Omelets to order. Choices that satisfy every culture and every taste.

photos.caption: Photo of The Buffet at Luxor - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is a quick shot of dining area

orjG76DZlThgSZItSOPWdw.text: Great value for the money. The food will not win any awards but it is filling and satisfying. There is also an extensive assortment of foods, drinks, and desserts available to choose from ranging from the healthy to those that may make your body resent you.

siCs8pUlhbMql27Tdv75vA.text: Went for the Memorial Day brunch that included bottomless mimosas. Selection was good, from breakfast items, to a carving station. Tacos, both chicken and beef. Chinese noodles potstickers. Everything was pretty good and filled up fast. Good place if you are in the area looking for something easy.

CG9DkV8j7CSB6i15_E9tYw.text: Went for breakfast buffet.  I usually figure you can't screw up eggs and bacon too much.  Yikes was I wrong.  Nothing at this buffet was worth eating.  Definitely don't waste your time here when there are so many other appealing places to eat in Vegas!

MT34Xmst819519pPAFxZPA.text: No flavor junk food. Soggy fried chicken and overcooked everything. Or if it wasn't overcooked it had been sitting out way too long. Deserts were just OK. Not worth it.

ykXnVPi_mszUYKfkYjUH4w.text: The buffet is decent. I've come for breakfast a bunch of times & for dinner once. I forget how much it is but I know it's cheaper for Luxor hotel guests.   Breakfast: pretty good! They have the usual breakfast spread (eggs, meats, hot/cold cereals, fruit & bagels/danish) They also have a made to order omelette station. On Sunday's they have unlimited mimosas!  Dinner: don't bother. There's a carving station, salad bar, plus Italian, American & Chinese food. Good dessert selection though.   Full cash bar (not open during breakfast hours except for the mimosa brunch) & soda, coffee, tea, juice, milk & hot chocolate available all day.   The food isn't bad, but there's definitely better selections & more to offer at other buffets.

KlWmohdYOGRj2GZgTmBZew.text: We had our Vegas vacation several months back, but I still remember the food. The variety was amazing and the food was delicious, for the most part. One of the Chinese beef dishes was a little bland, but my wife tells me it was supposed to be that way. So I can't really complain I guess.  The price is outrageous, though. Seriously.

sXt9SvE9gsNQBMXhFsTWLg.text: I'll give it 2 stars for consistency and access to both Luxor and Excalibur buffets with an all day pass.   This is not your Bacchanal or Bellagio buffet so don't expect superb dining. Only cool thing about this place is the interior..as if you were in modern Egypt with stone walls. I just can't believe how far the food is to the dining area. The closest seats are still a walk away. By the time you go get your food and sit down its already cold. They do have a good variety of cuisines. But I would rather have quality over quantity, since I'm paying almost $40/person. Couldn't tell the difference between their mediterranean and chinese food. A lot of different beverage..coffee, teas, sodas, juices. Breakfast/brunch is better than their dinner menu. You can't really go wrong with pancakes and eggs right?  They do take a while to clear your table. Their desserts are comparable to those at HTB. They did have creme brulee when I was there. It wasn't too bad. Just go to Mickey D's you'll get just as full for lesser the price. :)

gvnY7y-wIGyLOoXbcxxx2A.text: I wish I had checked yelp before going to this crappy buffet. I understand buffet food in general is not the best but man this place is total crap. They hardly had any variety (even though it was international) and the food was cold. They brought a fresh batch of fries and I was thinking yay something warm but no! it was cold WTF??? like the other reviewer said "you couldn't pay me to eat at this place again." So if you're in Vegas save your money and go somewhere else!

TrZLaN02VEdZZaLLHZp-sQ.text: I'm giving the buffet three stars not because it's a great buffet, but because it met my expectations.  First off, those of you complaining that this "doesn't even compare" to $60-per-person five-star buffets are hilarious.  It's one of the cheapest buffets on the strip; you get what you pay for.  If you want $60-per-person buffet quality, then you have to go to a $60-per-person buffet.  Stop being cheap.  We had a free all-day pass from myVegas.  Since this is an older "cheap" buffet, I didn't expect much.  I figured they'd be about on par with Old Country Buffet.  That's a good description of More.  Breakfast was the best.  Everything was fresh, though it could have been hotter.  The eggs Benedict were my favorite, though they weren't the best I ever had.  The other breakfast items were as you would expect from a buffet:  the oatmeal was overcooked, the fruit was obviously from a can, the bacon was decent -- overall everything was above average.  You'll get your money's worth from breakfast if you don't have unrealistic expectations.  Dinner was another story.  The chile relleno tasted like watery cheese; disgusting.  The beef brisket was all fat.  The chicken pot stickers were decent, but nothing to brag about.  The pesto pasta salad was still half frozen.  All in all it was like going to Old Country Buffet.  The food is edible, but nothing you'll ever brag about.  It's obvious that none of the food is made on-site, and is instead trucked in from elsewhere and reheated.  Keep your standards in line with the price and you'll be fine.  But if you're truly on a budget and need a cheap buffet, there are far better options downtown.

5oX4CMd21osIes1dcS6Rvw.text: Had the regular lunch buffet. Nothing really stuck out to me at this buffet. Maybe I'm a little biased for giving this place one star because I'm really not a fan of buffets, but it also really wasn't a very good one too. My friend and I pretty much settled for this place, so we both wouldn't recommend it.  I think my favorite part was the drink buffet, nothing special but its nice having the choices literally right in front of you.

GPgC4wQriNFFC1NVm8rGFw.text: The food was decent & all. But this review is about the CHEESECAKE!  Best cheesecake I have ever tasted. I have dreams and how I long to eat this deliciousness fluffiness once more!   Came here 'cause I was touring my friends in LA back in Sep 2011, so why not go to Vegas. After we checked in at Luxor we were so hungry, so our original plan was to go to one of the Buffet of Buffets and purchase the 24 hr pass. Unfortunately we were too tired to go anywhere and settled with what was closest to us. Unlike the 24 hr buffet from Buffet of Buffets, if you buy a day pass at Luxor (& Excalibur) the time does not go to the following day. Which was pretty lame. But being tired as we were we went ahead and purchased dinner.  So the four of us ate to our hearts content.  With little to no space left, we headed over to the desserts section. Picked some fancy looking cakes, sat down, and this is where the magic begins. I do not know how to begin to describe the wonders of the cheesecake. Even though we were so stuffed, the cheesecake was just amazing.  So fluffy, so creamy, full of awesomeness of taste.  I've had italian, french, mexican, chinese, japanese, american etc style of cheesecakes this one is on top of them all! Cheesecake factory has nothing on these. They were so simple yet so wonderful. You can get them with strawberries and jelly on top or just plain. But wow, not something I was expecting. A truly life-changing surprise!  I can only hope that when I go again, they did not make any changes.

0kDEXFn0OhG-cK4t51utxg.text: Got there for lunch and they were not organized at all. We had vouchers for free meals and they had told us at the MLife desk to go to the VIP cashier, we tried to do that when the manager came over and split the line ahead of us into two lines because their computers had crashed and they only had 3 cashiers available. We waited another ten minutes in the line. Food was mediocre, for them to have just put out lunch it was cold, the veggies were soggy. My friend wanted Mac n cheese but all they had was a lukewarm imitation of Mac n cheese that had artichoke in it... And that wasn't very good.

jU7JY3IxHNY3cj5fhgy3jA.text: For $20 a person I was expecting a large buffet with tons of variety and tasty food, but it was not the case. The food bars were positioned all around the dining area. There were Asian, Mexican, American, desert, etc., but only a handful of bins for each. Most of the food didn't seem appealing or appetizing. The only good thing was the prime rib. It was seasoned well and cooked properly.  Considering all the talk about Vegas buffets being over the top, this was not one of them. You can get more variety and tastier food from a hole in the wall buffet place and pay less than half the cost.

UqvUQNL4fEnAQtCufKN58w.text: You know a buffet is bad when you don't leave full.  The food here wasn't as bad as prison food (though my wife makes that comparison) I do think it was comparable to low grade cafeteria food.  Very low quality and made it extremely difficult to gorge yourself :)  The line for the buffet made me think we would be getting something awesome, but it wasn't.  Instead it turned out just to be a long wait for crappy food.  On top of that we went right at the cusp of breakfast and lunch.  Now most buffets would keep some of the breakfast stuff out at least until noon.  I had the luck of waiting in line for the breakfast stuff and then just as I got the front of the buffet, they decided to consolidate all the breakfast stuff to the OTHER side of the room, so I had to wait in line again.  And of course by the time I got to the front, everything was almost gone anyway.  Annoying!  And the lunch buffet itself was just as disappointing.  I highly don't recommend this place.  Go to the Paris Buffet instead

5uKuIWLMsNk2WwFFHrweCg.text: On a positive note, this buffet did have A LOT of choices! More than other buffet places. On a negative note, it wasn't the best buffet I've ever had. I might even have to say that the Golden Corral might just have been a little bit better.  I mean, it's a buffet, what do you expect? Fine dining? No! I'd say, check it out but don't expect it to be AMAZING. I went at around 8:30 pm? It was crowded, but not too crowded. Seating was nice, the area is nice. Kids might like it! Just wanted the food to be better. So, it was just overall OK. :)

F7AJZ0iFhy-RnGaXtKKGHQ.text: For those giving low stars, it's a buffet come on...  Now for my review. I went here for brunch and it was fabulous. HUGE selection, of course you have to take the first round to find the foods you actually like, and the second course to get the ones you really like.   Bottomless mimosas or champagne. Only flaw with that is it took the table server forever to make a round to get back to us.  The biscuits and gravy were awesome!

zTK_6HnBF3OKlnZUi1HURw.text: We purchased the all day pass that allows you to eat at the Luxor and Excalibur buffets all day. I've always heard about how amazing the buffets in Vegas were, and this was our first trip. Good god.   We only ate breakfast and lunch. We skipped dinner. Breakfast we ate at the Luxor. They had all of your standard fare, including terrible coffee and soggy eggs. The bacon was ok, but you could have soaked a blanket with the grease. It was probably 2 stars.   Lunch we started at Luxor; we filled our plates and started eating. Everything was so overwhelmingly terrible that we decided to just leave our plates full and walk over to Excalibur, hoping theirs would be better. It wasn't.  First, the Luxor. The best thing I tasted was the pasta salad, though I could tell that some of the ingredients were on the verge of spoilage.  The lasagna still haunts me, as it was a soggy, noodley, sickly sweet mess. It tasted like someone layered chef boyardee ravioli, then boiled the hell out of it. Ugh.   The Excalibur was somehow worse. I tried their pizza, their pork loin, the fried chicken, and their 'asain' chicken wings. The pizza was somewhat akin to Little Caesars, but think 3 day old Little Caesars heated up in a hot car. I haven't yet decided if the pork loin was tougher or drier, but I was unaware that science had advanced to the point where all taste and enjoyment could be removed from a pork product. Think pork loin cooked by a Rabbi. The fried chicken was a thigh, with literally 3/4" of breading on the top. The bottom of the chicken was wet; not greasy, wet. And miraculously, the chicken itself was dry and overcooked. I have never had chicken this bad. ...until I tried the wings. I love wings. But these... the skin was soft and soggy, like they had cooked them in a warm bathtub. The sauce was terrible. It had a flavor somewhat akin to soy sauce, but whatever they were mixing it was remarkably off putting.   After this experience, we decided to simply accept our loss on the buffet 'deal', and go to a restaurant for dinner.  I would recommend this deal to anyone who kind of likes Golden Corral, but is off put by their fancy standards.

fIP5nzNhINBf1Pm_7vmR3A.text: The night before my dining experience at the Luxor buffet, my friends and I had attended a dinner in the hotel for a buddy's birthday.  The catering was done by the Hotel, set up buffet style, and was absolutely delicious.  Under the impression that the Luxor made delicious food, we decided to try the More buffet.  Waking up the next morning was difficult, once we finally got up and got decent, we were starving.  The rest of our party was still asleep, so in a frenzy we landed here.  Boy oh boy.  As you can probably tell, I am one broke ass fool, so the $34 dollars to eat all day allured me.  I knew that I would probably be eating three times a day, at a rate of at least 20 dollars a meal, so I'd be saving like twenty bucks.  Win.  Wrong.  They had free "mimosas" which tasted like beer and ass, in my expert opinion.  There was a chef making custom omelets, and I will admit that those were pretty good.  They also had tons of bacon, which I aint complaining about.  The rest of the food could be described as crispy, at best.  I'm not talking about the good kind of crispy either.  The french toast was hard around the edges.  Since I had, like a genius, purchased the all day pass, I had the pleasure of returning around 3 for dinner.  The enchiladas edges were all stiff and gross, like they'd been there for too long.  I tried some "chow mein" and the noodles just fell apart and were overall nasty.  Overall, the food was just not good.  I didn't puke or anything, but it wasn't delicious.  I mean, would you want to eat at a place where someone's review was "I didn't puke or anything"?  It will get the job done (as in remove your hunger pains) but that's about it.  Eat somewhere else, please.

q3VXUF5QuJCPtYUW2BvEAw.text: Despite not-so-great reviews, my husband and I decided to get lunch ($16/person) here the first day of our honeymoon. Now, we are definitely not food snobs, but we do love eating and appreciate good food. We couldn't understand why this place got such bad reviews. I mean, it wasn't the best food I've ever eaten, but we've been to many, many much worse buffets.  The salad bar section was definitely the best part.
